text:
, Lapland
Lapland is a harsh fairy-tale land that stretches to the South and North of the Arctic circle. In winter, the temperature drops to -50 °C, but this does not prevent thousands of tourists from celebrating New Year and Christmas in the homeland of Santa Claus.

text: Santorini is a picturesque archipelago in the Aegean sea, a ring of 5 Islands: Tirasii, Nea Kameni, Palea Kameni, Aspronisi and, in fact, Santorini, or, as it is also called, Tira. Officially, the Islands are part of the Greek Cyclades, but this is a slightly different Greece: sleek, fabulously beautiful, aristocratic, although at the same time homely. Everything here is superlative: the scenery is amazing, the architecture is incredible, and the service is impeccable.

text: Zhangye National Geopark Dan is known for an unusual natural treasure - colorful mountain formations of colored rocks of sandstone and conglomerates, mainly from the Cretaceous period. About a hundred million years ago, the mountains were replaced by a natural pool, which later dried up and its sediment oxidized, taking on an unusually beautiful motley colouring.

text: It's a small fishing town in the province of Genoa. One of the most picturesque Mediterranean ports. text: The unique monastery complex "Meteors" literally grows out of the rock, crowning the tops of the rocks. The rocks themselves are part of the ancient mountain system of Thessaly, located in the historical region of Greece. About 60 million years ago the sea was located on the place of the rocks, and today Meteora is one of the most valuable and sacred historical places in terms of Christian religion.

text: In the south of the alpine desert, on the Altipano Plateau, there used to be a salt lake. Later it dried up, exposing the salty bottom. The thickness of the salt layer is from 2 to 8 meters, and in the rainy season, when the surface of this layer covers a layer of water, the salt lake Uyuni becomes like a giant mirror: the surface of the lake merges with the blue sky, and the surrounding landscapes become truly unearthly beauty.

text: One of the seven new wonders of the world is in Jordan, the oldest city of Petra, which has a history of almost three millennia. The city, whose name is derived from the word "rock", is indeed entirely carved out of the rock. Numerous temples, colonnades, tombs, baths and much more are skillfully carved out in the rock. In total, there are more than eight hundred historical monuments.

text: Asked what is the most beautiful place on earth, many travelers choose Zhangjiajie, one of China's natural parks. There are "soaring" mountains on its territory. The mist-cloaked mountain peaks against the background of a green abyss make a truly stunning impression.

text: Yen Bai Province, located in the north of Vietnam, has seven hundred hectares of special land. The inhabitants of the northern province of Vietnam have actually accomplished the impossible by arranging rice terraces right on the steep slopes of numerous hills. The residents' "thresholds" on which rice is planted create a horizontal plane, while trapping water coming down the slopes from the tops. The formed curves of the terraces do not disturb the harmony of natural landscapes and are even a kind of decoration.

text: Another one of the paradisiacal natural corners of the planet is in Croatia. Plitvice lakes - a magical natural creation, which the Croats themselves called the eighth wonder of the world. In total, there are 16 such lakes in the area of the national park.

text: Norway is known for its fjords - giant mountain corridors filled with sea water. One of the most famous fjords in Norway is the Geyranger Fjord, whose serene waters reflect overhanging rocks and lush greenery of forests. On its shores there are small villages, villages and farms, and in some places, the streams of waterfalls fall directly from the rocks into the abyss.

text: A large funnel of karst origin is located in the Atlantic Ocean, near the coast of Central America. Its depth reaches 120 meters, and the ideal round shape of its edges is best seen from a height - for example, from a helicopter, where the beauty of this natural phenomenon will be revealed. According to one of the versions, the funnel is a collapsed limestone cave.

text: One of the most revered Indian shrines and real miracle of nature is the Batu Caves. The caves are about 400 million years old - once it was the rocks in their place, where cavities were washed away as a result of water. Thus, several long caves were formed. Walking through them, you can see amazing formations of stalactites or visit the cave temple.

text: The great wall of China - a grandiose creation with a length of exactly 6,350 kilometers-is one of the 10 most beautiful places in the world. It began to be built in the fifth century BC. Then it was built of stone, earth, wood and grass. Bricks also appeared later, when people learned how to produce them.

text: It would seem that what can be interesting in bioluminescent phytoplankton? However, it is worth looking at. A unique kind of plankton that glows in the dark, can only be seen on the island Vaadhoo. The waves, rushing on the shore, carry it away with them, and the water begins to shimmer with hundreds, thousands of sparkling lights.

text: Blue lagoon is a geothermal Spa resort just 40 km from Reykjavik. This place did not appear by itself, but largely thanks to man: water from power plants that supply energy to the capital, accumulated on the lava plateau. As a result, mineral salts, silica and blue-green algae appeared in the water, which gave it medicinal properties.

text: The Torah well is a stone funnel that goes several meters deep. What is at the bottom of the Well is still unknown, scuba divers do not risk going down there-a strong current interferes. It is advisable to visit the funnel an hour before high tide: the water begins to quickly fill the well of Thor, and then effectively shoots up a 6-meter fountain of spray.

text: This beautiful place is called "Paradise on earth". And it justifies its name. The beautiful city, which is located at the very end of the African continent, is surrounded by huge mountains. This fact makes a person feel like a small creature in the midst of a huge splendor.

text: This is the highest cave, it was formed in 263, when suddenly a large piece of the mountain just fell off, creating a huge cavity. 999 steps lead to its foot: according to legend, passing through them, you can achieve enlightenment and get closer to God. Not everyone can do this, and in China, apparently, they do not like to disappoint tourists, so they made the world's longest funicular and the highest open Elevator. You can almost always see a cloud of fog over the cave, which makes it even more mysterious.

text: Niagara falls-a cascade of waterfalls on the border of America and Canada, between the state of new York and the province of Ontario. Perhaps, Niagara falls can be called the most effective natural fault of the earth's crust. The Niagara river, which connects lake Erie and Ontario, falls from a 50-meter-high cliff more than 1,000 meters wide. This waterfall is considered to be the most amazing natural wonder of North America.

text: One of the" star " attractions of Thailand, Tapu island, became famous thanks to the famous film back in 1974. Since then, the small island has become the starting point for the active development of tourist business in Phuket. This area is captivating in its beauty: against the background of emerald sea waters rises a limestone rock covered with greenery. Boat trips are regularly arranged from Phuket to Tapu island.

text: The Bahamas is a separate delightful world, incredibly beautiful and bright: wide beaches on the Atlantic ocean with coral reefs, unique colors of water and sky, amazing beauty of sunsets, and at night — the stars as in a planetarium. "Caribbean Switzerland" - so called the Bahamas for the amazing scenery, luxury and prestigious holidays.

text: In Iceland, the cold kingdom of snow and ice, you can also find the most beautiful places on the planet, one of which is glacial caves. Getting into their bowels, as if you find yourself in a fairytale kingdom of cold: everywhere there are ice walls, through which light flows, refracting at different angles. The process of cave formation is caused by the movement of melt water, which forms bizarre cavities inside the glacier.

text: The world's largest religious building, built in the 10th-12th centuries in Cambodia, was dedicated to the Supreme Hindu deity Vishnu. Angkor Wat is a giant 3-level complex of temples that has kept the secrets and legends of the capital of the Khmer Empire for about a Millennium. Built of Sandstone, the complex is 65 meters high and has a colossal area of 2.5 square kilometers with magnificent towers, terraces, galleries and gardens.

text:
, Taj Mahal 
The Taj Mahal is one of the most recognizable and visited places on the planet, attracting millions of people with its unusual beauty and amazing creation legend. Thanks to the ingenuity of architects, special techniques of creation and decoration with precious stones, the majestic mausoleum looks more like a fairy-tale vision than an earthly structure, which for many centuries not only inspired artists, designers and poets with its incredible outlines, but also generated a huge number of myths and legends.

text: Going to Senegal, you should understand that there are so many colorful attractions there that it is unlikely to be possible to visit everything at once. But what is definitely worth your attention is the mysterious "pink lake" - Retba-one of the most beautiful places on Earth. It looks like a picture from a children's book - snow-white banks and rose water. The oldest cyanobacteria living in the salt lake are responsible for this unusual color.

text: You will not believe it, but in these caves you can see the starry sky! The culprits of this spectacle are amazing creatures-Arachnocampa Luminosa. These are fireflies that can only be found in New Zealand. Their green-blue glow makes the cave vault look like a starry sky on a frosty night.

text: A colossal complex of rough waterfalls was formed at the intersection of the Iguasu and Paranasu rivers. The Cascade forms about three hundred small waterfalls. On the opposite side of the crevice, where water falls, there is an observation platform from which you can see a stunning spectacle: a huge mass of water, forming a myriad of water splashes, sparkling and shimmering in the sun, with a roar falls down.

text: We present to your attention another one of the most unusual waterfalls in the world, which is located in the American state of California. Mac Way Falls is considered to be eternally alive waterfall, because it never dries up, and its waters fall from the rock right into the picturesque bay. And the very vegetation surrounding the falls always remains green - the secret is that the trees in this area are fed by the waters of an underground river.

text: One of the most interesting geyser fields is located in the Kronotsky biosphere reserve in Kamchatka. In fact, the valley is a volcanic canyon, on the territory of which there are several dozen gushing hot springs. The whole area resembles a bubbling cauldron — everything here flows, hisses and boils, steam jets escape and hot thermal water pulsates.

text: Cappadocia is called the heart of Turkey - this historical region is located in the heart of the country. Once here, you can feel like a guest of another planet - so unusual are the local landscapes: there are snow-covered peaks of extinct volcanoes, and low mountains, and Cappadocia has become a popular destination for sightseeing flights on large balloons.

text: Fantastic Brazilian scenery of the natural Park of Lençóis maranhenses make a lasting impression. The vast territory of the Park with snow-white sand dunes is occupied by small turquoise lakes that create a magnificent contrast of colors. Despite the desert views, Lencois Maranenses is not really a desert - it regularly rains here, which fill the spaces between the sand hills with water

text: A hidden beach on Islas Marietas, near the city of Puerto Vallarta, was formed from a crater from the explosion of a dropped bomb - the Mexican army was conducting exercises. Just imagine: you go home and tell everyone you know how you spent a few perfect days in a bomb crater in Mexico. Hidden beach is pure white sand, clear water, few people and wildlife.

text: With a height of more than 1,000 meters, angel consists of two cascades and three levels. This is the highest waterfall in the world, the height of the continuous fall of water is 807 meters. Before reaching the ground, the water is sprayed and turns into a mist that can be felt several kilometers away. By the way, the name of the waterfall has nothing to do with angels, it is named after the American pilot James angel.

text: This is a coastal area consisting of 40,000 (!) basalt columns connected to each other. It is also the most popular tourist attraction in Northern Ireland and a UNESCO world heritage site. The road of giants is the result of many years of volcanic eruptions. The lava, slowly solidifying, turned into hexagonal columns, the largest of which reaches 12 meters in height.

text: Yellowstone Park is located on the territory of three States: mostly in Wyoming, as well as in Idaho and Montana. The Park is famous for its picturesque landscapes, diverse wildlife and geysers. Here you can see waterfalls, canyons, lakes and even a volcanic eruption. According to Wikipedia, the Park has 1,770 kilometers of marked trails-just imagine how many routes you can take.

text: Black beach - Punaluu-was formed as a result of volcanic activity. The beach, in fact, is a mixture of lava and basalt, so the sand on the coast is rich black. On the beach you can meet not only tourists, but also a lot of sea turtles.

text: Flathead lake in Montana is one of the largest in America, it covers an area of 510 km2. In addition, it is the most transparent lake in the world - it seems that it is shallow, but in fact its depth can reach 113 meters. This place is very popular among fishing enthusiasts, because the clear water is always very visible fish — trout and perch.

text: One of the most beautiful places on our vast planet is located on the border of Chile and Argentina in the Patagonian Andes. A fabulous creation created by nature itself, located in South America in one of the deepest lakes in the world - Buenos Aires. The locals call it majestically the Marble Cathedral, but many tourist avenues refer to it as the Marble caves of Chile. This is the most striking and memorable attraction in Patagonia, which is visited annually by tens of thousands of tourists from all over the world.

text: You may have already heard of the famous ice hotel in Quebec. It is considered to be one of the most romantic places on the planet, so thousands of couples come here every year to get married. It is made entirely of 20 tons of snow and ice. Every year in December, it begins to be rebuilt in order to receive the first guests in early January. Which, by the way, before checking in, they are instructed how not to get frostbite while staying at the hotel.

text: Known as the City of Love, Dalat in Vietnam is an incredibly romantic place. There are beautiful waterfalls, poetic landscapes, rich history and culture. And a special place among this is occupied by the Pongur waterfall. 100 meters wide and 40 meters high, Pongur consists of 7 levels and flows into a small lake. The waterfall is surrounded by 25 hectares of pristine rainforest.

text: Cano cristales locals call the river of five colors - the water glides over the colorful mosses, and creates the complete illusion that the river is painted in different colors of the rainbow. It is best to come here in the period from the end of July to December, when the river is especially bright. In addition, you can see 420 different species of birds, 8 species of primates and 10 special varieties of amphibians. Local residents have realized how attractive their land is for tourists, and now conduct a variety of excursions.

text: Japanese cherry trees - Sakura - can be seen not only in Japan, but also in the small German city of Bonn. In spring, during cherry blossoms, the street is transformed. In 1984, the city of Bonn began to fight for clean air, and two streets in the historic center of the city were planted with cherry trees.

text: Let's continue talking about waterfalls. Another favorite, is worthy of a place in the list of waterfall Mobrey in California. text: Whitehaven is 7 kilometers of white sand. The beach is one of the cleanest in the world. Order is maintained by two measures: you can not smoke here and stay with dogs. In addition, the sand has one feature: it does not heat up, so it does not burn your feet even on the hottest day.

text: Chittorgarh, the capital of the former Mewar Kingdom, is located on the banks of the Gambia river in the Rajasthan region. Chittorgarh Fort, from which the city gets its name, is a symbol of Rajput pride and valor. It consists of 22 reservoirs, palaces, towers and temples. In addition, Chittorgarh is located on 700 acres of land and stands on a 180-meter high hill - the view is extraordinary.

text: It is best to visit Windermere in the autumn, in September or October. This place will appeal not only to lovers of beautiful nature, but also to those who are fond of rowing. There are also many museums nearby that will appeal to children and adults, such as the Cumberland pencil Museum. Great restaurants with delicious food are located near the lake.

text: In the South-East of Iceland, there is a great place that attracts not only tourists and visitors to the country, but also the local population. It is home to the Skaftafell national Park, founded in 1967. It is difficult not to find it, it is located right at the foot of the amazing and largest Glacier in Iceland Vatnajökull. The Park is protected from the Northern cold winds by high majestic mountains, completely covered with ice. Skaftafetl is a stunningly beautiful place that makes you fall in love with yourself at first sight.

text: Bled is the name of a lovely Alpine town in Slovenia, located in the North-West of the country. Not far from it is the lake of the same name, which attracts thousands of tourists. This is a place for good fishing, mountain climbing, peaceful outdoor recreation, boat trips and sports.

text: Kliluk, the Spotted lake or a reservoir in British Columbia, near the town of Osoyoos. The lake water is rich in minerals (magnesium sulfate, calcium, sodium, silver and titanium). Therefore, in the summer, its surface forms bizarre spots, which, depending on the weather, are painted in different colors. Needless to say, the water in the lake has a strong healing effect.

text: The Golden gate is one of the most recognizable bridges in the world, and you've probably seen it in movies more than once. More than 100 thousand cars pass through the bridge every day. text: Darvaza is a gas crater in Turkmenistan, which locals and travelers call the door to hell and the gate to hell for its very frightening appearance. In the 70s, geologists discovered a gas accumulation near the village of Darvaza and started drilling a well, but by chance the ground collapsed and a huge hole filled with gas was formed. To prevent people living nearby from being poisoned by harmful fumes, it was decided to set fire to the gas. Everyone thought the fire would go out in a couple of days. But since 1971, the fire continues to burn continuously day and night.

text: The eponymous island of Aogashima was formed as a result of volcanic activity. The volcano has not erupted since 1700, but is still considered active. About 200 people live right next to the crater. To see all the beauty of this place, you need to go to the peak - more than 430 meters above sea level. You can only reach the island by helicopter or boat.

text:
, lake Baikal 

Baikal is the deepest and possibly the oldest lake in the world, about 25 million years old. It stores almost a quarter of the world's fresh water, and the purest and most transparent. A white disk with a diameter of 30 centimeters is visible through the Baikal water even at a depth of 40 meters.

messages.text:
The full name of the capital of Thailand reads as follows:
Krungthepmahanakhon Amonrattanakosin Mahintharayutthaya Mahadilokphop Noppharatratchathaniburirom Udomratchaniwetmahasathan Amonphimanawatansathit Sakkathattiyawitsanukamprasit
(กรุงเทพมหานคร อมรรัตนโกสินทร์ มหินทรายุธยา มหาดิลกภพ นพรัตนราชธานีบูรีรมย์ อุดมราชนิเวศน์มหาสถาน อมรพิมานอวตารสถิต สักกะทัตติยวิษณุกรรมประสิทธิ์).

The name translates as:
City of angels, great city of immortals, magnificent city of the nine gems, seat of the king, city of royal palaces, home of gods incarnate, erected by Vishvakarman at Indra's behest.

The name is listed in Guinness World Records as the world's longest place name, at 168 letters.

text: See Paris and die, as they say. If you find yourself in this city, you will not be able to pass by the Eiffel tower - a symbol not only of Paris, but of the whole of France. You can even climb it, but you will have to pay a few euros for it.

text:

Underwater waterfalls occur due to the difference in temperature and salinity of some parts of the ocean, as well as due to changes in the ocean floor - the Eastern side of the Danish Strait is much colder than the Western one.

text: Madrid, being the capital of Spain, is a multi-ethnic millionaire city. Not only the economic, but also the cultural center of the country is attractive for its long history since the reign of the arabs. The name of Madrid comes from the arabic "machra" (water) and "it" (abundance) and means "source of full waters". Madrid is usually a leisurely city, quiet and perfect for leisurely walks. The city comes alive during football games ― fans of the clubs "real Madrid" and "Atletico" come from all over the country to enjoy the game of their favorite teams. At night, the city also does not look like itself ― night parties do not stop until the morning, and noisy companies wander from place to place. The familiar state of Madrid at night allowed us to call the city one of the most popular night cities in Europe.

text: Spread out on steep slopes that descend to the Tagus river, Lisbon attracts tourists like any European capital. Gothic cathedrals, majestic monasteries, are part of the colorful urban landscape, but the real charms and amazing discoveries lie in the narrow alleys and beautiful streets of Lisbon. Ride the yellow tram, walk through the old quarters, go to a cozy cafe that has preserved the atmosphere of the forgotten 30s, go to the sea and walk along the embankment that once saw the famous return of Vasco da Gama-it means to feel the charm of this ancient city with a rich and interesting history.

text:
Boracay island is part of the Philippine archipelago and covers an area of 10.32 km2. Tours to Boracay are preferred by young people because of the huge variety of bars, night clubs and entertainment clubs, which are mainly concentrated in the white beach area. The island also offers excellent opportunities for Windsurfing, snorkeling and diving. Budget hotels are located in close proximity to beaches, and luxury hotels are located in secluded, picturesque lagoons.
 The best is considered to be the White beach of the island, which boasts white, fine sand and a convenient entrance to the sea. Coral reefs are located at a distance from the shore, which allows you to swim carelessly.

text: This is a real Kingdom of wild nature, such a concentration of unique natural phenomena as here, you will not find anywhere else. Iceland is not without reason called the country of "fire and ice" - it is here that volcanoes and glaciers are preserved in large numbers – amazing natural artifacts. And the waterfalls? And the beautiful mountain gorges – canyons, striking in their beauty? The flora and fauna of this beautiful little country attract tourists from all over the world, and even the capricious climate is not a hindrance to them. The unique climate, due to the combination of the island's proximity to the Arctic circle and the influence of the warm Gulf stream, or rather, its continuation – the North Atlantic current, largely determines the natural characteristics of this region. Therefore, despite the fact that there are enough glaciers, this is not an Arctic country – all year round, the waters along the coast of the island are free of ice.

text: The nature of Kamchatka is one of the most unique and interesting in the world. The location of the Peninsula on the faults of tectonic plates, on the coast of the Pacific ocean, provided the Peninsula with truly unique features. The dominant Kamchatka nature is volcanoes, of which there are more than a hundred. 29 of them are active, so constant eruptions serve as a backdrop for all life. Every time a volcano erupts, it changes the landscape in one way or another. Vegetation is buried under a layer of lava and ash, rivers change their course, disappear and lakes appear.

, Blue lagoon.

It is considered the hallmark of Iceland and attracts a huge number of tourists from all over the world.

text: The blue lagoon is located next to the small village of Oludeniz on the shores of the two seas of the Mediterranean and the Aegean. Turquoise coast — it really is! The water here is clear and beautiful turquoise shades. Part of the blue lagoon is a continuation of the city beach Belcekiz in Oludeniz.

text:
The world's largest dried-up salt lake. It glitters and shimmers so much in the sun that it hurts your eyes, so you can't do without sunglasses.
During the rainy season, from November to March, the Uyuni salt lake turns into a huge mirror: the salt honeycombs are covered with a thin layer of transparent water, which reflects the sky, and it becomes completely unclear where, in fact, the horizon is.
Later, the salt crust dries up, and the water from below breaks out-thanks to this "salt eruption" small cone-shaped volcanoes are formed.

text.text: # Myanmar, the ancient city of Bagan.

text: Bagan - the main attraction of Myanmar, which is a must-visit, travel around the country. Thousands of ancient buddhist temples and pagodas, like sprouted seeds scattered in the field since ancient times, appear to the eye for many kilometers, plunging into the mysterious world and admiring tourists from all over the world no less than the famous Angkor Wat in Cambodia or Borobudur in Indonesia. A paradise for historians and pilgrims, and positive energy. The most interesting and unique place not only in Myanmar, but also abroad!

text: This unique natural phenomenon is so far from reality that it is easy to mistake it for a Mirage. What is Lençóis? Lençois Maranhenses national park in the state of Maranhão in Northern Brazil. It is located in close proximity to the equator next to the Atlantic ocean. The area, covering approximately 1,000 square kilometers, is covered with snow-white sand dunes up to 40 meters high. At first glance, the park looks like a typical desert, but it is not. Since Lençois Maranhenses is adjacent to the Amazon river basin, it is subject to regular precipitation – 300 times more precipitation than in the Sahara! From January to June, heavy rains fall in the Park, and water accumulates in the valleys between the dunes before it can go into the ground. As a result, we get a cosmic landscape — snow-white sand dunes stretching beyond the horizon, diluted with fabulous blue and turquoise lagoons.

text: Koh Tao island is a combination of high mountains and lowlands covered with shrubs, granite boulders and dense jungle. Moreover, mountains cover more than 65 percent of the total area and form the basis of the landscape. According to archaeological data, in the past there was no vegetation on the island, only rocks, but over time the landscape has changed and today it is a very beautiful place, located in pristine purity, as there are no large buildings, etc.

text: The Maldives is located southwest of the island of Sri Lanka, at the equator. Numerous coral reef Islands, 1,190 in total, form an archipelago of 26 natural atolls (groups of neighboring coral Islands). These 26 atolls are divided into 19 administrative districts with the capital island of male being the 20th administrative district. When viewed from the air, atolls and Islands form beautiful pictures against the blue depths of the Indian ocean.

text: The extraordinary nature of Canada attracts a huge number of tourists. This is very rare in the Northern hemisphere, when natural complexes are preserved almost in their original state and border on modern cities. About 10% of Canada's territory is still uninhabited . Canadians are proud of their nature and cherish it. Most of the territory of Canada was explored and developed thanks to beavers. Why? In the 1600s-1700s, beaver fur hats were very fashionable in Europe. Thousands of eEuropeans went to Canada to engage in the fur trade and set up trading posts.

text:
Professor Michael Sukou. World wildlife fund.

In Georgia, you can get a lot of impressions that are possible when a person meets nature. Its landscapes are full of contrasts. It seems that the picturesque corners of many parts of the world have merged here. The lush vegetation of the black sea subtropics is adjacent to the eternal snow and glaciers of the highlands. Deep gorges-the abode of rapid rivers-with sultry steppes overgrown with sagebrush and bearded. The green carpet of Alpine meadows is replaced by dense forests, forests-fertile valleys.

text: The first thing you need to know about Bosnia and Herzegovina is not one country, but two. It would seem that one part is Bosnia, and the other is Herzegovina, but in reality everything is much more complicated. The Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina is a single entity and only makes up half of the country. The second half is called the Republic of Srpska, and it should not be confused with the Republic of Serbia, which is an independent state. Bosnia and Herzegovina is a country of mountains. Only a small area in the very North of the country is occupied by lowlands along the Sava river.

text:
We offer you to escape from the daily hustle and bustle and enjoy the beauty of the starry sky. ✨ 
Night - the most mysterious period of time. The world of people falls asleep and is replaced by darkness-the time of dreams and dreams. And it is at this time that thousands of stars flash in the sky.
The sky is so majestic and always attracts people's eyes. Boundless, distant, unknown and therefore even more alluring. It can be different-bright, affectionate, cheerful, ominous, overcast, gloomy. But it never ceases to interest people.

text: Sakhalin is the largest Russian island. The Japanese covetously call this island Karafuto, which means "land of the God of the mouth". Most of the island is shrouded in taiga. Local forests are unique, as the Sakhalin taiga is the richest in Russia in terms of species diversity. Judge for yourself — about 200 species of trees and shrubs grow on the island. the main feature of Sakhalin is the amazing neighborhood of southern plants and Northern representatives of the kingdom of flora. So, in the South, it is quite possible to see tropical lianas, larch feels very well surrounded by polar birches, lemongrass and rhododendrons often bloom next to fir trees.

text:
Redwood national park.
Here it is, covered with redwoods, the planet Endor from Star wars — this is where a significant part of the filming of the final episode took place. The natural range of these giants is the Pacific coast of North America. Individual specimens of redwoods reach a height of more than 110 meters (35 floors!) — these are some of the tallest trees on Earth. The maximum age is more than three and a half thousand years.

text: It is not without reason that the indigenous people of Russia believe that so far the wild nature is preserved only in the vast expanses of Siberia. Siberia is a unique, beautiful place where it is quite possible to find a corner that, in the literal sense of the word, has not been trodden by a human foot for decades, and whose owners are exclusively birds and animals. Despite this, most Westerners assume that modern Siberia is a vast snowy expanse without any animals or vegetation.

messages.text:
In the Pacific ocean, there is a conditional point that is farthest from any land. The closest to the earth is at a distance of 2688 km. This place is also called the pole of inaccessibility. The next "pieces" of land is the uninhabited Ducie atoll,  Motu Nui island and the island of Maher.

The point got its name thanks to the hero of the novel by Jules Verne "20 thousand leagues under the sea". It
is interesting that the orbit of the International space station can pass over the Nemo point, so sometimes the nearest populated place is about 400 km away, but not on Earth, but in space.

The Kingdom is lost among the majestic Himalayas, a patchwork of ancient culture, wise lamas and unique landscapes. The country is located at the foot of the Himalaya mountain range between India on the South side and China on the North side.
The nature of Nepal is very diverse from subtropical plants to lifeless mesmerizing mountain peaks. The country has rich nature reserves and national parks, which are home to more than 800 species of mammals and birds, wild animals such as leopards, rhinos, tigers, dwarf bears and many others.

text:
While most countries in Africa remain in quarantine, the cycles of nature remain the same. 
The sun is still rising, the antelopes are still out grazing, and the lions are still hunting. Elephants roam in their routes of migration, hippos grunt in the river and birds singing songs. 
Maybe it's a good thing that nature got a little respite from tourists. The more interesting it is to come to Africa and become a pioneer again! Traveling to Africa is the best way to replenish your energy reserves, restore your mental balance, and relax your body and soul. In the world of digital technologies, where information is overwhelming, Africa provides a connection with nature, the need for which is acutely felt in modern megacities.

text: Just a half-kilometer from Russian island is a small Shkota island. It is worth coming here to plunge into the smells of wonderful nature and admire the panorama of the nearby islands and the turquoise surface of the sea. The southern coast  gives a reef rising from the water with surface stones lying along it. A place to relax on the island can be a dense deciduous forest, which, walking, is bypassed in a day: the area of the island is not up to 3 square kilometers. Small streams and grassy meadows, bird markets and rocky grottoes - all this beauty can be seen when you come to the Shkota island.

text:
Off the coast of Rudder Cut Cay, divers can find a life-size sculpture of a mermaid resting on the sandy ocean floor. Undine is positioned near the piano bench, as if beckoning divers to sit down and play her a tune.

The stainless steel sculpture is hidden at a depth of 3-5 m, and it can be difficult to detect when the current lifts the sand from the bottom and the water becomes cloudy. These circumstances make detecting a composition on a clear day even more magical. Diving enthusiasts who can hold their breath long enough to dive like to swim around and sit on a bench, imitating their belonging to this underwater world.

text:
Osinovetsky lighthouse, which today is a favorite vacation spot for St. Petersburg residents, was a guiding star for the besieged Leningrad a little more than half a century ago.

It has been more than a hundred years since it first illuminated the surrounding territories with its light. Forty kilometers away, you can see the radiance that comes from this stone giant. The lighthouse rises 74 meters above sea level. The highest point is reached by a spiral staircase. The number of steps is equal to the number of days in a leap year — 366 of them. During its long history, the walls of the lighthouse were covered with mold, but to this day, the 500-watt lamp at the top sends signals from April to November every four seconds.

text: Seville has the charm of antiquity. The city was founded by the romans, and today three sites located here are included in the UNESCO world heritage list. The Alcazar Palace complex is an amazing mix of architectural styles. In beauty, it is not inferior to the cathedral where Christopher Columbus was buried. The Parasol Metropol is the largest wooden structure in the world. The suspended structure of wooden beams houses, among other things, a farmer's  market and a viewing platform.

messages.text: In 1966, retired British major Roy Bates and his wife and son settled on a concrete platform built 11 kilometers from the British border during the Second world war. Bates named his platform "Sealand" and declared it an independent state. He proclaimed himself a monarch, also introduced postage stamps, developed passports, and even printed the Sealand dollar. Today it is the smallest state in the world

messages.text:
The price of water

On top are five people from Niger who make do with three bottles of muddy water a day. 
Below — three from New York and the water that they spend per day. 

The photographer traveled to six countries, from India to Bolivia, to collect data on access to water for UNICEF, first asking people how much water they use per day. Then he shot his characters with plastic bottles that contained the daily allowance.

text:
Croatia has an amazingly beautiful nature and is considered one of the most environmentally friendly places in the world. The Adriatic sea has unique properties. In some places it is transparent up to 50 meters deep. Croatia is famous for its thermal and mineral springs. There are 7 amazing national parks on the territory of this country.

The Northern part of the country - Istria is famous for its hilly landscape, Mediterranean vegetation and medieval towns. The ridges of the Dinaric mountains and pine forests adorn the coastal part of Central and southern Dalmatia.

Berlin has 12 districts-important administrative divisions that can boast their own local government and even a Mayor. Unlike many other cities, where everything "delicious" is located in the center, Berlin is completely interesting. Which is not surprising: after the significant destruction left by the Second world war, and the division of the city by the wall into two countries

text: Budapest in Hungary was formed in 1873 as a result of the merger of two ancient cities: Pest, which lies on the eastern bank of the Danube, and Buda in the west. Today, Budapest is one of the most beautiful capitals in Europe, which is put on a par with Vienna, Prague and even Florence. There are an incredible number of interesting places here, so it is better to spend a few days exploring this city – especially since the restaurants, hotels and healing baths of Budapest have to stay here longer.

# Greece, Cyclades
The Cyclades Islands are an underwater rapids that connects the Balkan Peninsula and Asia Minor. The Cyclades consist of 56 islands and islets. Located in the center of the Aegean Sea, they form an imaginary circle around the sacred island of antiquity - Delos.

text:
This is a country where the past is adjacent to the present and welcomes the future. From ancient times to the Middle Ages, the country absorbed the advanced culture of Asian countries. And from the end of the XIX century began to adopt elements of Western civilization.

The sophistication of the eastern perception of the world is in harmony here with advanced technology and trendy urbanized lifestyle.

Ancient pagodas and spirit gates coexist in Japan with mirrored skyscrapers, promoted spa centers-with the national baths of ofuro. This almost fantastic mix of the heritage of the East and the achievements of the West is the main thing that Japan attracts its guests.

text:
The largest and most famous resort city in America, located in the state of Florida on the coast of the Atlantic Ocean.

The modern and very convenient city, which was named after the Indian tribe that lived on these lands, is famous for its beautiful beaches, expensive hotels, the coolest parties, clear turquoise water and wonderful conditions for tourists to relax.

Every year, more than 15 million people come here from all over the world to hang out and sunbathe on the beaches of Miami or go on an unforgettable cruise to the Caribbean Islands.

text:
The resort town of Bonifacio occupies a magnificent secluded location on the southernmost tip of Corsica on a narrow peninsula of dazzling white limestone.

The upper town, a maze of narrow streets flanked by two tall Genoese houses, grows naturally out of sheer cliffs where winds and waves have hollowed out voids and furrows.

On the northern side, between the peninsula and the mainland, lies a deep crevice, forming an ideal natural harbor, which for centuries served as a shelter for various ships. Today it houses a luxury marina that attracts yachts from all over the Mediterranean.

# Greece, Giola Lagoon

Giola Lagoon is shaped like a pearl shell. It is separated from the waters of the open sea by a low rock barrier up to two meters long. During tides and storms, the waves easily overcome it and fill the pool with cool sea water.

text:
Mount Roraima — the lost world of the gods. Why the lost world? Because in the 18th century, it was assumed that relict life forms — including dinosaurs-could survive on the tops of such table mountains. Why the world of the gods? Because Roraima isn't really just a mountain. In general, these are several dozen mountains called tepui Roraima. And in the Indian language, "tepui" means " house of the gods."

It is a mountain with peculiar interesting vertical slopes and flat peaks, — one of the oldest in the world. Representing the remains of a long-eroded plateau, it is composed of very hard sandstone. These hard-to-reach, remote cliffs rise above the surface, forming bizarre, unearthly shapes.

text:
A sandstone mountain formation located on the Colorado Plateau. This place is known among travelers and photographers for its colorful, hilly forms and the rough” excursion " off-road to reach it.

The wave consists of Navajo Sandstone, which is approximately 190 million years old. Scientists studying the Wave say that the old dunes have been turning into solid rock for centuries, consisting of vertical and horizontal layers. Erosion by wind and rain has created a spectacular, futuristic landscape that can be seen today.

text:
The city is located on the coast of the Gulf of Papua, on the south-eastern coast of the island of New Guinea. The city itself is relatively small – its entire historical core is located on a small peninsula between Walter Bay and Port Moresby Bay, but the blocks that have grown over the past 20 years encircle the entire Fairfax Harbor, forming a fairly spacious series of small suburbs and individual villages.

This part of the country has a noticeably drier climate than the rest of New Guinea, so it is here that the main administrative and commercial institutions are gradually concentrated.

text:
Majorca is the largest island of the Balearic Archipelago, which belongs to the Spanish Kingdom. It is located in the western part of the Mediterranean Sea.

In fact, Majorca is not so big, but the landscapes of the island are so diverse, and the landscapes are so delightfully changeable, that it may seem as if Majorca is "sewn" from different rags, each of which nature has created from randomly selected treasures of its bowels.

text:
Valencia is the third most populous city in Spain, as well as the center of the province of the same name, known for its picturesque beaches. This is a place where a rich historical past and future technologies get along in an amazing way.

Only here architectural monuments peacefully coexist with futuristic buildings of recent years, and folk traditions do not interfere with the development of science.

Located on the Mediterranean coast, Valencia is one of the few cities in Spain where it is so easy to combine a holiday, sightseeing and familiarity with local customs.

text:
The fear of being left in an unfamiliar country without documents and money is at the top of everyone's list of fears. 
To protect yourself from this, get yourself an email address, the username and password from which you will easily remember. 
Send 2 emails to this address: in the first email, attach the scans of your documents, in the second email, attach the access keys to your cryptocurrency wallet. Now your documents and money are in your mind
and even in the worst case scenario, you will return home from anywhere in the world.

text: Lake Baikal is located on the border of the Irkutsk region and the Republic of Buryatia — in the center of the Asian continent. The deep-water lake holds the world's largest supply of fresh water, unique in composition. On all sides, Lake Baikal is surrounded by mountain ranges and hills. The exceptional diversity of flora and fauna attracts tourists from all over the world.

text:
Toledo is the capital of the Castile-La Mancha Autonomous Region and the first capital of Spain, which is only 50 minutes away from Madrid. The whole city is an architectural monument and in 1987 was included in the UNESCO lists.

Toledo has preserved its medieval charm at first sight fascinating tourists. This is an atmospheric place to walk along the cobbled streets, where dozens of architectural monuments are hidden, as well as the best place for a photo shoot in Spain.

Toledo conquered the famous artist El Greco, who left his paintings in almost all the churches and museums of the city. In local gun shops, you can buy the best blades in the world (you can not export them abroad) or tiny souvenir skewers.

messages.text: Palm Jumeirah is the largest artificial island on Earth, a real miracle created by man. It follows the shape of a palm tree (trunk and 16 symmetrically arranged leaves), which is surrounded by a crescent-shaped breakwater to protect it from the destructive effects of the waves. The island has a huge number of luxury private villas, hotels, skyscrapers, shopping and entertainment centers, parks, beach clubs. Palm Jumeirah is located in the United Arab Emirates, on the shore of the Persian Gulf near the coast of Dubai.

text:
⚡Check all the documentation — this item is mandatory and not for nothing is in the first place. More than once there were occasions when a person simply forgot one important document, and the entire tour was postponed or canceled.

✅ Passport
✅ Insurance
✅ International passport
✅ Help
✅ Tickets
✅ Power of attorney for the child
✅ Hotel booking confirmation
✅ Bank documents
✅Check everything you need at each stage of the trip and put it in a folder, leaving it in a visible place.

⚡ Read the rules of the country where you are going — here we are talking about customs, traffic rules, basic laws, rights and duties of a tourist, because ignorance of the laws does not exempt you from responsibility, even if you are abroad for the first time.
⚡ Prepare the rear-specify where and how you can contact the embassy of your country, find out the number of the hotline. 
⚡Look at the bank — when crossing the border, it is important to have a certain amount of cash on hand.

⚡ Read the rules of the country where you are going — here we are talking about customs, traffic rules, basic laws, rights and duties of a tourist, because ignorance of the laws does not exempt you from responsibility, even if you are abroad for the first time.
⚡ Prepare the rear-specify where and how you can contact the embassy of your country, find out the number of the hotline. 
⚡Look at the bank — when crossing the border, it is important to have a certain amount of cash on hand.

messages.text:
SHERATON HOTEL in China 🇨🇳
⠀ 
The Sheraton Huzhou Hot Spring Resort in China on Lake Taihu is one of those that are being talked about – unusual.
 For its extravagant appearance, tourists call Sheraton Huzhou not only a horseshoe, but also a "Donut", "Bagel", and sometimes a "Moon Hotel". But the architect of the building, Yansong Ma, put the idea of infinity and unity into its design – reflecting in the water, especially in the glow of night lights, the hotel gives the impression of an eight, which, as you know, has no beginning or end.
⠀
In fact, this 27-storey hotel has an "end", it is hidden under the water, where there are 2 more floors. The Shanghai Feizhou Group, which was engaged in the construction of the building from 2007 to 2013, made sure that the "ring hotel" was firmly held on the surface. In reality, these are two towers, fastened together at the bottom by two levels of bases, and at the top – by a rounded arch.

text:
Fly River - flows through the southern part of the island of New Guinea, in a short section forms the state border with Indonesia.
The river begins in the Star Mountains, at a 3-kilometer altitude. In the upper reaches of the Fly is very fast, sometimes there are rapids, but they are not so large as to interfere with the movement of boats.

In the middle and lower reaches, the Fly enters the plains, slows down, flows in a southern and then south-eastern direction, breaking up into a large number of branches and oxbow lakes. It flows into the Gulf of Papua Coral Sea, forming a wide estuary. An interesting and impressive phenomenon is the bor wave, which is formed at high tide when sea water rises 240 km up the riverbed.

text:
It is considered one of the most unique attractions in Turkey due to its topographical features and impressive views.

Cappadocia is famous all over the world for its balloon rides.This is due to the fact that the scenic views of the region are stunning, and the conditions for flying in this area are optimal.

Cappadocia is also a vast historical region in the east of Asia Minor on the territory of modern Turkey. It consists of a number of underground towns and villages that are scattered throughout the region.

text:
Seville is located in the south of Spain and is the capital of the autonomous community of Andalusia. Seville lies at the foot of the Sierra Morena Mountains with winding trails and centuries-old pastures where bulls graze.

The large Guadalquivir River, the fifth longest river in Spain, passes through the city. Seville is one of the most interesting cities to visit, the birthplace of flamenco and the center of a rich Andalusian culture.

text:
Varirata is a national park in Papua New Guinea, designed to preserve the existing island ecosystem and the original territory of the Papuans.
The protected area offers a convenient and extensive network of hiking trails of varying length and complexity, observation platforms and equipped places specifically for picnics. Tourism lovers will find interesting routes with overnight stays in campsites or lodges.
You can hire a guide or travel around the park yourself.

text:
🇨🇭 Helmer Funicular, Bern, Switzerland ⠀
⠀ 
The Gelmer funicular with a slope of 106° is considered the steepest in Europe. Its open trailer will take you to the Helmer Lake, located at an altitude of 1860 m above sea level. Hiking mountain trails start from the lake. ⠀
⠀ 
The Gelmer Railway was built in the 1920s to support the construction of a dam on Lake Gelmer. The journey on this freight railway was very exciting, and in 2001 it was converted into a passenger railway. An open carriage takes 24 passengers in 12 minutes from Handegg in the Gasly Valley (1,412 m above sea level) to Lake Helmer.
View on maps:

🇹🇭Thailand, Dragon Temple

One of the most incredible sights in Thailand. In the ancient city of Nakhon-Patom, there is a 17-story pink tower, which is wrapped around a giant mythical dragon. 

They say that an amazing temple will bring happiness if you touch the tip of the dragon's tail, and then make a donation to the "pot of happiness" and hit the gong.

text:
🇳🇦Namibia, Dead Valley of Deadvlei

One of the main natural attractions in the Namibian National Park Namib-Naukluft.

Surrounded by the dunes of Sossusflei, the clay basin is located at the bottom of a dried-up lake and is famous for the petrified trees of the camel acacia. It is covered with a layer of salt and clay, from which the roots of trees stick out, as if frozen by gusts of wind.

The most beautiful Lake Tahoe lies on the territory of California and Nevada. Its banks are overgrown with picturesque coniferous forests, and small channels and streams have long been favored by beavers.

This lake is considered one of the most popular recreation centers in the western United States. It attracts beach lovers, avid fishermen and water sports enthusiasts.

🇰🇪Kenya, Nairobi

The capital of Kenya, the largest and most populous city in East Africa. In addition to the city center, there is a large national park of the same name.

Black rhinos are raised in the reserve. It is also home to giraffes, zebras and lions. Not far from the park is a well-known shelter for orphaned elephants, owned by the David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust.

text: 🇨🇭Gelmerbahn

🇿🇦South Africa, Lion's Head Rock

An unusual rock in the city of Cape Town. It is located between Signal Mountain and Table Mountain. The height of this wonderful rock is only 670 meters.

From here you can enjoy a great view of Cape Town. On its slopes, you can meet various small animals that look like ground squirrels, but are about five times larger than them. In addition, the rock is a very popular place for paragliding enthusiasts.

text:
🇮🇩Bali is a place of power

There are quite a few such places on the planet. They are also available in other countries. Bali is just one of them. It's a place where everything you've been saving up for years starts to come out of you very quickly. There is a powerful cleansing at all levels. For everyone, it happens in different ways. There is lightness, there is confidence, there is inspiration. The flow of ideas, energy, and creativity opens up. People open up, find their purpose, begin to walk their true path.

text:
🇨🇱Chile, Atacama

The driest desert on the planet is the Atacama Desert in Chile, located between the Andes and the Pacific Ocean.

In the driest parts of the desert, there is nothing alive — even cacti and scorpions die there. But in some places there is an evergreen thorny shrub and even flamingos and wild foxes live, although for the most part they are unpretentious insects and reptiles.

text:
🇪🇹Ethiopia, Dallol Volcano

The landscapes of the volcanic crater of Dallol, located in northeastern Ethiopia, resemble the rainbow-colored alien landscapes of Io, a satellite of Jupiter. 

Washed to the surface, potassium salts, manganese and iron paint the salt plains in sandy, scarlet and greenish shades, forming a lifeless surreal landscape.

text:
🇮🇹Italy, Florence

A city in Italy in the province of Tuscany, located almost in the center of the country on the banks of the Arno River. 

One of the most significant and famous cultural centers of the European continent. This is a city that has preserved the charm and splendor of the past and will never cease to amaze with its masterpieces of art, legends of the past, marble churches and the splendor of architecture.

text:
🇹🇭Thailand, Khao Sok National Park

Khao Sok National Park is located 175 km north of Phuket, in the province of Surat Thani, it covers more than 700 square kilometers.

It is home to many exotic species of animals and plants. Majestic limestone cliffs, trails through the jungle and other spectacular landscapes will give an unforgettable experience to all nature lovers.

🇲🇲Bagan, Myanmar

The ancient city, which is located in the northern part of Myanmar, 140 kilometers southwest of Mandalay near the modern city of Nyaung-U. 

Bagan is an amazing and eclectic sight: the temples are built of limestone, sandstone, marble, with tiles and underground galleries — and each is at least somewhat different from its neighbors.

text:
🇪🇬Egypt

It is located in the north-eastern part of Africa with its capital in Cairo — the largest city of the entire African continent. 

A land of mysterious pyramids and god-like pharaohs, thousand-year-old temples and majestic sphinxes, endless beaches and modern megacities.

A full-fledged beach holiday in Egypt is popular in any season. But the most favorable months are May, early June, the second half of September and October.

🇵🇪Peru, Rainbow Mountains

The Rainbow Mountains are located 100 kilometers from Cuzco in Quispicanchi Province at an altitude of 5200 meters above sea level.

According to local residents, there was snow on the top, which under the influence of global warming began to melt, and the mountains acquired the appearance that they have now.

During the tour, you will have the opportunity not only to see the Rainbow Mountains, but also to get acquainted with the local people, their customs and wildlife.

text:
🇧🇴Bolivia, Salar de Uyuni

It is located in Bolivia, but when you look at this place, you want to attribute to it an unearthly origin.

The world's largest dried-up salt lake. It glitters and shimmers so much in the sun that it hurts your eyes, so you can't do without sunglasses. Another attraction of the Uyuni salt marsh is the Forest of Stones. This is an unusual landscape with stone statues and sculptures created by wind and water.

On a trip to Salar de Uyuni, you can spend the night in "salt" hotels, in which even beds and tables are made of sodium chloride.

🇨🇭Switzerland, Lauterbrunnen

A picturesque village located at an altitude of 802 m in the valley of the Bernese Oberland, near Interlaken, surrounded by steep cliffs and waterfalls.

Lauterbrunnen is considered one of the most picturesque places in Switzerland. A village with green valleys, mountain hotels and multicolored alpine meadows.

📌 The Lauterbrunnen Valley can be reached by train from Bern
* Travel time – 1 hour and 40 minutes.
* Ticket price – 34-44 francs, depending on the class.

Considered the largest Alpine meadow in Europe, it boasts only two large villages-Compaccio and Saltria-as well as countless lonely huts in picturesque locations.

🇦🇺Australia, Lucky Bay Beach

A bay on the south coast of Western Australia, located in the Cap-le-Grand National Park, west of Esperance.

The sandy surface on the beach consists of the smallest grains of quartz without impurities-hence its milky color. It doesn't have the tropical beauty of Queensland, but it's certainly one of Australia's best beaches. At Lucky Bay Beach, friendly kangaroos will be waiting for you.

The best time to visit Lucky Bay Beach in Australia is the warm period from December to April-ideally in February.

text:
🇨🇭Switzerland, Lake Kauma

Unusual in its beauty, Lake Kauma is located near the small Swiss village of Flims in the Alps.

The lake attracts with its unusual color: the water in it is turquoise-green. The lake is quite warm, it is quite possible to swim there. Therefore, in the warm season, there are a lot of tourists here. The unspoilt nature and pristine nature of this place leave an unforgettable impression.

If you are going to visit Lake Kauma, it is worth knowing that it is better to visit it at an earlier time of day. So you will not get into the main influx of tourists and quietly enjoy the atmosphere.

text:
🇸🇨Seychelles

They are located in the western part of the Indian Ocean, east of Africa. To the northwest of the Seychelles is Kenya, to the west - Zanzibar and Tanzania.

Visitors to the 115 islands in this archipelago in the Indian Ocean are mainly engaged in sailing, diving, fishing and relaxing holidays. There are many beaches, coral reefs and nature reserves, which are home to rare species of animals, including giant turtles.

text:
🇺🇸USA, Arches National Park

Located on the territory of the state of Utah in the United States, near the city of Moab, a 10-minute drive from it.

There are more than 2 thousand natural stone arches in the park, and the terrain is made up of monolithic sandstone rocks, which formed hundreds of pinnacles, huge stone ridges protruding above the surface and giant balancing stones.

📌 In the summer, it is quite hot here, so experienced travelers are advised to plan their trip in the spring or autumn.

🇫🇷France, Mont Saint-Michel

The famous fortress island, located in Lower Normandy, in the north of France, on the border with Brittany. 

Mont Saint-Michel attracts thousands of tourists from all over the world every year. In addition to the picturesque location and ancient architecture, it is also additionally interesting with strong tides. 

📌Enjoy the Abbey of Saint-Michel in the Christmas lights from December 14 to January 11 (from 18:00 to midnight). And you can have a snack in one of the 10 oldest restaurants in France.

text:
🇬🇷Meteora, Greece

Meteora - monastery in honor of the Transfiguration of the Lord in Greece, the largest and oldest Orthodox monastery among the Meteora. 

It was founded at the beginning of the XIV century by the monk Athanasius on one of the Meteora rocks in Thessaly near the village of Kastracion in the community of Meteora

📚Meteors are rocks in the mountains that appeared 60 million years ago at the confluence of a river with the sea. They are located on the Greek mainland in the region of Thessaly — 350 kilometers northwest of Athens.

text:
🇫🇮Finland, Levi

Levi Ski Resort is located in the north-western part of Finland, in Lapland, in the municipality of Kittila in the province of Lappi.

Six months of the year, the mountain is wrapped in a thick layer of snow, and the monochrome landscape is broken only by the lights of hotels and bright ski jumpsuits. Tourists here are surrounded by care, which is manifested on the slopes, in hotels, restaurants, and entertainment centers.

The best conditions for skiing are created in March-April. Frosts are no longer fierce, and the snow cover is ideal for alpine skiing.

🇺🇸USA, South Dakota

It occupies the territory of the Great Plains, as well as some part of the Mississippi River basin, which led to an extremely diverse terrain and picturesque districts. 

This is a truly American province, where there are practically no large cities. The most famous natural area of the region is the Black Hills, which for centuries have been considered sacred to all the Indian tribes living on the territory of the Great Plains.

📌Rent a car — the most convenient thing to choose for traveling throughout the state of South Dakota. Rent a car will cost about $ 60 per day.

text:
🇨🇭Switzerland, Ticino

The only canton in Switzerland where Italian is spoken. Separated from the rest of the country by an impenetrable Alpine ridge, it looks more like Italy than the rest of Switzerland.

A special charm of the province of Ticino is given by the unique nature: calm valleys, lush southern vegetation, lakes and quiet cities that do not know the hustle and bustle of large megacities.

The restaurants of Ticino offer very interesting dishes with an Italian accent, which you will not be able to try in other regions of Switzerland.

🇵🇭SOME INFORMATION ABOUT THE PHILIPPINES 

✅Language. Everyone speaks English.

✅Money exchange. The most profitable course will be at the Manila airport.

✅Local communication. You can buy a local SIM card with unlimited internet right at the airport for € 16.

✅Taxi. In Manila, the worst traffic jams, so calculate the time with a margin. Taxi drivers are not always well-oriented, even in their own area. 

✅Street thieves. In Manila, you should not carry a phone in your hand or a bag on your shoulder.

🇧🇷Brazil

A country in South America that stretches from the Amazon River basin in the north to the vineyards and huge Iguazu Falls in the south.

The Amazon jungle, the golden beaches of Rio de Janeiro, the subtle aroma of coffee, the roar of mighty waterfalls-all this, like a magnet, attracts millions of tourists from all over the world to Brazil.

📌As souvenirs from Brazil, you can bring hammocks and beautiful lace. Here you can also buy high-quality leather goods: shoes, bags, belts and wallets.

text:
🇨🇭5 reasons to visit Switzerland:

1. The Swiss Alps. The beauty of the Swiss Alps is something that must be seen.
2. Waterfalls and lakes. The most famous of them is the Rhine Waterfall in Schafhausen.
3. Kitchen. Speaking of restaurants. Swiss cuisine is diverse and influenced by neighboring countries.
4. Museums and historical sites. If you are an explorer at heart, you will be captivated by Swiss museums and castles. The most popular among them are the Museum of Transport and the glacial garden in Lucerne.

text:
🇵🇭Philippines, Coron Island

It is the third largest island in the Calamian Islands group, located north of Palawan Island.

A distinctive feature of the island of Coron : 11 pristine lakes, three of which are connected through underground caves to the sea. It is also a place of pilgrimage for divers — there are many Japanese warships sunk during the Second World War in the area.

📌 Transfer from Busuanga Airport to Coron city costs 150 pesos per person. The journey time is 30-40 minutes.

🇳🇴Norway

It is located in northern Europe, also occupying the islands of Svalbard, Medvezhy and Jan Mayen. Part of the territory is located on the Scandinavian Peninsula, in its northwestern part.

Norway impresses with the majestic beauty of its nature: fantastic fjords, lush forests, sparkling waterfalls, picturesque seascapes. Here you can enjoy the magic of the northern lights and walk around the clock under the summer midnight sun.

📌 Here you can go on "the most exciting railway journey in the world". Ride past the beautiful mountain scenery on the Bergen Railway from Oslo to Bergen.

🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿Scotland, Borthwick Castle Hotel

Just 24 kilometres from Edinburgh, this romantic castle sits on a hilltop in a green valley.

One of the best preserved defensive structures in Scotland. It offers elegant rooms, some with four-poster beds, antique tapestries on the walls and wonderful arched windows, as well as the most modern amenities.

📌 For recreation, in the surrounding area: horse riding, golf course, archery, falconry and fishing.

text:
🇰🇷South Korea, Yeonnamdong Cafe 223-14

Located in Yeonnamdong district, Yeonnamdong Cafe 223-14. The address of the establishment was taken as the name.

This is a unique place where the entire interior is made in the style of black and white drawing. The cafe rooms look like scenes from cartoons or pages from a comic book. The design of the walls and floor is designed in a single artistic style, which creates the illusion of a hand-drawn world. Furniture, dishes, cups – everything is made in the style of drawings.

📌The menu in the cafe is quite modest, so if you are hoping to eat delicious food, it is better to find another place. In the cafe, you can only order coffee and sweets.

text:
🇭🇷Croatia, Dubrovnik

A city in the south of Croatia on the Adriatic coast.

This is a real masterpiece of architecture, a grandiose fortress city with an amazing history. For its amazing architecture, beautiful beaches and crystal clear sea, Dubrovnik is called the "pearl of the Adriatic".

Enjoy the local cuisine, replete with seafood and delicious dishes of lamb, oysters and eels from the Neretva River. Be sure to try the wines from the Peljesac Peninsula, which is famous for Southern Dalmatia.

text:
🇨🇷Costa Rica

Hilly country in Central America, covered with tropical forests and washed by the waters of the Caribbean Sea and the Pacific Ocean. 

Mountains, ocean, lush vegetation, wild and outlandish animals – all this is Costa Rica. Three-quarters of the country is protected by protected areas, national parks, mysterious caves, majestic waterfalls, picturesque valleys, volcanoes and beaches with white sand. 

📌If you want to save on gifts, we recommend that you stay in San Jose on the way back. The souvenir market will allow you to buy souvenirs for a fairly modest amount.

text:
🇫🇷France, Valensolle

A small town in the east of Manosque, between the regional parks of Luberon and Verdon in Provence, north of Toulon and south of Sisteron. 

It is a picturesque, traditional village with typical Provencal houses perched on a hill overlooking endless fields of lavender, almond and olive trees.

The most beautiful lavender fields are located right along the road leading from Valensol to Manosk.

text:
🇲🇦Morocco

One of the states of the Maghreb in north-west Africa, which in ancient times was called "the farthest country of the sunset".

A trip to Morocco is like a trip to a magical Arab fairy tale, where there are waterfalls, eternal snow on the tops of mountains and tangerine trees. The famous Casablanca, the beaches of Agadir, the bustling markets of Marrakech, the majestic mosques of Rabat, the vast expanses of the Sahara Desert — all this is Morocco.

📌In Marrakech, you should visit Jemaa al-Fna Square, where street performers perform, and bazaars selling ceramics, jewelry and metal lanterns.

text:
🇸🇦Saudi Arabia, AlUla

It is a natural and archaeological treasure of Saudi Arabia. It is located in the province of El Madina.

The impressive sand mountains of AlUla, and the many bizarre figures created by nature to form a unique landscape, have witnessed the development of ancient civilizations.
📌One of the most iconic sights of the AlUla region is the huge complex of ancient rock graves of Madain Salih.

text: 🇮🇹Enjoying the view in Positano.

🇺🇸Kauai Island, USA 

Kauai is one of the most beautiful islands in the Hawaiian archipelago, deservedly called the garden island.

Lush vegetation, white beaches, so in harmony with the turquoise waters of the ocean attract newlyweds here, and the steep slopes of majestic mountains, intricate paths winding through the jungle, and excellent places for spending the night in the fresh air attract lovers of adventure and hiking life.

You should visit Kauai mainly in the summer. In late autumn and winter, you can easily get "rain for the whole week".

text.text: El Peñon de Guatape: an unusual rock-stone with a staircase, Colombia.

text:
Its height is 220 m, length – 380 m, and width – 100 m. The age of the huge rock is estimated at 70 million years, and its weight exceeds 10 million tons.

For those who want to climb to the top and see the beautiful panoramas, a staircase of 650 steps is laid between the crevices of the rock. However, for this, tourists have to pay a symbolic price of $2 - this money is then used to maintain the stairs in good condition. At the top, a small restaurant is built, where you can eat and relax, as well as take a lot of photos against the backdrop of the Guatape reservoir spread out below.

text:
🇭🇹Haiti

A country in the Caribbean Sea, occupying the western part of the island of the same name and bordering the Dominican Republic. 

One of the most picturesque countries in the Caribbean. It organically combines unique beaches, untouched thickets of exotic forests, and original ethnic architecture. 

📌It is best to stay in Haiti from November to April. There are two rainy seasons on the island: from April to June and from September to November. Tropical hurricanes most often occur from June to September.

text:
🇨🇭Switzerland, Schilthorn

A peak in the Bernese Alps with a height of 2970 meters. The Schilthorn offers a circular panoramic view of the Bernese Alps.

At its top is a gift shop and a large viewing terrace with a magnificent view of the Eiger, Jungfrau and Mench Mountains. Here is the world's first revolving restaurant "Piz Gloria" where one of the episodes of the James Bond film was filmed. There is also a movie theater where episodes from the film are shown.

📌 You can stay in the village of Murren, located on the slope of this mountain, offering Swiss specialties - roshti, raclette and fondue.

text:
🇺🇸USA, Morning Glory Lake

The amazing beauty of the lake is located in the Yellowstone National Park in the United States.

This lake is small, but its depth is 2,200 meters and the water in it is always hot, steam comes from it. The lake is unusual in that it periodically changes color like a chameleon. From time to time it becomes purple, then turquoise, it can become green with an orange tint around. It looks extremely beautiful.

📌 Yellowstone Park is open daily, regardless of the time of year. You can get here through one of the existing entrances (there are five of them). Vehicles may pass through some entrances.

text:
🇮🇹Italy, Milan

Milan is the main city of northern Italy. The most fashionable and stylish city, the capital of the fashion industry.

The Duomo Cathedral in Milan is a unique structure that has no analogues, it can accommodate up to 40,000 people. And if you look at the building from a bird's-eye view, it becomes clear that it is made in the form of a Catholic cross. A breathtaking view opens from the roof terrace of the building. The observation deck allows you to move freely on the roof of the cathedral and offers the best views of Milan.

📌The cathedral is open all days except holidays, from 8: 00 to 19: 00. The ticket price for adults is 3 Euros, for children from 6 to 12 years - 2 Euros and up to 6 years – free of charge.

🇸🇨Seychelles, La Digue

La Digue is one of the islands of the Seychelles archipelago located in the Indian Ocean.

The eastern part of the island is not affected by civilization, and offers the tourist a piece of pure nature in its original form. This is an amazing place for photo shoots with absolutely stunning views and absolutely deserted beaches.

text:
🇭🇺Hungary, Budapest

Budapest is the capital of Hungary, located on the Danube River, and is divided into two parts-hilly(Buda) and green, flat(Pest).

The Hungarian capital is rich not only in ancient Baroque quarters, luxurious theaters and palaces that have preserved the spirit of the empire in their bronze domes. The majestic parliament building, as a monument to the great Hungarian kings, wellness baths that are famous throughout Europe, all this is Budapest.

📌 Do not forget to visit the Marzipan confectionery Museum and bring a souvenir of an unusual shape from this useful sweet.

text:
🇳🇵Himalayas

The Himalayas are a mountain system located in the southern part of Asia. The Himalayas are part of such states as Nepal, India, Pakistan, Tibet and Bhutan.

This mountain range is the highest in the world, reaching an altitude of 8848 meters above sea level. The Himalayas separate the Indian subcontinent from the interior of Asia. The very word "Himalayas" means "house of snow". Mountaineering has become the main direction of tourism in the Himalayan Mountains. 

🧐In 1953, mountaineer Edmund Hillary and a representative of the indigenous Tibetan people Sherpa Tenzing Norgay were the first to conquer the highest point of our planet – the summit of Mount Everest.

text:
🇫🇮Finland

A country in the north of Europe in the eastern part of the Scandinavian Peninsula. 

The land of white nights and northern lights, endless forests and hundreds of thousands of blue lakes, many picturesque islands and vast snowy expanses of Lapland, known to many as the birthplace of Santa.

📌Popular souvenirs: Finnish knives (puukko), woven ryijy carpets, handmade products (with the label Sámi Duodji).

text:
🇹🇭Thailand, Phuket

Phuket is the largest island of Thailand, located in the south of the country, in the Andaman Sea of the Indian Ocean.

This is a paradise with snow-white sand, coconut palms, warm sea, gentle sun and mountain views. The city is well developed, there are numerous hotels for every taste and budget, restaurants, bars, huge shopping centers, souvenir shops, nightclubs, discos and entertainment venues. And in Phuket you can watch incredible pink sunsets.

text:
🇬🇷Greece, Navaio

Navaio is a beach in the north-west of the island of Zakynthos, belonging to Greece, and is washed by the waters of the Ionian Sea.

The beach is surrounded on all sides by steep white limestone cliffs, so you can only get to it by water. There is also an observation deck at the highest point. One of the attractions of the beach is a rusty wrecked smugglers ' ship.

📌 The best time to visit the beach is before noon to catch the bright sunlight on the beach. The bay is protected from the winds by rocks, and the stay in it is very comfortable.

text:
🇦🇪UAE, Dubai 

Dubai is the largest city in the United Arab Emirates and a deep-water seaport, located on the coast of the Persian Gulf.

Even 40 years ago, there was only a desert on the territory of Dubai, but now it is a place where there are many tall buildings, clean white beaches, luxury hotels and exquisite entertainment for tourists.

📌If you arrived with a camera, then put it back in the suitcase, photo/video shooting is prohibited on the territory of the city. And if you also brought a drone, then you will need the UAE flight rights for it at all. Yes! As a driver's license, only for flights!

text:
🇦🇹Austria, Hallstatt

Hallstatt is a small charming town (community) in Western Austria. With a population of about 800 people, this tiny, picturesque village is located on the shore of the lake of the same name, surrounded by the Alps.

Beautiful gingerbread houses are reflected in the purest water of a mountain lake, narrow streets, small old churches and fantastic natural landscapes - this place is created so that you can take stunning pictures from here, for which we recommend climbing to the observation deck using the funicular (18€), which is already in the city itself. 

💡 From the food, it is worth trying dishes from local fish, König Ludwig Dunkel Braun beer, traditional red beer.

🇳🇴5 NATURAL ATTRACTIONS TO SEE IN NORWAY:

1)Geiranger Fjord

Phuket is the largest island of Thailand, located in the south of the country, in the Andaman Sea of the Indian Ocean.

This is a paradise for tourists with snow-white sand, coconut palms, warm sea, gentle sun and mountain views. The city is well developed, there are numerous hotels for every taste and budget, restaurants, bars, huge shopping centers, souvenir shops, nightclubs, discos and entertainment venues. And in Phuket you can watch incredible pink sunsets.

text:
🇬🇷Greece, Navagio

Navagio is a beach in the north-west of the island of Zakynthos, belonging to Greece, and is washed by the waters of the Ionian Sea.

The beach is surrounded on all sides by steep white limestone cliffs, so you can only get to it by water. There is also an observation deck at the highest point. One of the attractions of the beach is a rusty wrecked smugglers ' ship.

📌 The best time to visit the beach is before noon to catch the bright sunlight on the beach. The bay is protected from the winds by rocks, and the stay in it is very comfortable.

But due to the fact that the islands are located on the equator line, there are short-term showers: ten minutes, and the sky is clear again. The water temperature here is plus 24-27 all year round.
