🇺🇸Hawaii, Oahu

Oahu is one of the Hawaiian Islands in the central Pacific Ocean, where the capital of the state of Hawaii is located - Honolulu, the famous beaches of Waikiki and Lankai, Pearl Harbor, the Diamond Head crater and the Haiku Ladder.

In addition, there are mountains, a national park with albatrosses and other interesting places. Whatever place you choose on Oahu-do not hesitate, here you will find a large number of attractive historical and cultural centers that are unparalleled.

✅ The average annual temperature on the island ranges between 20-29. 4 C. The best time of stay, when tourists will be able to enjoy the warm coastal waters with an average temperature of 24.4-24.5 C, is from April to November.

text:
🇳🇱Netherlands, Githorn

Githorn is a Dutch village, one of the most cozy settlements in the world. It is known as the "Venice of the Netherlands". Instead of roads, there are river channels, and boats and silent boats running on electricity are a popular means of transportation. You can also move around the small streets by bike.

In this "Little Venice", the number of bridges is also striking: there are more than 170 of them, and they are almost opposite every house that is located by the water. One-story houses with thatched roofs helped to preserve the two-hundred-year history. And the locals with their folk attire take you into the atmosphere of an old fairy tale.

📌 The best time to explore is in July and August, at this time the most cozy weather for the Netherlands. Sightseeing is better to start at nine in the morning: at this time there are few people here and after five in the evening the crowds disappear abruptly, and silence and peace reigns around.

🇹🇷Turkey, Cappadocia

Cappadocia is a semi-desert region in the central part of Turkey.

This region is one of the most picturesque places on the planet, with rocky mountains of the most unusual shapes, valleys, canyons. All this is reminiscent of space movies with their Martian views.

📌 the best time to visit the region is the beginning of June. After all, at this time there is a Balloon Festival, when up to 250 balloons rise into the air at the same time.

text:
🇮🇩Indonesia, Nusa Penida

Nusa Penida is a small island located near the Indonesian island of Bali. The tourism industry on the island is poorly developed, which creates a special specificity of traveling here.

Fans of active recreation, ecotourism, should visit the island without hesitation. You will admire the cultural sights that are practically untouched by civilization, the way of life of local residents. Nature, picturesque beaches, karst caves, ancient Hindu temples that attract the attention of extreme sports enthusiasts from all over the world to the island.

📌According to the climatic conditions, Nusa Penida does not differ from Bali, which means that the high season begins in May and ends in September-October.

text:
🇳🇴Norway

A country on the Scandinavian peninsula, the birthplace of the Vikings, with severe weather, and a stunning landscape - all this is Norway!

For those who like to be alone with nature, to hide from the bustle of the city - green forests, mountains, pristine glaciers, waterfalls, many rivers and lakes, beautiful fjords, white nights and the Northern Lights - will help you find peace. This beautiful country will also be able to please you: ski resorts, fishing, diving and mountaineering.

The best time to visit is May-September, when it is summer here, at this time you will not only enjoy warm days, but also be able to observe the natural phenomenon "Summer Solstice".

text:
🇺🇸USA, Las Vegas

A city where everything is available! A city that wakes up only at night! A city where you can find yourself in 5 countries at once! A city that will amaze you with exquisite luxury and incredible entertainment! "This is Las Vegas, Baby!" - that's right, you will be greeted by the streets of the city.

One of the most amazing and free shows in Vegas is the Bellagio Fountains, located in front of the five-star Bellagio Hotel-Casino, one of the largest hotels in the world. The show makes an indelible impression, causing the delight and admiration of every viewer.  

📌 You can watch the show from 15.00 and then every 30 minutes until midnight. For those who think that this is a one-time show, then I'm afraid you're wrong. Every time it's a new music, a new light and water show.

🇹🇭Thailand, PhiPhi

Phi Phi is an archipelago of 6 islands, near the province of Krabi and the island of Phuket. Locals pronounce the name of the island as Pee-Pee. But the islands became known after the filming of the movie “The Beach " with Leonardo DiCaprio.On the shores of the Andaman Sea, which washes the beaches of the islands, it may seem to you that you are in a commercial for "Paradise Delight". 

📌The best time to relax, where you can enjoy diving, azure water, the wildlife of the islands, swimming on wild beaches, Viking caves is from November to April.

text:
🇨🇳China, Zhangjiajie

Zhangjiajie is a national park located in central China in the north-west of Hunan Province, more than 1000 kilometers from Shanghai and Beijing, also included in the UNESCO World Heritage List.

The best time to visit is spring and autumn, at this time you can enjoy the amazing landscapes of Zhangjiajie. The nature of the park impresses with its splendor: huge sandstone pillars located above a tropical forest, a labyrinth of karst caves, majestic waterfalls, a picturesque lake, powerful rivers.

📌Zhangjiajie Park became famous all over the world after the movie "Avatar", because it was the incredible landscapes of Zhangjiajie that inspired the creation of the nature of the film!

text: 🇮🇹Alpin Panorama Hotel Hubertus

🇫🇷France, Versailles

The Palace of Versailles is a palace and park ensemble, which includes 3 palaces, about 1400 fountains, each of which is a unique structure, huge park areas, with a variety of flora and a stunning landscape. 

One of the symbols of the French crown of the 16th century was the Palace of Versailles, located near Paris. This place impresses with its scale and variety of architectural details. The perfectly drawn lines of architectural complexes will impress not only from the outside, but also inside. Large halls and bedrooms are decorated with ostentatious luxury, the walls are covered with detailed wood and marble carvings, decorated with frescoes, paintings, sculptures, velvet draperies, silk carpets, gilded bronze and tinted glass. 

📌 You can visit the Palace at any time, the ticket price is 20€, but it is better to take tickets for two days at once, because the palace is so big that you can't get around it in a day.

🇱🇨Saint Lucia 

Saint Lucia is a small island state that is part of the Lesser Antilles and is washed by the warm waters of the Caribbean Sea and the Atlantic Ocean.

The island seems to be created for those who are used to elite holidays: luxury hotels, SPA centers with local natural mud and healing baths, snow-white yachts, excellent beaches, azure water, a variety of tropical fruits grown on the island, tropical forests, and a unique world, all this awaits you in Saint Lucia.

📌Saint Lucia is the venue of the famous jazz festival, which gathers musical talents from all over the world in early May. So this is a great time to visit the island.

text:
🇬🇷Greece, Meteora

Meteora Monasteries is a unique complex in Greece, on the tops of rocks and is one of the most striking sights of Greece. This place got its name from the Greek. Meteor, which literally means "hanging in the air".

At an altitude of 600 meters above sea level, there are six active Orthodox monasteries. The greatness of this place and its natural natural security from the invasions of robbers and robbers allowed to create over time a large organized monastic community with many monasteries, but only some of them have survived to this day.

The best time to visit is summer, as some monasteries are closed in winter for the safety of tourists.

text:
🇲🇽Mexico, Huasteca Potosina

Far from the tourist trails, one of the most picturesque and most inaccessible regions of Mexico is hidden on the slopes of the Sierra Gorda mountains. Huasteca-Potosina is an emerald jungle, stormy rivers, turquoise lagoons and deep karst caves. But the main treasure of the wonderland is dozens of waterfalls, sparkling and sparkling in the dense greenery of rain forests. For the sake of the pristine beauty of these places and unforgettable extreme entertainment, it is worth overcoming a difficult path and getting here from the Mexican capital.

Spain impresses with its architecture, which has preserved its cultural heritage. It is impossible to get around, go around or fly around them in a month or two, because in every city, on every island, what makes Spain a sunny, colorful country with incredible landscapes has been preserved. 

In Barcelona alone, you can observe the Sagrada Familia, a famous building with unusual shapes that it seems as if it was built by alien creatures. The architect Gaudi not only combined various styles of Gothic and Art Nouveau, as in the temple, but also brought a zest to the architecture of Barcelona itself

text:
🇲🇾Malaysia, Kuala Lumpur

Kuala Lumpur is the capital of Malaysia, located in the south-west of the Malacca Peninsula at the mouth of the Klang and Gombak rivers, in a valley surrounded by mountains.

The combination of incongruous under the open sky is exactly what you can say about the capital of Malaysia. Modern skyscrapers, Indian temples, British colonial houses, mosques and lace-like buildings in the Arab style, Chinese markets and temples traditionally decorated with paper lanterns are intertwined here-you never know what an amazing combination of architecture and cultures is waiting for you around the corner.

The recognition of the city was brought by the Petronas towers, whose height is 452 meters. These are the world's tallest twin towers since 1998.

text: 🇮🇩On the edge of Bali

🇮🇹Italy, Capri

Capri is an island in the southern part of the Bay of Naples of the Tyrrhenian Sea. The island is so striking in its nature that poems were dedicated to it, paintings were painted. In a word, this resort became popular even during the Roman Republic.

Today, the island represents not only a rich culture, azure sea and sandy beaches, but also the island has become the abode of expensive and chic villas, boutiques of famous fashion designers, restaurants with local delicacies. And a yacht ride among the rocks of “Faraglioni" will take you to the most picturesque places of the island.

📌There is no winter on the island, so you can come here to relax all year round, but the cost of a hotel per night can cost from 100 to 700 euros.

🇻🇳What will you like about Bai Tu Long Bay?

1. Bai Tu Long Bay is the quiet older brother of Halong Bay. this bay is much less overloaded with boats, and the waters of the bay are much cleaner from pollution.
2. Thanks to the strong connection of cruise companies with the local culture and their way of life, you will also be able to visit floating villages.
3. Bai Tu Long has several beautiful attractions to visit, including Kong Do District, Vung Vieng Fishing Village, Da Hep Park, Kong Dam District, Thien Son Son Cave and Tra Joy Beach.

text:
🇫🇮Finland, Lapland

Lapland is a cultural region located in Northern Europe, which is not a separate city or state. Currently, the region is divided between four states: Norway, Sweden, Finland and Russia. Lapland is a province of Finland with the capital Rovaniemi, which is located right on the Arctic Circle crossing this part of Finland.

For many, this region is heard only from fairy tales about Santa Claus, and this is so. Thousands of tourists travel to Lapland to the city of Rovaniemi to see the real Santa Claus in his official residence. But before you taste ginger cookies and hot cocoa, you need to plunge into the fabulous atmosphere of ski resorts, go dog sledding, visit a deer farm and see the Northern Lights, which happens here about 200 days a year.

📌The real name of the Finnish Santa Claus is Yolupuki, which means "Christmas goat". Santa has a passport, where in the column "date of birth" it is written: "a long time ago".

text:
🇮🇹Positano, Italy
The pearl of the Amalfi coast — Positano is a whole galaxy of pastel-colored houses clinging to the steep ledges of the Lattari mountains. They are reflected in the clear sea below, and are surrounded by fragrant lemon gardens, and bright and lively colors of Bougainvillea flowers. A maze of alleys and steps with small shops where you will find local Italian products of local artisans, which, together with the undeniable beauty of the landscape, have greatly contributed to the fact that Positano and the Amalfi coast have become famous all over the world.

text:
🇯🇴Jordan, Petra

Petra is an ancient city located in the south-west of Jordan. It is located at an altitude of more than 900 m above sea level in the narrow Sik canyon. The ancient city of Petra belongs to the new wonders of the world, and is also included in the UNESCO World Heritage List. 

One of the main attractions of Peter is the Stone City and the Palace of El-Khazneh - this is the tomb of one of the kings of the Nabataean kingdom. The palace is a monumental building, carved entirely from the rock in the I century, 40 meters high. The stone city boasts more than 800 ancient monuments, which are evidence that people lived here. To this day, it remains a mystery how the builders at that time managed to create such a structure. 

📌The Al-Khazneh Temple is widely known in the world thanks to the Steven Spielberg film "Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade" and "Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen" because it is the most popular attraction in the district.

Miami is the largest metropolis in the southeastern United States, located in the state of Florida and has access to the Atlantic Ocean.

It is not only an ideal city for entertainment, but also the most important financial and economic center of the country.

text:
🇫🇷INTERESTING FACTS ABOUT PARIS

1)Paris became one of the first cities in the world to install street lights.

2) Paris is the birthplace of striptease, since the first dance with full nudity occurred during a student party at the Moulin Rouge cabaret.

3) Famous writers Alexandre Dumas and Guy de Maupassant, as well as the architect of the Paris Opera Charles Garnier and other famous people at the time signed a petition claiming that the Eiffel Tower disfigures the appearance of Paris.

text:
🇧🇴Bolivia, Salar de Uyuni

It is located in Bolivia, but at one glance at this place I want to attribute to it an unearthly origin.

The largest dried-up salt lake in the world. It glitters and shimmers so much in the sun that it hurts your eyes, so you can not do without sunglasses. Another attraction of the Uyuni salt marsh is the Forest of Stones. This is an unusual landscape with stone statues and sculptures created by wind and water.

📌 On a trip to Salar de Uyuni, you can spend the night in "salt" hotels, in which even beds and tables are made of sodium chloride.

text:
🇦🇪Dubai Aquarium is the largest and most frequently visited aquarium in the world. It is located in a huge shopping and entertainment complex "Dubai Moll" in the city of Dubai. 

This aquarium is so huge that it rises on 3 floors of the shopping center, several thousand species of marine plants, fish and other underwater inhabitants live here. Here you can not only observe the life of underwater animals and fish, but also go diving and snorkeling, and even a boat ride, where you can feed the marine life. 

📌Dubai Aquarium is listed in the Guinness Book of Records as the largest owner of the tiger shark collection and as a tank with the largest panoramic viewing panel. The cost of tickets starts from$ 10, depending on which package of services you choose.

text:
🇸🇬Singapore is a miniature city-state with an area of only 725 km2 in Southeast Asia. It is located in close proximity to the equator (1 degree north), so that temperature fluctuations are minimal here, and the thermometer shows from +23 to +30 ° C almost all year round.

Singapore is one of the most expensive and prosperous countries in the world, which unites various Asian cultures and ethnic groups. There is not a single natural source of fresh water in the city-previously it was imported from Malaysia, now they desalinate sea water and carefully store it in reservoirs.

📌Singaporeans are so tolerant that all conflicts on national grounds stopped here in the 1970s, and now you can go to jail for a month for a racist comment in a Singaporean social network!

text:
🌍Africa is the second largest continent after Eurasia, washed by the Mediterranean Sea from the north, the Red Sea from the northeast, the Atlantic Ocean from the west and the Indian Ocean from the east and south. Africa is also called the part of the world consisting of the continent of Africa and adjacent islands. There are 54 States, unrecognized States and 5 dependent territories (island) located on the territory of Africa.

For travelers, this is a rich, diverse continent, where a huge number of nationalities, languages and cultures are located, an unusual, wild animal world that you want to learn, enjoy and feel. 

📌 Countries where it is safe to relax in Africa: Sierra Leone, Botswana, Ghana, Namibia, Uganda, Cape Verde, Kenya, Tanzania, Madagascar, Zimbabwe, Egypt, Tunisia, Morocco.

text:
🇪🇸Ibiza is a small Spanish island in the Mediterranean Sea, which is recognized as the most fashionable and party island in Europe.

"Fashionable”," Party” these are the words that can describe all the streets, bars, restaurants, beaches and hotels in Ibiza. Most of the music festivals and parties take place on the island in the summer season, in autumn and winter the rest on the island is more peaceful. During the day, you can go diving, windsurfing, fishing, visit spa centers, buy souvenirs at the "hippie market" or just take a walk among the fashionistas of Europe. But the evening should start with the contemplation of a beautiful sunset and then give yourself up to fun in the numerous nightclubs of Ibiza.

text:
🇮🇳India, Jog

The Jog Falls waterfall in Karnataka is the highest in India. Its height is 253 meters.

The best views of the waterfall can be found during the rainy season, at other times you risk experiencing disappointment – in a drought, the Jog often turns into pathetic trickles of water that evaporate halfway to the reservoir at the foot. In addition, the flow capacity is regulated by a dam, and on weekends, for the sake of tourists, it is increased. For an energetic morning, you can go down to the foot of the waterfall and swim in the invigorating, energized water. 

📌The cost of entering the territory of the waterfall is 100 rupees or $ 1.5.

🇵🇭The Republic of the Philippines is a country in Asia. It consists of many islands located in the Pacific Ocean between Indonesia and Taiwan. 

The Philippines is a state lost among the seas and oceans on seven thousand islands, with about 1000 inhabited. The warm climate, the gentle sea, snow-white beaches, diverse tropical vegetation, steep cliffs and numerous coral reefs with their colorful underwater world create a unique feeling of unreal beauty of these places. There are also plenty of exotics, delicious cuisine, developed resorts and dizzying skyscrapers, as well as luxury diving.

text:
🇮🇹The Dolomites are a mountain range in the Eastern Alps, located in the north-eastern part of Italy. The length of the system is about 150 km, the highest point is Mount Marmolada (3342 m).

These Majestic rocks are known for their unusual and spectacular natural phenomenon, when the mountains change their color from a pale tone to a flaming red, gradually turning into orange,and then fading into purple. Due to the geological composition, the mountain peaks change their color in the rays of the setting sun, thereby creating a unique light effect, which is called "Enrosadira".

📌The most authoritative mountaineers of our planet – Reinhold Messner once said that "the Dolomites are hardly the highest mountains in the world, but without a doubt the most beautiful".

🇮🇸Iceland is an island country located in the west of Northern Europe, washed by the Atlantic Ocean in the north and northeast by the Arctic Ocean. 

"The land of ice", that's what it is called, a country in which almost all the sights are its nature. There you can see active volcanoes and geysers, hot mineral springs and waterfalls, glaciers and lava fields. There are all conditions for hiking, cycling, mountaineering and paragliding. 

📌The best time to visit the country is July and August, when it is summer here and nature allows travelers to enjoy all the beauties of the island.

text: Spain

Hacks

For your trip, we have studied the country and compiled a small list of useful tips that will help you on a trip to Spain.

✏ ️ If you are traveling on your own and want to ride on public transport, then buy a travel ticket, you can save up to 10 euros per day.

✏ ️ Safe in the hotel, be sure to take rooms with a safe, as there is a high level of theft on the streets of Spain and it is better not to carry your passport and all your savings with you.

✏ ️ Shopping, set aside a day or even two for it, the shops in Spain are huge, and some have a separate schedule, so if you come for a couple of days, check in advance whether your store is working.

✏ ️ The sun in Spain is very treacherous and does not spare the snow-white skin, after cold winters. Be careful!

messages.text:
Cliff Diving has been an extreme sport since 1992, jumping from natural towers (rocks, buildings) into the water. Usually the height of the tower starts from 10 meters.

Cliff Diving is the leader among other sports in terms of its entertainment. A special highlight is added to it by the picturesqueness of the surrounding landscapes. Particularly interesting is the diving that takes place in the water, with sharp rock formations located under it. The athlete has a high risk of collision with them and instant death. A person who has chosen cliff diving for himself goes through a lot of training that prepares his body for this risky event, because the impact force when entering the water is 9 times greater.

To enjoy the skills of cliff divers, you can go to such countries: Krabi Island in Thailand, Santorini Island in Greece, the vicinity of the city of Kimberley in Australia, where jumps are performed among picturesque rocks, cut by caves and rich waterfalls.

🇵🇹Portugal is the westernmost country of mainland Europe, washed by the Atlantic Ocean. This country combines the traditions and culture of modern Europe and also does not forget about its cultural heritage.

Portugal is created for a calm, measured holiday, and is suitable for those who want to enjoy the beauty of Europe. Depending on the region, the culture of the country changes. You can enjoy in Portugal not only viewing architectural structures, but also beaches and even surfing in the period from May to October, the weather is comfortable here, which will help you feel the atmosphere of Portuguese life.

messages.text:
🇵🇹Portuguese cuisine is simple to prepare dishes based on seafood, cabbage and a wide variety of cheeses. The Portuguese are not indifferent to spices, especially to pepper Pri-Pri - this hot pepper is used in almost every dish.

One of the most famous dishes that every visitor should try - Bakalyau - is dried salted cod. Previously, this dish was common, but now it is not an indispensable attribute of all holidays.

For dessert, Portuguese confectioners have prepared Pate de Belen - these are cakes made of dough in the form of baskets with custard, sprinkled with powdered sugar and cinnamon on top.

🇵🇹Portugal. Attractions 🥰

Portugal is beautiful at any time of the year, but for those who like to go sightseeing, it is best to visit the country in autumn and spring.

The most popular routes are the capital Lisbon and the city of Porto, but despite this, there are many other cultural and architectural places hidden in Portugal that are worth looking for when moving away from the well-known routes.

messages.text:
🇵🇹Portugal. Life Hacks

After a stay in the country, you always want to bring a piece of it with you, but sometimes the choice is either so huge that your eyes run away, or quite meager. But there is something in Portugal that you need to bring necessarily👇

✏ ️ Wine, the famous Madeira and Port Wine, the price will start from 2.5€.

✏ ️Souvenirs in the form of a rooster are symbols of the country, so it is mandatory to add them to the list. 

✏ ️Products made of cork. A cup holder made of this material will be an excellent set for a bottle of Port wine.

✏ ️And of course, for those with a sweet tooth, you can bring the famous sweets from the Algarve.

✏ ️Leather goods, various embroidery, wood crafts, handmade carpets - all this is made in the Portuguese style, will remind you of a part of your unforgettable journey.

messages.text:
🇺🇸Sequoia National Park is one of the most interesting natural attractions on the West Coast of the United States, located on the slopes of the Sierra Nevada Mountains in California. 

Sequoia Park in the USA is interesting primarily because you can see the largest living organisms in the world – giant sequoias. The park has high mountain peaks, deep canyons and a whole system of branched caves, as well as alpine meadows, lakes and rivers. Special attention is required by General Sherman — the largest tree in the world, this is the absolute record holder of all currently growing trees. It has a height of almost 84 meters, a diameter at the base of 11 meters, a total weight of almost 2000 tons, and an age of about 2500 years. Just imagine: this giant grew up even when the world did not know either Columbus or Alexander the Great.

📌 Entrance to the park is paid: for a regular car, regardless of the number of passengers inside, it costs $30. The ticket is not a one-time ticket, it is valid for 7 days.

messages.text:
Sandboarding is a sport that consists of snowboarding on sand dunes, dunes or embankments in quarries instead of snowy mountains.

Opened in 1940, and known since ancient Egypt, surfing on the sand is almost no different, except whether you will get sea spray of water or sand in your face.It is distributed in Australia, Egypt-the birthplace of sandboarding, South America. The World Sandboarding Championship is also held annually in Hirschau, Germany, in Monte Kaolino, where the largest sand hill in Europe is currently located. Participants can climb to the top of the dune, which is more than 300 feet (91 m) high, and descend to the base of the hill.

📌 The official world speed record achieved on a sandboarding board, recorded in the Guinness Book of Records, is 82 km/h, unofficial-97 km/h.

text:
🇮🇸INTERESTING FACTS ABOUT ICELAND

1. The territory of Iceland due to severe weather conditions was inhabited by one of the last on Earth – people came to this region only in the IX century AD.
2. Icelanders often build small churches in their gardens, hoping to convert to Christianity the little people of Huldufolk, who, according to legend, hide in the local mountains.
3. The inhabitants of Iceland seriously believe in the existence of trolls and elves – for example, before starting the design of a new road, builders consult with experts in folklore, so as not to accidentally invade the possessions of these fantastic creatures.
4.It is not allowed to import horses into the territory of Iceland for an unknown reason. If the horse is taken out of the country, it is also impossible to return it back.
5. Iceland is the only European country where striptease is legally prohibited. The ban was introduced in 2010.

text:
🇪🇸Ronda is a city in the south of Spain in the province of Malaga. It is located on a cliff around the deep El Tahoe gorge with a depth of 100 meters, through which an impressive bridge has been built. 

Ronda is one of the most beautiful cities in Andalusia, a colorful ancient tapestry woven from threads of winding streets, ancient white houses and picturesque landscapes. Everything is admired here-from the extraordinary, breathtaking landscapes that open from almost anywhere in the city, to the frightening concentration of attractions.

📌Ronda is the birthplace of bullfighting and it is here that the oldest and largest bullring in Spain (Plaza de Toros de la Real Maestranza), built in 1784, is located. A ticket to the arena costs 6 euros per person.

text:
🇬🇷Athens is the capital of modern Greece and the majestic center of the ancient Greek civilization, which was famous for its power in the era of antiquity.

Athens is the heart of Greece, which has collected the largest collection of Greek ruins and artifacts that, like a time machine, will take you back a couple of millennia. 

Everyone who happens to be in Athens by the will of fate will be welcomed cordially and hospitably — in Greek. And they also like to make a lot of noise in taverns, laugh loudly in the streets, live to the fullest and breathe in the air with a full chest.

text:
🇮🇳Jaipur is the capital of Rajasthan, the famous "pink city" in the north-west of India. It is named so because of the old part of the city painted in pink or terracotta color. 

Most of the attractions are concentrated inside the city walls, there is also one of the busiest markets in India, where you can taste the most delicious cheese tortilla of India, as well as many craft workshops. Jaipur has preserved a unique geometric layout in India, spelled out in the oldest Indian treatise on architecture.

📌The best time to visit is in the winter season (October - March) - when the temperature rarely rises above +22 °C.

text: 🇮🇩Pink Beach or Pantai Mera is one of the seven pink beaches on the planet, located on the island of Komodo, which make it a truly natural wonder of nature. This exceptional beach gets its striking color thanks to microscopic animal foraminifera, which emit red pigment on coral reefs. For this reason, it is called Red Beach in the local language. When tiny fragments of red coral are combined with white sand, a soft pink color is obtained, which is visible along the coastline.

🇺🇸USA, New York

New York is perhaps the most famous city in the world, where financial institutions, numerous historical and cultural attractions, museums, shops, theaters and much more are concentrated. This is a noisy and bright city of skyscrapers and freedom, which is familiar to many from the abundance of movies and photos where the action takes place on its streets. There are as many possibilities as you can imagine. From Times Square to the darkest corner of the Bronx — the realm of extremes. From the Russian enclave in Brooklyn on Brighton Beach to the branch of South America in Queens-communities from any country in the world.

text:
🇱🇰Sri Lanka, Ambuluvava Tower.

Visiting this tower, you are convinced that the view from it is simply fantastic! But you still need to climb to the very top! The peculiarity of the building is that it is equipped with a spiral staircase. And what is most interesting, the ascent is not inside, but outside the building, and it becomes narrower and narrower as you approach the top!
Although the tower is not a skyscraper, it is contraindicated for people who are afraid of heights, because they will have to climb on foot alone along a narrowing spiral of stairs, an accordion wrapped around it and only on one side fenced with a stone railing to the waist.

text:
🇧🇿Belize, the Big blue Hole.

The Big Blue Hole is a large sinkhole of the Belizean Barrier Reef in the Atlantic Ocean, located near the coast of a small Central American state. Diving into it is a serious test, to which only experienced divers are allowed. The gloomy beauty of deep-sea limestone caves overgrown with stalactites, deadly funnels formed by tides, flocks of nurse sharks that have chosen the surroundings of the Big Blue Hole make the descent into it a truly exciting adventure for true extreme athletes.

text: 🇫🇮Gorsa Canyon is located in the Kåfjorddalen Valley between the Barents Sea and the highest mountain in Finland. A bridge with the same name Corsa is thrown across the 153-meter ravine. The bridge offers a fantastic view of the surrounding area. Every summer on Saturdays, bungee jumping enthusiasts come here to make a jump to the northernmost point of the world.

text:
🇮🇩Indonesia, Bali, Broken Beach

Literally translated from the Balinese language, this place sounds like a "broken beach", which is true: Pasih Uug is a large natural pool created by a partially collapsed limestone hill hundreds of thousands of years ago. The whole beauty of this place lies precisely in the fact that the rock did not collapse completely, but in the form of an arch, the height of which is 98 m. Despite the fact that there is a huge selection of beaches in Indonesia, Pasih Uug is now one of the main tourist attractions for foreigners around the world. 
This beach is also recognized as one of the most unique works of natural art. And in the blue crystal clear water, you can see sea turtles and stingrays, which are absolutely not afraid of people.

🇬🇷Crete is the southernmost and largest island of Greece. The terrain of Crete is mostly mountainous, with many caves and gorges. Mountains and hills alternate with fertile valleys planted with vineyards, olive and citrus plantations.

The beaches of the island are famous for their cleanliness, many of them have been awarded the EU blue flag for cleanliness, safety and environmental friendliness.

🇩🇪Germany, Bonn

Bonn is a city in the western part of Germany on the Rhine River. This is the birthplace of the famous composer Beethoven.
Every spring, the old town of Bonn - Altstadt - turns into a marshmallow-pink fairy tale, causing a "hype" in all social networks. The blooming of the Bonn cherry blossom takes on a legendary character far beyond the borders of Germany.

text:
🇨🇭Sledding in St. Moritz:
Schlittelbahn Preda Bergün is the most famous toboggan run in Switzerland. To get to it, you need to take the train from St. Moritz to Preda, the trip will take about 20 minutes. At the Preda station, we rent a sleigh and take the train to Bergün-another 5 minutes. Finally, we get into the sleigh and roll 5 kilometers down, hooting with delight. A day ticket, including a train ride from Preda to Bergün and a sledge descent, costs 44 CHF for adults, 28 CHF for children.

text:
🇨🇴Colombia, Andes

The Andes is the longest and one of the highest mountain systems on Earth, bordering the entire South America from the north and west; the southern part of the Cordillera. In some places, the Andes reach a width of over 500 km. The average height is about 4000 m.

The Andes are a major interoceanic watershed. To the east of the Andes, the rivers of the Atlantic Ocean basin flow. The Amazon itself and many of its major tributaries originate in the Andes, as well as the tributaries of the Orinoco, Paraguay, Parana, the Magdalena River and the Patagonia River. To the west of the Andes flow mainly short rivers belonging to the Pacific Ocean basin.

The Andes also serve as the most important climatic barrier in South America, isolating the territories to the west of the Main Cordillera from the influence of the Atlantic Ocean, to the east — from the influence of the Pacific Ocean.

text:
🇺🇸USA, Yosemite National Park

The unique beauty of Yosemite attracts tourists from all over the world. The National Park seems to be a treasure box, hiding the most amazing jewels of nature. Among the four of its famous waterfalls is Yosemite-this is the largest waterfall in the United States, its height is 800 m. This is one of the highest waterfalls in the world, it consists of three separate waterfalls: the Upper Yosemite Waterfall - 436 m, the Middle Cascades with a height of 206 m and the Lower Yosemite Waterfall-98 m. It's easy to get to the Lower Yosemite Waterfall, but it will take a whole day to get to the Upper One, and the path will not be easy. 
Vernal Waterfall falls down with a white-foaming stream from an almost vertical cliff. The Nevada Waterfall is reminiscent of the wild primeval nature of the Sierra Nevada itself. The last in the list - but by no means the last in its merits - the waterfall "Bride's Veil" pours its icy waters into the valley.

3. In the morning, waking up in the town of Machu Picchu, you need to go to the bus stop, where buses depart every minute to the entrance to Machu Picchu. 
4.You can go down the mountain on the same bus

text:
🇦🇺Australia, the Twelve Apostles

The Twelve Apostles are a group of limestone cliffs off the coast of Port Campbell National Park. The rocks are one of the main attractions of the Great Ocean Road. Every year, the 12 apostles are visited by more than 2 million tourists, among whom there are many professional photographers. And this is not accidental. You can watch for hours how amazing and unique the rocks change their color depending on the lighting. The most spectacular views open at dawn and sunset, when the sun's rays paint the coast and rocks with bright colors, and then everything plunges into twilight. And on calm sunny days, the Twelve Apostles become magnificent sand-colored monuments.

text: 🇨🇳Zhangjiajie National Park is a nature reserve in the southeastern Chinese province of Hunan, located 32 km from the city of the same name. It was created primarily to protect unique species of plants and animals and fantastic rocky landscapes, but for 33 years of its existence, the reserve has risen to the second line of the most visited protected areas of the country, just behind the valley of the Jiuzhaigou waterfalls in Sichuan.

text:
🇯🇵Japan, the inhabited volcano Aogashima.
The last eruption of the Aogashima volcano occurred in 1783, as a result, 140 people died — half of the island's population. Half a century after these events, the inhabitants returned to Aogashima. In Aogashima, there are several dozen houses, several shops, a Bed & Breakfast hotel, an auto repair shop and a helipad.There are few tourists on the island with its picturesque nature, unique geothermal springs and opportunities for diving in the clear azure waters. 
You can get to the island by helicopter, which makes one route per day from the island of Hachijō-jim located 70 kilometers away or by ferry. There is an airport on Hachijo-jim, where planes fly from Tokyo.

text:
🇺🇸USA, Chicago

Chicago is the third most populous city in the United States; the largest metropolis of the state of Illinois, located along the coast of Lake Michigan. Chicago is often called the "second city" or "city of the winds": the "second city" means leadership in economic terms (after New York), and it received the nickname "city of the winds" because of the fluctuations of the city government (and not because of strong winds, as many think). The nickname, said by politicians, was so fixed that it became the second name of Chicago. This city has no lack of audacity and vanity, there is something fascinating about it... The powerful architecture of Chicago hides Mexican, Polish, Vietnamese and other ethnic residential areas that you can wander through. It is a city of blues, jazz and rock clubs open every night.

🇷🇺The Kuril Islands are a chain of islands between the Kamchatka Peninsula and the island of Hokkaido, separating the Sea of Okhotsk from the Pacific Ocean with a slightly convex arc.

 The length is about 1200 km. The total area is 10.5 thousand km2. To the south of them is the state border of Russia with Japan. The islands are of great military, strategic and economic importance. They are part of the Sakhalin Region of Russia.

🇦🇺The famous migration of red crabs on Christmas Island! 🦀
Every year in November or December, millions of red crabs migrate from the tropical forests located in the central part of this small piece of land to the coast of the Indian Ocean to breed. The beginning of the movement depends on the weather conditions - the change of the moon phase and the rains.

text:
🇯🇵Fujiyama Volcano, Japan 
Fujiyama is an active stratovolcano on the Japanese island of Honshu, 90 kilometers southwest of Tokyo. The height of the volcano is 3776 m (Kengamine Peak, the highest point in Japan). Currently, the volcano is considered weakly active, the last eruption was in 1707-1708. 
 This is the only natural attraction that everyone, without exception, wants to see and visit.

text:
🇨🇭High-speed elevator to Hammetschwand Mountain, Switzerland

 The elevator takes passengers to the top (1132 m), overcoming the vertical height of 152 m in less than a minute. It was built a century ago, and is the tallest open elevator in Europe.
 The elevator is also famous for the fact that it was used by James Bond in the 1967 film "Goldfinger".

text:
🇺🇸Glory Hole, Lake Berryessa.
A terrible whirlpool in the lake, absorbing everything that just gets into it.
A circular rotation is formed when encountering an obstacle, the water flow turns back, moving against the current. But all the water does not have time to return back and bumps into a newly arriving water flow. As a result, it begins to spin at a speed that largely depends on the speed of the main current.

text:
🇦🇷Perito Moreno Glacier, El Calafate, Argentina
This is the largest and most accessible glacier in Argentina, Patagonia and all of South America, so crowds of tourists come here. The area of Perito Moreno is 250 sq. km, the width of the tongue is 5 km, the average height is 60 m above the water surface. The glacier is moving at a speed of 2 m / day, but since pieces of ice break off from it every day, it has not been advancing and retreating for more than 90 years.

text:
🇮🇹 Como, Italy
The third largest lake in Italy, one of the deepest in Europe (up to 410 m). It is located 40 km north of Milan. Villa Balbianello (1787), located on Cape Lavedo, in Lenno, is widely known. It was on it that a fragment was shot for the movie "Star Wars. Episode II: Attack of the Clones "(2002). The beauty of the lake can be seen in other films: "Ocean's Twelve Friends", "Casino Royale", "A Month by the Lake", etc.

text:
🇦🇹INTERESTING FACTS ABOUT AUSTRIA

1. Mountains cover as much as 62% of the territory of this country.
2. Vienna, the Austrian capital, has repeatedly been included in the top 10 best cities to live in all over the world.
3. Baking is very popular in Austria. There is a "special" cake in every village.
4. It is in this country that such a famous dance as the waltz appeared.
5. In the Austrian city of Salzburg there is the world's oldest operating restaurant, which has been operating for more than 1200 years.
6. All public saunas in Austria are designed for everyone at once, men and women, without gender separation.
7. Theaters are very popular here, but it is sometimes difficult for tourists to buy good seats for a performance, since local residents buy season tickets and book their favorite seats for six months in advance.
8. Keeping a dog in Austria is taxable.

🇮🇩 Nusa Penida, Indonesia
An island in the Indian Ocean southeast of Bali. Nusa Penida is a quiet nature reserve, without the noise of roads, traffic jams and dust. Tourism is less developed on it and in general, there is less presence of civilization. People come to the island for beautiful and sometimes wild nature, which is already difficult to meet in Bali.

text:
🇲🇨INTERESTING FACTS ABOUT MONACO:

1. Citizens of Monaco are prohibited by law from visiting casinos — they work only for foreigners.
2. After walking for an hour through the evening streets, there are good chances to see the top 10 most expensive cars in the world.
3. Helicopter owners in Monaco have the right to fly no more than twenty minutes daily.
4. The price of real estate in Monaco starts from about thirty thousand euros per square meter.
5. The National Orchestra of the Principality is bigger than its army.

text:
🇲🇻Ari Atoll, Maldives
One of the largest atolls in the Maldives, it covers an area of 80x30 km, as much as the atolls of North Male and South Male combined. Located to the west of the South Male Atoll, it took on the third wave of the resort construction boom in the early 1990s, following two atolls on each side of the capital that were built up two decades earlier. Now there are 30 resort islands on Ari, that is, the most in the archipelago.

text:
🇳🇿New Zealand, Lake Wanaka 
The lake is located in the central part of the Yuzhny Island to the north of the resort town of the same name. The altitude is 280 meters above sea level. It is surrounded on all sides by the Southern Alps — a mountain range up to 3000 meters high, while on the western side the terrain is more mountainous than on the east. The lake is located in a valley formed as a result of glacial erosion during the last ice age about 10 thousand years ago. Lake Wanaka is a famous New Zealand resort. Real estate in the lake area is very expensive, the cost of a house can reach several million euros. The nearby mountains also attract skiing enthusiasts.

text:
🇮🇸The Blue Lagoon is a year-round spa in Iceland. Entrance ticket for adults (14+) - from 6990 ISK (Icelandic kroner).

The Blue lagoon is a large lake with an ideal temperature for swimming (on average 39°C). It is located on the Reykjavik Peninsula in the south-west of Iceland, a 15-minute drive from Keflavik International Airport and about 30 minutes from the capital, Reykjavik. It turns out that this is an ideal place to stop on arrival or departure from the country.

text:
🇮🇸Ice caves, Iceland
This is an amazing manifestation of the many elements that take their toll on the island: lava flowing deep into the Ground, melting glaciers and a huge amount of ice moving at the speed of a snail come together to create these ice wonders. They are always moving and changing: from one season to another, ice caves can become completely new scenes.

text:
🇺🇸From May to July, you can watch special sunsets in New York, when the luminous disk of the setting sun lines up with skyscrapers along the streets of Manhattan.

The best places to observe Manhattan are along the main streets of New York, in particular 14th, 34th, 57th and 79th Streets. Experts recommend going to the easternmost part of Manhattan to observe this phenomenon.

text:
🇨🇦Canadian Rockies, Lake Moiraine.
The Canadian Rocky Mountains are a mountain range in western Canada, which is part of the Pacific Cordillera. The highest point is Mount Robson (3,954 m).
Large beautiful lakes are very characteristic of the Rocky Mountains. An unusually picturesque feature of the lake is the turquoise color of the lake water, which struck its discoverer W. Wilcox. The color is due to the presence of microparticles in the water that reflect the blue color and fall into the water from melting ice.

🇦🇪Sandboarding in Dubai is entertainment for real thrill-seekers. 

Strap on a board that resembles a snowboard and conquer the dunes like snow slopes in Ski Dubai. You can get to the Big Red Dune yourself and rent a sandboard there. 

There are also many companies in Dubai, such as Dream Explorer Dubai, Desert Rangers and LamaDubai, which offer special travel packages. Sandboarding may seem difficult, but in just a couple of attempts you will learn how to glide smoothly on sandy slopes.

🇮🇳Manali, India is a city in the Kullu district of Himachal Pradesh, located in the northern part of the Kullu Valley. The city lies at an altitude of 1800 meters.
Manali is visited by people who are fond of such active recreation as skiing, hiking on rough terrain and mountains, mountaineering, paragliding, rafting, kayaking and mountain biking.
There are also hot springs, religious shrines and Tibetan Buddhist temples in Manali.

🇵🇼Koror is an island in the Pacific Ocean. 
It is part of the Koror State of the Micronesian state of Palau. 
From the point of view of geology, the island has a mixed volcanic and coral origin. The climate is tropical.
The basis of the economy is agriculture and fishing. Tourism is actively developing.

text:
🇧🇸WHAT YOU SHOULD DEFINITELY DO IN THE BAHAMAS:
1. Go down the stairs of Queen Victoria in Nassau.
2. Look into the realm of unique perfume scents in Freeport.
3. Swim in the open ocean with trained dolphins on Grand Bahama.
4. Build a sand castle on the pink beach of Harbor Island.
5. Scuba dive into the bowels of the Exuma archipelago, which consists of 400 islets with caves and rocks.
6. See the habitat of the cleanest pigs on the planet on the island of Big Major Spot.
7. Visit the capital of world fishing on the island of Andros.

text:
🇹🇭Thailand  

Thailand is a country in Southeast Asia, located in the southwestern part of the Indochina Peninsula and in the northern part of the Malacca Peninsula.  

Every year, thousands of tourists flock to the beautiful beaches and the incredible sunset of Thailand. But many people forget that the beauty of the country is not limited to views alone, but is closely connected with the culture and life of the Thais themselves.

text:
🇻🇪Angel Waterfall. Venezuela.
Angel Falls is the most famous natural treasure of Venezuela and one of the most impressive places in the world. Its height is 1054 m. It was opened relatively recently - in 1935. The discoverer of the waterfall is considered to be an American pilot Jimmy Angel, who dreamed of finding the Golden River all his life.

text:
🇲🇲Shwedagon Pagoda, Myanmar. 
98-meter gilded stupa in Yangon, Myanmar. The name comes from "Shwe" (Burm. gold) and "Dagon" — the ancient name of Yangon. The most revered pagoda in Burma, according to legend, contains relics of the four Buddhas: the staff of Kakusandha, the water filter of Konagamana, part of the tunic of Kassapa and eight hair of Gautama.

text:
🇮🇪Ireland is an island that holds many mysteries, stories and the heritage of Celtic culture.

In 1393, a rock with a height of 45 meters, which is equivalent to a task of 15 floors, separated from the mainland and is now located at a distance of 228 meters from it. This sight looks incredible and very fascinating. The separated part of the land was named "Dún Briste" (translated: destroyed fortress)

text:
🇨🇭Ticino, Switzerland.
The canton of Ticino is the only canton in Switzerland where Italian is spoken. Separated from the rest of the country by an inaccessible Alpine ridge, it looks more like Italy than the rest of Switzerland.
Beautiful mountains, no longer as high and rocky as in the Bernese Oberland, softer, wooded, and numerous picturesque lakes are the main pride of the region.

text:
🇫🇴INTERESTING FACTS ABOUT THE FAROE ISLANDS:

1. The roofs of most houses in the Faroe Islands are green, and the houses themselves are painted in bright colors. This adds color to life and makes the city beautiful
2. There is almost no crime here. There aren't even any prisons here! None at all. And in those rare cases when a crime occurs, the caught criminals are sent to Denmark.
3. There is not a single McDonald's in the Faroe Islands.
4. Free buses run around the capital of the Faroe Islands. But there are also paid routes.
5. For a long time, alcohol was completely banned in the Faroe Islands. Prohibition was abolished a long time ago, but alcohol is still cosmically expensive here.

Rainbow mountains in Peru gained popularity just a few years ago. For the simple reason that they were previously hidden under the snow. And now everyone who comes to Cuzco considers it his duty to see this miracle of nature. At the same time, most people choose the most popular and affordable option - the route to Mount Vinikunka.

From the end of September to the end of March, it is dark in Northern Norway from early evening to late morning, and the northern lights are not uncommon in a dark sky. This part of Norway with its numerous islands, deep fjords and steep mountains is included in the list of the most beautiful and interesting places where you can watch the northern lights.

🇮🇸Dettifoss, Iceland
Dettifoss is a waterfall on the Jekulsau au Fjedlum River in northeastern Iceland, on the territory of the Jekulsaurgljuvur National Park. It is considered the most powerful waterfall in Europe. The width of the Dettifoss is about 100 m, the height is 44 m.
The waterfall is shown in Ridley Scott's film Prometheus in one of the main scenes.

🇲🇽Tulum, Mexico.
The city of Tulum is located in the eastern part of Mexico. Historical monuments of the heyday of ancient Indian civilizations have always aroused genuine interest among tourists from all over the world. The mysterious Mayan culture has left an invaluable cultural heritage to this planet, full of mysteries and contradictions. The unprecedented level of knowledge in architecture, astronomy and natural history reflect the ruins of ancient cities that have survived to our time.

text: 🇧🇴Bolivia. The dried-up salt lake Salar de Uyuni has gained special popularity due to one of its features. Its inner part is covered with a thick layer of table salt from 2 to 8 meters. During the seasonal rains, the thin layer of water that covers the area of the salt marsh turns it into an amazing mirror surface – it seems that in this place the sky and the earth are connected together.

text:
🇩🇪 Germany, Bavaria
The castle is a fairy tale hidden in the forests of the Bavarian Alps, a real masterpiece that has earned crazy popularity among tourists and brings fabulous profits to Germany. 
Neuschwanstein became the prototype of the Sleeping Beauty Castle at Disneyland Paris, a source of inspiration for Tchaikovsky's ballet Swan Lake and the embodiment of Ludwig II's love for Wagner's music.

🇺🇸Antelope Canyon, Arizona, USA
Antelope Canyon is a canyon located in the southwestern United States, in northern Arizona, 240 km from the Grand Canyon. The canyon got its name due to the reddish-red walls resembling the skin of an antelope. It lies on the lands of the Navajo tribe and belongs to the Indians of this tribe. To get there, you need to pay a toll for passing through Indian territory and hire a guide.

text:
🇯🇴 Ancient city of Petra, Jordan
Petra is an ancient city, the capital of Idumea (Edom), later the capital of the Nabataean kingdom. The Nabataeans themselves called their city Rqm 
((frame). It is located on the territory of modern Jordan, at an altitude of more than 900 m above sea level and 660 m above the surrounding
terrain, in the Arava Valley, in the narrow Sik Canyon.
The passage to the valley is through gorges located in the north and in the south, while from the east and west the rocks break off steeply,
forming natural walls up to 60 m in height.

The building houses the headquarters of the chemical giant Honda Xingyue Group and the Guangdong Plastic Exchange, the world's largest plastic trading platform.

🇸🇪Ore is a Swedish ski resort in Lena Emtland. 

The settlement was founded more than 1000 years ago in a place in the vicinity of which Vikings and the Sami people lived. 

In the XVIII and XIV centuries there were copper mines in the vicinity of Ore. Tourism has been developing here since the beginning of the XIV century

text:
🇧🇷 Lens Maranenses National Park, Brazil.
The snow-white dunes in the Lençóis Maranhenses National Park (parque Nacional dos Lençóis Maranhenses) are one of the main natural attractions of northern Brazil. The undulating landscapes of the reserve, resembling snow drifts from a bird's-eye view, are formed by natural lagoons and sand dunes. The relief is formed and changes under the influence of winds blowing from the Atlantic coast; strong gusts form dunes up to forty meters high.

🇳🇴INTERESTING FACTS ABOUT OSLO - THE CAPITAL OF NORWAY

1. Today Oslo is the most expensive city. When creating this rating, everything was taken into account: rental housing, public transport, food prices, etc.

2. The weather in this city is also amazing, because it can change every day: drizzling rain alternates with clear sun, so the weather here is unpredictable.

3. Oslo is often also called the city of sculptures, as there are hundreds of them here, and besides, they are very interesting. Most of them are in Vigeland Park.

4. The Nobel Peace Prize is awarded annually in this European capital on December 10.

🇫🇮Pallas-Yllästunturin, Finland
Pallas-Yllästunturin is the third largest national park in Finland. It is located in the north of the country, in the province of Lapland. In fact, the park was formed only in 2005 as a result of the unification of the territory of the parks Pallas-Ounastunturi and Yllas-Aakenus. The total area is 1020 km². The high hills of the park are the southernmost place in Finland, where you can meet some Arctic species of animals and plants.

🇺🇸Banzai Pipeline, Oahu, Hawaii, USA.
The Banzai Pipeline Wave, which is located off the coast of the island of Oahu, Hawaii, is considered the mecca of surfing. The legendary wave with amazing pipes occurs where the energy of the swell meets the coral reef. There are many competitions held on the Pipeline, including the Pipeline Masters. Professional surfers come here from all over the world to ride one of the biggest and most dangerous waves on the planet. In winter, the waves reach a size of up to 10 meters.

🇦🇺Lake McDonnell, Australia.
Lake McDonnell on the Eyre Peninsula in South Australia is an amazingly beautiful landscape. On one side the road is bordered by the sea, on the other by a salt lake. 
Algae give the water an unusual color.Under normal conditions, they are green, but at high levels of salinity, light intensity and a certain water temperature, the pigment beta-carotene begins to accumulate, which leads to the appearance of a pinkish-crimson hue.

Hverfjall is not the name of an IKEA chair. A huge crater with a tooth-crushing, cheeky name Hverfjadl is one of the most interesting sights of Iceland and an amazing place even by the standards of this country. Its crater has a diameter of about 1 km. Climbing up its steep slopes offers stunning views of the Lake Mivatn area.

🇪🇬Pyramids of Giza, Egypt.
The Great Egyptian Pyramids of Giza are the most famous place on the African continent. The huge stone structures of Ancient Egypt are an architectural monument of antiquity. The Great Pyramids are located on the Giza plateau, in the Libyan desert, 8 km from the old city of Giza and 25 km from the capital of Egypt - the city of Cairo, where the fertile Nile Valley borders the red-hot sands of the Libyan desert.

text:
🇪🇨Devil's Cauldron Waterfall, Ecuador.
Perhaps one of the most amazing places in Ecuador is the Devil's Cauldron waterfall.
He puzzles everyone by the fact that near the northern shore there is Lake Verkhne, into which the Bruhl River flows. She made her way through the rocks, after which she divided into two streams and picturesquely descends the stone steps. One of the streams flows into the lake, and the second into a crevice and its further path is hidden from the eyes of geologists, tourists and travelers. Multiple studies and attempts to find where tons of water still go have not been successful. This fact is fascinating, because everything indicates that the water from the "Devil's Waterfall" disappears forever.

🇦🇷 🇧🇷 Iguazu Falls, Argentina and Brazil
One of the largest waterfalls in the world. They are located on the border of three countries: Brazil, Argentina and Paraguay. But by a ridiculous coincidence, Paraguay did not get a single waterfall. All 275 beautiful compositions of free-falling water were divided between Argentina and Brazil. Most of the waterfalls went to Argentina.

🇵🇹Algarve, Portugal.
The winding coastline with many capes, small and large bays, protects the beaches from wind and waves, as for the rocks, the main charm of this coast is that the rocks are adjacent to wide sandy beaches here. In the Algarve, they are for every taste: from long and wide, framed by steep rocky walls, to secluded coves that cannot be reached by land. And everywhere, like a fantastic city, bizarre rocks of soft limestone rise: high cliffs, lonely cliffs, arches, caves, grottoes.

text:
🇺🇸"Wave", Arizona, USA.
Approximately 180 to 190 million years ago, one of the greatest geological sites on our planet began to form in the USA. In the Coyote Buttes ravine on the border of Utah and Arizona, at an altitude of 1,592 meters above sea level, an “Arizona Wave" formed, which eventually became one of the most popular destinations among hiking enthusiasts. This unique mountain measuring 19 m wide and 36 m long has an incredible undulating appearance and a massive sandy structure . In a sense, this is a snapshot of how natural forces affect the environment.

text:
🇵🇹People come to Madeira in Portugal to look at the steep coastal cliffs, green mountain slopes, levades, laurel forests, man-made botanical gardens and picturesque villages. 

You will have to move a lot, so it's better to take comfortable shoes and clothes with you right away. Long hiking trails lead to Cape Cabo Girau and Pico do Arieiro, where observation decks are equipped. Especially hardy people can get to the highest mountain on the island — Pico Ruivu, from where you can see the whole of Madeira in clear weather. 

There are no fashionable hotels here, but nature and beautiful sunsets fascinate.

🇷🇴 Piatra-Craiului, Romania
The Piatra Craiului National Park is a nature conservation area in Romania with the status of a national park. It is located on the territory of the Pyatra-Krajului mountain range in the Southern Carpathians, 200 kilometers north of Bucharest. The National Park is notable for its karst landscape with interesting limestone formations and diverse flora and fauna.

text:
🇵🇭Siquijor is a province of the Philippines, in the Central Visayas region.

 Siquihor cannot boast of an abundance of ideal extended beaches, but those that exist are more than enough for all vacationers, because there are not very many tourists here, even at the height of the season. 

But there are excellent conditions for snorkeling and diving, and this is one of the main reasons why people come here. There are also several attractions worth visiting, including underwater rivers unique to this region of the Philippines.

text:
🇨🇴Cocora Valley, Colombia.
The tallest palm trees in the world grow in this valley, this is the so-called Wax Palm, which is a symbol of Colombia. This plant species grows in large groups exclusively in the high-altitude Kokora Valley. The height of these trees reaches up to 80 meters! You can see that the tops of the palm trees are located among the clouds, this is really because the valley itself is at a high altitude.

text:
🇮🇳Taj Mahal, India
The mausoleum is a mosque located in Agra, India, on the banks of the Jamna River. It was built by order of Tamerlane's descendant, the padishah of the Baburid Empire, Shah Jahan, in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal, who died giving birth to her fourteenth child. The Taj Mahal has been named a UNESCO World Heritage Site: "the pearl of Muslim art in India and one of the universally recognized masterpieces of World Heritage."

text:
🇦🇪Mangrove Reserve in Abu Dhabi. UAE.
A unique nature reserve consisting of mango thickets is located in the eastern lagoon. It is the first of 5 nature parks, the creation of which is planned in Abu Dhabi by 2030. Being among endless deserts, this green oasis has sheltered many fish, animals and birds. It is very important to maintain a balance in the environment and is carefully protected by the state.

text:
🇻🇳Golden Bridge, Da Nang, Vietnam.
Near the resort town of Da Nang, in Ba Na Hills in the summer of 2018, a huge bridge was built in the form of a golden thread, pulled out of the ground by giant hands. In appearance, this structure is hundreds or even thousands of years old. In fact, it was created only a few years ago from steel and glass.
When tourists are on the bridge, they feel like walking through the clouds like deities living in the sky.

🇫🇴Tjørnuvík is the northernmost village, located in the municipality of Sunda in the Faroe Islands. The village used to be a natural harbor, but after a terrible storm in the 1600s, the fjord was blocked by sand and became inaccessible. A black sand beach was formed here. 
Quite an interesting place to surf.

🇷🇺 Avachinskaya Sopka, Kamchatka, Russia
Avachinskaya Sopka is an active volcano in Kamchatka, in the southern part of the Eastern Ridge, north of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky
Height 2741 m . The diameter of the crater is 400 m . It has erupted 18 times in the history of observations, the last one in 1991.

text:
🇺🇸Fly Geyser, Nevada, USA
The geyser appeared on the territory of the "Fly" ranch thanks to human intervention. In 1916, a well was drilled here for a well, and a geothermal pocket was accidentally punched. And only in 1964, boiling water began to penetrate to the surface, creating an unusual landscape from minerals dissolving in water.

messages.text:
🇭🇷Plitvice Lakes, Croatia. 
Plitvice Lakes is the largest and oldest national park in Croatia. This magical creation of nature, located on the border with Bosnia and Herzegovina, is one of the ten most beautiful cascade lakes in the world. Croats themselves call Plitvice Lakes the eighth wonder of the world. In 1979, the park was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

text:
🇨🇦Helicopter flight over British Columbia, Canada 

Interesting facts about Canada:

1. The most popular sport among Canadians is ice hockey.
2. The Great Lakes in Canada are the largest source of fresh water on the planet by area, which does not freeze.
3. Tens of thousands of snakes mate annually near the city of Winnipeg.
4. In Canada, a special permit is required for the transportation of alcoholic beverages between different provinces of the country.

text:
🇮🇩Tirta Gangga Palace, Bali, Indonesia.
Tirta Gangga Royal Water Palace is a maze of pools and fountains surrounded by a lush garden with stone carvings and statues. In a small pond, pebbles "float" on the water, and between them - a lot of bright golden Koi carp, which can reach up to 1 meter in size. Tirta Ganga is a famous cultural site of Bali, it belongs to the royal family of Karangasema.

The palace and Park ensemble in France, the former residence of the French kings in the city of Versailles, now a suburb of Paris. The center of tourism of world importance.
Versailles was built under the leadership of Louis XIV since 1661. From 1682 to 1789, before the French Revolution, Versailles was the official royal residence.

On the bank of the river, half a kilometer north of the current city, there is a salt marsh, which, in fact, explains the appearance of this city in such difficult conditions

Floods here are quite predictable, which is why houses are built on high stilts.

🇩🇪Mount Watzmann, Germany.
Mount Watzmann, located in the south of Germany, in Bavaria, is the third highest peak in the country, located near the border with Austria. This peak is shrouded in myths and legends. For many centuries, she inspired artists. Unfortunately, she also has a notorious reputation. Many climbers have found their doom here. Perhaps the old curse was to blame.

🇨🇭Bridge "European", Switzerland
The longest pedestrian suspension bridge in the world, reaching a length of 494 meters. It is located at an altitude of up to 85 meters above the Grabengufer gap and is part of the tourist route between the towns of Grahen and Zermatt. The ropes that hold the bridge weigh about eight tons.

text:
🇨🇦 Omega Park, Quebec, Canada 

On the French side, just an hour's drive from Ottawa, there is a wonderful Omega Park, spread over a vast territory where animals - deer, elk, wild boars, bison - freely walk. Wolves, arctic foxes, and bears live a little less freely (in fenced, but very spacious territories). Visitors, slowly, drive through the park in cars, endlessly getting high from the deer and bison customs, extorting carrots and apples.

text:
🇮🇹Positano, Italy.
The resort town of Positano, located in the Bay of Naples, is incredibly beautiful: colorful houses cascading down steep hills directly to the shore, the sparkling dome of the church of Santa Maria Assunta, elegant yachts, boats and pleasure boats cutting the azure expanse of the sea… These landscapes have long attracted people of creative professions – film actors and directors, musicians, artists, writers.

text:
🇺🇸 Golden Gate Bridge, San Francisco, USA
Suspension bridge across the Golden Gate Strait. It connects the city of San Francisco in the north of the San Francisco Peninsula and the southern part of Marin County, near the suburb of Sausalito. The total length of the bridge is 2737 m, the length of the main span is 1280 m. Construction of the bridge began on January 5, 1933 and lasted for more than 4 years.

text:
🇪🇸 Montserrat Monastery, Spain
The Benedictine Monastery, the spiritual symbol and religious center of Catalonia and the center of pilgrimage for Catholics from all over the world. The monastery, located at an altitude of 725 m above sea level, got its name from the mountainous area of Montserrat ("Cut Mountains") 50 km northwest of Barcelona. The first mention of the Montserrat monastery dates back to 880.

text:
🇨🇴 Abandoned Hotel Del Salto, Colombia
This is one of the most amazing and mysterious sights of South America, causing conflicting feelings. On the one hand, the building fascinates with the grace and elegance of its lines, on the other hand, the devastation and dilapidation inherent in the structure abandoned by people gives it a gloomy and eerie shade. The building was built in a fantastically beautiful place - on the edge of a sheer cliff, surrounded by mountains covered with a misty haze, opposite the thundering waterfall of Tequendama.

🇮🇹Capri, Italy.
Capri is a wonderful island in the Bay of Naples, one of the most charming resorts in Italy. A small island with steep shores rises from the sea. It is an island of thickets of purple, pink and white bougainvillea and lemon trees, labyrinths of narrow and crooked streets and pastel-colored houses.

text:
🇻🇳Hong Thom Cable Car, Phu Quoc Island. Vietnam.
The Hong Thom Cable Car was opened in February 2018 and is the longest cable car in Vietnam and the world. The cable car is located on Phu Quoc Island in the south of the country, near the border with Cambodia. It stretches for 8 kilometers and connects the city of An Toi with the island of Hong Thom.
The journey takes only 15 minutes at a speed of 8.5 meters per second and allows passers-by to admire one of the most beautiful landscapes in all of Southeast Asia.

🇮🇩Ubud, Bali. Indonesia.
Ubud is the heart of the island, its cultural and spiritual centers. Here is a paradise for expats, nature music is everywhere, swimming pools with views of the giant jungle, places with delicious food, yoga at dawn and the most picturesque rice terraces. Waterfalls are just around the corner, but 40 minutes by bike to the nearest beach.

text:
🇺🇸 Sedona, Arizona, USA
Sedona is a small town in the north of Arizona in the USA, a real oasis in the desert lands on the very edge of the Colorado Plateau, surrounded by red rock formations, a picturesque canyon and coniferous forests. Due to its convenient location at the foot of the mountains, Sedona is famous for its rather mild climate. The beauty of nature and stunning panoramic views, as well as energy vortexes attracted the most creative people from all over the world.

🇦🇺Pink Lake, Australia.
Pink Lake is an extraordinary miracle of nature. Why is this lake so pink? The color of the water in it is so unusual due to the presence of special microorganisms. Their name is Dunaliiella saltwater. These algae belong to a special group of green algae that produce special pigments called carotenoids.

🇸🇮Kranjska Gora, Slovenia  

Kranjska Gora... even those who are not familiar with Slovenia yet have probably heard this name. And no wonder: here, on Kranjska Gora, the Alpine Skiing World Cup is regularly held. And the resort itself is so good that thousands of tourists occupy all available places in local hotels, apartments, hostels, apartments and just rooms. And the Planica Valley with one of the largest ski jumps in the world? In short, there is something to do here in winter.

🇭🇷Rovinj, Croatia.
Rovinj is a small seaside town in the west of Croatia. It is located on the Adriatic coast of the Istrian peninsula. Rovinj is one of the most picturesque and charming cities in the Mediterranean, which enchants with Venetian architecture and a maze of narrow streets, red tiled roofs and ancient buildings, a wonderful atmosphere and stunning sunsets. Its historical center is located on an island that was connected to the mainland only in the 18th century.

text:
🇲🇻Ithaa Restaurant, Maldives. 
The Ithaa Restaurant (Ithaa), owned by the Conrad Maldives Rangali Island Hotel, located on Rangali Island, is the first underwater restaurant in the world: it is located at a level of 5 meters below the sea surface.
Translated from the Maldivian language, the name of the restaurant means "pearl shell". The interior space can accommodate only 14 people. The transparent curved roof of the Itha restaurant opens a 270-degree panoramic view, offering to admire the sea beauties during a leisurely meal.

text:
🇦🇺Australia, Jenolan Caves

Jenolan Caves is a world-famous cave system located in the Blue Mountains of Australia, 175 kilometers from Sydney.

The Jenolan Caves are one of the oldest complexes in the world. By measuring the ratio of radioactive potassium and inert argon gas, which was released during the decay of potassium, scientists have determined the approximate age of clay in the cave - 340 million years.
The galactic formations in the caves are striking in their beauty. White, almost transparent stalactites shimmer with all the colors of the rainbow in the light of a lantern. Some caves are well lit and accessible to tourists, but most of the complex can only be explored by speleologists.

text:
🇦🇺Kings Canyon, Australia.
The Kings Canyon is one of the main natural attractions of Central Australia, located in the Watarrka National Park. The cliffs of the Canyon rise to a height of more than 300 m, forming a real rock maze, through which several hiking routes pass, and a small river Kings Creek flows at the bottom. Part of the gorge is a sacred territory for aborigines, and there are very few visitors there. There are more than 600 species of plants and animals in this amazing place.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Altai, Dragon's Teeth

"Dragon's Teeth" is one of the most beautiful sights of the Altai Mountains, which is a picturesque rocky islands in the shape of pyramids, as if emerging from the Katun River. This whole rocky complex resembles a dragon ridge.

An ancient legend tells us the story of the hero Sartakpai, who loved his native land very much, admired its beauties on the left and right banks of the Katun River, watched the locals. Only one thing bothered Sartykpai, how to make sure that residents of different shores could communicate with each other? He thought for a long time and finally found a solution to the problem: he took a huge piece from the top of the mountain with a mighty hand, crushed it into small stones and put it in the river so that people could build a bridge connecting the two opposite banks.

Now a road bridge has really been laid across the river. When you look at the "Dragon's Teeth" it's like you're in a fairy tale.

text:
🇹🇷Pamukkale, Turkey.
Pamukkale in Turkey is a famous thermal spring located in the southwestern part of the country. There is an extremely high amount of calcium carbonate in its water, which over the millennia has helped to form natural terraces, baths and stalactites. 
Nearby are the ruins of the ancient Greek city of Hierapolis. Together, they have long been included in the famous UNESCO list and represent a huge tourist center of Turkey, visited annually by millions of tourists.

text:
🇫🇷The city of Colmar, France.
Colmar is a charming city in the north-east of France in the province of Alsace, Haute-Rhin department. It is known for its ancient half-timbered houses along the canals, wines and as the birthplace of Auguste Bartholdi, the creator of the famous Statue of Liberty. Colmar is one of the most picturesque and photogenic cities in Alsace, which has well preserved its cultural and architectural heritage.

text:
🇮🇹Italy, Lombardy, Monza Park
(Autumn🍂)

Monza Park is one of the largest parks in Europe, a real green pearl of the city.
It resembles London's Hyde Park or Munich's Englischer Garten. In the Monza Park, you can not only walk or ride a bike, but also do sports. 700 hectares of land was allocated by Napoleon to create a park in 1805, which is almost three times more than in Versailles. It is an ideal place for running enthusiasts of all ages.

Nordic walking, fencing, shatsu, tai ki and yoga are also practiced in the park.
In summer, you can swim in the Olympic pool next to the circuit. The best way to explore this paradise with all its hidden corners - 11 ancient farms, mills, Mirabello villas of the XVII century and Mirabellino (Mirabellino) of the XVIII century, taverns - is to rent a bike at the Cascina Bastia farm and quietly pedal, from March to October. And fans of modern technology can download the Reggia Monza app and follow interactive routes.

text:
🇬🇧The White Cliffs of Dover, UK.
The White Cliffs of Dover are a magnificent natural monument located in the southeastern part of Great Britain, on the territory of the county of Kent. A strip of white rocks frames the shore of the Strait of Pas-de-Calais and stretches west and east from the ancient port city of Dover. For many centuries, it has served as a reliable reference point for all ships that are heading for the UK.

text:
🇺🇸USA, Hawaiian Islands, Maui Island, Haleakala Volcano

Haleakala is an inactive volcano, the eruption of which was last observed in 1750 (although different sources indicate differently). The perimeter of its crater is the largest in the world among inactive volcanoes and is 32 km. And, believe me, this sight is really impressive. 

The main observation deck is located just at the top of the volcano – at an altitude of 3055 meters. The most ordinary asphalt road leads there, and a large parking lot is provided for cars. The only thing that is not there is no cafes and eateries, you need to bring food with you. 

Actually, there are several viewing platforms, they are scattered all along the way to Haleakala. And on each of them the view is amazing!

text:
🇹🇷Hagia Sophia, Turkey.
Hagia Sophia is one of the most visited sights of Istanbul. It attracts tourists with its unique architecture, magnificent mosaics and special energy, so strong that it seems you are immersed in a different reality, where different historical epochs coexist simultaneously. Arabic script is adjacent to the symbols of Christianity here, and they, without mixing in any way, complement each other.
