text:
🇷🇺Russia, Voronezh region, Divnogorie

The Divnogorye Nature Museum-Reserve is located near the town of Liski in the Voronezh Region. This is a very unusual museum, if we proceed from the classical understanding. Excursions are held here in the open air. And in order to see all the exhibits, travelers need to climb the stairs to 401 steps. 

The museum complex was founded in 1991. Tourists are attracted here by the pristine nature and centuries-old history. These lands have witnessed various events, many of which have left their mark. The main attractions of the Divnogorye Nature Reserve are chalk rock formations in the form of pillars, a canyon with a depth of 5 floors, several cave temples and the ruins of an ancient fortress of the IX–X centuries. There is also a monastery of the XVII century, with which the fate of these places is inextricably linked.

In 2016, the museum-reserve became considered a cultural object of federal significance.

text:
🇵🇹Portugal, Covandos-Conchos 
There is an artificial lake in the Serra da Estrela mountains, in the middle of which there is a gaping hole. It looks like a portal to another dimension, but in fact it is a funnel leading to a spillway tunnel.
Lake Lagoa Serra da Estrela was created in 1955 during the construction of a hydroelectric power station. Instead of building a pipeline to circulate water between Lagoa Serra da Estrela and another lake, Lagoa Comprida, the engineers working on the project decided to drill a tunnel into the mountain.
The Covandos-Conchos discharge is designed to supply water to nearby settlements. The absence of other structures nearby gives the impression that this is a natural part of the lake. There is even grass growing on the slopes of the concrete funnel. Few people knew about this place until 2016, when photos with him began to be actively distributed by users of social networks.

🇨🇳Hangzhou Zoo, Zhejiang. China.
Hangzhou, the capital of Zhejiang Province, is home to one of the oldest and largest zoos in China, created back in 1958 on the initiative of the city authorities. The enclosures are equipped with innovative equipment of international standard, which allows animals, including pandas, to feel as comfortable as possible and reproduce in an artificial habitat.

text:
🇫🇷France, Benedictine Palace

The Benedictine Palace is located in the city of Fekan, the center of fishing and fishing trade. Until 1204, Fekam was the residence of the Dukes of Normandy, since that time there have been many historical monuments in the city. However, one of the most popular - the Benedictine Palace - was built much later - in the XIX century.

The palace owes its appearance to the local liquor. According to legend, in the XVI century, the Benedictine monk Bernardo Vincelli created an elixir in the Abbey of Fekam. 350 years later, in 1863, Alexandre Le Grand, a wealthy collector of ecclesiastical art, discovered the recipe for this elixir, made on the basis of 27 different plants and spices. This is how the world-famous Benedictine liqueur appeared.

Inside it is a museum, most of the exposition of which presents items related to the production of liquor and its history. The ticket price includes a liquor tasting.

🇦🇪Singing fountains in Dubai, UAE.
Singing fountains in Dubai is a bright and amazing structure of the UAE, which symbolizes the luxury and wealth of this region. The attraction is located at the foot of the Burj Khalifa Tower. The singing fountains of Dubai are considered one of the largest on the planet: the jet can rise to a height of about 150 meters, which corresponds to the level of the fiftieth floor of a skyscraper.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Kabardino-Balkaria, Chegemsky airfield

This place is well known to all paragliders in Russia: the relief and the wind rose of the Chegem gorge allow local and visiting daredevils to soar in the air for a long time together with mountain eagles. In the vicinity of the small alpine village of Eltuby, this year there were especially many fans of the gliding parachute - most likely because of the closed borders.Which gave the locals hope for the future. After all, it is only thanks to paragliders that the villagers have the opportunity to somehow earn money, there are simply no other sources of livelihood in these places, except for raising livestock and small vegetable gardens.

The Chegem Gorge is considered the heart of Kabardino-Balkaria. It is here that the invisible border passes, which divides the mountain peaks into the North and South Caucasus.

Translated from Balkar, Chegem means "broken earth".

text:
🇨🇭Lake Blausee, Switzerland
The small Swiss Lake Blausee is one of the most romantic and picturesque places in this Alpine country. Locals call it the bluest of all the blue lakes in Switzerland. The secret of the amazingly piercing emerald-blue color is underground springs that feed the lake with crystal water all year round.

text:
🇦🇹 🇩🇪Austria, Germany, Leutash Gorge

Unique alpine meadows, picturesque surroundings, ecologically clean lakes, majestic mountains with eternally snowy tips - this wealth can be observed if you visit the famous Austrian resort of Leutas in Tyrol. It is in this region that the famous mystical and mysterious place - the gorges of the spirit of Loytash is located.

You can walk over the gorge on a steel bridge. This bridge connects two states: Germany and Austria. The gorge was opened for tourists in 2006. The length of the Dukka Gorge itself is about 3 km. When travelers pass over the bridge, powerful mountain streams flow under their feet, and sharp protrusions of rocks are located on the sides. The growling and bubbling of mountain waters, and unusual mystical images of rocks create the impression of a mysterious place that is guarded by some kind of spirit.

You can get into the gorge from Austria in the village of Leutash or from the German town of Mittenwald.

text:
🇮🇷 Hormuz Island, Iran.
Despite its tiny size, the island of Hormuz remains a favorite tourist destination. This is the only place on Earth where you can find many shades of ochre, from red to gold. The beaches of Hormuz look especially fascinating at sunset or sunrise.

text:
🇨🇦Canada, Helmken Waterfall

Travelers who have seen this waterfall with their own eyes claim that even the world-famous Niagara, located on the border of Canada and the USA, cannot be compared in beauty with the majestic Helmken. On the edge of the canyon, from which the waterfall jets fall, there is a safe observation deck, from which a stunning view of the surrounding area opens. The bravest tourists make their way directly to the water itself. Keep in mind that it may not be safe, so it's better to limit yourself to a fenced area.

The height of the famous Helmken waterfall in Canada is 141 m. A wide, full-flowing jet falls from a great height onto a stone plateau formed due to tectonic activity. It is noteworthy that Helmken does not freeze even in severe winter frosts – a small stream of water flows all year round, forming a giant glacier around. Desperate climbers throw an exit to an ice-covered waterfall and conquer it, risking their own lives.

Travelers who have seen this waterfall with their own eyes claim that even the world-famous Niagara, located on the border of Canada and the USA, cannot be compared in beauty with the majestic Helmken. On the edge of the canyon, from which the waterfall jets fall, there is a safe observation deck, from which a stunning view of the surrounding area opens. The bravest tourists make their way directly to the water itself. Keep in mind that it may not be safe, so it's better to limit yourself to a fenced area.

The height of the famous Helmken waterfall in Canada is 141 m. A wide, full-flowing jet falls from a great height onto a stone plateau formed due to tectonic activity. It is noteworthy that Helmken does not freeze even in severe winter frosts – a small stream of water flows all year round, forming a giant glacier around. Desperate climbers throw an exit to an ice-covered waterfall and conquer it, risking their own lives.

The Aktru Valley in the Altai Mountains is hidden behind high and majestic mountains at an altitude of 2150 meters. 
Here, a person without high physical fitness can touch glaciers and even almost "touch" the clouds at the mountain peaks.

text:
🇬🇧United Kingdom, City of Canterbury

Canterbury is a medieval city in Great Britain, located in the south-east of the country, in the county of Kent. Of all the city's treasures, the main one is Canterbury Cathedral, the main cathedral of the Anglican Church. The western twin towers and the central bell tower with a height of 72 m are decorated with amazing turrets at the top.

Canterbury is surrounded by city walls on three sides, obscuring the streets with houses. Built at the beginning of the XIV century . The Friedland Gate is located on the Monastery Street at the entrance to the Abbey of St. Augustine, where this missionary is buried. Charles I and his bride Henrietta Maria spent their wedding night in the bedchamber above the gate. Of all the ancient gates in the city, only the Western Gate of 1387, which was once used as the city prison, has been preserved. And nowadays there are handcuffs, shackles, as well as weapons and armor.

Blue Lagoon is a popular geothermal resort in the southwestern part of Iceland, located on the Reykjavik Peninsula, 38 km from the capital of the country – Reykjavik. The geothermal complex consists of several pools with bright blue water and is one of the main attractions of Iceland.

text:
🇺🇸USA, Haiku Stairs

The Haiku Stairs on the island of Oahu is one of the most beautiful and extreme hiking trails in Hawaii. The staircase, consisting of almost four thousand steps, leads to the top of the Kulau cliff with a height of 850 meters. The climb is so steep that only experienced climbers can keep their balance during a dizzying ascent.

The staircase was built in 1942 for the needs of the military. The staircase turned into an iconic walking route, which was conquered by travelers in excellent physical shape.

The famous Hawaiian Haiku staircase, which is also called the stairway to heaven, will be destroyed in 2022. This decision was made by the local government due to the fact that the structure is an emergency and tourists are in danger while there.

🇹🇷 Kekova Island, Turkey
Kekova Island is located in the Mediterranean Sea. As a result of an earthquake, in the II century BC, it partially went under water, absorbing the coastal territory of the ancient city of Dolichiste, located in its northern part. Since 1850, there has been no population on the island. Its only inhabitants are mountain goats, and goats of course.

text:
🇹🇷Turkey, The City of Gocek

Gocek is a small Mediterranean town located near the sea bay of the same name in the beautiful bay of Fethiye. From the international airport of Dalaman to Gocek it is necessary to overcome 22 km. Gocek has an unusual geographical location, which makes it very similar to Kemer. Its southern part is the Mediterranean coast, the rest of the town's border is surrounded by the Taurus mountain slopes.
Oddly enough, but most of the population of the town are foreigners, mostly English. They really like Gocek, it is, according to them, a small warm England.

The main highlight of Gocek is rest. And the rest is the turquoise sea and snow-white yachts. The investment campaign, which lasted in the late 80s of the last century and up to the present day, has done its job - Gocek has become the center of yachting in Turkey, having won the neighboring Marmaris in a serious struggle for the championship.

text:
🇫🇷France, Verdon Gorge

The Gorge of Verdon (Gorges du Verdon) is located in Haute-Provence, between the villages of Castellane and Moustiers-Sainte-Marie. A unique natural wonder combines picturesque natural attractions, opportunities for a variety of outdoor activities and a great place for swimming.

The territory called Provence today was under water several hundred million years ago. The sea was drying up, forming huge layers of limestone. A fast-flowing river later joined the process, which washed away limestone and gradually began to turn the place into what today we call the Verdon Gorge.

The length of the gorge is 19 km, the depth is more than 700 meters, making it the deepest in all of Europe. The width varies along the entire length, ranging from 200 meters to 1.5 km. Here, the whiteness of the cliffs, the greenery of plants and the azure of the river create an incredibly beautiful landscape that attracts thousands of tourists every year.

The name mammatus comes from the Latin mamma (meaning "udder" or "breast").
In fact, these clouds are very dangerous. Pilots are advised to fly around mammatus side. The appearance of such clouds is always associated with thunderstorms, there is a high probability of ball lightning, as well as wind shear.

🇾🇪Socotra, Yemen.
The Socotra Islands are the pearl of Yemen and the entire Arabian region. The Socotrian archipelago is truly a treasure trove of flora and fauna. For centuries, Socotra Island was inaccessible to early explorers and naturalists. But at the end of the 90s, unprecedented attention fell on Socotra, especially from those who are interested in the economic development and preservation of the natural environment of these islands.

text:
🇮🇹Italy, Madonna della Corona Monastery

High on the cliffs of Monte Baldo mountain in Italy is a beautiful old monastery with incredible energy. It seemed to hover in the air over the picturesque valley of the Adige River. The temple offers a beautiful view of the surrounding area. The monastery is visited by many pilgrims and tourists.

The beauty and grandeur of the Madonna della Corona Monastery is impressive. The temple is more than 1000 years old. In the X century, hermit monks of the Abbey of St. Zeno from Verona lived here, high in the mountains, in rock caves. In the XII century, there was already a monastery and a chapel of St. Maria di Mantebaldo. It could only be reached by dangerous narrow mountain trails. The Madonna della Corona Monastery was founded in 1522, when a statue of the Holy Madonna — Our Lady of Sorrows was miraculously brought from the island of Rhodes. So they saved the shrine from the Turkish army of Suleiman II, who captured Rhodes.

text:
🇨🇳 Guoliang Tunnel, China
One of the most dangerous mountain roads in the world is the Guoliang Road located in the Chinese province of Henan. The length of the route is 1.2 km (height 5 meters and width 4 meters) and at its core it is a tunnel cut through sheer cliffs. Guoliang Tunnel was opened in Taihangshan Rock in May 1977. Its construction took more than five years.

text:
🇮🇩Indonesia, Nusa Penida Island, Diamond Beach

Diamond Beach on the island of Nusa Penida 
A picturesque place on the eastern shore of the island of Nusa Penida. This beach is covered with snow-white sand. The water near the shore has a sky-blue hue. On the beach there are palm trees and stones of a pleasant white color. But swimming on this beach will not work, because there are a lot of corals and rock fragments on the bottom. 
 
You can take beautiful photos from the equipped platform, which is located on top, or on the shore itself. Not so long ago, the way to this beach was inconvenient and even dangerous. In 2018, a fairly convenient stone staircase was built here.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Sochi, Krasnaya Polyana

⛷The Krasnaya Polyana ski Resort announced the opening of the season on December 3.

So, today the slopes of the mountain valley Circus-2 at an altitude of over 2000 meters are open at the resort. Skiers and snowboarders have access to medium-difficulty trails and the "First Snow" track for beginners. 

⛷Additional snowfalls are expected to open the trails at lower altitudes at the resort in order to form a sufficient snow substrate.

🚡The Krasnaya Polyana cable car is open (height 540-960 m).

The climate in Krasnaya Polyana is unique. In Sochi— it is too warm, it is considered subtropical. In winter everything is green, palm trees and flowers grow. And half an hour's drive from the seashore - there is a real winter in Krasnaya Polyana, the temperature usually does not fall below -5 degrees.

🇳🇴 Seven Sisters Waterfall, Norway
Seven Sisters is the 39th highest waterfall in Norway. The waterfall consists of seven separate streams, for which it was nicknamed as the "seven sisters". The maximum height is 410 m, the height of the greatest drop is 250 meters.

text:
🇳🇴Norway, Preikestolen

Preikestolen is a large cliff with an almost flat top in the form of a square with an area of about 625 m2. "Pulpit of the preacher" - this is the literal translation of the name of the rock. Here, tourists see a wonderful overview of the surrounding area, so the attraction is particularly popular and recognized as the most beautiful place in Norway.

The Preikestolen Cliff is located above the Luse Fjord, a bay with shores in the form of rocks. Similar reservoirs were formed tens of thousands of years ago due to the passage of glaciers. Nearby rocks can sometimes reach a kilometer high. The area near the Luse Fjord is almost uninhabited due to the characteristic soil, which makes it possible to see the picturesqueness of nature. The trail to Preikestolen is located at different heights, there are numerous areas of vegetation - from forests to mosses and lichens.

text:
🇦🇮Anguilla
Anguilla is a self-governing Overseas Territory of Great Britain. The territory includes the island of Anguilla itself, which is stretched in an arc for 26 km from southwest to northeast, as well as small adjacent islets and coral reefs that do not have a permanent population. These are the northernmost islands in the Windward Islands group in the West Indies. The area is 91 km2. The population is 18,090 inhabitants.

text:
🇲🇽Mexico, Tolantongo Caves

The Tolantongo Caves are a real natural paradise hidden in the beautiful Sierra de Hidalgo Mountains in Mexico. This unusual series of natural caves and springs is immersed in a majestic canyon with a warm river, and the entrance to the caves is hidden under waterfalls.
 A family spa
center with a hotel, swimming pools, slides and hiking trails was created around the springs. The caves themselves will amaze you with the natural forms of stalactites and stalagmites.
⠀
The crystal-blue river waters reach a temperature of 35 degrees Celsius. Flowing through the rocks, they form a series of small waterfalls. As a result, natural pools known for their healing effects are formed. The special mud that settles along the banks of the river brings health benefits. Thousands of visitors to these thermal pools really celebrate their healing effect.

text:
🇪🇬Karnak Temple, Egypt.
The Great Karnak Temple of the supreme deity Amun was founded in the 16th century BC in the capital of Ancient Egypt, Thebes, on the eastern bank of the Nile. This is the largest temple complex of Ancient Egypt and the main state sanctuary of the New Kingdom (XVI-XI centuries BC). In the New Kingdom, the ancient Greek god of the sun (Amon-Ra) was considered the patron saint of the capital Thebes. The construction lasted more than 1300 years! And about 30 pharaohs contributed to the creation of the complex.

text:
🇰🇪Kenya, Lake Bogoria

Lake Bogoria is an alkaline and very salty lake in Kenya, which is home to a huge number of pink flamingos and 135 species of other birds. For half a century there has been a national park of the same name on Lake Bogoria. Picturesque landscapes and an abundance of avifauna attract tourists from all over the world to these places.

Lake Bogoria is located in the north of the Great Rift Valley. Since 2011, it has been recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The length of the lake reaches 17 km, width – 3.8 km.

The shores of the natural reservoir are not swampy, and there are a dozen and a half hot alkaline geysers on them. Some geysers emit water up to a height of 5 m. It is not difficult to approach Lake Bogoria, however, flamingos are very shy. As soon as the birds see people, they scatter by the thousands across the water and rise into the air. However, even from a distance, a flock of flamingos is a grand sight.

text:
🇹🇭Thailand, Krabi Province

The Thai province of Krabi is located on the coast of the Andaman Sea and occupies an area of 4,700 square kilometers. According to the 2010 census, about 360 thousand people live here.

The province is divided into eight districts (amphoe), and its administrative center is Krabi Town. Across the Strait, Krabi borders an island province called Phuket, and on the land side it is adjacent to Tranche, Surat Thani, Phang Nga and Nakhon Si Thammarat. During the tsunami of 2004, this area was absolutely not affected. A big role in this was played by the coastal islands, which managed to extinguish huge waves by themselves.

Krabi occupies a leading place in terms of attendance among tourists who come to Thailand for a beach holiday. What are the Phi Phi Islands, which are also part of this province, worth. It was here that the world-famous film "The Beach" was filmed, since it is difficult to find a more picturesque place on Earth.

During the tsunami of 2004, this area was absolutely not affected. A big role in this was played by the coastal islands, which managed to extinguish huge waves by themselves.

Krabi occupies a leading place in terms of attendance among tourists who come to Thailand for a beach holiday. What are the Phi Phi Islands, which are also part of this province, worth. It was here that the world-famous film "The Beach" was filmed, since it is difficult to find a more picturesque place on Earth.

text:
🇹🇭Dragon Temple, Thailand
The Dragon Temple (Wat Samphran) is an original Buddhist temple with a height of 17-storey building in Nakhon Pathom province. From a distance, it looks more like a fairy-tale tower from Disneyland than a religious object. The temple is not included in the main tourist guides to the sights of Thailand. And that's why it's not so easy to find it right away.

text:
China 🇨🇳, Duge Bridge

At the end of 2016, the South Chinese province of Guizhou acquired the world's tallest bridge. The reason for this was the terrain. Due to the mountainous landscape and deep gorges, local residents were previously forced to build several high bridges, but Duge became not just the largest of them, he even broke a world record and was immortalized on the pages of the Guinness Book of Records.
The province is unique in that three of the five highest bridges in the world are located here. They cross steep cliffs and gorges, allowing local residents to get from one settlement to another. On December 29, 2016, the new Duge Beipanjiang bridge was named the king of bridges, a red arrow pierced into the space of the mountains.

This concrete bridge has a cable-stayed structure; it is laid over a deep gorge, along the bottom of which the Beipan River flows. The distance from the bottom of the gorge to the bridge bed is 565 m.

The beach is so poetically called because of the numerous pieces of ice scattered here and there on the black velvet of volcanic sand. Colorful icebergs of the most intricate shapes and incredible sizes are crowded on the black shore. Icebergs arrive on the black beach from the Breidamerkurjokull glacier.

text:
🇻🇳 🇨🇳Vietnam, China, Detian Waterfall

There are not many waterfalls on the planet that divide the territories of neighboring states. These are the 120-meter Victoria between Zambia and Zimbabwe, the 82-meter Iguazu on the border of Brazil and Argentina, and the 53-meter Niagara Falls separating Canada from the United States. The fourth largest border waterfall is the Detian Cascade: two 30-meter waterfalls in China and Vietnam. During high water, they merge into a common bubbling stream, and the sound of water breaking on rocks can be heard from afar.

The cascade is extremely picturesque at any time of the year: autumn fills the landscape with golden tones; in winter, the sleeping Detian is shrouded in fog, giving a touch of mystery and romance; in spring, its shores are painted with blooming flowers, and in summer - from May to September - it is a colossal rumbling stream, falling 120 m. The width of all 3 levels reaches 200 m.

text:
🇮🇹The Earthen Pyramids of Renona, Italy
A natural monument in Italy, the province of South Tyrol, the commune of Renon. It consists of pointed vertical columns made of clay, often with a top in the form of a stone boulder. They were formed during the Ice Age by the erosion of the soil caused by rain and wind. There are about 150 of them in total, the height reaches 40 meters.

text:
🇲🇾Mabul Island. Malaysia.
Not far from the southeastern coast of Sabah in the Sulawesi Sea is the small paradise island of Mabul. It is considered one of the best places in the world for mac diving. If you dream of seeing seahorses, octopuses, stingrays, squid, admire various types of corals or just lie under a coconut palm while sipping pina colada, go on a trip to the popular Malaysian seaside resort of Mabul.

text:
🇦🇪UAE, Parus Hotel (Burj Al Arab)

The Burj El Arab hotel, similar to the sail of an Arab ship, the dhow, has become the most recognizable symbol of Dubai. This building is one of the most expensive hotels in the world. It is located right in the sea, located on an artificial island, which was poured specifically for the location of the tower here. From the coastline to the hotel 280 m. by sea. The island is connected to Dubai by a bridge.

Burj al-Arab, that is, the Arab Tower, has a height of 321 m. For a hotel, such a height is huge. But the creators of the project from the very beginning were determined to use this building to amaze the imagination of the guests of the city. They succeeded.

At the top of the hotel there is a helipad, and on the back side there is a restaurant called "The Highest" (El Muntaha). Dubai is clearly visible from this restaurant.

text:
🇮🇩Kelimutu Volcano, Indonesia
A volcano on the Indonesian island of Flores with a height of 1639 m . Because of the three crater lakes, each of which is painted in its own color, Kelimutu is a popular tourist attraction. The last known eruption took place in 1968. Three Kelimutu lakes, in which various minerals are dissolved, change their color from black to turquoise, red-brown or green for several years.

text:
🇮🇹Italy,  Rocca Imperiale Commune

Rocca Imperiale, whose name can be translated as "imperial rock", is a popular resort located in the Italian region of Calabria on the coast of the Ionian Sea. Only about 3.5 thousand people live in the town all the time, but in the "high" season its population increases significantly due to tourists! This ancient Rocca Imperiale once played an important role, as it was conveniently located on the way from Puglia to Calabria. The city was founded in the 13th century by Emperor Frederick II and was named after the majestic castle towering on a cliff. The place for the construction of the castle was not chosen by chance – from the cliff there is a beautiful view of the entire Tarant Bay from the "heel" to the "toe" of the Italian "boot". The castle itself, from which only fragments of walls, bastions and bridges have been preserved, is currently undergoing reconstruction under the auspices of UNESCO.

text:
🇮🇳India, Meghalaya State

If you look at the map of India, you will see a small piece of land connecting the subcontinent with the part of the country that is almost completely surrounded by neighboring states Bhutan and Myanmar. This part of India stretches from the Himalayas to the mountain jungles, adjacent, in turn, to Bangladesh. Located among the lush mountain forests, Meghalaya is considered the most beautiful picturesque corner of the country.

Meghalaya, which means "abode of clouds" in Sanskrit, has "hiding" mountains, bridges of living root plants, crystal clear rivers and endless caves. An incredibly amazing and interesting place that should be on every traveler's list.

One of the most interesting and beautiful features in the region are "living bridges" made of rubber trees, which, unlike conventional bridges, become stronger and stronger over time due to the development of the root system.

text:
🇮🇹Italy, The City Of Pitigliano

Pitigliano is an amazing city in the Italian province (Provincia di Grosseto), located in the Maremma region.
This territory is a state national park, the nature of which evokes feelings of pleasure and tranquility. The city rises 313 meters above sea level.

The first impression of Pitigliano is a city of natural rocks. But in fact, a large number of Pitillano caves are carved by human hands from limestone and tuff, the deposits of which in this area are used for growing gardens.

The city itself is an extraordinary attraction. But there is also a wide variety of restaurants, craft shops, art workshops located on charming city alleys and roads. Lively, multi-voiced streets and shops filled with a variety of flavors are arranged in such a way that a traveler can feel like in the Middle Ages.

text:
🇷🇺Sulak Canyon, Dagestan, Russia
One of the deepest canyons in the world and the deepest in Europe, its depth reaches up to 1920 meters, and its length is 53 kilometers. It is one of the most famous
natural attractions of Dagestan. The Sulak Canyon is located in the central part of Dagestan, in the valley of the Sulak River. It is located 55 kilometers west of Makhachkala.

text:
🇺🇸USA, Brooklyn Bridge

The Brooklyn Bridge, which is rightfully considered one of the main attractions of New York, is the oldest of the suspension bridges in the United States of America.

There are many legends and mysteries associated with it, the Brooklyn Bridge quite often appears on wide screens in various motion pictures. The length of the magnificent bridge, which once made a real sensation, is 1828 meters. The Brooklyn Bridge in the USA crosses the East River Strait, it connects two districts of New York: Manhattan and Brooklyn.

The width of the bridge, divided into three lanes, is 26 meters, and at its highest point it rises 41 meters above the East River. Cars move one-way along two parts, and pedestrians and cyclists can walk along the middle part, which is located at a considerable elevation from the highways. Naturally, such a structure can be considered the safest for both vehicle drivers and pedestrians.

text:
🇬🇷Holy Trinity Monastery, Greece
A male Orthodox monastery on one of the rocks of Thessaly in the nome of Trikala, Greece. One of the six surviving Meteora monasteries. The Monastery of the Holy Trinity in Meteora is located northwest of the Monastery of St. Stephen on top of a majestic cliff at an altitude of 535 meters. The Monastery of the Holy Trinity is one of the most inaccessible monasteries in Meteor.

text:
🇳🇱Netherlands, The Village of Zaanse Schans

Zaanse Schans is an ethnographic village in the open air, where a collection of wooden houses and windmills of the ⅩⅦ — веков centuries is collected. It is located on the left bank of the Zaan River, three kilometers north of Zaandam, the administrative center of the Zaanstad community, near Amsterdam. From 1961 to 1974, about 30 samples of wooden architecture of the Netherlands, collected throughout the country, were transported here in parts. In 1994, the Zaans Museum was created, in which a residential Dutch village was reproduced.

The museum features several working mills, a cheese factory, warehouses, sheds and a shoe workshop for the production of typical Dutch shoes - wooden klompov. Here you can walk along an old village street, see the laconic device of rear wipers, living quarters and workshops, tools, mechanisms and everyday objects of residents.

text:
🇫🇷Arc de Triomphe in Paris, France.
The Arc de Triomphe in Paris is an architectural monument in the antique style and one of the recognizable symbols of the capital of France. The monument was built in the XIX century in honor of the victory of Napoleon's troops in the Battle of Austerlitz.

text:
🇨🇳China, Jilongbao Resort

On a small island in China in the middle of a lake there is a beautiful castle, a landscape as if taken from a fairy tale. This is a wonderful hotel "Sleeping Beauty Castle".
Have you ever dreamed of living as a king and queen in a magnificent castle?
Well, a dream can come true if your trip takes place in China, at a hotel called Jilong Castle Country Club or else it is called Jilongbao Resort.

Jilongbao Hotel is located in the middle of Wangfeng Lake in Guizhou Province. It is a luxurious European-style castle building. Decorated in pink, cream and red tones, this hotel stands out among the green rocks and the surrounding magnificent lake. The unique location of this castle connects an equally majestic bridge. Very suitable for those who like to take pictures.
The Jilong Castle Country Club Hotel and Country Club, built in 2011, also known as Jilongbao Resort, is one of the most impressive and unusual attractions in China.

text:
🇰🇿Charyn Canyon, Kazakhstan
A canyon stretching for 154 km along the Charyn River in Kazakhstan. The canyon is located 195 km east of Alma-Ata, near the border with China. Charyn Canyon is a natural monument composed of sedimentary rocks, the age of which is about 12 million years. The height of the steep mountains of the canyon reaches 150-300 m .

text:
🇹🇿Tanzania, Serengeti National Park

Serengeti National Park was established in 1951. In the Maasai language, Serengeti means "Endless Plains". This is a very accurate description, since the park is the largest in Tanzania, it is located on a plateau, at an altitude of 914 -1829 m above sea level.

Roughly comparable in territory to Northern Ireland and considered one of the largest nature reserves in the world, the Serengeti is famous for being home to 35 types of mammals, including lions, cheetahs, leopards, elephants, giraffes, hyenas, hippos, buffaloes, rhinos, baboons and antelopes, as well as more than 500 species of birds. Many of these animals are not found anywhere else in the world.
The annual migration of ungulates and zebras for 800 km in search of food and water during the dry season in May is one of the attractions of the park. It is impossible to forget the sight of animals rushing across the plains.

Kauai Island Nature Park. It is distinguished by its beauty and rich nature. You can only get here by boat, well, or on foot. Fascinating rocks, rich vegetation, valleys, beautiful sandy beaches, amazing observation decks and views, turquoise water - you can enjoy all this by coming here.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Saint Petersburg, Hermitage Museum

The formation of the Hermitage collections originates from private collections of works of art that were acquired by the Russian Empress Catherine II.
Initially, the collections were housed in a separate palace building, which was erected starting in 1764 by decree of Catherine II next to the Winter Palace, and was used for personal needs and a narrow circle of the Empress.
This building was called "Hermitage" - from the French "ermitage" - a place of solitude, a cell, a hermit's shelter. It was from this building that the name of the entire Hermitage museum was fixed. Now the building is a Small Hermitage.

By 1842, the collection had grown so much that it had little space in existing buildings, and, by decree of Nicholas I, a new separate building was erected - now the New Hermitage.

Today, the State Hermitage Museum is one of the largest and most visited museums in the world.

text:
🇮🇩Agung Volcano, Indonesia.
Agung is an active volcano in the eastern part of Bali. The diameter of the volcano's crater is 500 by 320 meters. The top of the mountain is bald and practically devoid of vegetation. It is the highest point of the island – its peak is located at an altitude of 3142 meters above sea level.

text:
🇲🇽Mexico, One&Only Mandarina Hotel

One&Only Mandarina — a real new masterpiece of modern resort architecture, began to receive guests on November 1, 2020. It is spread over an area of 33 hectares surrounded by lush, untouched tropical nature and coastal cliffs on the Pacific coast of the Riviera Nayarit in Mexico. A luxurious complex just 45 minutes from Punta Mita unites secluded buildings scattered at a distance from each other in a modern style, created from eco-friendly materials and harmoniously integrated into the surrounding landscape.

Every guest here is greeted with a blow to the bronze gong, which gently echoes throughout the pavilion and informs the resort team about new arrivals.

In Cliff Villa, the bathrooms open onto a private courtyard surrounded by lush tropical vegetation and flooded with light. In tree houses, bathrooms with panoramic glazing allow guests to feel at one with the outside world.

text:
🇪🇸Ronda, Spain.
Ronda is a small but very colorful Spanish town located in the north-west of the province of Malaga. Residents of the city call it the soul of Andalusia – and for good reason, because its unique charm does not leave indifferent any tourist who has visited here. Colorful Spain would lose a lot if it didn't have such an interesting corner, so visiting Ronda is one of the mandatory tasks for any self–respecting traveler.

text:
🇺🇸USA, Christmas 2021

Christmas in the USA is celebrated on December 25. Americans celebrate it with family and close relatives.

The most popular place to celebrate Christmas in the USA is New York. At the Rockefeller Center Square at the beginning of winter (December 3-7), a grand lighting of the main Christmas tree takes place. About a million people are going to watch this show. For those who could not attend the solemn event, a live broadcast is carried out. A free outdoor ice rink is being poured on the square. Large-scale Christmas markets are opening in New York's Bryant Park. Visitors will be delighted and surprised by a variety of gifts, toys, handmade souvenirs. At the fair, you can enjoy hot cocoa, mulled wine and sweets.

On Christmas Eve (December 24), American believers attend services in Catholic churches. Many residents of the country make charitable contributions on this day. Housewives bake pies, cookies and distribute them to friends, neighbors.

text:
🇨🇭 Brienz-Rothorn Railway, Switzerland
Mountain railways in Switzerland are the main way to see all the dizzying beauty of the Alps. The paths are laid to the most inaccessible peaks and luxurious slopes. An excursion retro steam locomotive climbs the Brienz-Rothorn — one of the top viewing platforms in the Bernese Oberland. The slope offers a magnificent panorama of the Bernese Alps and the Alps of Central Switzerland.

text:
🇯🇵Japan, Kyorinbo Temple

The Kyorinbo (Shiga) Temple was built by Crown Prince Shotoku in 605 and named so because it was originally a place of study (”Kyo") surrounded by a forest ("Rin").

The Kyorinbo Temple, with its magnificent moss-covered stones laid out throughout the garden, recalls the famous Japanese artist and aristocrat Enshu Kobori and his magnificent world of wabi-sabi.

The thatched roof of the academic building located at the entrance to the temple is now recognized by the city as an important cultural value and is another highlight of the Kyorinbo Temple.

text:
🇷🇺 Motherland Statue, Volgograd, Russia
The sculpture "Motherland calls!" is the compositional center of the monument-ensemble "Heroes of the Battle of Stalingrad" on Mamayev Kurgan in Volgograd. One of the tallest statues in the world, the highest statue of Russia and Europe. After being built in 1967, it remained the tallest in the world for another 22 years. Height 85 m.

text:
🇮🇹Italy, Menaggio

Menaggio is a charming resort town located on the shores of Lake Como in Northern Italy. Menaggio is often visited as part of an excursion program along the "golden triangle" of Como. In addition to Menaggio, the triangle also includes Bellagio and Varenna. Menaggio attracts tourists with its historical and architectural attractions, as well as picturesque surroundings. It usually takes half a day to explore the old part of the city, no more, however, if you want to experience the real resort atmosphere of the town, then you should definitely stop here for at least a few days. For vacationers there are all kinds of entertainment, ranging from hiking and rock climbing to golf courses and tennis courts.

Menaggio consists of 4 districts - the old part of the city proper (the center) and the suburbs of Loveno, Nobiallo and Croce, which have now merged into one agglomeration. Menaggio is famous for its villas, old churches and picturesque promenade.

text:
🇹🇷Amasra, Turkey
Amasra is a very ancient place, which can be seen even by the name of the city, named after the Persian princess Amastris (niece of the last Persian king Darius III), who founded it around 300 BC. Amasra remained a city throughout its subsequent history, as part of the Pontic Kingdom, Roman province, then Byzantium, and from 1261 was a Genoese colony until the Ottoman Turks gained full control over Anatolia in 1460.

text:
🇩🇰 🇬🇱Denmark, Greenland Island

The island of Greenland is the largest on Earth, located in the north-east direction from North America, washed by three large bodies of water: The Arctic Ocean in the north, the Labrador Sea on the south side and the Baffin Sea on the west side. To date, the island territory belongs to Denmark.

Greenland is a rare place that has been preserved as untouched as possible, and human intervention is minimal. There are excellent conditions for extreme sports, ecotourism, which is popular today. Nature lovers can admire the amazing landscapes, plunge into the original culture of the peoples inhabiting the island, who still live according to ancient traditions. The length of Greenland from north to south is almost 2.7 thousand km, the maximum width is about 1.3 thousand km, and the area is 2.2 thousand square kilometers, which is 50 times the area of Denmark.

text:
🇨🇭Canton of Uri, Switzerland.
Uri is a German-speaking canton located in the heart of Switzerland, between Lake Lucerne and the Saint-Gotthard mountain range, in the north of the Swiss Alps. These are very wooded lands - both in the mountains and on the plains. Many of the local mountains are covered with eternal glaciers.

text:
🇺🇸Olympic Mountains, USA,
Olympic Mountains are mountains in the system of Coastal ranges of North America, in the state of Washington (USA). Located on the Olympic Peninsula. High-stemmed coniferous forests grow on the slopes, the peaks are covered with alpine meadows and glaciers. The Olympic Mountains are one of the wettest areas in the United States, with over 2,000 mm of precipitation per year.

New York is perhaps the most famous city in the world, where financial institutions, numerous historical and cultural attractions, museums, shops, theaters and much more are concentrated. There are as many possibilities as you can imagine. From Times Square to the darkest corner of the Bronx - the realm of extremes. From the Russian enclave in Brooklyn on Brighton Beach to the branch of South America in Queens - communities from any country in the world.

text:
🇷🇺Manpupuner, Russia
The complex of seven outliers with a height of 30 to 42 m. Manpupuner, or Weathering Pillars (Mansiyskie dummies) is a geological monument in the Troitsko-Pechora district of the Komi Republic of Russia. They are located on the territory of the Pechora-Ilych Reserve on Mount Manpupuner. Many thousands of years ago, there were high mountains on the site of stone pillars. The Manpupuner weathering pillars are considered one of the seven wonders of Russia.

text:
🇬🇾 Kaieteur Falls, Guyana
Kaieteur Falls is one of the main attractions of Guyana. But there are more than 300 waterfalls on its territory, but it is Kayetur that is the most beautiful and spectacular of them. A huge mass of water feeds at high speed from a height of 226 meters into the abyss, shrouded in fog, over which numerous rainbows play with bright colors - a view that simply takes your breath away.

text:
🇵🇭 El Nido, Philippines
This is the pearl of the Philippines, one of the most beautiful places on Earth. The small village of El Nido is located on the island of Palawan and is a protected area. The Bakuit archipelago, famous for its beauty, is located near El Nido, consisting of 39 islands, mostly uninhabited, with beautiful snow-white beaches, hidden coves, hidden lagoons, and magnificent marine life.

text:
🇮🇳India, Maharashtra, Harihar Fort

Harihar Fort is located 40 km from Nashik City. In ancient times, the fort was of vital importance, because here they kept watch over the trade routes from Maharashtra to Gujarat. Harihar Fort is one of the oldest outposts built during the reign of the legendary Rajput dynasty of the Yadavas.
Harihar Fort, along with 17 other Indian forts, was handed over to the British in 1818. The British officers who visited the fort left a description where they indicated that the hike to Harihar Fort was so difficult that only 5 people from the team were able to climb to the top.

This fort is really for those who are not afraid of difficulties and heights. Many tourists come here not for the sake of the fort itself, but for the sake of climbing absolutely vertical rocks, in which 117 stone steps are knocked out. The ascent to Harihar Fort is so difficult that not everyone can climb there.

text:
🇳🇴 Lofoten Islands, Norway
The Lofoten Islands are an archipelago in the Norwegian Sea off the northwest coast of Norway. The area of the archipelago is 1,227 km2, and its population is 24,014 people. The islands are rocky and are divided among themselves mainly by narrow straits. The maximum height is 1161 m above sea level. They are separated from continental Norway by the West Fjord Strait.

text:
🇮🇸Iceland, Dinyandi

Dinjandi (Fjallfoss) is an amazing noisy waterfall, which is located on the Vestfirdir peninsula in Iceland. 
 
Dinyandi is considered to be one waterfall, but in fact it is a cascade of seven waterfalls with a total height of about 100 meters. The waterfall has a trapezoidal shape, the width of its upper tier is 30 meters, and the lower part is about 60 meters. Each tier of Dinyandi, apart from the main one, has its own unique name. 
 
Despite the remoteness of the Dinyandi Waterfall from other popular attractions in Iceland, there are paved paths, signs, toilets and large parking lots, as well as other amenities. In addition, in this place you can quite often see tourist buses that stop near the waterfall.

text:
🇺🇸State of Utah, USA
Utah. The edge of pristine nature, untouched by human hands.
Everything that is here was created without human participation, millions of years. An inspiring, unique and magnificent state of turbulent beauty and incredible geological wonders.

text:
🇺🇸USA, Fischer Towers 
The Fisher Towers are a series of Cutler sandstone towers, clad in Moenkopi sandstone and covered in red mud stucco, located near Moab, Utah. The towers are named after a miner who lived next to them in the 1880s.

In addition to the unusual color, the towers also amaze with the expressiveness of their silhouettes, a huge variety of lines, shapes and textures. On closer inspection, it is clear that nature is working here in large strokes, the works are still far from completion, the work of the master continues.

The official status of Fischer Towers is very modest: this is not a national park, a national monument, or even a Utah state park. This is just a place of recreation(Recreation Site), where a scenic tourist route is laid.

The total length of the route is about 7 km. At first, a gradual climb to 300 m prevails. On the way back, descent prevails, and accordingly, it is easier to go. In general, the trail is considered moderately difficult.

text:
🇮🇩 Tumpak Sevu Waterfall, Indonesia
Tumpak Sevu or Coban Slava is located on the island of Java at the foot of the Semeru volcano. The waterfall is a huge semicircular cliff with a height of about 180 meters. Surprisingly, however, you rarely see tourists or travelers here, let alone large crowds. You can get to it from the city of Malang - either by public transport, or by rented car, or as part of an excursion.

text:
🇫🇷France, The City Of Colmar

Colmar is a charming city in the north-east of France in the province of Alsace, Haute-Rhin department. It is known for its ancient half-timbered houses along the canals, wines and as the birthplace of Auguste Bartholdi, the creator of the famous Statue of Liberty. Colmar is one of the most picturesque and photogenic cities in Alsace, which has well preserved its cultural and architectural heritage.
All the sights of Kalmar are located in its old town, which has been preserved surprisingly well despite the world wars. The historical center of the city is quite large, but it is still convenient to explore on foot. A walk through the old streets of Colmar, believe me, will give you a real pleasure.

text:
🇧🇷Fervedouros do Ceara, Brazil
Fervedouros is one of the most unusual places in Brazil, the groundwater here comes out through the bottom, mixing the sand. If you climb inside, you can experience very unusual sensations, it is impossible to drown in these waters, because they constantly lift you up.

text:
🇨🇭Switzerland, Lauterbrunnen
(Winter❄️)

Lauterbrunnen is a picturesque village located at an altitude of 802 m in the valley of the Bernese Oberland, near Interlaken, surrounded by steep cliffs and waterfalls. These beauties struck the heart of more than one traveler. As they say, Lauterbrunnen became the prototype of the fairy-tale world of elves in the famous movie "The Lord of the Rings". 
 
The Lauterbrunnen Valley is often called the valley of 72 waterfalls. The village is located at the foot of the 300-meter Staubbach waterfall— one of the highest waterfalls in Europe. Near Lauterbrunnen, you can also see the Trummelbach Waterfall — the only waterfall in Europe inside the rock.

text:
🇳🇿The largest Tesla coil, New Zealand
The largest Tesla coil in the world is located in the New Zealand city of Kaukapakapa. It is noteworthy that it was erected not by a mad scientist, and not by filmmakers, but by connoisseurs of art. The giant coil called "Electrum" has 4 floors, and the total length of the structure is more than eleven meters. This art project was carried out on the initiative of the outstanding art patron Alan Gibson, who installed a giant reel on his farm.

text:
🇨🇳China, Chongqing City, A stunning road on the Lanshin Cliff, cut down in the mountains.

Located in Wuxi County, in southwestern China, the road to Lanying Cliff is an amazing trail cut in the mountains. Located on the southern slopes of the central Daba Mountains, the extremely narrow road is completely paved. This is the only transport route connecting Lanqing Village with the outside world. 

Previously, residents had to travel almost all day to get out of the mountainous area. The road is steep, in some areas it reaches a slope of 22.9%. The 1.2 km (0.745 mile) long road descends from the cliff face, built by the villagers in 2001, who paved the road along the cliff to better connect the city with the outside world. The road is extremely scary, with a drop of more than 1000 meters. 

From the road there is a magnificent view of the Grand Canyon of Lanshin, the deepest canyon in Chongqing.

The road is extremely scary, with a drop of more than 1000 meters. 

From the road there is a magnificent view of the Grand Canyon of Lanshin, the deepest canyon in Chongqing.

text:
🇺🇸Sedona, Arizona, USA
Sedona is a small town in the north of Arizona in the USA, a real oasis in the desert lands on the very edge of the Colorado Plateau, surrounded by red rock formations, a picturesque canyon and coniferous forests. Due to its convenient location at the foot of the mountains, Sedona is famous for its rather mild climate. The beauty of nature and stunning panoramic views, as well as energy vortexes attracted the most creative people from all over the world.

🇷🇺Russia, Gamova Peninsula

The Gamova Peninsula is one of the most picturesque natural sites of southern Primorye, attracting a large number of tourists here, both Primorye residents themselves and visitors. It is located 260 km from Vladivostok, it is washed by the Posyeta Bay from the southwest, and the water area of the Far Eastern Marine Reserve is located from the east. Therefore, it is beautiful to everyone – magnificent beaches, exotic coves, hills. And thanks to the efforts of man, a lot of interesting things have appeared here – a military dolphinarium, Yankovsky Castle, an artillery battery.

text:
🇮🇹 Colosseum, Italy
The amphitheater, an architectural monument of Ancient Rome, is the most famous and one of the most grandiose structures of the Ancient world that have survived to our time. It is located in Rome, in the lowland between the Esquiline, Palatine and Target hills.
The construction of the largest amphitheater of the ancient world, with a capacity of over 50 thousand people, was carried out for eight years as a collective construction of the emperors of the Flavian dynasty. It began to be built in 72 AD under Emperor Vespasian, and in 80 AD the amphitheater was consecrated by Emperor Titus. The amphitheater is located in the place where there was a pond belonging to the Golden House of Nero.

text:
🇫🇷France, Opera Garnier

Opera Garnier is a majestic and resplendent temple of music and dance in the 9th arrondissement of Paris, and if you get off at the Opera metro station or walk to the end of the avenue of the same name. It is also not far away if you go from the Lafayette Gallery, crossing Osman Boulevard and Diaghilev Square.
The building was built in the Beaux-arts style, as a continuation of the French Baroque and Italian Renaissance, and bears the name of its creator – Charles Garnier. True, it was originally the Paris Opera, but after the appearance of the Bastille Opera, it was decided to rename it.

Opera as an art in France was officially recognized only in 1669 thanks to Louis XIV, and even built a separate building for it – the Royal Academy of Music.

The Paris Grand Opera resembles an artfully carved casket, and going inside, the feeling is even stronger, because gilding, painting, crystal and marble, according to the French, does not happen much.

text:
🇮🇹Cala Goloridze Beach, Sardinia. Italy.
The decoration of the rugged rocky coast is the 128-meter limestone pyramidal cliff of PerdaLonga, adjacent to the Santu di Baunei mountain. Behind them begins the forest, filled with the aromas of strawberry trees and oaks. The beach of Cala Goloritce with smooth white pebbles, turquoise water and marble rocks organically fits into the surrounding landscape. There is little to compare with the uniqueness of this place, recognized as a national monument of nature and since 1993 taken under the protection of UNESCO.

text:
🇨🇦Canada, Athabasca Falls

Athabasca is a very beautiful waterfall that you just need to see if you are in Canada, namely in Jasper National Park. This waterfall, in addition to its undeniable picturesqueness, is known for the indomitable power of endless streams of water and, in general, its fullness. To clarify, the Athabasca Waterfall is located about 30 kilometers from the city of Jasper, after which the national park was named.

The area in which Athabasca is located is distinguished by rare beauty and simply incredible lush greenery. The height of the water fall at this waterfall is relatively small - 23 meters, but everything is compensated by the width, which is 18 meters. This guarantees any beholder an impressive sight. Surprisingly, even if the water level in the river drops, the waterfall does not lose its beauty and fascinating appearance.

text:
🇩🇪Germany, The City Of Cochem

The Moselle River Valley is considered the most beautiful and most romantic region in Germany.
In the heart of the Moselle Valley is one of the most romantic cities – Cochem. Its history is inextricably linked with the Imperial Castle Reichsburg (Reichsburg). 

Cochem is located on the picturesque left bank of the 20-kilometer long Moselle River. The panoramic view of the northern part of the Moselle Valley clearly shows the important strategic position of the Castle and how majestically it towers over the city. The river dug a channel deep into the rock of the mountains, thus creating lands on the steep slopes of the river, where grapes have been grown since the Middle Ages. 

If you walk along the Moselle River embankment, you can see the amazing beauty of the city, and how the houses harmoniously fit into the urban landscapes.

🇳🇴Møre og Romsdal, Norway.
Mere og Romsdal is the northernmost region of the fjord kingdom. As everywhere else on the Atlantic coast of Norway, landscapes change from thousands of islands and skerries near the coastline to deep fjords and mountains that rise 2000 m above sea level. This is the only county in Norway that has such impressive mountains as Romsdal. Trollveggen peak is known to almost every climber in the world. Not to mention the millions of tourists who visit the kingdom of fjords and trolls every year.

text:
🇫🇷France, Gouffre Berger cave

Until 1963, the deepest cave in the world was considered to be the Gouffre Berger cave located in the French Alps. Discovered in 1953 by Joseph Berger, Goufr Berger became the first cave on the planet in which researchers descended to a depth of more than one kilometer.

The Gufr Berger cave system is complex and is considered one of the most dangerous. The base of the walls of the Gufr Berge cave is porous limestone, which is destroyed by heavy rains and floods. It was he who caused the death of the researchers who descended into the cave. In addition, because of the difficult transitions, cavers who have sunk to the bottom of the cave may need from 15 to 30 hours to rise to the surface.

A town and commune in eastern France, in the Haute-Savoie department. The population is 9830 inhabitants. It is located in the Alps, in the narrow valley of the Arve River, at the foot of Mont Blanc, in which Chamonix has a tunnel dug connecting France with Italy. Chamonix is the center of the popular Chamonix-Mont Blanc ski region.

text:
🇮🇸Iceland, Seljalandsfoss Waterfall

Seljalandsfoss is one of the most famous waterfalls in the world. It does not differ in too high a height and is not considered the most full-flowing, but many tourists rush to it every year to see with their own eyes this amazing miracle of nature: noisy waters falling almost without touching the rocks.

This majestic Icelandic waterfall is located in the southwest of the country. It flows from a river called Seljalandsau. The nearest settlement is the small town of Skougar (30 km away). The Seljalandsfoss waterfall is truly unique. Its uniqueness lies in the fact that it can be viewed not only from the outside, but also from the inside: behind the falling stream of water there is a natural depression in the rock, along which a trail for tourists passes. The continuously flowing waters of the Seljalandsfoss waterfall make a fascinating impression, there is a feeling that the water is floating in the air.

text:
🇫🇮Finland, Lapland.

Levin Iglut - Golden Crown is an exclusive glass igloo hotel in Lapland. The distance from the lights of the center and the unobstructed view of the northern sky from the slope make this place ideal for admiring the northern lights. And it can be seen in Finland almost every second dry cloudless night. The peak of the "season" is December-January.

There are two types of accommodation possible in the hotel: in the glass igloo with panoramic views and in one of the luxuriously equipped Northern Lights House cabins. The first one offers guests not only a good view of the valley and the northern sky, but also a private terrace with an outdoor Jacuzzi, where you can also admire the scenery.

From the Northern Lights House cabins, you can choose a Lapland suite in the style of a wild hut or a Golden Suite, the design of which was inspired by the Palace of Versailles. In addition, the hotel also has a sauna with Jacuzzi and a restaurant.

The idea for this attraction is taken from local mythology. Two "heavenly beings", personifying the image of love and a romantic meeting, first bend down to greet tourists, and then turn to each other 360 degrees.

text:
🇵🇹Portugal, Tropical Gardens of the Monte Palace

The "Tropical Gardens of Monte Palace" or "Jardim Tropical Monte Palace" are located on the green and ever-blooming Portuguese island of Madeira, in the island capital – the resort town of Funchal. "Monte Palace Tropical Gardens" stand on the top of the hill of the same name, from where travelers can enjoy stunning views of the Atlantic Bay of Funchal.

The tropical garden hides its main attraction – the beautiful Monte Palace, built in the eighteenth century by the then owner of the island - the English consul Charles Murray, actually before the gardens were founded.

In the Tropical Garden you can find the rarest and uncharacteristic plants for this region: heather from Scotland, laurels from the Canary Islands, azaleas from Belgium, as well as tropical ferns and cedars of Lebanon. There are two artificial lakes on the territory of the park, where numerous Japanese carp and waterfowl live: ducks, white and black swans.

text:
🇦🇪 Al Qudra Lakes, UAE
This is a network of man-made lakes in the UAE, located in the center of the Seikh al-Salam desert, near Dubai. The lakes themselves cover an area of 10 hectares, and are home to numerous birds, including many migratory ones, and Swan Lake in Dubai is the habitat of many released exotic bird species. Here you can also see, for example, desert foxes, oryx and many other animals in their natural habitat.

text:
🇿🇦South Africa, Augrabies Waterfall
The Kalahari Sands, along the southern border of which the largest river in South Africa, the Orange River, flows, protect Augrabies from annoying tourists. It got its name not for some special color of the water, but simply in honor of the Dutch ruling house of the Princes of Orange.
The waters of the Orange River, rushing into one of the main channels, fall into a narrow stone crevice to crash down with a terrible noise on the granite foot of the ledge. After flying almost 150 meters, water jets fall into a stone bowl, which hydrologists call a "giant boiler". At the same time, waves rise as high as a two-story house, and a rainbow sparkles in the water spray rising above the waterfall.
The roar of the waterfall can be heard several kilometers before it. No wonder the locals - Hottentots - called the waterfall Augrabis, which means "a very noisy place".

text:
🇯🇵 Aogashima volcano, Japan
The volcano is located on the volcanic island of the same name, which belongs to the Izu group of islands, part of the Nampo Archipelago, Japan. Aogashima is a stratovolcano, 423 meters high. The volcano is composed mainly of andesites. The occurrence of the Aogashima volcano is associated with the volcanic activity of the Kurosaki stratovolcano, which is located in the northwestern part of the island. Volcanic activity on the island began about 3,000 years ago.

text:
🇫🇷France, Pierrefonds Castle

Pierrefonds (Chateau de Pierrefonds— is an ancient battle castle of the XV century, an important cultural and historical landmark of France. The chateau is located on the southeastern edge of the Compiegne forest, near the town of Ville-Cottreux. The large-scale history of the building covers not only the period from the XIII - XV centuries, but also earlier French periods, starting from the XII century.  The castle of Pierrefonds has been depicted in many feature films, for example, "The Eagle with Two Heads", "The Man in the Iron Mask" and "Merlin".

The Hall of Beautiful Ladies and the Hall of Arms are the most impressive. It is there that large-scale figures of knights and women in the images of ancient goddesses are located. Expositions and light performances are installed in some halls of the Pierrefonds Castle.

text:
🇮🇳Palace of the Winds, Jaipur. India.
The Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of the Winds, is the main attraction of Jaipur. The palace got its second name due to the fact that thanks to a well-thought-out system of windows, natural ventilation is created in the premises of the building. Therefore, the inhabitants of Hawa Mahal, even in the most intense heat, were a little cooler than all the other residents of the city, because they were blown by a light breeze, even if the city itself was completely calm. Such a ventilation system is recognized as unique, which makes the Palace of Winds an even more attractive structure.

text:
Abkhazia, Lake Ritsa

The high-mountain lake Ritsa can rightfully be considered the main attraction of Abkhazia. It has long been favored by locals and tourists. Previously, a mountain river flowed here, but after a large earthquake, part of the Pshegishkha massif collapsed in Laships, forming a natural barrier. Scientists suggest that this happened about 250 years ago. So it turned out to be the most beautiful lake in the country.

The area of Lake Ritsa is 1.27 square kilometers.
Interestingly, the water in the lake retains its transparency at any time of the year, and the temperature does not rise above 18 degrees. In winter, the lake mirror is rarely covered with an ice crust. This phenomenon occurs only in the harshest winters. Trips here at such a time can be unsafe, due to snowfall and ice on a narrow access road.

Depending on the seasons, the color of the water in the lake changes. This is due to the flowing rivers and the life cycle of phytoplankton.

text:
🇨🇱 Villarrica Volcano, Chile.
Villarrica volcano is one of 5 volcanoes in the world with a crater with boiling lava, to the top of which it is allowed to ascend.
And the Villarrica volcano is the most active in South America and often snorts with burning sparks. On March 3, 2015, the last major volcanic eruption occurred. 5 million cubic meters of ash settled in the vicinity at that time. Until 2016, the volcano was active. Columns of smoke from the crater were visible in the dark.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Kamchatka, Koryak volcano

The Koryak volcano, or Koryakskaya Sopka, is the active and highest volcano in the south of Kamchatka. Its height is easy to remember: 3456 m. It belongs to the "home" volcanoes, that is, it is located near the city and is clearly visible from any point of it. 

Koryakskaya Sopka attracts climbers as an accessible, but not too easy peak. It requires good physical fitness, basic athletic training and skills in special equipment. Even among the Petropavlovsk residents themselves, for whom the view of the Koryak peak is familiar, like the sun and moon, not everyone has visited it.

For those who manage to climb the Koryak volcano, the best panoramic view in the whole south of Kamchatka opens from above: the craters of the neighboring hills, the Nalychevskaya Valley, the nearest cities, the bay and the ocean - up to the horizon.

text:
🇹🇲Darvaza, Turkmenistan
A gas crater. Locals and travelers call it "The Door to the underworld", or "The Gates of Hell". It is located 90 km from the village of Yerbent in the Dashoguz Velayat. The diameter of the crater is approximately 60 meters, the depth is about 20 meters. Since 1971, the natural gas coming out of the crater has been continuously burning day and night, it was set on fire so that gases harmful to people and livestock would not come out.

text:
🇩🇰Denmark, Faroe Islands, Tjørnuvík

Tjørnuvík is the northernmost settlement on the island of Eysturoy, Faroe Islands.

The village, located in the municipality of Zunda, has a population of about 71 people.
The village used to be a natural harbor, but after a terrible storm in the 1600s, the fjord was blocked by sand and became more inaccessible.

The black sand beach is known for surfers who are interested in surfing on the wild Faroe Islands.

The village is also famous for two rocks, 71 and 68 meters in height.

text:
🇲🇻Muraka Underwater Villa at Konrad Hotel, Maldives.
In November 2018, the Conrad Maldives Hotel opened the world's first underwater residence. This is not just a room or a comfortable suite, but much more – a whole two-storey villa built at a depth of 5 meters below the level of the Indian Ocean, capable of accommodating up to 9 guests at the same time.

text:
China🇨🇳 - Macau🇲🇴

Macau is a special administrative region of the People's Republic of China, which was once a Portuguese colony. It is located on the coast of the South China Sea and occupies a small peninsula and two islands nearby.

Macau is a holiday city, a place where Europe, Asia and America meet, a place where there is a real conflict of patterns, where Portuguese architecture is adjacent to Buddhist temples, and Chinese temples are almost an exact copy of Las Vegas. However, Asian Las Vegas has already overtaken its American rival, becoming the gambling capital of the world. Moreover, I surpassed him in many points, not only in gambling. Numerous casinos, hotels and entertainment complexes are simply amazing. Moreover, despite their multitude, they are all individual and not like the rest. Macau is a city with not only one of the largest population densities (20 000 people per 1 km2), but also the largest density of gambling establishments per 1 soul.

text:
🇧🇦 Blagaj, Bosnia and Herzegovina
Blagaj, like neighboring Mostar, are geographically located in Herzegovina. Next to it is the source of the Buna River, it is very picturesque. And, as often happens, such a beautiful deserted (once) place was chosen by monks for their serene living. But the monks are unusual - Islamic. That is, the dervishes. In the sixteenth century, "tekia" (from Turkish - "tekke"), a monastery of dervishes, was erected here.

text:
🇹🇭Thailand, Hin Sam Wan Rock (Three Whales Rock) 

The futuristic mystery of nature Hin Sam Wan from Bueng Kan province, Thailand is the "Stone of Three Whales" that majestically "swim out" of the mountains.
The rocks were formed 75 million years ago and create the illusion of a family of whales swimming in the middle of the forest. And for fans of Ridley Scott's early films, they are more likely to resemble alien xenomorphs from the Alien film series.

Only two rocks ("mother whale" and "father whale") can be reached on foot, it is impossible to reach the "baby whale" by land.

This place is not very popular. Moreover, relatively recently, images from space have shown that there are several more such natural “structures” in the jungle, the existence of which even the locals did not know. According to geologists, the rocks assumed an unusually smooth and rounded shape due to the centuries-old influence of tropical winds and heavy rains.

text:
🇨🇳China, Human Anthill (Maijishan Grottoes) 
This is one of the largest Buddhist cave monasteries in China in the form of an anthill.
The beginning of monastic life and the construction of the first caves is attributed to the period of the Late Qin dynasty (384-417 AD).

The grottoes are carved on the southern slope of the mountain, at an altitude of 80 m from the foot. Inside there are more than 7200 clay and stone sculptures, over 1300 sq.m. frescoes that were created from the IV to the XIX century. Here you can trace the stages of the development of sculptural art in China.   From one cave to another you can get only by a wooden path passing over the cliff.

In the uppermost cave known as the "cave of Heaven", a huge stone statue of Buddha with two attendants was hidden, apparently dating back to the era of the northern Zhou dynasty. It is not known where this statue was brought from, how it was raised to such a great height.

text:
🇳🇦Namibia, Hotel Zannier Sonop

The luxurious Zannier Sonop tent camp is located in the southern part of the Namib desert, amidst a stunning desert landscape that falls in love with itself from the first seconds with its beauty.

This unusual hotel was created in the refined style of the 1920s. 10 spacious awnings built on top of boulders will offer a unique journey into the era of the British colonial past. Richly furnished with antiques made of high-quality materials, covered with colorful carpets and decorated with precious woods, these awnings are the perfect place to feel like a pioneer.

At the hotel, everything is focused on the richness of the desert: panoramic views impress with their grandeur, and a large selection of leisure options allows guests to explore the landscapes and wildlife of the Namibian desert. Every evening, guests are invited to enjoy luxurious gastronomic dishes, where silverware creates a mood complemented by first-class service.

text:
🇮🇹 Amalfi, Italy
A seaside town near the Gulf of Salerno in the Italian province of Salerno, the seat of the archbishop and the capital of the medieval maritime Republic. The heart of the Amalfi coast. The city is located on the slope of a cliff, so that the houses are connected to each other by stairs carved into the rock, while the roofs serve as gardens. Among all this tangle of houses, stairs, passages, bridges and rocks, the most luxurious vegetation, consisting of grapes, orange, lemon and olive trees, breaks through everywhere.

text:
Russia, Long Mountains

Here they fly paragliding, watch animals and birds and, of course, admire alien landscapes.
135 kilometers southeast of Orenburg, near the border of Russia and Kazakhstan, there is one of the most picturesque places of the Orenburg region — the Long Mountains. This ridge between the Sakmara and Ural rivers impresses with its surreal landscape: it was as if the surrounding steppe had reared up and frozen in giant folds. People come here to paraglide, observe animals and birds, or just take pictures of beautiful landscapes.

The Long Mountains belong to the Ural Mountains, one of the oldest mountain ranges in the world. The ridge with a length of 14 kilometers was formed from limestone in the Permian period - 250-300 million years ago. The long mountains cannot be called high: the maximum point of the ridge reaches 414 meters above sea level.  The impression of an alien landscape appears at dawn and sunset.

It is believed that the name of this original country and one of the most exciting places on our planet was given by the Old Norse word Norðrvegr, meaning literally "the way to the north". The Norwegians call themselves that: nordsmenn, i.e. a Northerner or a person from the north.

text:
🇫🇷France, Gouffre Berger cave 

Until 1963, the deepest cave in the world was considered to be the Gouffre Berger cave located in the French Alps. Discovered in 1953 by Joseph Berger, Goufr Berger became the first cave on the planet in which researchers descended to a depth of more than one kilometer.

The Gufr Berger cave system is complex and is considered one of the most dangerous. The base of the walls of the Gufr Berge cave is porous limestone, which is destroyed by heavy rains and floods. It was he who caused the death of the researchers who descended into the cave. In addition, because of the difficult transitions, cavers who have sunk to the bottom of the cave may need from 15 to 30 hours to rise to the surface.

text:
🇬🇷Greece, Thassos Island, Emerald Lagoon Giola 

The Greek island of Thassos welcomes guests with wonderful lush vegetation, snow-white marble beaches and the purest sea. Among its most beautiful natural attractions is the Giola Lagoon located in the coastal cliffs.
A lagoon with emerald-colored clear water is located near the village of Astris. A small pool of 15 by 20 meters was formed naturally under the influence of sea waves. The depth of the lagoon is only three meters, so the water in it warms up well and the bottom is very clearly visible.
Giola Lagoon has the shape of a pearl shell. It is separated from the waters of the open sea by a low rock barrier up to two meters long. During tides and storms, waves easily overcome it and fill the pool with cool sea water.

text:
🇹🇷Turkey, Babadag Mountain

Babadag Mountain is a famous landmark near the town of Fethiye in southwestern Turkey. Mount Kragos in ancient times, today Babadag, is the western extension of the Taurus Mountains. The modern species has been formed for millions of years, according to some sources, since the Ice Age. Babadag is a unique treasure for nature lovers: it has a unique flora with 47 rare and endemic plants, and the richest butterfly population in the world. There are various hiking routes on Babadag: "Oludeniz - Summit", "Kozagaji - Summit - Kirme", "Summit - Deep - Pinara".

The height of the main peak of Babadag is 1969m above sea level. The second peak, just below, has a height of 1400 m. The two peaks of the mountain are separated by a valley, so sometimes Babadag Mountain is also called a mountain range.

Babadag Mountain consists mainly of limestone. It is located close enough to the sea, so it is one of the most popular places for paragliding.

text:
🇨🇭Switzerland

Rheinfall is considered to be the largest waterfall in Europe - in terms of the amount of water thrown down. The waterfall is located almost on the border with Germany, in the north of Switzerland.
The width of the Rhine Waterfall is 150 m, the height is about 23 m. The waterfall has existed here for about 17 thousand years. The waterfall becomes especially impressive in summer, when it gains enormous strength and turns into a solid water cloud with many small rainbows.

If you want to enjoy the waterfall closer - you can take a boat ride. You will be taken to a rocky ledge in the center of the waterfall, where you can slowly climb and be literally in the center of the waterfall.

In addition, you can land on the other side, where an old castle - Schloss Laufen - rises on the mountain near the waterfall. It houses an exhibition dedicated to the Rhine Waterfall and an observation deck overhanging the raging waters of the Rhine Waterfall.

text:
🇪🇬Egypt, Giza.

The Giza Pyramid complex is the last remaining wonder of the ancient world. They are more than 4000 years old, and their extraordinary shape, impeccable geometry and huge mass still cause a lot of admiration and questions. These massive tombs were built by order of the pharaohs, and tens of thousands of workers were needed to create them. Today, the pyramids of Giza inspire awe of the power, organization and achievements of ancient Egypt.

text:
🇮🇹Italy, Lake Braies

Lake Braies (Italian: Lago di Braies) is a large mountain lake located in the Trentino Alto Adige region, in the province of Bolzano, at an altitude of 1,496 m above sea level. The total area of the water surface is about 0.31 km2, the maximum depth is 36 m. The lake is located in the Bryes Valley at the foot of the Croda del Becco Mountain.

One of the most popular activities on Lake Bryes is a boat trip. This romantic and relaxing activity, allowing you to fully enjoy the surrounding beauty, was once the only way to cross to the opposite shore.

No less interesting will be a walking tour around the lake, which will take about an hour and a half and is suitable for both adults and children. Along the tourist trail there are places to relax, where you can enjoy fascinating views of Lake Bries in a calm atmosphere and, possibly, have a snack. The total length of the trail is about 3.6 km.
