text:
🇧🇴Bolivia, Salar de Uyuni.

People talk about such iconic places as Paris, Santorini, Bali, etc. But this place has a special magic. It is located in the south of the Altiplano desert plain at an altitude of about 3650 m above sea level and resembles a plain desert of bright white salt, has rock formations and islands, the largest of which is Incahuasi Island. There are many cacti growing on it and from its top you can appreciate the beauty of this mysterious place.

text:
🇦🇺Australia, Puffing Billy

Puffing Billy is a beloved Australian steam locomotive and one of the very well preserved steam-powered railways in the world. "Puffing Billy" has been around for over a century. He continues to work on the railway from Belgrave Station to Jembrook Station.
This place is located in the Dandenong Natural Area, about 40 km from Melbourne.

This railway is the only remaining of the four experimental lines used for rural development in the early 1900s. Puffing Billy is open every day except Christmas, thanks to the tireless efforts of more than 900 volunteers. Each of the locomotives working for Puffing Billy has its own history and identity.

A favorite activity of tourists is hanging their legs, looking around in the hope of seeing a koala or an Australian kookaburra bird on a tree.

text:
🇬🇷Greece, Milos.

In the northeast of the island of Milos is one of the most famous Greek beaches - Sarakiniko.
The beach is known for its snow-white mountains and volcanic rocks forming a small bay with a crystal clear Aegean Sea. The coast is often compared to the surface of the Moon, which is why Sarakiniko is sometimes called Lunar Bay - all thanks to the bare rocks and the lack of vegetation and any amenities.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Karachay-Cherkessia, the Mahar River and the Mahar Gorge

The Makhar Gorge is located in the south-west of Karachay-Cherkessia and borders Abkhazia. It stretches for several tens of kilometers along the Mahar River. This is an untouched corner of nature with mountain ranges, glaciers, waterfalls, impenetrable forests and healing springs. When you get here, you get the feeling that this is the wildest and most alive place on the planet.

During the tour of the beautiful gorge, travelers will meet mountain peaks, lakes, windbreaks, a noisy river with suspension bridges over it, logs and rapids. Narzan springs are especially valuable for health, of which there are several in these places. The height of the Mahar Gorge is approximately 2km above sea level.

It is better to break the trip to this gorge into several days to explore the most interesting points, visit waterfalls and mountain lakes, to which you need to walk at least a few hours.

text:
🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿 Great Britain, Scotland, Edinburgh.

Edinburgh was not affected by the Second World War, which is why the old city is absolutely integral in it. Multilevel, with winding streets, narrow, steep alleys and stairs, the city is a fairy tale. There are such figures in cemeteries and just on the facades of houses that make your head spin, in old churches there are now markets, pubs and nightclubs, a bookstore looks like a museum, and schools look like Hogwarts. In general, if you haven't been to Edinburgh yet - go by all means!

text:
🇿🇦South Africa, Lion's Head Mountain.

In the XVII century, the mountain was known as the Lion's Head, and Signal Hill as the Lion's Tail, as they resembled a squatting lion in shape. The British in the XVII century called the mountain Sugar Loaf. The mountain offers a beautiful view of Cape Town, especially during the full moon. The slopes of the mountain are also a popular destination for paragliders.

text:
🇲🇽Mexico, Tulum, Eco-hotel Azulik

With crystal-blue waters for nature lovers and beautiful ruins for culture lovers, Tulum is undoubtedly the vacation capital of the Yucatan Peninsula. This makes sense: there are many places to stay at a variety of prices, from inexpensive hotels to high-end hotels.

The task of standing out among the saturated resorts dotting the Tulum coastline was best solved by Azulik, an eco-resort with 48 villas located near the city center. Opened in 2003, it offers an alternative understanding of luxury and meditation to visitors who are fascinated by the hotel's mesmerizing architecture and connections with nature. 

It consists of wooden log bridges that connect rooms and facilities, including a spa, several restaurants, a meditation center and an art museum called SFER IK. The whimsical design of the museum is the most distinctive feature of Azulik among many Tulum hotels.

🇨🇴 Colombia, Cocora Valley.

There is an amazing place in Colombia, this is the "Cocora Valley", which is also called the "palm valley", the tallest palm trees in the world grow here, reaching the sky itself. In addition, these types of palm trees have served people for a long time as a source of wax for candles and were used in ceremonies.

text:
🇦🇺Australia, Twilight Beach

Seven kilometers from Esperance there is a Twilight beach that attracts all tourists with its white sands, turquoise waters and huge boulders that are scattered everywhere. 

The beach consists of fine white sand, which, combined with low waves averaging 1 m, forms a wide, flat beach and a continuous shallow strip. 

This place is considered one of the best beaches in Australia. Twilight beach is great for families with children, because it is considered the safest. At the same time, rescuers patrol the beach in those months when there are especially many tourists here.

🇷🇴The Transfăgăraș Highway is a mountain highway in the Carpathians connecting the Romanian regions of Wallachia and Transylvania, passing through the Făgăraș mountain range. 

It reaches its highest point at an altitude of 2034 meters. This is the second highest mountain highway in Romania. 

🚵We are convinced that the best transport for this route is a bicycle, if, of course, we only talk about the descent 😉

text:
USA, Nevada, Fly Geyser

Fly is an artificial geyser located in the northwest of the U.S. state of Nevada. The geyser is located at an altitude of 1230 meters above sea level. The walls of the geyser continue to grow even now. According to the latest data, its height is almost 1.5 meters. The geyser constantly throws out three jets of water. Minerals (calcium carbonate), algae and cyanobacteria give it its current color.
ГейThe geyser has greatly changed the surrounding area. Despite the fact that this amazing phenomenon is considered to be a geyser, in fact it can rather be called a thermal spring, since the water here beats constantly (whereas the geyser throws out a water jet periodically). As for the Fly, the flow of hot water pouring out of it does not stop for a second, and the height of the fountains (there are not one, but three) is about one and a half meters.

🇷🇸Belgrade is the capital and pearl of Serbia, one of the oldest cities in Europe and the largest city in the Balkans. 

Belgrade is the center of Serbian culture, filled with dynamics, monumental architecture and tangible history, during which it was constantly shaken by wars. 

Therefore, it is difficult to find buildings and structures older than a couple of hundred years here. Despite all the historical upheavals, Belgrade has an easy disposition and traditional Balkan charm

🇺🇸The most beautiful Lake Tahoe is comfortably located on the territory of California and Nevada. 

On all sides it is surrounded by picturesque coniferous forests, and small channels and streams have long been favored by beavers.

This lake is considered one of the most popular recreation centers in the western United States.

text:
🇦🇴Angola, 🇳🇦Namibia, Epupa falls

The Epupa Waterfall is formed by the Kunene River in the southwestern part of Africa, just on the border of two states – Angola and Namibia. At this point, the width of the river reaches 500 m, it is always full-flowing, as it is fed by abundant tributaries flowing down from the mountainous side of Angola.

The river flows in streams in the arid zone of the Kaokolands on the side of Namibia, washing numerous narrow channels there. Then it plunges into a 37m high stone fault, forming the highest cascade of the Epupa waterfall, and spreads out in a series of cascades that run down the red stone ledges with noise or even with a roar.

text: 🇺🇸The majestic Rainier volcano, the fourth highest peak in the United States, can rightfully be called one of the most beautiful. The volcano is under the protection of a national park, at the time of its opening in 1899, it became the fifth national park in the world. Under the snowy peak and in the wooded foothills there are countless hiking trails, huge meadows strewn with flowers, as well as a wonderful conical peak that challenges purposeful climbers.

text:
🇯🇵Japan, Tokyo, Tokyo Skytree TV Tower

Tokyo Sky Tree is the world's tallest (634 meters) TV tower and the second tallest structure in the world after the Burj Khalifa.

The TV tower is located in Tokyo's Sumida district, it was built to replace the old Tokyo TV tower, which is almost twice as low as the new one. Tokyo Sky Tower got its name as a result of a competition held in April-May 2008. As a result, its winners were the first to climb the observation decks of the tower on May 22, 2012. The construction itself lasted for 3 and a half years - from July 2008 to February 29, 2012. The design was approved in 2006, the developer was the Nikken Sekkei architectural bureau. The roof of the tower is located at an altitude of 470 meters, followed by a huge antenna.

Observation decks are located at an altitude of 350 and 450 meters. The first (Tembo deck) can simultaneously accommodate up to 2000 people, the second (Tembo galleria) - about 900.

messages.text:
🇰🇿Kazakhstan, Bogdanovich Glacier and Oktyabrskaya Cave

Bogdanovich Glacier is the largest glacier at the junction of the Maloalmaatinsky and Komsomolsk spurs. The glacier is named in honor of Karl Ivanovich Bogdanovich, who made a huge contribution to the development of seismology and investigated the Vernensky earthquake of 1910.

The Oktyabrskaya Cave in the Bogdanovich Glacier is the longest cave in Kazakhstan, which was opened in 1963. Oktyabrskaya cave has 5 entrances and its length is 1300-1390 meters.

When you go down into the cave, it's as if you find yourself in a world frozen in time and bound by ice. Huge stones are inside transparent ice, stalactites and ice growths of completely different shapes hang on the walls and ceiling, smooth smooth floor and high ceiling create their own atmosphere — all this is an icy world, fascinating with its inviolability and purity!

The season of visits to this location is December-February.

text:
🇮🇸Iceland

In Iceland there are grandiose waterfalls, the height of which exceeds 200 meters, and there are very small ones up to 5-7 meters in height. 

Waterfalls on Icelandic lands are located everywhere. They can be found among rocky cliffs, at the foot of volcanoes, on hilly plains and among rare forests.

text:
🇭🇺Hungary, Budapest, Szecheni Bathhouse

Budapest is the only capital in the world awarded the title of "resort city". All thanks to the thermal springs located here. 
Especially popular among tourists is the Secheni bathhouse near Varoshliget Park. It was built in 1913 and is a health and wellness complex, including swimming pools, baths and steam rooms - so large that there is no other such not only in the Hungarian capital, but throughout Europe.

From the outside, the Baroque building of the bathhouse looks much more like a palace, rather than a balneological complex.

Inside there are pools with therapeutic water of different temperatures. Water is supplied from a hot spring opened in 1879 from a depth of 1246 meters and comes to the surface at a temperature of +74 °C.

text:
🇺🇸Niagara Falls, USA

Niagara Falls is a complex of waterfalls on the Niagara River, separating the American state of New York from the Canadian province of Ontario.

Millions of tourists visit the waterfall every year. There is a cable car, observation decks and towers, paths and galleries for pedestrians, helicopter tours and even a balloon. 

In the evenings, the Niagara Falls Illumination light show begins at the waterfall — the waters are illuminated in different colors with the help of spotlights. Throughout the year, the waterfall becomes the center of various festivals, shows and mass events.

text:
🇮🇳India, Reverse Nanegat Waterfall

A natural phenomenon - a waterfall that flows from the bottom up – is a point of collision of the elements, which can surprise even the most sophisticated viewer. There are several such "shifters" in the world, and their appearance is scientifically explained.

The reason why the water does not flow down is the strong wind, which causes the water to flow in the opposite direction.

One of these reverse waterfalls is located in India, just a 3-hour drive from Mumbai. This waterfall is located in Nanegat, near Junnar.

text:
🇮🇩Broken Beach, Indonesia

Pasikh Uug is a large natural pool created by a partially collapsed limestone hill hundreds of thousands of years ago. 

The beauty of this place lies precisely in the fact that the rock did not collapse completely, but in the form of an arch, the height of which is 98 meters 

Literally translated from Indonesian, this place is called "broken beach"🌊

🇺🇸Florida, Weeki Wachee Springs Park

Weeki Wachee Springs is a nature park located in Hernando County, Florida, where in the spring at Weeki Wachee you can see underwater performances of "mermaids", women in fish tails and other fancy outfits in an environment reminiscent of an aquarium. 

In Wickiwachi there is a crystal clear river with manatees living in it, in the park you can rent a river boat or kayak to admire these kind mammals.

Also in the park you can take a walk in the luxurious garden and swim, there is even a jungle, a cozy beach and a water park.

text:
🇨🇿Prague Czech Republic

Prague is the capital of the Czech Republic and one of the most beautiful cities in Europe. The city is located in the northwestern part of the Czech Republic, almost in the center of the historical region of Bohemia, and is divided in two by the Vltava River.

The city is incredibly popular with tourists who come to admire its unique architecture, get acquainted with Czech culture and traditions, taste delicious local cuisine and, of course, drink the famous beer.

text:
🇸🇪Sweden, Gulholmen Village

Gulholmen is a small island village, the main part of which occupies an island near the coast, densely built up with low-rise buildings. Along the perimeter of the island there are piers, almost the entire contour of the coast is occupied by boats, boats and yachts of residents.

From each building of the village there is a view of the water space. Every resident can get to this water space with the help of a swimming facility located very close. Due to the specific location, there are practically no cars on the island, all transport links are by water. 

The west coast of Sweden is famous for its sunny climate and fishing villages. Gulholmen was a home for fishermen back in the thirteenth century, and to this day retains its original appearance, with small red houses huddled together.

The west coast of Sweden is famous for its sunny climate and fishing villages. Gulholmen was a home for fishermen back in the thirteenth century, and to this day retains its original appearance, with small red houses huddled together.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Gelendzhik, Blue Abyss

The Blue Abyss is a lagoon located between the village of Divnomorskoye and the village of Dzhankhot, with amazingly clear turquoise water and large white pebbles on the coast. The area got its romantic name due to the fact that after swimming a little deeper into the long plateau, a sharp cliff begins, the depth of which reaches 20 m. If you look at the turquoise water from the sheer cliffs surrounding the lagoon, it seems that the sky reflected in the sea has drowned in it.

Since early spring, the area is literally drowning in all the colors of nature: the sea, the sky, reflections of rocks and clouds in the water, as well as stunning shades of relict Pitsunda pines.

The cliff offers an incredibly beautiful view of Gelendzhik, surrounded by mountains, and the Gelendzhik Lighthouse.

🇺🇸Oahu, Hawaii

Oahu is one of the Hawaiian Islands in the central Pacific Ocean, where famous beaches are located: Waikiki and Lankai, Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head Crater and Haiku Stairs.

In addition, there are mountains, a national park with albatrosses and other interesting places. If you decide to go to Oahu, do not hesitate, here you will find a large number of attractive historical and cultural centers that have no equal.

text:
🇮🇹Italy, Isola Bella Island

On the beautiful Lake Lago Maggiore in northern Italy, 400 meters from the coastal town of Stresa, there is a picturesque castle island, an island park. The entire small area of the island of Isola Bella is occupied by the palace and park complex of Count Borromeo.

Of particular interest from a historical point of view is the Music Hall, where in 1935 the Stresa Conference was held with the participation of British Prime Minister James MacDonald, French Foreign Minister Pierre Laval and Italian leader Benito Mussolini, as well as the Napoleon Hall, in which the great commander himself and his wife Josephine spent the night in 1797.

Of particular interest from a historical point of view is the Music Hall, where in 1935 the Stresa Conference was held with the participation of British Prime Minister James MacDonald, French Foreign Minister Pierre Laval and Italian leader Benito Mussolini.

text:
🇹🇷Istanbul Magic Of Night Lights

The romantic and even a little magical atmosphere of the evening Istanbul will envelop you: in the light of the night lights, the center will sparkle with new colors✨ 

You will see the majestic Hagia Sophia in the brilliance of illumination, the shimmering golden mosaic of the fountain on the main square and marvel at the transformed facade of the hamam Hurrem Sultan, in the walls of which the locals celebrate the "night of the groom" or the bride.

text:
🇨🇳China, Zhangjiajie, Tianmen Mountain, Heavenly Gate 
(Winter❄️)

In the distant Chinese province of Hunan, on the territory of Tianmen Park, the mountain of the same name rises, and this mountain is decorated with a natural wonder known as the Heavenly Gate. It is also sometimes called the Paradise Gate or the gate to heaven.
It is known that in 263 AD, during an earthquake, a huge part of the sheer cliff fell off, forming what we see in the photo.

Zhangjiajie Airport is 7 km away. The height of the Tianmen Mountain itself is 1519m, the height of the arch is as much as 131.5 m, the length is 60m, and the width is about 57m! 

Since ancient times, the Chinese have attached mystical significance to this area. The whole mountain leaves an indelible impression on itself, on the way to the arch you are accompanied by a feeling of peace and tranquility. The fog that envelops the heavenly gates and the haze around are fascinating.

text:
🇺🇸Kauai Island

Kauai is one of the most beautiful islands in the Hawaiian archipelago, deservedly called the garden island.

Lush vegetation, white beaches, turquoise ocean waters so in harmony with them attract newlyweds here, and the steep slopes of majestic mountains, tangled paths winding through the jungle, and excellent places for spending the night in the fresh air attract lovers of adventure and camping life.

text:
🇱🇰Sri Lanka, Sigiriya

8 wonder of the world Sigiriya is an ancient city of the island of Ceylon, is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Sri Lanka. Mount Sigiriya is a rocky plateau, which is also called Lion Mountain or Rock, which rises 370 meters above sea level! At the top of the plateau are the remains of the city, as well as the ruins of an ancient fortress and palaces built (according to one version) during the reign of King Kashyapa (479-495).

The palace was built on the highest point of the mountain: a luxurious structure surrounded by fountains (one of the first in the world!), swimming pools and beautiful gardens. Inside the castle there is a magnificent gallery with frescoes depicting the concubines of the king, as well as a hall of mirrors – it was one of the most unusual and rich buildings of that time.

text:
🇫🇷France, La Roque-Gageac

La Roque-Gajac is a picturesque French town with a population of just over 400 inhabitants. The town itself consists of one long street, which is located along the cliff on one side, and on the other along the Dordogne River. Despite its small size, the town successfully ranks among the most beautiful villages in France. And this is not surprising, because in addition to the beautiful landscape, La Roque Gajac is famous for rare plant species that are characteristic of tropical and Mediterranean climates. The flora, unusual for the Aquitaine region, turned out thanks to the rocks that do not let the cold wind pass, and the climate itself resembles a tropical one by all signs.

La Roque-Gajac is a member of the Association of the most beautiful villages in France (Les Plus Beaux Villages de France). Among the main attractions are the castle, the Tarde mansion, a chapel with a tropical garden, and troglodyte caves.

text:
🇸🇮Slovenia

Slovenia is a unique European country that unites the Alpine and Mediterranean worlds,

The variability of landscapes surprises you again and again. Admiring the sea, and behind - the mountains. You climb the wooded slope of the mountain, and a green plain stretches beneath it. 

From the expanses of the Alpine pasture, the gaze reaches the gorge created by the river waters, and thermal springs will also please. The proximity of contrasts and differences is a feature of Slovenia.

text.text: ✏️The working day usually starts early, at seven to eight o'clock in the morning, but also ends at three to four o'clock in the afternoon. An interesting fact about Slovenia and an equally interesting candidate for relocation

text:
🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿Scotland, Castle Stalker  

If you happen to visit Scotland, then you should definitely visit Castle Stalker. This medieval building is located on a small island. The castle is interesting not only for its antiquity, but also for the mystery that its walls hide. Most of its owners died a violent death.

The name of the castle Stalker translates from the Celtic as "Falcon Hunter". The history of this building began back in 1320. Initially, the castle was a small fortification. The fortress was the property of the Macdougallgalls.

Stalker Castle, which many consider cursed, attracts tourists not so much by its antiquity as by its mysterious and bloody history. In 2006, guests of Scotland had the opportunity not only to admire the building from the outside, but also to visit inside. You can visit the fortress only by appointment. Tourists are allowed to enter the castle in the period from May to September.

text:
🇨🇭Rhine Falls, Switzerland

The Rhine Waterfall is the pearl of Switzerland, which is still not as famous as it deserves. 

This miracle was formed during the last ice age. Melting blocks of ice coming down from the peaks of the Alpine Mountains have repeatedly changed the direction of the Rhine, eroding rock strata and paving a new path for itself. 

✅The waterfall was finally formed about 15,000 years ago, at the same time it acquired a modern appearance😊

text:
🇩🇿Algeria, Tassili N'Ajjer

Tassili N'Ajjer is a mountain formation located in the Sahara, in the southeastern part of Algeria. Since 1982, the site has been included in the UNESCO World Heritage List. In addition to its unusual and amazing forms, the mountainous region also has historical value. Rock carvings, petroglyphs and archaeological excavations indicate that people lived here already in the Neolithic, about 9 thousand years ago, when the climate was milder, and there were savannas instead of deserts.

The National Park with a total area of 80k km2 is protected by the state. Tassili N'Ajjer is also a biosphere reserve. But to a greater extent, interest in the park is manifested for geological reasons. Sandstone formations that have been subjected to erosion for a long time now resemble a stone forest, or landscapes of Mars. Most of the rocks have bizarre views, and each is unique in its own way. In addition, there are about 300 natural arches.

text:
🇫🇷Paris 

The capital of France and the largest city of the country, located on the river in the center of the Ile-de-France region. 

In every country there are romantic places that will decorate your trip, but Paris is out of competition. 

With a huge history steeped in romanticism, it is simply immersed in romance by every corner of its scale, and there is nothing surprising in the fact that it is called the most romantic city in the world.

Visit the Eiffel Tower, walk to the picturesque scenery along the Seine, book tickets for a dinner cruise on the Seine. There are endless ideas and options for a romantic pastime in this magnificent city.

text:
🇳🇴Norway, Aurland

Aurland is a small village that gave its name to an entire municipality in the Sognefjord region. Aurland is located on Aurland Fjord, one of Norway's view roads - Aurlandsfjellet - descends here. Travelers coming to the region most often prefer the more popular Flom, which lies a little further in the "pocket" of Aurland Fjord. Aurland is chosen as a stop by those who like the silence and measured pace of village life on the fjords.

Aurland is the 292nd most populous municipality in Norway with a population of 1,781.

text:
🇻🇪Angel, Venezuela

Angel Falls is located in Canaima National Park, Venezuela.

The height of the waterfall is 979 meters (or 1,054 meters according to other data). It is so high that while the water is flying from the top of the cliff, it splits into small drops and turns into fog. 

This fog spreads over a radius of several kilometers. Most of Angel's water falls into the Kerep River.

text:
🇹🇿Tanzania, Lake Natron

Lake Natron is one of the most famous natural attractions in Tanzania. It is famous for the fact that the water in the lake has a bright red color.

The lake is located near the border of Tanzania with Kenya, and covers an area of just under 1040 sq.m. It reaches a length of no more than 57 km, and a width of about 21 km. In the warmest months, the water temperature in the reservoir can exceed 50-60° C. The average depth of the Natron is 1.5 meters, and in the deepest places – 3 meters.

Lake Natron is the only permanent nesting site for small flamingos in East Africa. There are about 2.5 million individuals of this graceful species of birds. 

Cyanobacteria, using the process of photosynthesis in nutrition, are the main producers of the color of Lake Natron. The color of the water can have yellow, orange, pink and red shades, and depends on the season and the number of such microorganisms.

🇮🇩Ijen volcano, Indonesia

Ijen is an active volcano in Indonesia, to the crater of which you can make fascinating excursions. 

Picturesque trails lead to the mouth, along which tourists get to the edge of a natural spring, amazing in its appearance and content

During the tour, tourists can also visit coffee and tea plantations, get acquainted with the living and working conditions of local residents

🇨🇳China, Pingshan Canyon, Hefeng County, Hebei province

This area is one of the poorest in China. It is not connected to the outside world by railways, airports, ferries, or highways, all this has allowed this region to preserve its unsurpassed natural beauty.

The water is so clear that when sailing on a boat you see the bottom, there is a feeling that the boat is floating through the air.

The main and main problem for tourists is that it is extremely difficult to get to this region, all transport hubs are in the design process. By the way, you can't do without a local guide to navigate the terrain in this region.

text:
🇪🇬Egypt, Siwa Oasis

Siwa Oasis is an island of life lost in the great Desert, the most remote from the valley and delta of the Nile and the most isolated of all the oases of Egypt. It is located in the west of the country, 50 km from the border with Libya, in the Qattara depression, whose level is below sea level. Like any oasis, Siwa owes its appearance to water: subsurface waters, which are rich in the eastern part of the Sahara, or, as it is also called, the Libyan desert, break through to the surface here with numerous springs, among which there is cold spring water suitable for drinking and irrigation, and warm and mineralized.

If you dream of getting off the beaten track in Egypt, then an extraordinary fertile pool in the remote Western Desert will console your imagination. Located on average 18 m below sea level, the isolated Siwa oasis is dotted with  palm trees, warm clean springs and borders the Great Sandy Sea stretching into the distance.

A city in the Italian region of Basilicata, located in the south of the country, just between the "toe" and the "heel" of the famous "boot" of Italy.

This is one of the most unusual cities in Italy: its entire old center is completely hollowed out in the rock. Of the attractions in Matera, there are most churches and temples - about 130.

text:
🇧🇷Brazil, Waterfalls of the Chapada Diamantina National Park

Chapada Diamantina is a famous national reserve located in the vast expanses of the state of Bahia. Its area is 1,520 sq. km., which is very impressive.

Translated, the name of the park sounds like "diamond plateau" for the reason that jewels were actually discovered here. There used to be a real plague in these parts, called diamond fever. Today, the nature park is visited mainly by ecotourism enthusiasts, and previously only jewel hunters could be found here.

Tourists are happy to visit local caves, as well as waterfalls, where special trails lead. Almost all the bright routes originate from the town of Lens.

🇧🇷Brazil, Waterfalls of the Chapada Diamantina National Park

Chapada Diamantina is a famous national reserve located in the vast expanses of the state of Bahia. Its area is 1,520 sq. km., which is very impressive.

Translated, the name of the park sounds like "diamond plateau" for the reason that jewels were actually discovered here. There used to be a real plague in these parts, called diamond fever. Today, the nature park is visited mainly by ecotourism enthusiasts, and previously only jewel hunters could be found here.

Tourists are happy to visit local caves, as well as waterfalls, where special trails lead. Almost all the bright routes originate from the town of Lens.

text:
🇫🇷France, Pierrefonds Castle

Pierrefonds — is an ancient battle castle of the XV century, an important cultural and historical landmark of France. The chateau is located on the southeastern edge of the Compiegne forest, near the town of Ville-Cottreux. The large-scale history of the building covers not only the period from the XIII - XV centuries, but also earlier French periods, starting from the XII century. For some time the castle was a ruin, but later it was restored, rebuilt and used for its intended purpose. The castle of Pierrefonds has been depicted in many feature films, for example, "The Double-headed Eagle", "The Man in the Iron Mask" and "Merlin".

The interiors of the castle do not have a single style: medieval halls turn into an imperial study and bedroom in the spirit of the Second Empire.

text:
🇦🇹Austria, Stairway to Heaven

This dizzying staircase is part of Via Ferrata on the Donnerkogel mountain in Austria. Translated from Italian via Ferrata means "iron road". In fact, this is a route laid along a rocky slope with safety cables, and in some places with metal steps. The term became popular after the First World War: a network of routes was built in the Italian Dolomites to make it easier for soldiers to move at high altitudes. Now these trails allow tourists who do not have climbing skills to get to the picturesque peaks. 

The "Stairway to Heaven" is 40 meters long. It is located 700 meters from the ground.
The "iron Way" accelerates the ascent, but it is easier for some travelers to climb rocks than to walk on an artificial structure.

The "Stairway to Heaven" got its name because in most cases it looks exactly like that in the photos - like something leading from nowhere to nowhere.

text:
🇨🇦Canada, Helmken Waterfall

Travelers who have seen this waterfall with their own eyes claim that even the world-famous Niagara, located on the border of Canada and the USA, cannot be compared in beauty with the majestic Helmken. On the edge of the canyon, from which the waterfall jets fall, there is a safe observation deck, from which a stunning view of the surrounding area opens. The bravest tourists make their way directly to the water itself. Keep in mind that it may not be safe, so it's better to limit yourself to a fenced area.

The height of the famous Helmken Waterfall in Canada is 141 m. A wide, full-flowing jet falls from a great height onto a stone plateau formed due to tectonic activity. It is noteworthy that Helmken does not freeze even in severe winter frosts – a small stream of water flows all year round, forming a giant glacier around. Desperate climbers throw an exit to an ice-covered waterfall and conquer it, risking their own lives.

text:
🇸🇨Seychelles, Anse Lazio Beach 
Anse Lazio is located on the northwestern coast of Praslin Island in the quiet harbor of Chevalier Bay. This is a unique beach, access to which is not closed by a coral reef, unlike the rest of the island's beaches. The length of the coastline is 400 m. There is soft white sand on the coast, the beach is surrounded by huge rocky boulders. 

Anse Lazio Resort is located in a picturesque bay in the northern part of the island with dense tropical vegetation, between lush hills. On the coast there are tall palm trees, takamaka trees, in the shade of which tourists hide from the scorching sun. The beach is shallow, the lowering of the bottom is smooth. The water is clean, warm and transparent. At high tide, it comes close to the shore. Walking and morning jogging are pleasant on the soft sand. Lifeguards are working on the beach. The conditions for tourists' recreation are safe, but there is a strong current in the local waters.

text:
🇵🇪Red River in the valleys of Cusco, Peru

The red color of the river is a seasonal phenomenon.

Scientists have found out that the acquired color is a consequence of the flow of mountain waters through a valley saturated with many different minerals. 

In particular, we are talking about iron oxide, because it lies in large quantities under the soil.

text:
🇻🇳Vietnam, Halong Bay

In the north of Vietnam, 160 km from Hanoi, there is a bay of amazing beauty — Halong. 3000 islands covered with greenery and rocks of bizarre shapes rise above the emerald expanse of water, and the shores of the bay are decorated with beaches, caves, freshwater lakes and mangrove forests.

Most of the islands are uninhabited, only two large islands are permanently inhabited — Tuan Chau and Cat Ba. Tourist activity is developing on them, there are beaches and hotels. There are wonderful beaches on other smaller islands – Bai Chau, Ti Top, Min Chau, Kuan Lan and others.

If you look from above, Halong looks like a beautiful painting created by a wizard. A unique masterpiece of nature, which has transformed thousands of silent stone islands into fantastic sculptural and picturesque works of various forms - sometimes familiar, sometimes strange. Here a person feels like an alien trapped among the fossils of the ancient world.

text: 🇮🇳India. Puga Valley💚

🇨🇳China, Huanglong Nature Reserve

China has one of the most amazing nature reserves in the world. We are talking about the Huanglong Nature Reserve (Huanglong - translated from Chinese as “yellow dragon"), which is located in the highlands of Sichuan province. 
The reserve is located at an altitude of 3500 meters above sea level. From a bird's-eye view, Huanglong really resembles a giant dragon, sparkling in the sun with its scales. The main pride of the reserve is the bizarre relief forms composed of limestone.

For tens of millions of years, precipitation and water flowing from mountain glaciers seeped through the earth. Underground streams gradually dissolved the calcite rock layer. And when the streamlet, having run underground, made its way out, calcite crystallized under the influence of the temperature difference and settled on any surface, be it shells of ancient mollusks, stones or plants. So nature has created travertine terraces with reservoirs.

text:
🇦🇴Angola, 🇳🇦Namibia, Epupa Waterfall 

The Epupa Waterfall is formed by the Kunene River in the southwestern part of Africa, just on the border of two states – Angola and Namibia. At this point, the width of the river reaches 500 m, it is always full-flowing, as it is fed by abundant tributaries flowing down from the mountainous side of Angola.

text:
🇹🇭Thailand, Ko Poda Island

Ko Poda island is the nearest island located off the coast of Ao Nang. Ko Poda heads the island group, which also includes Chicken Island, Tab and Mor. The attraction is located in the province of Krabi, 8 km from the mainland of Thailand. On the shore, travelers will find soft, fine sand, a large accumulation of vegetation, and there are also many monkeys living here who feel like the rightful owners of the island and behave accordingly - brazenly stealing tourists' belongings and food.

Ko Poda Island with an area of 1 km by 600 m is covered with palm trees and is undoubtedly included in the list of the most visited natural sites in Thailand. The main attraction of the island is the picturesque cliffs and comfortable beaches. Many travelers note that such a clean sea is difficult to find all over the world. The main purpose of a trip to Podu in Thailand is to swim, sunbathe, swim in a mask.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Karelia, Kizhi Island

Kizhi has long been not just the name of an island in Lake Onega, but a synonym for the unique beauty that Russian architects were able to create from wood. The Transfiguration and Intercession Churches, sparkling under the northern sun— are a symbol of Kizhi and all Russian wooden architecture. Tourists from all over the world come to Karelia to see these monuments, which are included in the UNESCO World Heritage List.

The area of the island is only 5 sq. km. The length of the territory is 5.5 km, but the width is only 1.4 km.

More than 89 monuments of wooden architecture were collected on such a tiny territory. In the park you can see ancient chapels, wooden churches, houses, mills, and many barns. The pearl of the complex is called the Transfiguration Church of 1714, whose height reaches 37 m. This church is crowned by 22 domes.

messages.text:
Do you know who the Nazis are? Do you know about the massacre of Poles in Volhynia, when the Ukrainian Nazis killed about 50,000 Poles? I'm from Russia. When I see comments where Russians are accused of supporting the war, I want to ask: "Are you really sure you understand who we are waging war against?" And are you sure that you from your distant country are well aware of what is happening here with our neighbors? In a country where almost everyone speaks Russian. In a country where a huge number of Russian people live, and where every fifth has relatives? And in your opinion we have come to kill them? Killing your own people? For what purpose? Do you think that 71% of Russians dream of seizing the territory of a neighboring country, while killing thousands of the same Russian people? Are you sure this is real?
Our wars have come to cleanse the earth of Ukrainian Nazis, who are right now teaching their children to kill Russians and everyone who does not recognize Ukrainians as a great nation. Fake? No, I'm sorry. There are enough videos on the Internet of how little Ukrainians shout "Death to the Russians" in a broken voice, and Nazi parents teach them to kill, how in the 21st century Nazi Hitler Youth camps for children work on the territory of poor oppressed Ukraine.

text:
🇦🇪UAE,  Ain Dubai

On October 21, 2021, Ain Dubai opened in Dubai - the tallest Ferris wheel in the world, its height is 250 meters.
The construction of the wheel required 2,400 km of cables and 11,200 tons of steel, the latter - 33 percent more than was used in the construction of the Eiffel Tower. The cost of the attraction was $ 1.6 billion.

text:
🇯🇵Japan, Arashiyama Bamboo Forest

Arashiyama Bamboo Forest also known as Sagano Bamboo Forest is a popular tourist destination. A bamboo grove is located in the west of the city of Kyoto in the Arashiyama district. This is a historical area of the city with many attractions.

By its size, the bamboo forest is more like a small park. The area of this picturesque place is about 16 square kilometers. A small area of the grove is densely covered with bamboo. Some plants reach a height of 40-50 meters, thereby closing the sky. Because of this, it seems that you are in an impassable thicket.

A bamboo forest appeared in the Arashiyama area in the 14th century. The founder of such an unusual park was Muso Soseki, a mentor of the rinzai Zen school and a sign of garden art. Moso bamboo, which is native to China and Taiwan, was planted in the park.

text:
Maldives, Vaadhoo Island 

The real paradise, which is located in the north of the atoll called South Male, can be safely attributed to the resort island of Vaadhoo. Here you will be able to contemplate an amazing unique phenomenon - the beach shores sparkling at night. The reason for this is simple - you see plankton that glows. This process is explained by bioluminescence.

These chemical processes appear due to the appearance of energy. It is released from the body of animals, being released in the form of light. This glow is amazingly beautiful. Watching it at night on the picturesque shores of the island of Vaadhoo, you seem to find yourself in a fairy tale. If you actively spray water, the glow will be even more intense.

The air temperature hardly changes during the year. It's always from twenty-seven to thirty-two degrees Celsius.

text:
🇹🇭Thailand, Nang Yuan island 

Nang Yuan Island is a small island near Koh Tao, located in the Gulf of Thailand in the south of Thailand. It consists of three parts connected by a long sand spit that goes under the water during tides. The place is famous for wonderful diving and snorkeling spots, white sandy beaches and clear turquoise water.

By itself, Nang Yuan is very small, movement along it is possible only on foot. The island is part of a marine reserve, so there are special rules of conduct. It closes for visitors at 17.00, unless, of course, you stay overnight at the Nangyuan Island Dive Resort.

text:
🇵🇭Philippines, Cambugahay Falls

Cambugahay Falls is the most popular waterfall on Siquihor, there are always a lot of vacationers here. Sometimes there are even queues of people who want to take a ride and jump on the "bungee" into the water. In fact, this is a recreation complex where you can swim in three natural pools of the waterfall, swim on a raft, swing and jump into the water from a bungee, have a picnic and even fry a barbecue.

The waterfall itself is low, consists of three rapids about 2-4 meters high each. It is worth coming here not to see the waterfall, it is not very spectacular, but to relax and swim.

A series of small cascades with clear water make the waterfall a really wonderful place to relax. The lowest level has the deepest and largest pool, it is also easy to climb to the top to find smaller pools.

The best time to visit is summer, when the fast-flowing waters change color to emerald.

text:
🇫🇷Lyon, France

Lyon is a monument city, a master city and a city of abundance, in which you are provided with an interesting and peaceful vacation.

📙 Ancient Lyon was part of the Roman Empire. Fragments of two thousand-year-old buildings and two amphitheatres have been preserved on the territory so far. For the most enthusiastic there is a museum of Gallo-Roman civilization.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Geyzernoye Ozero

Geyzernoye Ozero is a unique attraction located near the village of Aktash in the Eastern Altai. This is a small thermal lake about 30 meters in diameter, in the center of which springs are beating, forming a bizarre pattern on the bottom, thanks to which the lake looks very picturesque and impressive.

The lake has several names, including Blue or Silver.

Due to the bluish clay at the bottom, in the middle of the lake has a unique turquoise color with oval round streaks. They are formed under the influence of geyser eruptions that raise what is at the bottom to the surface.

The maximum depth of the lake is only 2 meters, and the water is crystal clear, so the clay patterns on the bottom can be observed from any shore and in any weather. On all sides, the lake is closed by tall larch trees, which only adds to the picturesque place.

The water in the lake does not freeze all year round, even at temperatures below 0 degrees.

text:
🇺🇸Arches Park, USA

It is located on the territory of the state of Utah in the USA, near the city of Moab, a 10-minute drive from it.

There are more than 2 thousand natural stone arches in the park, and the terrain is made up of monolithic sandstone rocks, in which hundreds of turrets were formed.

📚It is quite hot here in summer, so seasoned travelers are advised to plan their trip in spring or autumn.

text:
🇹🇭Thailand, Wat Sam Phran Temple

Wat Sam Phran Temple is an original Buddhist temple with a height of 17-storey building in Nakhon Pathom province. From a distance, it looks more like a fairy-tale tower from Disneyland than a religious object.
⠀
Only a few floors are used in the main building of the temple complex. On one of the floors there is an entrance to the dragon's body. However, it will be quite difficult to see anything, because there is no lighting inside the mythical creature. Only ten floors are available to visitors, it will not be possible to go further, since the remaining floors of the temple are closed. Some floors are used by monks as living quarters.

It is believed that if you touch the dragon by the tail, throw a coin into a special "pot of happiness" and hit the temple gong, then luck will accompany you all the coming year.
⠀

text:
🇵🇭Philippines

The Philippines is a state lost among the seas and oceans on seven thousand islands, with about 1000 inhabited. 

The warm climate, the gentle sea, snow-white beaches, diverse tropical vegetation, steep cliffs and numerous coral reefs with their colorful underwater world create a unique feeling of unreal beauty of these places.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Lena Pillars Nature Park

Lena Pillars is a natural park located on the banks of the Lena River, in Yakutia. The reserve got its name due to unusual rocks in the form of pillars stretching along the right bank of the river for tens of kilometers. The stone formations consist of limestone, the height reaches 220 meters above the river level.

Lena Pillars Park is a huge valley with an area of 1353 thousand hectares, standing on 3 rivers. Most of the land has not been developed and is not included in economic exploitation. In the reserve you can meet rare representatives of flora and fauna and admire the beauty of pristine nature.

The diversity of the reserve's ecosystems makes it possible for many species of plants and animals listed in the Red Book to live. Today, more than a thousand species of fauna are observed here.

text:
🇮🇳Jog, India

🚰The Jog Falls waterfall in Karnataka is the highest in India. Its height is 253 meters.

The best views of the waterfall can be found during the rainy season, at other times you risk disappointment – in a drought, the Jog often turns into pathetic trickles of water that evaporate halfway to the reservoir at the foot. In addition, the flow capacity is regulated by a dam, and on weekends, for the sake of tourists, it is increased.

text:
🇱🇰Sri Lanka, Pidurangala Mountain

Pidurangala Rock is an underrated attraction of the island of Sri Lanka. The guests of Ceylon have heard a lot about Sigiriya, many have been there on excursions. Meanwhile, the equally beautiful Pidurangala rock stands modestly on the sidelines, and shares its beauties only with truly curious travelers, connoisseurs of the beauties of wild nature.

The height of Pidurangala is exactly 170 meters above sea level. The attraction of Pidurangala includes several parts that are interconnected by a man-made stone staircase.

The way to the top of the cliff is interesting: a narrow road among boulders that are located at an angle. It seems that the stone giant is about to fall down. However, this is only an illusion.

text:
🇲🇽Mexico, Xcaret Park

Xcaret Park is a unique complex of its kind with exceptional architecture, ecosystem, archaeological sites, cultural and entertainment programs. Xcaret is Mexico's most famous national park. The complex is named after a nearby archaeological site, the remains of an ancient pre-Columbian Maya civilization. Some of the ancient ruins are located on the territory of the resort.

Xcaret Park is located in Mexico, about 75 kilometers south of Cancun, on the Yucatan Peninsula in the state of Quintana Roo. From the east, the territory of the park borders the Caribbean Sea.

Xcaret Amusement Park was built on the territory where the ruins of a Mayan settlement were discovered.

The name of the park translates as "little bay". The theme of the complex is everything related to the ancient Mayan culture and the history of Mexico.

Xcaret Park has a lot of entertainment for any age.

Monte Carlo is an administrative region in the Principality of Monaco. The area is a resort and a center of international tourism.

Monte Carlo is famous for its casinos, luxury hotels, opera house, exotic garden with a view of the city. This country is amazing with its aesthetics and the beauty of architecture. 

It will be a special pleasure to visit the city in May, when the streets will turn into Formula-1 racing tracks.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Ivolginsky datsan

The center of spiritual and cultural life of Buryatia, an architectural monument, a key attraction of the republic — all this is about the Ivolginsky datsan. Datsan is a Buddhist temple complex that includes a monastery, a university, as well as other religious sites.

Ivolginsky datsan occupies an honorable first place among Buddhist temples in Russia. Its full name in Tibetan sounds like this: "Rivo Gandan Geje Dashi Choinkhorlin", which translates as "The Abode of the Perfect Wheel of Learning, the Mountain that Multiplies the Virtues of Tushita". All guests of the datsan note that there is a sense of calm, joy and positive emotions on the territory of the temple. 

In 2002, the datsan in Ivolginsk became the "home" of one of the greatest wonders of the whole world. The incorruptible body of Lama Etigelov was transported here, which has not been decomposed for almost a hundred years.

In this "Little Venice", the number of bridges is also striking: there are more than 170 of them here, and they are almost opposite every house that is by the water.

text:
🇨🇳China, Via Ferrata in Chenzhou

This place is practically unknown to tourists from abroad, however, in China it is very popular as an unusual route and a source of adrenaline. The "iron Way" or Via ferrata are trails along steep cliffs that are overcome with the help of iron ladders, an ordinary iron cable or other devices. As a rule, such sections run along the most dangerous routes, and travelers will need a lot of courage to overcome them.

There is a unique geopark in Chenzhou, the main part of which is located around Mount Feitian, which means "flying sky". In addition to the most beautiful rocks and landscapes, here you can see unusual vegetation, bizarre rocks, lakes and valleys. The routes take place both in the jungle and on the tops of bare rocks.

text:
🇺🇸San francisco, USA

San Francisco is a California city known for its hilly terrain, Victorian architecture, beautiful landscapes and cultural diversity.

One of the most famous places in San Francisco is the Golden Gate Bridge. A suspension bridge that connects the city of San Francisco in the north of the San Francisco Peninsula and the southern part of Marin County, near the suburb of Sausalito.

The Golden Gate Bridge was the largest suspension bridge in the world until 1964, its length is 2737 m.

text:
🇳🇿New Zealand, Waitomo Firefly Caves

The Waitomo Firefly Caves in New Zealand are a unique natural attraction. A real planetarium under the arches of the cave.

Nature has worked hard and created underground grottoes, abundantly filled with luminous insects Arachnocampa Luminosa. They are also called mushroom mosquitoes-fireflies, because the main food of this species is spores of fungi that grow in caves.

The main reason for the glow is as follows: mosquito larvae (up to 3 cm in length) hang special threads with a glue-like substance.

Larvae catch small insects with these spider threads. Then the thread is wound and the caught prey becomes a delicious breakfast or lunch. And in order to attract "food", the larvae begin to glow actively. Scientists believe that the more the larva glows, the hungrier it is.

Interesting fact - fireflies are afraid of noise. If you shout loudly, the magic lights can go out, plunging you into darkness.

text:
Chile 🇨🇱, Argentina 🇦🇷, Patagonia

Patagonia is a land with icy lakes, glaciers, inaccessible slopes and rocky cliffs. But, despite all the severity of the region, thousands of tourists come to Patagonia to enjoy the pristine nature. Mountaineering, downhill skiing, snowboarding, fishing and even, you won't believe it, beach holidays thrive here.

Patagonia - has no clear borders, being located in the region of South America. Chile and Argentina have divided Patagonia geographically, so you can relax in both countries at the same time. Lovers of downhill skiing, mountaineering and outdoor activities on snow-capped peaks can safely go to a popular place in the north of Argentina - San Carlos de Bariloche.

If you want to go to the coast, by the way, in summer the water warms up to +25 degrees, the best place is Rio Negro.

text:
Lake Moraine Canada🇨🇦

Canadian Lake Moraine is located in Banff National Park.

Nature has created an unusually harmonious picture here, in which majestic mountains, the blue expanse of a crystal clear lake and coniferous forests merge into a single whole. Every person who has visited this amazing place feels a special atmosphere.

📙Individual trips are not allowed, only in a group of four or more people. This is due to the fact that bears and wolves are found in the forests, and the path is full of all sorts of surprises🐺🐻😱

text:
Kazakhstan 🇰🇿, Kolsai lakes

A system of 3 lakes in the northern Tien Shan, in the Kolsai Gorge. The lakes are located on the territory of the Kegensky district of the Almaty region of Kazakhstan and are located 10 km north of the border with Kyrgyzstan.

Kolsai Lakes are a unique place for mountain recreation. Kazakh nature has created a real miracle, which people called the "blue necklace of the Tien Shan". The reservoirs are unimaginably beautiful, and the nature surrounding them impresses with its greatness. The water in the lakes is clean and transparent. 

Lakes were formed as a result of a natural cataclysm. After a strong earthquake, a mudslide descended in the mountains, which formed a natural dam in the gorge. The mountain river filled the hollows that appeared, but a small channel still remained. The lakes are still connected today by the Kolsai River. The territory of unique reservoirs is recognized as a national park.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Cable-stayed bridge in Vladivostok (Russky bridge)

The longest bridge in the world by arch span is the cable-stayed bridge in Vladivostok. It runs through the Eastern Bosphorus Strait and connects the Cape of Novosilsky and the Nazimov Peninsula. It is known for the largest span among all cable-stayed tracks - 1104 m, as well as for its highest point of construction – 324 m.

The construction of the cable-stayed bridge began in 2008 and lasted until 2012. The cost of the entire project cost about $ 1 billion.

Russky bridge in Vladivostok - automobile, part of the federal road A-371, connects the Nazimov Peninsula beyond Ulysses Bay with Russky Island - leads to Cape Novosilsky. Two lanes are allocated for vehicles in each direction, the width of the roadway reaches 21 meters. This bridge is one of the main attractions of the city.

text:
🇵🇭Philippines, Sirao Park

Sirao Park - also called the mini Amsterdam of Cebu, a huge part of this garden blooms with celosia flowers, which are yellow, fuchsia and orange, and surprisingly creates a surreal landscape. A very instagrammable place. Interestingly, at first it was not conceived as a commercial object, but thanks to the social network.the networks quickly gained popularity. The park has a large number of art objects and flowers. 

High mountains near the city of Cebu adorn the blooming garden of Sirao. Here you can not only enjoy the fresh mountain air and the view of bright exotic flowers, but also take beautiful photos at specially equipped points: a giant hand, in charming nests and gazebos, next to a Buddha statue or on a huge inscription "LOVE".

messages.text:
🛳Royal Caribbean Cruises 

For 50 years, Royal Caribbean International has held the brand of a world leader in the field of cruise tourism. The company implements and equips ships with technological achievements, uses the experience of the entertainment industry to attract tourists.
Sea and ocean liners are "floating cities" with restaurants, shops, attractions, entertainment, theaters.

Royal Caribbean Cruise Line (RCCL) was established in 1968 by shipping companies from Norway Anders Wilhelmsen &Company and I.M. Skauge& Company and Gotaas Larsen.
Over the years, the company has undergone reorganizations and mergers, but has remained true to the principles of providing a variety of services on board superliners that can accommodate up to 6 thousand people.

The company occupies 26% of the global cruise market and offers tourists various destinations to travel around the world.

Modern skyscrapers, Indian temples, British colonial houses, mosques and Arab-style buildings are miraculously intertwined here.

text:
🇦🇪UAE, Dubai, Musical Fountain

The Musical Fountain in Dubai is located in the heart of the largest city in the UAE, surrounded by skyscrapers, restaurants and shopping malls belonging to the modern, wide-functional Downtown Dubai complex. The fountain is rightfully considered one of the tallest and most unusual in the world. Its length is 275 m, and the height of the jets reaches 150 m, which is approximately equal to the height of a 50-storey building.

Several times in the evening, the Dancing Fountains of Dubai, originally illuminated by special spotlights, turn into a light and music complex, creating stunning compositions. The complex structure, controlled by automation, is located within the boundaries of an artificial lake, which stretches at the foot of the Burj Khalifa (or Khalifa Tower). On its facade during grandiose performances, you can often see amazing laser projections.

text:
🇦🇺Australia, Hymes Beach 

Hyams Beach is a beach with the whitest sand in the world. That's how it appears in the Guinness Book of Records. Surprisingly, the local sand stands out in its color even in the dim light of the moon, it is so white. And on a sunny day, it just shines, so when going here on vacation, be sure to take sunglasses and sunscreen with you. The sand on Hymes Beach is not just snow–white, but also very fine - it feels more like flour or powdered sugar than sand rock. And some tourists compare it with starch for its characteristic creak.

The length of the beach is just over 2 km. At the same time, the beach is wide enough to fit everyone.
 
Hymes Beach is not just popular, it is known all over the world. It is here that tourists come to make unique shots against the background of snow-white expanses, relax, sunbathe and, of course, swim in the purest waters of Jervis Bay.

text:
🇺🇸South Dakota

It occupies the territory of the Rocky Mountains, the Great Plains, as well as some part of the Mississippi River basin, which caused an extremely diverse relief and picturesque districts. 

This is truly an American province, where there are practically no large cities. 

The most famous natural massif of the region is the Black Hills, which from time immemorial have been considered shrines for all Indian tribes living on the territory of the Great Plains.

text:
🇵🇹Portugal, Odeleite River 🐉 

There are many different rivers in the world. However, among this diversity, really unique rivers are not so common. One of these is the Odeleite River or "Blue Dragon", in Portugal.

No wonder, because if you look at the river from a bird's-eye view, it really resembles the shape of a dragon.

The right tributary of the "Blue Dragon" is the Portuguese river called Guadiana. The Odeleite River originates in the Serra de Caldeiran mountains.

The river can be found in the cities of San Brash de Alportel, Alcotin, Castru Marin, as well as in the city of Tavira.

There is a dam on the river, which is located near the port of Barragem de Odeleite. By the way, the dam and reservoir formed from the waters of the river have the same names – Dress up.

text:
🇧🇷Brazil, Cave "Gruta Lago Azul"

Gruta Lago Azul is located 20 km from the city of Bonito, in the state of Mato Grosso do Sul, it contains two caves with interesting but fragile limestone formations, and has been included in the list of protected areas since 1978. Gruta Lago Azul means "Cave of the blue Lake". 

Inside there is a stunning lake of bright blue color with a depth of 90 meters. Its size makes it one of the largest flooded cavities on the planet. Prehistoric animal fossils such as giant sloths and saber-toothed tigers have been found at its base.

The best time to visit is the morning of a sunny day, on cloudy days it is impossible to appreciate the beauty of the cave. The excursion requires average physical fitness, because the caves are slippery, and the ascents are quite steep. The unusual color of the lagoon and the sunny gaps in the cave will remain as bright in the photo.

text:
🇷🇺Saint Petersburg, Russia

St. Petersburg is the magic of drawbridges in the light of white nights, imperial palaces with luxurious decorations, elegant sculptures, romantic fountains and fascinating architecture.

For three centuries, St. Petersburg has deservedly become one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Unlike many other outstanding European cities, the beauties of St. Petersburg are not chaotic, but represent a certain system of architectural ensembles

text:
🇹🇭Thailand, Ko Kut – coconut palm island in Thailand

Ko Kut is an island with pristine exotic nature, located far from noisy tourist centers. This is a suitable place for a quiet contemplative rest. On this island you can find solitude and peace, a transparent warm sea and lush tropical vegetation, maximum relaxation and romance.

Ko Kut Island is located in the eastern part of the Gulf of Thailand, near the border of Thailand and Cambodia. It is the fourth largest island in Thailand. Ko Kut has a low population density, no more than 2 thousand people live here in six small villages. The main occupation of the inhabitants of the island is serving tourists, fishing, growing coconut palms and rubber trees. The national composition is dominated by Thais and Cambodians, the locals profess Buddhism.

Measuring 22x8 km2, Ko Kut is surrounded by lush tropical greenery and is rightfully considered one of the most beautiful islands in Thailand.

🇨🇭Rhone Glacier, Switzerland

A glacier in the east of the canton of Valais in Switzerland, is the source of the Rhone River.

Being one of the most accessible glaciers in the Swiss Alps, the Rhone Glacier has become a popular destination for tourists

Amazing sensations can be experienced inside the glacier, moving along a 100-meter tunnel cut into the ice thickness

text:
🇮🇳India, the Earth center of Jatayu

The Jatayu Earth Centre, also known as the Jatayu Nature Park, is a new attraction in India, located in Kerala, 50 km north of Trivandrum.
⠀
The world's largest bird sculpture is located here: 61 m long, 46 m wide, 21 m high, and occupies an area of 1400 sq. m
. ⠀
This masterpiece is the creation of Rajiv Anchal, who devoted 10 years of his life to this. The sculpture is dedicated to the safety of women and honor, symbolizing their protection. Jatayu Park itself symbolizes an era where people and other living beings take care of each other.
In
addition to sculpture, there are 20 types of entertainment to attract visitors. Some of them are rock climbing, rifle shooting, paintball. There is also a digital 6D museum. For the more active, there are cable cars in the center, which will definitely help you get a good overview of the entire center.

text:
Solomon Islands 🇸🇧

The Solomon Islands are a fairly large group of Pacific islands located northeast of the continent of Australia. In total, the state includes over 990 large and small islands, considered part of the so-called Melanesia. Almost all of these islands are of volcanic origin, so they are very picturesque. They are covered with evergreen tropical forests, sometimes turning into impenetrable jungles.

This corner of the Earth has become the most sought-after for drivers whose eyes open to intact coral reefs, colorful marine fauna, ships and planes flooded during the Second World War.

One of the most popular tourist attractions was the cruise ship "World Discoverer", which on April 30, 2000 ran into a reef and ripped its starboard side. Under the threat of flooding, the captain sent the ship to a quiet bay on a shoal (Roderick Dhu Bay, Nggella Sule Island). Human casualties were avoided, but the ship could not be saved.

text:
Iran🇮🇷

Iran is one of the most magical and underrated countries in the world. Some confuse it with Iraq, others are sure that there is a war going on there and there are a lot of terrorists. 

But those who did not listen to the warnings and gave Iran a chance, return smitten by the Persian charm and are already planning a new trip.

Iran hides the greatest historical heritage, magnificent natural landscapes, the richest cuisine and exquisite objects of national art.

Iran is a huge country located in several climatic zones at once. There are snow-capped peaks and dormant volcanoes, crystal lakes and endless green hills, centuries-old forests, mysterious mangrove groves and the azure coast of the Persian Gulf.

Of course, there are deserts in Iran, but even they resemble a Martian landscape rather than the usual sandy sea. But what to say, let's watch!

China🇨🇳, Guangzhou, Sculpture "Child of the Earth"

In the Gobi Desert in Guangzhou County, you can meet a gigantic baby, 15 meters long and 4 meters high. The author of the sculpture, Dong Shubing, scanned a real child, then pulled out a sculpture of red sandstone bricks on a 3D printer. Despite the pretentious name "Child of the Earth", a baby of this size looks frightening.

text:
🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿

Edinburgh is the capital of Scotland and one of the most beautiful cities in Europe. It is located near the east coast of the island of Great Britain, facing the North Sea.

Edinburgh Castle towers over the city, where the royal jewels of Scotland and the legendary Skunk Stone, on which the Scottish and English monarchs were crowned, are kept.

The name of the city comes from the Breton name of the fortress "Din Eidyn", that is, the Fortress of Eidin, which was located on the lands of the ancient British kingdom of Gododin.

text:
Belgium 🇧🇪 , Hallerbos Blue Forest

Hallerbos is a picturesque place, which is a beech forest with an area of 552 hectares (5.5 km2). It is located in the Belgian municipality of Halle on the border between Flanders and Wallonia, a 30-minute drive south of Brussels.

The forest is known for its extraordinary beauty, which envelops it in the spring – every year in late April and early May, several hectares of forest are covered with a magnificent thick carpet of millions of bluebells (wild hyacinths), creating bizarre patterns of all shades of blue. The ultramarine blanket extends deep into the forest as far as the eye can see, circling around trees, covering valleys and decorating the banks of streams. It is very popular both among Belgians and among foreign connoisseurs of beauty.

The Blue Forest acquires a special charm at dawn – at this time the area is enveloped by the morning dawn, and the thick fog further emphasizes its mysterious and surreal atmosphere.

text:
🇸🇮

Bled is a mountain resort in northwestern Slovenia near the Austrian border. 

🔶A small town of the same name is located around a lake of glacial origin. A picturesque island with an old chapel in the middle of the lake and a medieval castle built on a rock at the beginning of the 11th century give it a special charm.

🔶The tourist season in Bled can be divided into thematic races: winter is the time for skiing, spring is for romantic trips, summer is for beach holidays, and autumn is for treatment at thermal springs.

text:
Tuvalu 🇹🇻

Tuvalu is an island country in Oceania, located halfway between the Hawaiian Islands and Australia. It is one of the smallest countries in the world, with a population of less than 12 thousand people. Here is an incredibly beautiful exotic nature: blue lagoons of the Pacific Ocean, white sand, luxurious palm trees, but also full of its own problems.

Tuvalu is located on 3 reef islands and 6 atolls. The distances between the neighboring islands range from 50 to 172 km .

The center of the country is Funafuti Atoll, where about half of the country's population lives. It consists of small islands with a lagoon in the middle. The highest point of Tuvalu is 5 m above sea level, and most of the islands are at an altitude of 3 m.

Scientists predict that in 50-100 years, the islands of Tuvalu may become uninhabited if the water level in the ocean continues to rise. And according to some forecasts, Tuvalu will sooner or later go under water.

text:
Russia, Moscow, Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception of the Blessed Virgin Mary

The Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception of the Blessed Virgin Mary is a Neo-Gothic cathedral in Moscow, the largest Catholic cathedral in Russia, the cathedral of the Archdiocese of the Mother of God. The third Moscow Catholic Church.

It was built from 1901 to 1911, the interior was finished in 1917. By permission of the governor, the construction was carried out far from the center of Moscow and large Orthodox churches, without towers and sculptural statues. 

World-famous organists perform concerts in the cathedral. They perform works by Bach, Handel, Vivaldi, Mozart and other classics. Organ arrangements of rock compositions and music from the cinema often sound in the cathedral. On certain days, you can listen to a charity concert of organ music.

text: Volcano

🇮🇩

Agung is an active volcano in the eastern part of Bali. It is the highest point of the island: its peak is located at an altitude of 3,142 meters above sea level. 

🔶Tourist groups go to the volcano to meet the dawn at the top, from where a fantastic panorama of a green island surrounded by the ocean and illuminated by the morning sunshine opens. 

🔶It is recommended to conquer Agung, as well as visit Bali, during the "dry" period (from June to November).

text:
New Zealand 🇳🇿, Hobbiton 

Hobbiton is a village in New Zealand, artificially created specifically for the filming of the trilogy "The Lord of the Rings" and "The Hobbit" based on the works of the same name by J.R. Tolkien. This small settlement is the habitat of the people invented by the writer. The scenery includes hobbit holes, landscape elements and the Green Dragon Inn. Unlike standard cinematographic funds, which are usually created from cardboard and plywood, the village was rebuilt for real.

Now it is a local attraction, which is visited every day by about 300 tourists who come to these parts precisely for the sake of Hobbiton. Artfully executed houses, well-groomed gardens, an abundance of picturesque details allow the traveler to fully plunge into the recognizable atmosphere of his favorite movies from the first step.

text: Bridge

🇻🇳

Near the resort town of Da Nang, in Ba Na Hills, in the summer of 2018, a huge bridge was built in the form of a golden thread, pulled out of the ground by no less huge hands🌉

The Golden Bridge is located at an altitude of more than 1400 meters above sea level and looks like a silk strip that hides in the clouds over Da Nang.

text:
Italy 🇮🇹, Vernazza City

Vernazza is a small town in the Italian province of Spezia, in the Liguria region, one of the five that make up the Cinque Terre National Park of Italy. The picturesque cliffs surrounding a small bay, colorful houses huddled close to each other on the very seashore, the calm, even peaceful atmosphere of this place will not leave any tourist indifferent. Many who have been here claim that Vernazza is the romantic, bright, cheerful Italy that they dreamed of seeing.

The settlement on the site of the modern city of Vernazza originated in the era of the Roman Empire and until the end of the XIII century was jointly owned by three powerful and noble families. From those times, there are many old architectural buildings in the town, which are adjacent to modern buildings on the streets of the town of Vernazza. However, such a neighborhood does not destroy the picture of universal integrity and harmony, but only strengthens the impression.

Italy 🇮🇹, Vernazza City

Vernazza is a small town in the Italian province of Spezia, in the Liguria region, one of the five that make up the Cinque Terre National Park of Italy. The picturesque cliffs surrounding a small bay, colorful houses huddled close to each other on the very seashore, the calm, even peaceful atmosphere of this place will not leave any tourist indifferent. Many who have been here claim that Vernazza is the romantic, bright, cheerful Italy that they dreamed of seeing.

The settlement on the site of the modern city of Vernazza originated in the era of the Roman Empire and until the end of the XIII century was jointly owned by three powerful and noble families. From those times, there are many old architectural buildings in the town, which are adjacent to modern buildings on the streets of the town of Vernazza. However, such a neighborhood does not destroy the picture of universal integrity and harmony, but only strengthens the impression.

text:
🇳🇵The most terrible section on the way to Everest is considered to be the Khumbu icefall. 

The Khumbu icefall flows down from the southern slopes of Mount Everest. It is located at an altitude of 5486 meters above sea level - just above the base camp. The fact is that the glacier is constantly in motion, and collapses often occur there. And climbers use ladders to overcome deep cracks.
Google Earth gives a good idea of this icefall:

text:
Bolivia 🇧🇴, Uyuni Salt Marsh

The Uyuni salt marsh is called the pearl of Bolivia. This is the largest salt marsh in the world — 10,588 sq. km. It is located in the vicinity of the city of Uyuni, in the south of the Altiplano plain, at an altitude of 3,650 m above sea level.

Experts believe that the Uyuni salt marsh, which arose as a result of the drying up of the huge lake Minchin, contains 10 billion tons of salt, of which about 25 thousand tons are extracted annually. The thickness of the salt beds ranges from 2 meters at the edge to 10 meters in the center.

The best time to visit the Uyuni salt marsh is the rainy season, which lasts from December to January, when the salt surface is covered with water and you can admire the unique mirror reflections of the sky with clouds.

In December, you can see all the variety of salt marshes, both dry areas where the dried surface is covered with patterns in the form of hexagons, and wet "mirror" zones.

text:
🇰🇿 The underwater forest of Lake Kaindy, where the trunks of giant fir trees rise from the turquoise surface of the lake, like the masts of sunken ships.

Once upon a time, century-old majestic spruce trees grew in the Kungei Alatau gorge. However, in 1910, a powerful earthquake caused a landslide that blocked the flow of the river. The river, looking for a way out, began to fill the gorge with water, absorbing huge fir trees one by one. But their roots were already firmly clinging to the ledges of the rocks, and large stones kept them from falling. The seething water, rising 25 meters, calmed down, winning back part of the possessions from the forest and turning them into a mountain lake.

text:
Australia 🇦🇺, Monkey Mia Beach 🐬

Manki Mia is a seaside resort with a charming beach. But this is not an ordinary beach that we are all used to. People are in no hurry to swim here, or sunbathe on the sand. Tourists are standing on the shore and waiting for special guests from the ocean. A distinctive feature of this beach is that almost every day 5-10 female dolphins swim to the shore with their babies, and frolic near the shore without fear of observers at all.

The tradition of feeding dolphins on the shore began in 1964. The wife of a local fisherman saw a dolphin swimming nearby and gave him a fish. He liked it and the next day the dolphin returned for a new portion. Over time, Charlie, that's what the locals called this dolphin, began to bring his friends to the beach. It all became a habit — Charlie and his friends increasingly came to the shallow water for feeding.

 This area has received the status of a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

text:
Mexico 🇲🇽, Bakalar Lagoon

Bacalar Lagoon is the second largest freshwater lake in Mexico. The lake is unique, if only because it houses a colony of stromatolites, the rarest coral-like organisms - an ecosystem of bacteria of the Precambrian period. And yet - right in the lagoon itself there are three cenotes up to 90 m deep. The water in the lagoon is extremely clean, warm and surprisingly changes its colors - silver, bluish, turquoise, aquamarine, blue, green - shades, the color of the water in the lagoon depends on the time of day and the weather.

The second largest freshwater lake in Mexico, Laguna Bacalar, is located in the Mexican state of Quintana Roo about 40 km north of the state capital, the city of Chetumal. The lake got its name in honor of the city of Bakalar located on its shore, the oldest settlement of Quintana Roo. The word "Bakalar" from the Mayan language translates as "Surrounded by reeds".

text:
Greece 🇬🇷, Meteora Monasteries

Meteora Monasteries are the brightest and most unusual attraction in Greece, which can equally be called both historical and natural. Meteora is undoubtedly one of the most stunning sights that Greece, rich in sights, has to offer.

Meteora is one of the largest monastery complexes in Greece. Their very location is unique — on the tops of rocks. The monks settled here around the 10th century. Since then, the monastery complex has been operating continuously, although some of the monasteries have now fallen into disrepair.

In 1988, the monastery complex of the Meteora Mountains in Greece was included in the UNESCO World Heritage List according to several criteria, including as an object of world cultural significance and a natural phenomenon.
