text:
Cambodia 🇰🇭, Ta Prohm Temple

Ta Prohm, also known as the Jungle Temple, is an area of temple ruins overgrown with trees, located near Siem Reap, Cambodia. The temple is basically in the same condition as it was originally found: tree roots sprout through the temple structures and the jungle around. The sandstone from which the temple is built absorbs moisture well, so the seeds of the ficus strangler and cotton tree germinate and release their roots directly into the air, trying to catch on to all the nearest objects.
Ta Prohm was used as one of the filming locations of the movie "Tomb Raider".
⠀
What is Ta Prohm?
Ta Prohm is a 12th-century temple in Angkor, Cambodia.
 Ta Prohm was built by the Khmer king Jayavarman VII (king of the Khmer Empire from 1181 to 1218). It was dedicated as a Mahayana Buddhist monastery.
 It is part of the UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
 Along with Angkor Wat, Ta Prohm is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Cambodia.

In the usual understanding of many, Venice is a historical part with many channels connecting the islands to each other, which does not cease to attract tourists from all over the world.

text:
Austria 🇦🇹, Hallstatt City

Hallstatt is a picturesque fairy–tale town located on the shore of Lake Hallstattersee on the slope of the mountains. The place is absolutely amazing: it seems that time has stopped here.
It resembles rather not even a city, but a cozy village: the population is less than 1000 people, the area is about 60 square kilometers.

Tiny houses surrounded by greenery, medieval elegant churches, unhurried lifestyle of local residents… By the way, Hallstatt is considered one of the oldest villages in all of Europe.

The history of the settlement dates back about three thousand years and is associated with the development of local salt caves. The first written mentions appeared in 1311, but very little is known about that period due to the secluded location of the village.

Most tourists go to Hallstatt in the summer, in summer the temperature stays at around 15 °C.

text: Lake

🇦🇺

Hillier Lake is a unique natural attraction known all over the world. It is located on Middle Island and is surrounded by eucalyptus forest on all sides.

Soft pink shades of water against the background of golden sand and green eucalyptus trees create fantastic landscapes.

The most contrasting colors of water can be observed in the Australian summer (from December to February). At other times of the year, the pink color is slightly less saturated.

text:
Venezuela🇻🇪, Angel Waterfall

Angel is the world's highest waterfall, with a total height of 979 m. The length from the cliff to the first obstacle in the way of water is 807 m, after that the stream overcomes another 172 m. For comparison, Angel is 3 times larger than the Eiffel Tower and 20 times larger than Niagara Falls. 
 
The unique creation of nature is located in the dense forests of Venezuela and is a treasure of the Canaima National Park, on the territory of which it is located. The flow of water fills the Kerep River and partially dissipates in the form of small particles forming fog. Moisture in the air is felt within a few kilometers.

The power of the waterfall depends on the time of year.  When the rains go away, the volume of water in Angel falls: most often the stream splits into two, sometimes turning into a very small jet. During such periods of drought, a pond is formed at the foot of the waterfall in which you can swim.

The colorful, full of contrasts country attracts tourists not only with its rich archaeological heritage, but also with authentic colonial architecture, exquisite gastronomy, as well as untouched nature in the mountains and jungles.

text:
Russia🇷🇺, Dagestan, Karadakh gorge

The Karadakh gorge is one of the most picturesque corners of Dagestan, which is not so easy to get to, but you will not have to regret it

This natural monument in Dagestan is sometimes called the Gate of Miracles. The canyon is very narrow — only two to four meters wide, and the height of the "walls" reaches 170 meters. The gorge stretched for about four hundred meters.

The road runs through a pretty gorge, where you can admire the fractures of rocks, and a small forest stretches in front of the entrance to the gorge.

The gorge itself is very picturesque, its unusual curves rise to a height of hundreds of meters. The road is narrow — sometimes you have to literally squeeze between the rocks. And in some places the stones hang over your head. Light rarely penetrates here, but when it happens, the picture before your eyes is unforgettable.

text:
Germany 🇩🇪, Cherry Blossom Tunnel in Bonn 🌸

Every year in spring, the ordinary streets of the old district in Bonn, Germany, turn into an incredibly beautiful tunnel of blooming cherry trees. All the streets are flooded with a pleasant pink color, crowds of tourists come here to see all the beauty of Japanese sakura (cherry).

The city itself was founded by the Romans in the first century. But by the 1980s, the city center was quite gloomy and polluted. And in order to somehow improve the ecology in the city itself, it was decided to plant a huge number of Japanese cherry trees.
After a successful series of photos taken in 2012, the place became famous and tourists from other countries went there. 
Sakura blooms in spring in April and blooms for only 7-10 days and turns the streets of the old city into an incredibly beautiful tunnel of cherry blossoms. Also during the cherry blossom festival begins "Cherry Blossom".

text:
Spain 🇪🇸, the Island of Majorca

The high season falls on July and August — the flow of tourists is maximum. But, perhaps, the most favorable time for a holiday in Majorca is the end of August — September. September is the most interesting time for diving. The underwater world is very diverse here — exotic flora and fauna sometimes surprises even experienced divers.

Majorca is an amazing place, the nature of the island is rich and diverse. Note that there are no rivers on the island, and fresh water is drawn from spring springs and reservoirs. Despite the limited availability of fresh water, the territory seems to be strewn with nature reserves. There are a total of 40 nature reserves that have the status of national. Oak groves, pine forests on the mountain slopes, endless valleys and incredibly beautiful bays of the Mediterranean Sea and sandy beaches — this is the real value of Majorca!

text: Tegallalang

🇮🇩

Tegallalang Rice terraces are located in the central part of Bali at an altitude of 800 meters above sea level.

It is one of the oldest and most visited attractions on the island. Tegallalang is one of the three most amazing terraced landscapes in the Ubud area.

text:
Switzerland🇨🇭, Lungern Commune

A fascinating sight that will forever remain in your memory, even if the video suddenly disappears and digital photos disappear, is the landscapes of Switzerland near the town of Lungern. The population of this commune is just over 2 thousand people, and it is located in the canton of Obwalden.
 
Lungern is located on the shore of the beautiful mountain lake Lungerer. The lake is fed by the waters of the Sarner Aa River.

Lake Lungerer has very clean water, which even during cloudy weather does not lose its extraordinary deep emerald color. In the warm season, you can swim here, and in other seasons enjoy nature and the magnificent surrounding landscapes. The surroundings of the lake are famous for the purest transparent air, the splendor of green forests and mown meadows, mountain peaks with snow caps.

Not a single photo can convey the impressions experienced by tourists who visited these places for the first time.

Lake Lungerer has very clean water, which even during cloudy weather does not lose its extraordinary deep emerald color. In the warm season, you can swim here, and in other seasons enjoy nature and the magnificent surrounding landscapes. The surroundings of the lake are famous for the purest transparent air, the splendor of green forests and mown meadows, mountain peaks with snow caps.

Not a single photo can convey the impressions experienced by tourists who visited these places for the first time.

text: Imerovigli

🇬🇷

Imerovigli is a small village on the island of Santorini.

 Locals often call their village "balcony with a view of the Aegean Sea", as the village is built at the highest point of the caldera, which offers the best view of Nea Kameni (a black volcanic island in the center of the lagoon).

text:
Belgium 🇧🇪, Bruges

Bruges is a fabulous city, one of the most beautiful and picturesque in Belgium, as if copied from a movie about the Middle Ages. 

A quiet idyll of nature against the backdrop of stone houses, swans swimming steadily in the same channel with cruise boats, beautiful picturesque piers and the most delicious waffles with the most delicious chocolate in the world!

All this causes admiration and, at the same time, an irresistible desire to visit the described place — a small but quite authentic Belgian town of Bruges. Lovers of sightseeing holidays will especially like it here, it is unhurried and measured, it disposes to walks and reflections.

Although Bruges is a small city, there are a lot of attractions here. You will be pleased with architectural monuments – not only municipal buildings of the 15th-16th centuries and ancient churches, but also ordinary residential houses built over canals and charming tourists.

🇮🇸

One of the most famous and accessible waterfalls in the world.

Of course, it does not boast a record height or the strength of the flow, but it is easy to reach and tourist routes are extremely convenient.

A waterfall is always a phenomenon and a holiday if you are lucky enough to see it with your own eyes. And if you add to this the general beauty of Iceland, then there is another place for a mandatory visit)

text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Kuril Islands, Cape Columnar

Cape Columnar is located on the southernmost island of the Great Kuril Ridge — Kunashir. It's like walking on the body of a dragon, and there are mysterious pillars of rock around. The pillars are hexagonal, actually of volcanic origin. 
 
Cape Columnar is an amazing formation that arose 6 million years ago as a result of the eruption of a volcano named after the great Russian chemist Mendeleev. It is obvious that the hot lava from the volcano flowed straight into the sea and then froze

Up close, Columnar makes an amazing and absolutely indelible impression. In the Kuril Islands, in general, terrestrial magnetism and a sense of novelty do strange things to the tourist's psyche, so that everything is realized only when viewing photos and videos upon returning home.

🇮🇱

One of the most amazing reservoirs of the planet is a resort, a hospital and an attraction. 

Bathing in the Dead Sea is a very unusual feeling, since there is no habitual immersion in water. You can lie on the water surface to sunbathe or read the newspaper)

And also thousands of people come here for the healing effects of this place.

text:
Denmark, Tivoli Park

Tivoli Park in Copenhagen with an area of 8 hectares is one of the oldest parks in Europe and one of the most popular. It is visited by about 5 million visitors a year.

The territory of the Tivoli Park is extremely beautiful — amazing alleys and paths, 27 different attractions, a large pond with ducks and small ponds with fish, many different flower beds, fountains, picnic areas. The Tivoli Aquarium is home to more than 100 species of water inhabitants, including sharks, moray eels, tropical fish, piranhas and octopuses. Among the places worth paying special attention to are the fountain with bubbles near the Nimbus Hotel, a small Chinese-style pantomime theater with a small stage, the curtain of which is made in the form of a peacock's tail, hanging gardens, an edible garden, a bamboo forest, a Chinese tower, a dancing fountain, curved mirrors and much more.

🇪🇸

Rich history, magnificent sights, delicious cuisine and a unique atmosphere make a trip to Barcelona unforgettable.

text:
Singapore 🇸🇬, Jewel Changi Airport Pavilion

The Jewel Changi Airport Pavilion with a garden and the world's largest indoor waterfall opened in 2019 at Singapore Changi Airport. 

Forest Valley Garden is spread over five floors, there is a Canopy Park recreation area on the roof, in addition, the pavilion includes about 300 shops, a hotel, an IMAX cinema. In the center of the rainforest there is a 40-meter-high Rain Vortex waterfall.

Rain Vortex is the highest artificial waterfall under the roof in history. You can admire the "Rain Whirlpool" day and night. Just imagine: the rays of the sun make their way through powerful jets and bloom like a rainbow — the spectacle is fascinating.

And in the evenings, the water column becomes the stage for an amazing light and music show from the California design studio WET Design. When you look at this incredible waterfall in neon lights, you finally stop believing in the reality of what is happening.

text:
Armenia 🇦🇲, Khor Virap Monastery

The Khor Virap Monastery in Yerevan is located next to Mount Ararat — it is one of the most revered Christian buildings and a famous place for Armenian pilgrimage. Ararat, although located on the territory of Turkey, is also a sacred mountain, because, as the Bible says, it was here that Noah's ark ended up as a result of the Flood.

Historians attribute the appearance of the monastery to the middle of the XVII century. The construction of the Church of the Most Holy Theotokos, located in the center of the monastery complex, also dates back to this period.

The monastery has a magnificent view of Mount Ararat and you can take impressive photos. It is recommended to come to the monastery of Khor Virap in the morning, because in summer, during the daytime, it is very hot and there are a lot of people.

🇩🇰

Copenhagen is a city built on three islands. The city where the real queen lives in the castle👸

It was Copenhagen that became the birthplace of the most famous fairy-tale characters

text:
Malaysia 🇲🇾, Petronas Towers

Petronas Towers are located in the capital of Malaysia, the metropolis of Kuala Lumpur. This is the most famous and most visited attraction of the city for the past two decades.

The twin towers were built in 1998. The shape of the towers is similar to two corn cobs. The overall design reminds that Malaysia is a Muslim country. The Islamic style is expressed in the form of the bases of the towers, which form an 8-terminal star from two squares — this form is a symbol of integrity, unity, harmony and stability in this religion.

Petronas Towers are a real masterpiece of architecture and engineering. Both towers are 88-storeyed (452 meters), and the total area of all internal premises is equal to 48 football fields.

Petronas is still the tallest twin towers on Earth.

text: Ayder

🇹🇷

Aider is a Turkish mountain resort that resembles the European Alpine villages of Austria and northern Italy. The amazing similarity of the eastern Black Sea coast of Turkey and the mountainous part of Central Europe.

In 1987, a thermal center was opened on the plateau and began using local hot springs coming out of the bowels of the earth with a water temperature of +55 C.

text:
Russia🇷🇺, Karelia, Ladoga Skerries

Ladoga Skerries is a rocky archipelago on Lake Ladoga. The skerry district stretches along the northern and northwestern shores. About 650 small rocky islands, as well as steep cliffs, are concentrated on this territory. The relief of the nearest coast is rugged, rocky. Centuries—old rocks go deep under the water - exactly as much as they rise.

Ladoga skerries are no less interesting in winter: the lake freezes, and skiing trips become relevant, and the skerries themselves increasingly resemble Norwegian fjords. The unusual word skerries itself is borrowed from the Norwegian language and translates as archipelago. All this splendor arose on the shores of Lake Ladoga as a result of the protruding glacial layers on a part of the continent that was eventually flooded by the sea so that only the highest land areas in the form of small islands and rocks were visible above the surface.

text:
Russia🇷🇺, Kabardino-Balkaria, Shadkhurei Lakes

The Shadhurei Lakes are as beautiful as they are mysterious and dangerous. If you look at the place where they are from above — 2 water mirrors look like eyes. This place is shrouded in secrets and legends. Elements of mystery and mysticism combined with beautiful landscapes and clean mountain air make the Shadhurei Lakes an interesting place for travelers.

Shadhurey Lake has many secrets. For example, the water level in them does not change — and this is a mystery for scientists. After all, neither rivers nor streams flow into lakes and do not flow out of them. Perhaps the level is maintained by underwater sources. The water temperature does not change much during the year and never exceeds +10...+15 °C. So swimming in the lakes will not work. But fishing is quite enough.

Lakes Bolshoy and Maly Shadkhurey were formed as a result of karst failures.  It is known for certain that they are deeper than 200 m.

text:
Switzerland 🇨🇭, Chillon Castle

The Chillon Castle is the most famous attraction not only of the Swiss Riviera, but also of Switzerland as a whole. The fortress is located near the town of Montreux.

The Chillon Castle is built on a low rock near the shore of Lake Geneva. The fortress can be divided into two parts: the first, residential, is located on the side of the lake, and the defensive – on the side of the road. In total, the castle complex includes 25 buildings of different construction times.

As an exceptional heritage monument, the Chillon Castle has about 300 exhibits. With the exception of furniture, weapons and armor, all the items presented here were found during archaeological excavations carried out in the castle from 1896 to 1903. The collections belong to the Cantonal Museum of Archaeology and History of Lausanne under the name "fonds Chillon" (Chillon Collection).

text: London

🇬🇧

London is the capital of England and the United Kingdom, as well as one of the greatest cities of our time. 

London has been the center of political power and court life for centuries. It is all the more surprising how the pomp of the monarchy coexists with the daily life of millions of people.  

It is curious that the famous London "Big Ben" is not a tower at all, contrary to popular opinion. "Big Ben" is the name of the bell tower installed there, and the tower itself is called "Elizabeth"

text:
Greece 
🇬🇷, Zakynthos Island 

This is one of the resort islands of the Ionian Archipelago belonging to Greece. With its outlines, the island of Zakynthos resembles a cheerful penguin who decided to swim in the warm Ionian Sea to the west of the Peloponnese peninsula. This relief island of such an original shape is actually a densely forested peak of a mountain rising from the depths of the sea

The island of Zakynthos is quite large – 405 km2, and its coastline, broken by bays and capes, is measured at 123 km, and almost the entire coast is open to access to the sea.

The air of the island, which the Venetians called the "Flower of the Levant", is filled with intoxicating aromas of the sea breeze, coniferous forests, juniper thickets and spicy herbs, fruits of citrus trees and vines growing in abundance here. The island still preserves the aristocratic spirit of the Renaissance and Enlightenment, when famous musicians, poets, and painters lived and worked here.

text:
Denmark🇩🇰, Colony Gardens

Colony Gardens is the name of these allotments of land, which are located in the suburbs of Copenhagen. They can be rented for about $ 130 per month (for an area approximately equal to our 6 acres).

These are public recreation areas, and there is a small house on each plot. It is interesting that the plots cannot be redeemed - only rented. And it is also impossible to live on them permanently due to legal restrictions.

However, despite all these circumstances, the popularity of Colony Gardens is growing every year. Firstly, people want to take a break from the stressful life in the city. And secondly, it costs much more to rent even a modest apartment in the city.

text: Lofoten Islands

🇳🇴

An archipelago located in the Norwegian Sea. The islands are located in the north-west of Norway and cover an area of more than 1220 sq. km.

Lofoten consists of many islands, the coastline of which is indented by coves and comfortable beaches. The main feature of a holiday on Lofoten is privacy, tranquility and wild, untouched nature.

Killer whales and sperm whales hunt here from spring to early autumn. Huge animals swim next to the boats, and in the winter months they are perfectly visible from the shore.

text:
Italy 🇮🇹, Fiordo di Furore

Furore is a small village located on the Amalfi coast, in the province of Salerno, in southwestern Italy. A long time ago, there were small settlements overlooking the sea, along a picturesque road.
The main attraction of Furore is the so-called fjord or Fiordo. This is actually a narrow gorge, remote from the sea, created by the flow of the Schiato waterfall running along the mountain to the sea. The fjord is the old part of Furore. The main village is currently located 300 meters above, in the upper Vallone del Furore.

The fjord is equipped with an arch bridge over which the state road passes. The 30—meter bridge is the place where the International Diving Championship is held every summer.

The local authorities have made the fjord an attractive tourist destination. The old lime kiln has been converted into a bar and gift shop, old houses have been renovated, and the museum tells about the industrial heritage of the fjord.

🇦🇷

Perito Moreno is the largest and most accessible glacier in Argentina, Patagonia and all of South America. 

Many people dream of visiting the noisy and explosive Buenos Aires. And how about going beyond this crowded metropolis and instead of the sights of the stone jungle to go towards the most beautiful place in all of Argentina?

text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Lake Kezenoy-Am

The pearl of Chechnya is the so-called amazing high-mountain lake Kezenoy-Am. Its appearance is striking: the reservoir is distinguished by the turquoise color of the water, changing its hue depending on weather conditions, time of year and day.

Chechen lake Kezenoy-Am is considered one of the most beautiful. In addition, it is the largest alpine lake in Europe: its length from north to south is about two kilometers, and from west to east – 2.7! The area of the amazing reservoir reaches two square kilometers. It is often called Deep – in some places the depth is 72 meters. It is because of its size that it is also known as the Andean Sea. By the way, some scuba divers claim that the depth of the lake is actually much greater. For example, a Finnish scuba diver in 1989 plunged 103 meters. There are pictures of professional divers taken at a depth of about 90 meters.

text: San Francisco

🇺🇸

San Francisco is one of the most colorful cities in the USA. Surprisingly, the future cultural, commercial and financial center of Northern California began as a small settlement of Yerba Buena.

Unfortunately, almost everything that was built before 1906 was destroyed by an earthquake. San Francisco now consists of parks, business districts, squares and skyscrapers. And, of course, its legendary symbol is the Golden Gate Bridge🌉🌉🌉

🇺🇸

San Francisco is one of the most colorful cities in the USA. Surprisingly, the future cultural, commercial and financial center of Northern California began as a small settlement of Yerba Buena.

Unfortunately, almost everything that was built before 1906 was destroyed by an earthquake. San Francisco now consists of parks, business districts, squares and skyscrapers. And, of course, its legendary symbol is the Golden Gate Bridge🌉🌉🌉

text: Guilin

🇨🇳

Guilin is a city in southern China, which is famous for its impressive landscapes formed by karst limestone.

He gained his world fame thanks to the amazing beauty of the landscapes – a unique combination of the waters of the Likiang River, green mountains, stone grottoes and fancy stones

All this beauty is complemented by a fertile climate – snow falls extremely rarely here, and flowers can be seen at any time of the year

text: Agaete

🇪🇸

Agaete is a municipality in Spain, part of the province of Las Palmas in the autonomous community of the Canary Islands.

🔶In this small town, there is the most instagrammable field of sunflowers

🔶The best time to replenish your Instagram with bright pictures is from mid-May to mid-June, usually at this time there is a flowering of sunflowers.

text:
Malta🇲🇹

Malta is a picturesque island state lying in the Mediterranean Sea, 93 km from Sicily and 300 km from Tunisia. 

🔶It occupies an island archipelago consisting of three inhabited islands – Malta, Gozo and Kamino, as well as small islands and rock formations. 

🔶The capital of the Republic of Malta — Valletta is one of the first cities in Europe built according to a preliminary plan. Valletta belongs to a small number of well-preserved fortress cities.

text: Uyuni Salt Marsh

🇧🇴

The Uyuni salt marsh is not just the main attraction of Bolivia and one of the most interesting places on the planet.

From November to March, when the rainy season comes to the plateau, the surface of the salt marsh is covered with a thin layer of water, and then Uyuni resembles a giant mirror. 

The horizon line becomes almost imperceptible, the surface of the lake merges with the sky, and the landscapes around the Uyuni salt marsh acquire unearthly beauty.

text:
UAE 🇦🇪, Museum of the Future

The Museum of the Future in Dubai is one of the most unique buildings in the world and another architectural masterpiece of the city of innovations and skyscrapers — Dubai. This unusual and truly cosmic structure is associated with the center of hope, creativity and knowledge, and the combination of a number of unique technologies in the expositions will allow us to see the immediate and distant prospects of humanity.

Each level of the building corresponds to a certain direction, and its expositions combine elements of an exhibition, an immersive theater that includes visitors in a simulated reality, and a thematic attraction that will allow you to easily look beyond the present. Here are the greatest inventions of mankind and modern research, options for the potential development of technologies for the next 20-50 years and innovations that allow expanding the intellectual and physical abilities of a person.

text:
Tuvalu🇹🇻

Tuvalu is an archipelago of five atolls and four islands. The tiny country has preserved its identity, ethnic traditions and cuisine. 

Tropical plants, coral reefs, aboriginal tribes and stunning nature attract not only tourists, but also researchers.

The National Research Council in the United States has predicted that by 2100 the ocean level will rise by almost 1.5 meters due to climate change. If this happens, the corals surrounding the island are in danger, and Tuvalu itself may disappear altogether. 

That's why scientists and researchers from all corners of the globe come here. The island state is of professional interest to them.

text:
South Africa 🇿🇦, Boulder's Beach

Boulders Beach is the famous penguin beach in South Africa, at a distance of about 40 km from Cape Town by road.

African penguins have been living on the warm coast since 1982. It all started with two breeding pairs, and over the years this colony has managed to increase to almost 3,000 individuals. Favorable conditions for exotic birds were created when commercial trawling of fish in False Bay stopped: the number of sardines and anchovies, which form part of the penguins' diet, gradually increased in the waters.

Entrance to Boulder's Beach is paid, special bridges above the ground are equipped for tourists. In front of the main road to the tourist bridges on the left there is a barely noticeable path to the shore — you can walk along it to the free rocky beach, where you can also see penguins resting on boulders.

Next to the penguin colony there is a free descent to the sea, where you can swim.

text: ## Hyams Beach

🇦🇺

Hyams Beach is a paradise with the whitest sand in the world. That's how it appears in the Guinness Book of Records. 

Surprisingly, the local sand stands out for its color even in the dim light of the moon, it is so white.

Although Hyams Beach is not as famous as the beaches of the Dominican Republic or the luminous beach of the Maldives, this does not make it less attractive for travelers.

text:
Russia🇷🇺, Sochi, Matsestinskaya tea plantation

Not far from the center of Sochi, in the Matsestinskaya Valley, there is a tea plantation of the same name, one of the northernmost in the world. The local landscapes stand out even against the background of the bright nature of the Krasnodar Territory — the maze of tea bushes on the slopes of the Caucasian Ridge resembles Southeast Asia rather than the south of Russia. Black and green tea have been grown here since 1947.

Matsesta tea plantation is spread over 170 hectares at an altitude of 400 meters above sea level. The "Matsestinsky vintage" variety is cultivated here, almost the most northern tea in the world. The tea here is frost-resistant: plants survive at temperatures up to minus 16 degrees Celsius.

Tea has been grown here since the middle of the last century! Well, it's very picturesque here.

text: Patagonia

🇨🇱

Patagonia is a harsh wild land with narrow rivers and fjords, steep slopes and steep mountains, glacial valleys blown by cold winds. 

Here are such natural wonders as granite towers in the Torres del Paine National Park, Los Glaciares National Park with huge glaciers, colorful sedimentary rocks and stunning emerald lakes and rivers.

Patagonia is known to many mainly thanks to Jules Verne, who drove his heroes in search of Captain Grant into deserted snow-capped mountains with giant condors hovering above them.

text:
Germany 🇩🇪, Hohenzollern Castle 

Hohenzollern Castle at the top of 855 meters is one of the most recognizable and popular attractions in Germany. Located 50 km south of the city of Stuttgart, the capital of the federal state of Baden-Württemberg, it has long been the family patrimony of the powerful Hohenzollern dynasty, which ruled the country from the XII century to 1918 inclusive.

The exterior of the Hohenzollern Castle impresses even the most experienced travelers with its beauty and grandeur. It is not for nothing that it is ranked among the brightest examples of the German architectural style, in which medieval and neo-Romantic elements are surprisingly harmoniously combined. Tourists who come here on an excursion get acquainted with the rich history of this castle with genuine interest, admiring the luxury and sophistication of its interior interiors.

text: Lake Natron

🇹🇿

Lake Natron is one of the most serene, but frightening and incredible lakes in Africa.

It is not like the others: bright red, orange and sometimes green. Wide enough, but shallow. With its color, it warns us about the impending danger.

The peculiarity of the lake is a strong concentration of salt and alkali, which does not allow almost anyone to live except favorites. The water temperature often reaches 50 degrees Celsius, the depth does not reach 3 m. It is 22 km wide and 57 km long. 

🔶 Small flamingos have perfectly taken root in such conditions. They build their nests on salty islands, and the pungent smell and the ability of water to kill all living things and turn them into mummies scares off large predators. 

Thus, the lake saves these birds from extinction, and annually receives about 2,000,000 birds during the breeding season.

text:
Japan🇯🇵, Shikisai no Oka Flower Garden

There are a huge number of natural places in Japan where you want not only to visit, but also to live. One of such wonders of nature can be safely called the panoramic flower garden of Sikisai-no-Oka on the hills of the village of Biei, which offers breathtaking views of seven hectares of land abounding with 30 kinds of flowers against the backdrop of the majestic Daisetsuzan mountains. Its picturesque landscapes are very beautiful all year round and even in winter, when the territory of the hills is covered with a lot of snow. But still, in all its glory, the park will appear before you during the seasonal flowering period from April to November, when fantastically beautiful gentle hills are covered with waves of tulips, lavender, cosmea, poppies, sunflowers, purple sage and many other flowers, the aroma of which can stupefy anyone.

text: Castle Stalker

🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿

🏰Stalker Castle is a gloomy, but fascinating, stone stronghold in the middle of Loch Lach.

🔶The castle was founded in the XIV century, when there was still a clan system in Scotland. 

🔶There is a version that the island on which the castle is located is of artificial origin. This is the so–called crannog island, built in the Stone Age.

text:
Thailand 🇹🇭, Ayutthaya

In ancient times, Ayutthaya was the capital of Siam (as Thailand was previously called), and today it is the center of one of the provinces.

The current and ancient capitals are separated by a distance of only a hundred kilometers.

From the ancient capital there are majestic ruins and temples made of unfired bricks, once created in the Khmer architectural style (this is how the royal palace and the Angkor Wat temple complex in Cambodia were built).

The city is included in the UNESCO Heritage List.

The whole city is an open-air museum, smoothly fitting into the entourage of a modern city.

The main attraction is the Wat Mahathat Temple. This temple is curious for its main treasure, the Buddha's head in the roots of trees.

text: Isola Bella

🇮🇹

Isola Bella is one of the most famous Baroque palace and park ensembles in the world. It was admired by such different people as Stendhal and Dickens, Napoleon and Josephine stayed here. 

🔶When Count Vitaliano VI Borromeo began in 1632 the construction of the palace and park complex, which later became famous, Isola Bella (ital. "Beautiful Island") was only a small rocky islet on Lago Maggiore, inhabited by fishermen. 

🔶The palace was supposed to be a gift to the Count's wife Isabella, but the construction was delayed for decades: the southern facade of the palace was completed only in 1958.

🔶The palace and gardens were originally conceived in a single composition: as a result, the island turned into a kind of ship with a manor house at the bow and a garden at the stern.

text:
Switzerland🇨🇭, Pilatus Mountain

Mount Pilatus is a mountain range overlooking Lucerne in central Switzerland. It consists of several peaks, the highest of which (2128.5 m) is called Tomlishorn.

This is the most accessible and one of the most visited Alpine mountains in Switzerland.

The top of the mountain can be reached by rail, the world's steepest cog railway departing from Alpnachstad, operating from May to November or throughout the year with aerial panorama gondolas and aerial cable cars from Kriens.

The observation deck on Pilatus deserves special attention: it is from here that a beautiful panorama of the city of Lucerne and the picturesque mountain landscapes of Switzerland opens. Next to the site is the Pilatus Kulm Hotel, where you can have a snack in a self-service restaurant. Not far from the building of the complex there are several trails from which various mountain routes begin: some of them take several minutes, others – up to 4 hours.

text: Pragser Wildsee

🇮🇹

 Pragser Wildsee is the emerald of the Alpine valleys.

A lake of stunning beauty, surrounded by picturesque Alpine nature in the province of Bolzano in Italy, almost on the border with Austria. 
This is the largest lake of the Dolomites, located at an altitude of almost one and a half kilometers with a maximum depth of 36 meters and an area of 31 hectares.

text:
Russia🇷🇺, Ergaki Nature Park

The Ergaki Nature Park is part of the Western Sayan Mountain system. The name translates from Tuvan as "fingers". The park is located in the south of the Krasnoyarsk Territory. The age of the formations is more than 2 million years. This place is rich in unique mountain landscapes, the purest lakes and streams. Almost every pass or rock is associated with ancient legends.

The total area of the Ergaki Nature Park is 342870 hectares.
A large number of rare plant species listed in the Red Book grow on its territory. Here you notice changes in vegetation as you climb to the peaks. From coniferous forests to alpine meadows.

The natural park has unique landscapes. They are formed by all kinds of mountains. Almost everyone has their own name. The peak, which has the shape of a lying man, is called the Sleeping Sayan. A rock resembling a sitting monkey — the Mother of Sayan. An unusual stone that hangs over the abyss is a Hanging stone.

text:
Germany 🇩🇪, Elz Castle

Elz Castle is one of the most beautiful and most famous palaces in Germany. Hidden in a dense forest near Koblenz, it has attracted crowds of curious tourists for almost a thousand years.

Burg Elz Castle is located on a large rocky hill surrounded on three sides by the waters of the Elzbach River. For more than 800 years it has been owned by the Eltsk aristocrats and is still private property today. 

The oldest of the German castles was first mentioned in the annals back in 1157. Very little information has been preserved about the construction period. It is only known that it was originally planned to be used as a defensive structure. 

For a long time of its existence, the fortress has never been robbed or destroyed, so its medieval interiors have been perfectly preserved to this day. Sightseeing tours and historical films are regularly held here.

text: ⛰️Seljalandsfoss Waterfall

🇮🇸

🔶The Seljalandsfoss Waterfall is one of the few water cascades that can be walked around and viewed from all sides.

🔶The peculiarity of the waterfall is that the water jets do not flow down the surface of the rock, but fall from a steep cliff 60 meters high, forming a spacious natural cave right behind the water wall. There is a stunning view from there.

🔶🗿The cliff used to be a seashore, but over hundreds of years the coastline has moved away from it by several kilometers. Now there are spacious green plains on the site of the former seabed, emphasizing the majesty of the water flow.

Unlike most of Iceland's attractions, you don't have to climb mountains or rough terrain for a long time to get to Seljalandsfoss. It is located right next to the ring road — an asphalt path less than 200 meters long leads there from the highway.

text_entities.text:
🇮🇸

🔶The Seljalandsfoss Waterfall is one of the few water cascades that can be walked around and viewed from all sides.

🔶The peculiarity of the waterfall is that the water jets do not flow down the surface of the rock, but fall from a steep cliff 60 meters high, forming a spacious natural cave right behind the water wall. There is a stunning view from there.

🔶🗿The cliff used to be a seashore, but over hundreds of years the coastline has moved away from it by several kilometers. Now there are spacious green plains on the site of the former seabed, emphasizing the majesty of the water flow.

Unlike most of Iceland's attractions, you don't have to climb mountains or rough terrain for a long time to get to Seljalandsfoss. It is located right next to the ring road — an asphalt path less than 200 meters long leads there from the highway.

text:
🗾Japan 🇯🇵, Hitachi Seaside Park

🔶Hitachi Seaside Park  is located in the Japanese city of Hitatinaka, Ibaraki Prefecture. This unique place on the Pacific coast changes its color with each new season, so whenever you come here, you can admire the riot of colors.

🔶Hitachi Park is spread over an area of 350 hectares (200 hectares are open to visitors), it was founded in 1991 on the site of a former US military base. Today this place is a true flower kingdom, because all kinds of plants grow here: daffodils, tulips, poppies, lilies, sakura.

🔶In May, the Japanese Hitachi Park looks like a huge sky-blue blanket, because at this time, nemophiles — American forget-me-nots bloom on the hills. This event is celebrated by the “Harmony of Nemophiles” festival, during this period thousands of tourists come to Hitachi Seaside Park to see this amazing sight with their own eyes.

text: 🏡Cochem

🇩🇪

🔶Cochem is a city with old half-timbered houses, cobbled streets and medieval flavor, over which the romantic Reichsburg Castle, one of the most beautiful in the country, has been towering for many centuries.

🔶Located in the picturesque valley of the Moselle River among green hills and vineyards.

🔶Kohem is famous for its fairs, festivals and winemaking traditions. A popular tourist attraction is also a cruise on the Moselle River and hiking in the picturesque surroundings. 

🔶The town has changed little over the past centuries, combining beautiful nature, ancient history and rich cultural traditions.

text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Putorana Plateau

🔶The Putorana Plateau is a grandiose mountain range, representing a huge territory almost untouched by man, which is called "the edge of ten thousand lakes and a thousand waterfalls." The sight of all the incredible beauty of the plateau is breathtaking — the mountains here have no peaks, and the canyons have bottoms, lakes stretch for many kilometers, rivers fall from the rocks, forming the most amazing waterfalls.

🔶The Putorana Plateau was included in the World Heritage List in 2010.

🔶The Putoransky Nature Reserve, which was established here in 1988 and has been one of the largest in all of Russia since then, is located on a significant territory of the plateau. The area of the Putorana plateau is 250 thousand km2. The nearest major settlement is the city of Norilsk.

text: 🏔️Dynjandi

🇮🇸

🔶Dynjandi is one of the most impressive waterfalls in Iceland and the largest waterfall in the Vestfjord. 

🔶The name of the waterfall translates as "Thunderous" and indeed, the closer you get to it, the more thunderous its voice becomes. The height of this miracle of nature is 100 meters, its width at the top is 30 meters, and at the base is 60 meters. 

🔶Dynjandi is easy to identify even from a great distance, because in shape it looks like a huge wedding veil.

text:
🏟️Italy 🇮🇹, The City of Venice

🔶Venice is a historic city in northern Italy, famous for its canals, gondolas, palazzi, ancient temples and museums. This is the only city of its kind where there are no cars — their role is performed by water transport, and one of the few whose lines are endlessly copied. Venice is more than 1500 years old, and all these centuries it has been shining in the sky of world events.

🔶Since the Middle Ages, Venice has been called the "Queen of the Adriatic". Thanks to wise management, the island town managed to become so influential that it gained independence, many privileges and the honorary title of the Most Serene Republic. The wealth and status of the Venetian nobles can still be appreciated today by visiting one of the palaces-the palazzo.

🔶Venice is not just a city on the water, but a whole commune divided into 6 self—governing districts. The commune includes 118 islands and more than 150 channels.

text: 🏡Zaanse Schans

🇳🇱

🔶Zaanse Schans is an open—air museum in the vicinity of Amsterdam, near the city of Zaandam. There are about 30 real Dutch houses collected all over the country, several museums, a farm and 10 operating mills. 

🔶In the village of Zaanse Schans, an unforgettable atmosphere of the Dutch past reigns: the blades of ancient mills creak softly, the smell of freshly baked bread, a shoemaker knocks in the klompov workshop, and the cheese factory is always full of visitors. 

🔶Village houses, painted green, resemble pictures, with embroidered curtains, flowers on the windows, wicker furniture in the front gardens. Snow-white geese slowly cross the street, and fat sheep graze in the meadows. 

🔶Zaanse Schans even has its own small, almost toy-like, but drawbridge.

text: 🌉Brooklyn Bridge

🇺🇸

🔶The Brooklyn Bridge is one of the business cards of New York. It is laid over the East River and serves to connect the southern tip of Manhattan with Brooklyn. The width of the bridge reaches 26 m, the height above the water at the highest point is 41 m, and the length is 1828 m.

🔶The Brooklyn Bridge has long been the longest suspension bridge in the world and the first place in the construction of which steel slings were used. The bridge consists of two tiers, the lower one for cars and the upper one for pedestrians and cyclists. 

🔶The supporting towers of the bridge are majestic arched structures, well recognizable from numerous films.

text: 🏟️Pitigliano

🇮🇹

🔶Pitigliano is one of the most charming towns in Italy with an ancient history dating back to the time of the Etruscans. 

🔶The city is built right on a picturesque cliff and rises beautifully above the surroundings, thanks to which Pitigliano has an amazing flavor and is considered the pearl of Tuscany. 

🔶Pitigliano is famous for gastronomy and winemaking. Here you can taste the famous wines: white Bianco di Pitigliano and red Morellino di Scansano or Sovana DOC. Among the traditional dishes, ravioli with sheep's milk, ricotta with spinach and sage, lamb in white wine with artichokes stand out. Popular local products are cheeses and sausages. 

🔶Pitigliano is conveniently located approximately equidistant from Rome and Florence, and just an hour's drive from the Tyrrhenian Sea coast. Therefore, it is relatively easy to get here.

text:
Thailand 🇹🇭, Erawan Waterfall

🔶Erawan waterfall is not one, but a whole series of waterfalls at different levels, each of which has walking trails. You can swim in all reservoirs.

🔶Erawan Waterfall, located in the national Park of the same name in Kachananburi province, looks most impressive during the rainy season. Flowing streams form reservoirs of bright colors, shades vary from turquoise to emerald.

🔶On the 3rd level there is a small lake in which there are shoals of fish. They are similar to Garra Rufa, which are widely used for peeling in Southeast Asia, but much larger in size. The length of some individuals reaches 30 cm, and their biting is quite sensitive.

🔶The natural object is named after the many—headed elephant on which Indra moved - the supreme deity, the ruler of the heavenly kingdom in the mythology of Vedism, Buddhism and Hinduism.

text: 🏯Matsumoto Castle

🇯🇵

🔶Matsumoto Castle is a miracle of the Japanese fortification of the 16th century, which is also called the "Raven Castle" because of the black walls and side towers, similar to the outstretched wings of a bird. 

🔶The most interesting part is the main dungeon. From the outside, it seems that the castle has five floors, but in fact the sixth floor is hidden behind a defensive fortification. The castle has a unique architecture for Japan - in addition to the covered passage between the main tower, there are two smaller secret passages connecting the towers. 

🔶Ten round wooden pillars, carved with an axe, support the structure. If you look closely, you will notice that the walls are slightly curved – they were deformed due to earthquakes.

🔶An interesting attraction of Matsumoto Castle is the observation wing on the main tower, which offers panoramic views of the surrounding area.

text:
⛰️Australia 🇦🇺, Frenchman Peak

🔶Frenchman Peak is located in the Cap-Le-Grand National Park 70 kilometers east of the Western Australian southern coastal seaport of Esperance, known as "the most beautiful coast of Australia".

🔶Frenchman Peak was named after the shape of the mountain top, similar to the hat worn by the army in France in the 19th century. In 1870, explorer Alexander Forrest discovered and named it during an expedition in search of a good ranch.

🔶Frenchman Peak is the second highest point of the National Park at an altitude of 262 meters above sea level in the west of the Great Sea Corner National Park. From the top of the mountain there is a view of the National Park and Esperance Bay.

🔶It takes 2 to 3 hours to climb back and forth for about 3 kilometers.

text:
🏡Cotswold, United Kingdom🇬🇧

🔶The Cotswold is one of the most picturesque corners and a vivid symbol of rural England — it is these landscapes that are now so popular with landscape masters all over the world. 

🔶Small villages with houses, as if from a fairy tale, beautiful gardens, endless meadows, buildings three hundred years ago – all this attracts those who want to see the real England.

🔶The main attraction of these places are rightfully considered gardens and kindergartens, which have already become a symbol of rural England – in landscape design, this area has long been the progenitor of a whole style.

text:
🏰Finland 🇫🇮, Olofsborg Fortress

🔶Olofsborg (another name is Olavinlinna) is a 15th—century fortress on a tiny island in the Finnish city of Savonlinna. This is the northernmost medieval fortress that has survived to this day. The island is connected to the mainland by a pontoon bridge.

🔶Initially it belonged to Sweden, then it became part of the Grand Duchy of Finland as part of the Russian Empire, and then became part of independent Finland.

🔶The fortress was founded in 1475 by the Danish knight, royal governor Eric Axelsson Tott. Then it was called Nyslott (then Saknt-Olofsborg) and served to protect the eastern borders of the Danish-Swedish kingdom.

🔶Over time, a settlement was formed around the impregnable fortress, which in 1639 acquired the official status of a city and became known as Savonlinna.

🔶Several historical expositions have been opened in the walls of the fortress, as well as a small collection of Orthodox icons.

text: 🏘️Rothenburg on Tauber

🇩🇪

🔶Rothenburg an der Tauber is one of those cute old towns that at first glance don't seem quite real. Tourists are delighted with literally everything they see here! 

🔶The city is still surrounded by a defensive wall, including more than 40 towers, which remain the same as they were 400 years ago, when Rothenburg was the residence of the King of Sweden and Count Tilly. 

🔶These walls and towers guard the idyllic city, its chic patrician mansions and half-timbered houses with turrets, wooden bay windows, red tiles and flower boxes outside the windows.

text:
⛪Iceland 🇮🇸, Hallgrimskirkja Temple

🔶Hallgrimskirkja is a Lutheran church in the center of Reykjavik, the capital of Iceland. 

🔶Gudjohn Samuelson, the architect of the above—mentioned church (his "pen" also belongs to the churches of Akureyri and Aubayarkirkya), prepared the project in 1937, the temple was built for 38 years — construction was started in 1945 and completed in 1986.

🔶This unique church is clearly visible from anywhere in the city and serves as a reliable landmark on the terrain, since it is the tallest building in Reykjavik: the distance to the top of the bell tower is 75 meters. The temple is named after Hallgrimur Pietursson, a famous Icelandic artist, spiritual leader, poet, who wrote the book "Hymns of Passion" in his homeland

🔶In front of the entrance to the temple there is a sculpture of Leif Erikson, also known as Leif the Happy. It is believed that this brave Viking from Iceland discovered America long before Columbus.

text: Kaindy Lake

🇰🇿

🔶Kaindy is a fairly young lake in Kazakhstan with turquoise water and fir trees that seem to have grown into it.

🔶The lake was formed during a limestone landslide and subsidence of the soil that occurred as a result of the Kemin earthquake in 1911.

🔶It is located at an altitude of 1667 meters above sea level in the mountains, so the temperature there is low all year round.

🔶The length is 400 meters. The average depth is 20 meters, in some places it reaches 30 meters. Around it are rocky mountains overgrown with fir trees. 

🔶The landscape is simply extraordinary, and it is for this beauty that people come not only from Kazakhstan, but also from Russia and other CIS countries.

🔶The reservoir has a blue or turquoise color, which varies depending on the weather. After the rains, it changes to brown. This is due to calcareous sediment and mineral impurities.

text:
🏘️Norway🇳🇴 , The City of Alesund

🔶Alesund is the most beautiful city in the west of Norway, located between Geiranger Fjord and Heurond Fjord, which are included in the UNESCO list. It is spread over seven islands. Due to the proximity of the Gulf Stream, the climate in Alesund is mild.

🔶The city is unique in its landscape and architectural appearance: the city streets, repeating the relief, descend and rise in waves; most of the buildings in the center are built in a romantic, extraordinary and slightly fabulous Art Nouveau or Norwegian Art Nouveau style. The center of Alesund is located on the islands connected by the Hellebroa Bridge. The Old Town is cozy and peaceful, and there is always a lively atmosphere on the embankment and in the port.

🔶Alesund is the center of the fishing industry, its fishing fleet is one of the most modern in Europe.

text: Charyn Canyon

🇰🇿

🔶Charyn Canyon is a gorge in Kazakhstan, stretching for 154 km along the valley of the Charyn River, near the border with China and Kyrgyzstan. This is one of the places on Earth, the beauty and grandeur of which is breathtaking. 

🔶Considering the size and geological features of the Charyn Canyon, it is often referred to as the "younger brother" of one of the largest gorges on the planet – the American Grand Canyon. 

🔶Reddish rocks and precipices with a depth of 150 to 300 m, similar to fortress towers, impress everyone who has been here.

text: 🏰Carlowrie Castle

🏴󠁧󠁢󠁳󠁣󠁴󠁿

🔶Carlowrie Castle is a huge family residence near Edinburgh. The castle was built in 1852 and later restored by architect David Rind. It has always belonged to only two families: the Hutchison family, who built it, and the Marshall family, who acquired it 130 years later.

text:
🏝️Panama 🇵🇦, Guna Yala 

🔶Gliding on a sailboat through the calm waters of the Caribbean Sea, there is a feeling that you are arriving in paradise. Tiny islands of sparkling white sand, covered with palm trees and green coconuts scattered across turquoise coastal waters, look too perfect to be real.

🔶This is Guna Yala, also known as San Blas, an archipelago off the east coast of Panama containing more than 300 islands, 49 of which are inhabited by indigenous people known as kuna. There are more than 50,000 of them. The Koons still live the way their ancestors lived, living in small wooden huts covered with palm leaves, with smoldering logs in fireplaces and hammocks representing the only furniture.

🔶The main entertainment here will be: scuba diving at the reef, relaxing on numerous beaches, local seafood dishes, as well as acquaintance with the local culture.

US aid to Ukraine looks like a money laundering scheme — Marjorie Taylor Green

Newsweek: Representative Marjorie Taylor Green compared the billions of dollars that Congress is rushing to send to Ukraine with a "money laundering scheme," saying that nonprofit organizations are funded by "friends and families" of elected U.S. officials.

text:
Norway 🇳🇴, Nærøyfjord

🔶TheNærøyfjord is the narrowest fjord in the world. It is located in Norway, in the municipality of Aurlandom, Sogn-og-Fjordane province. Its width is only 250 m., length is 18 km, and the depth reaches 500 m. Mighty mountains, 1,700 m high, waterfalls, green valleys – all these wonders of nature surround the Nærøyfjord. 
This is one of the most popular destinations among tourists. In 2005, the fjord was included in the UNESCO World Heritage List.

🔶Numerous farmhouses are located on the banks of the Nærøyfjord, and the area itself was inhabited 10 thousand years ago. Agriculture plays an important role in this region, the land has been cultivated for more than 3k years.

🔶The bay owes its beauty to steep slopes, waterfalls, glaciers, coniferous forests, blue lakes, winding rivers and mighty mountains. And in the warm waters of the bay there are seals that can be observed in good weather when they swim out to bask in the sun.

text: 🏛️Navagio Bay

🇬🇷

🔶Navagio Bay is a protected, in the full sense of the word, corner on the Greek island of Zakynthos.

🔶The crescent-shaped beach with pure white sand and oval pebbles, turned by the surf, is surrounded by an amphitheater of a rocky massif of white limestone, far out into the sea. 

🔶These rocks resemble stone palms, in which the island carefully holds its treasure – a small strip of pebble beach and a bay with clear water. Depending on the time of day and illumination, the sea shows shades of luxurious gems. 

🔶In the morning, the water is emerald in color, in the afternoon it is sapphire, and in the evening it acquires a blue–green shade, this is the color that artists call aquamarine.

text:
🏰Israel🇮🇱, Masada Fortress

🔶Not far from the Israeli city of Arad, the fortress of Masada rises on a trapezoidal plateau of one of the rocks of the Judean Desert.

🔶It owes its appearance to King Herod I the Great, who in the 25th year BC built a shelter on the rock for his family. However, it was not built from scratch — as a basis, the king used the remains of the fortress of the Hasmonean period (dated 37-31 BC).

🔶Weapons, food, and gold were also stored in the fortress. There was even an artificial water supply, there were baths. Some of the buildings have survived to the present day. So, in the fortress you can see Herod's palace, a synagogue, baths, water tanks cut into the rocks, a pool for ritual ablution, and much more.

🔶Once at the foot of a steep 450 m cliff, on which the fortress is actually located, some tourists prefer to climb up on foot along a narrow path, which is called the snake.

text: 🏘️Gasaladur

🇩🇰

🔶Gasaladur is a fabulous and fascinating village on the Faroe Islands

🔶The village is located in an incredibly beautiful valley between the highest cliffs of the island. 

🔶To get to another part of the island, residents had to overcome a 400m mountain trail. Due to such inaccessibility, the population of the village was declining

🔶In 2004, a five-kilometer automobile tunnel was made in a monolithic rock, and people began to settle in this fabulously beautiful place again, dragging tourists with them

messages.text:
🦒Kenya 🇰🇪, Giraffe Manor

🔶Giraffe Manor or Giraffe Manor is a small private mansion hotel in the suburbs of the capital of Kenya — Nairobi, on the banks of the Mbagati River. This is an amazing place where one of the subspecies of these incredible animals is bred and then released into the wild — the Rothschild giraffe.

🔶Even 30 years ago they were on the verge of extinction, but thanks to the work of the National Giraffe Center and Giraffe Manor, the subspecies is now almost restored.

🔶Over the years, Giraffe Manor has grown and released about a thousand giraffes into the savannah. Traditionally, pets are given names here in honor of people who have made a significant contribution to the work of the foundation.

🔶The hotel itself is small — it has 6 bedrooms and a large high dining room, as well as an open terrace. Guests have the opportunity to feed the animals during breakfast and lunch.

text:
🏝️Anguilla 🇦🇮

🔶Anguilla is a group of islands in the Caribbean Sea. Tourists from all over the world come here to relax in comfortable resorts, soak up the gentle sun and swim in clean, clear water.

🔶In the north of the Lesser Antilles, a small and secluded terrestrial firmament called Anguilla was lost. The island is conveniently located in Central America. One of its shores is washed by the gentle Caribbean Sea, the other by the Atlantic Ocean.

🔶The natural beauty of the island shimmers with various shades. Unique sea grapes and a large number of coconut palms grow here. 

🔶Full of bright colors, nimble hummingbirds collect nectar from flowers almost all year round, delighting curious travelers with their appearance.

text:
🏞️China 🇨🇳, Jiuzhaigou Valley

🔶Jiuzhaigou Valley is an extraordinarily beautiful place on the eastern edge of the Tibetan Plateau. Nature has created genuine miracles from water and limestone, algae and bacteria, decorated its creation with mosses, lichens and many hundreds of plants in captivating abundance and splendor. As a rule, the Jiuzhaigou Valley means two reserves at once – Jiuzhaigou itself and the Hualong Reserve. In turn, Jiuzhaigou consists of three more smaller valleys.

🔶While the small Huanglong Valley can be walked in one morning or one evening, for the vast Jiuzhaigou valleys it will take at least one day, and then if you decide to walk less with your feet and take the bus more. If you want to avoid a large crowd of people, it is better to walk a lot - then it will take at least two days, and only then you will really enjoy the local beauties.

text: Lake Eibsee

🇩🇪

🔶The Eibsee is one of the most beautiful lakes in the Bavarian Alps. The name Aibsee comes from the yew forests that previously surrounded the lake.

🔶The water of the lake can be admired and admired endlessly. The bright blue color resembles the sea, and the water at a depth acquires a rich dark color, beckoning to the hidden secrets that the Aibsee has kept throughout the history of its existence.

🔶At a maximum depth of 35 meters, the crystal clear water allows you to admire the relief of the bottom. It is noteworthy that the water around the islands is turquoise in color.

🔶The picturesque picture of the lake is complemented by a dense forest, surrounded by a high-altitude reservoir, and mountains going behind the clouds.

text:
🏰Slovakia 🇸🇰, Castle Oravski grad

🔶The castle of Oravski Grad stands on a cliff more than 100 meters high on the banks of the Morava River, near the village of Oravski Podzamok. Due to its location, the castle acquired the second name "eagle's nest". This castle complex began to be built in the XIII century on the site of a wooden fortification. For the first time Oravsky grad was mentioned in chronicle sources back in 1267. A century later, it was already one of the largest castles in the area. The palace on the territory of the City was built in the XVI century, and in 1800 the castle buildings suffered during a fire, and only in the XIX century its reconstruction in the Romanticism style began. The castle was completely reconstructed only in the last century, and now the Moravian Museum of Local Lore is located here.

text:
🏝️Palau🇵🇼

🔶Palau is the embodiment of all the dreams of a tourist (especially a diver), a tropical paradise with hundreds of different islands, lagoons with crystal clear water and a rich underwater world.

🔶Palau, or to be more precise, the Republic of Palau is an island state consisting of 328 islands with a total area of 458 km2.

🔶It is noteworthy that only 8 islands are inhabited by humans. All the others are the kingdom of nature, stunning landscapes, blue lagoons and the incredible atmosphere of the amazing paradise islands of the Pacific Ocean.

🔶The climate on the islands is tropical, with classic wet and dry periods, but they practically do not have significant and sharp differences. The wet season falls on the period May-November, dry, respectively, from December to April.

text:
🏞️Australia 🇦🇺, Kakadu National Park

🔶Kakadu National Park is located 171 km east of Darwin. The park is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Its archaeological, natural and ethnological components are under strict protection, because Kakadu Park is unique and inimitable!

🔶Kakadu National Park covers an area of 20,000 square kilometers, it is located about 150 km east of the city of Darwin. It is the largest national park in Australia. It also includes the Southern Alligator River, where a particularly large population of crocodiles lives, and various areas of the park include wastelands, eucalyptus and rain forests.

🔶The peculiarity of Kakadu Park is that its nature looks as if no human foot has ever set foot here. The territory of the Park has not only a unique structure of the earth's crust, but also soils that are unusual in their biological and chemical composition.

text: ⛰️Digor Gorge

🇷🇺

🔶Digor Gorge is the farthest corner of North Ossetia-Alania. It is located in the western part of the republic on the territory of the national reserve. 

🔶Vacationers in the Digor gorge and locals pay attention to the amazingly beautiful clouds. They, like milk foam, cover the mountain ranges. In other parts of Ossetia, you will rarely find such a sight.

🔶Digoria is the edge of waterfalls. They are especially sought by vacationers on hot summer days. Tourists see the first unnamed waterfall in the gorge not far from the Ahsinta Canyon. It is customary to tie ribbons and make wishes near him.

text:
⛪France 🇫🇷, Mont Saint-Michel Abbey

🔶Mont Saint-Michel is a unique architectural complex consisting of a medieval abbey and a tiny commune at its walls, located on a small rocky island off the northwest coast of France in the department of the English Channel.

🔶The construction of the abbey began with the arrival in 966 of Benedictine monks, invited by the Duke of Normandy Richard I, to the place of the community of canons expelled by him.

🔶The Mont Saint-Michel rock in Normandy is a granite monolith 80 m high with a rounded foot, standing at the mouth of the Cusnon River. The area of the rocky island is 7 hectares.

🔶At intervals of 24 hours and 50 minutes, tides occur in the bay, the most powerful in Europe. The water leaves the island at low tide for 18 km and floods the coast at high tide for 20 km .

text: 🏰Oravski Grad

🇸🇰

🔶Orava Castle is the most beautiful castle in Slovakia, built on a 112-meter cliff above Orava. It is included in the list of national cultural monuments of the country. 

🔶The castle was built in the XIII century, on the site of a small wooden fortress that stood on a rock since the Mongol invasion. The first mention of Oravsky Grad is found in documents of 1267. 

🔶The stronghold was built on the northwestern border of the kingdom to control trade routes between Poland and Hungary. 

🔶There was also a customs post here, collecting tribute from merchants who brought goods by water along the Orava.

text: Nærøyfjord

🇳🇴

🔶Nærøyfjord is an exceptionally picturesque place. This fjord is considered the smallest and narrowest fjord (only 300 meters wide). It is included in the UNESCO list and is an "arm" of the Sognefjord, the longest fjord in all of Europe.

🔶It may seem that a fjord is a wide mountain river or an elongated lake, but in fact it is a bay with steep cliffs that can be more than two hundred kilometers long.

🔶The Norwegian fjords turned out to be due to the fact that during the ice age the glacier began to slide towards the sea and scratched long, deep gorges under its weight, which were later filled with seawater.

text:
Japan🇯🇵, Tokyo, Mori Digital Art Museum

🔶If you ever happen to visit Tokyo, be sure to check out the Mori Digital Art Museum (Mori Building Digital Art Museum) on the man-made island of Odaiba. Here you will not find the usual glass showcases with exhibits and signs with the inscription "Do not touch with your hands". Instead, you will be able to plunge into fantastic interactive worlds that have no boundaries, created with the help of music, color and light.

🔶The Mori Museum of Digital Art is 10 thousand square meters of dark labyrinths decorated with 50 fantastic light installations, which required 470 projectors and 520 computers to create. Exhibits are constantly changing, react to touch, interact with visitors and with each other. They can even run away from a person or follow him. The exposition is divided into five zones: "Forest of lamps", "Forest of Athletics", "Park of the Future", "Boundless World" and "Tea House".

text: 🏘️Bruges

🇧🇪

🔶Bruges is almost a ready—made movie decoration for a Hollywood blockbuster about the Hundred Years' War, for example. 

🔶It's not for nothing that the most popular excursions in this city are photo shoots, when the guide tells something about bridges and streets

🔶The perfectly preserved medieval quarters of the historical center, permeated with canals, allowed Bruges to rightfully enter the ranks of contenders for the title of "Venice of the North".

🔶Even by European standards, the architecture here is beyond praise – especially when it comes to Baroque and Gothic buildings.

text:
Kazakhstan 🇰🇿, Charyn Canyon

🔶Charyn Canyon is a unique natural monument, part of the Charyn National Park, which was opened in February 2004 in order to preserve and restore the unique natural monuments of the Almaty region.

🔶Charyn Canyon stretches for 154 km along the Charyn River. An amazing natural monument is composed of sedimentary rocks, the age of which is about 12 million years. The height reaches from 150 to 300 meters.

🔶To date, the canyon is visited by a huge number of people, because here you can not only go on an excursion, but also relax and do active sports. On its territory there is a tourist complex with gazebos, bungalows and summer cafes.

🔶The majestic canyon is so popular that tour operators have created special tours that allow you to see the Charyn Canyon in all its glory. As a rule, all excursions to the canyon start from the city of Almaty.

text: 🏘️Lungern

🇨🇭

🔶Lungern is a fascinating sight that will forever remain in your memory, even if the video suddenly disappears and digital photos disappear,

🔶No photo can convey the impressions experienced by tourists who first visited these places.

🔶Deep turquoise—colored water, the peaks of snowy mountains reaching the blue sky, the splendor of green forests and mown meadows - all this is the neighborhood of Lungern.

🔶This German-speaking canton is located in the central part of Switzerland, and its capital is the city of Zarnen.

🔶It is worth noting that today many sightseeing tours in Switzerland include a visit to it in their mandatory program.

text:
🏰Romania 🇷🇴, Clay Castle of Fairy Valley

🔶Wherever you go in Romania, you can notice the presence of the romantic spirit of the Middle Ages everywhere here. Many tourists really like to visit Transylvania, because who hasn't heard stories about the mysterious Count Dracula. However, now we would like to tell you about one place that is not connected with this image in any way, but undoubtedly deserves attention. The place has a charming name "Clay Castle of the Valley of the Fairies", and one glance at it is enough to light up an irresistible desire to visit here.
⠀
🔶Of course, this is not a real castle, but an eco-hotel built exclusively from natural materials: clay, wood, sand and straw. The establishment is located in the Valley of the Fairies in the village of Porumbaku de Sousse, away from noise and civilization, surrounded by mountains, forests and fresh air.

text: ⛲Bahai Gardens

🇮🇱

🔶The Bahai Gardens in Israel is a huge park with tropical plants located on Mount Carmel. 

🔶The gardens are considered the eighth wonder of the world, and are located on the territory of the city of Haifa. 

🔶This is one of the most grandiose and famous sights of Israel, which in 2008 was included in the UNESCO World Heritage List.

🔶About $250 million was spent on the construction of the gardens, which were donated exclusively by followers of the Baha'i faith. An interesting fact is that money and any help from representatives of other religions is not accepted.

text:
🏞️Germany 🇩🇪, Lake Aibsee

🔶Among the many attractions of Germany, a special place is occupied by lakes located in different parts of the country. One of them is Lake Eibsee, which is located near Munich, about 100 km south of the city.

🔶Located at an altitude of 1000 m, a few kilometers from the highest mountain in the country (peak Zugspitze), the lake is the highest.

🔶The water of Lake Eibsee can be admired and admired endlessly. The bright blue color resembles the sea, and the water at a depth acquires a rich dark color, beckoning to the hidden secrets of the lake, which it has kept throughout the history of its existence.

🔶At a maximum depth of 35 meters, the crystal purity of the water allows you to admire the relief of the bottom. It is noteworthy that around the islands on the lake, the water is turquoise in color.

text: 🏰Olafsborg

🇫🇮

🔶Olafsborg is a 15th—century fortress on a tiny island in the Finnish city of Savonlinna. This is the northernmost medieval fortress that has survived to this day. 

🔶Originally it belonged to Sweden, then it became part of the Grand Duchy of Finland as part of the Russian Empire, and then became part of independent Finland.

🔶The place, a rocky island on Lake Saimaa, was chosen for strategic reasons: firstly, high steep walls run almost along the very edge of the island, and it is difficult to approach them, and it is almost impossible to approach them without being noticed. 

🔶Secondly, the current is very strong, and the water does not freeze even in winter, so it is much easier to defend yourself in severe weather conditions

text:
🏝️Indonesia🇮🇩, Bali, Tegallalang Rice Terraces

🔶The Tegallalang rice terraces are one of Bali's most memorable landscapes.

🔶The unique landscape was created according to the classic irrigation system for the island, which spread back in the VIII century. And throughout the year, the landscape is constantly updated in accordance with agricultural cycles. It is impossible to capture the same view when visiting this place some time later.

🔶The village of Tegallalang is developing rapidly in a tourist direction: souvenir shops and shops where local craftsmen sell handmade products are lined up along the road to the famous terraces.

🔶On especially hot days, to visit rice terraces, it is better to take with you wide shade hats and a cream with a high level of protection from sunlight, since there is no natural shade on rice plantations — only on the approach to them.

text: 🗻Khibiny

🇷🇺

🔶Khibiny is the largest mountain range of the Kola Peninsula with the highest point 1200 meters above sea level called Yudychvumchorr. There are two cities at the foot of the mountains: Kirovsk and Apatity.

🔶The Khibiny is itself a landmark of the Kola Peninsula. This is a national park under state protection. In natural terms, numerous mountain ranges will be interesting here, which look best in winter. A typical tourist activity is trekking and mountaineering. There are several ski resorts.

text:
🏟️Italy 🇮🇹, Grotta Palazzese Restaurant

🔶There is a city in Italy that is particularly popular among tourists. We are talking about Polignano a Mare. There is a famous Italian restaurant — "Grotta Palazzese", a pearl among local attractions, hidden in a cave. From there you can enjoy a picturesque view of the Adriatic Sea. The restaurant itself is located on a cliff, inside a limestone cave. Grotta Palazzese is the largest cave. It has the shape of a semicircle, the diameter of which is 30 meters.

🔶The idea to equip a room inside the cave arose a long time ago. According to some sources, the date of its creation is attributed to 1.700. Previously, lavish balls and large-scale feasts were held there. At that time, Duke Leto ruled, who was the owner of this city, approved the construction of a room in the cave. Soon the place became popular among the upper strata of society.

text: 🏞️Erawan Waterfall

🇹🇭

🔶Erawan Waterfall is the most beautiful waterfall in Thailand, which is located in
Kanchanaburi province.

🔶The waterfall itself is located in the Erawan National Park, which was formed in 1975. 

🔶In addition to the waterfall of the same name, there are several lesser-known waterfalls, caves (including rock paintings), the coast of the River Kwai, impassable jungles inhabited by exotic animals and rare birds, and even the Sri Nakarin Dam. 

🔶There are several guesthouses and loggias on the territory of the park, so if you are a lover of pristine nature, you can stay here for a while.

text:
China 🇨🇳, Huangguoshu Waterfall

🔶The Huangguoshu Waterfall, along with other eighteen waterfalls of the Chinese "Eastern Switzerland", is included in the Guinness Book of Records. 

🔶Falling from a height of seventy-eight meters and reaching a width of one hundred and one meters, Huangguoshu is most beautiful in the summer rainy season.

🔶The waterfall has been forming for seventeen million years. At first, water flows flowed into the rocks, washing out a karst cave in them. Then the vault of the cave was destroyed and powerful jets of Huangguoshu burst to the surface. According to scientists, all this happened about ten to twenty–seven million years ago.

🔶The name of the waterfall is associated by local legend with the fruits of the magic yellow tree, which, after a hundred days of ripening, allow you to get the treasures hidden there from the bottom of the reservoir.

text: 🏰Hohenzollern Castle

🇩🇪

🔶Hohenzollern Castle is the brightest example of architecture combining utopian Middle Ages and German neo—Romanticism.

🔶Located on the top of the mountain of the same name (855 meters above sea level), it is the most recognizable historical object not only of Baden-Würtenberg, but of the whole of Germany, attracting hundreds of thousands of tourists with its majestic and at the same time fabulous view. 

🔶A special romance can be felt on cloudy days, when the numerous turrets and battlements of the fortress are hidden in the air shroud. 

🔶This is where the second name of the tourist object comes from – "castle in the clouds".

 🔶Hohenzollern has a rich collection of antique furniture, tapestries, relics of the last imperial dynasty of the Prussian kings and many historical documents that will be appreciated by those who are professionally or at an amateur level interested in world history.

text:
🏡Ireland 🇮🇪, Bantry House and Gardens

🔶The Queen Anne Bantry House was built around 1700 in a magnificent location on the shores of Bantry Bay on the West Coast of Ireland, in County Cork. Since 1765 it has been owned by the Shellswell-White family. 

🔶A beautiful view from the terrace above the house opens the bay with the island of Vida and Mount Kakha in the background.

🔶Today, inside there is an eclectic collection of art and furniture brought from Europe by the Second Earl of Bantry, and in the carriage and stables there is the center of the French Armada, which tells about the attempted attack of Theobald Wolf Tone in 1796.

🔶Terraces with a total of 7 levels are built around the house. The parterre on the south side is surrounded by wisteria, which surrounds the fountain. From here, 100 steps rise - a staircase made of local stone surrounded by azaleas and rhododendrons.

text: 🏰Chillon Castle

🇨🇭

🔶Chillon Castle is a historical monument and a former defensive structure on a small rocky island in Lake Geneva.

🔶After the fortified dwelling became a museum, crowds of travelers come here every year.

🔶Along with ordinary tourists, the complex attracts famous romantic writers. At one time, the historical monument was admired by Jean-Jacques Rousseau, Victor Hugo, Alexandre Dumas, Gustave Flaubert, Maria Edgeworth.
 
🔶George Byron was so impressed by what he saw that in 1816 he wrote the poem "The Prisoner of Chillon". The work is based on the true story of the Swiss patriot and historian Francois Bonivard, imprisoned in the castle. The events described took place from 1530 to 1536.
