text:
Thailand 🇹🇭, Pi Leh Lagoon

Pi Leh Lagoon is located next to Phi Phi Lei Island, famous for its Maya Bay, where the filming of the film The Beach with Leonardo DiCaprio took place. Geographically belongs to the province of Krabi in Thailand.

It is included in the mandatory point of the route on excursions with a direction to the Phi Phi archipelago.

Pi Leh Lagoon is the deepest lagoon in Thailand, formed as a result of a fracture of the earth's crust. Thanks to the limestone rocks at the bottom, the color of the water is simply unrealistically beautiful, as if you are looking through a Photoshop filter.

Thais believe that bathing in this lagoon has a rejuvenating effect, thanks to the composition of the water. It is saltier here than in the Andaman Sea.

The lagoon is surrounded by huge rocks overgrown with greenery. There is no possibility to go ashore.

text: 🌇Petronas Towers

🇲🇾

🔶Petronas Towers are stunning skyscrapers located in the Malaysian capital Kuala Lumpur. 

🔶These structures are a real masterpiece of architecture, erected according to all the laws of Islamic art. 

🔶Each of them is made in the form of an eight–pointed star with semicircular projections - a sacred symbol of integrity and harmony. 

🔶The Petronas twin Towers have become a symbol of modern Malaysia, embodying the ancient culture and huge opportunities of this country.

text:
🏙️UAE 🇦🇪, Dubai, Sheikh Zayed Street

🔶Sheikh Zayed Road is the main and longest street of the Emirate of Dubai, its length is 55 kilometers. Being part of the largest highway E11, Sheikh Zayed Street starts from the border with Abu Dhabi, runs along the coast through the whole city, and ends near Sheikh Rashid Road.

🔶A trip along the Sheikh Zayed Highway is included in the mandatory program of most travel guides to the UAE and is very popular among tourists, because along it there are numerous towers and shopping malls in Dubai, as well as luxury hotels and residential neighborhoods.

🔶Until 1990, the street did not have an official name, it was popularly called the "Dubai — Abu Dhabi Road". After reconstruction in the 90s of the twentieth century, the road was significantly expanded (up to 12 lanes). At the same time, the highway was named after the first president of the UAE, Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan.

text:
🏞️Russia 🇷🇺, Sulak Canyon

🔶Sulak Canyon is one of the most popular natural attractions of Dagestan. It is attractive both for Dagestanis themselves, who have recently become addicted to active recreation, and for guests of the republic. Tourists are increasingly coming to Dagestan, already knowing exactly where they want to go and what to see. Sulak Canyon is almost always on the wish list.
 
🔶The canyon stretches across the territory of Dagestan for 53 kilometers. In places it narrows, and in some places the gorge, on the contrary, is so wide that its opposite side is hardly visible. The river looks like a thin and helpless stream from above, but in fact the Sulak is one of the most full—flowing rivers of Dagestan.
 
🔶The canyon is beautiful from any point, but most often people come to the village of Dubki to admire it. There are several places at once, from where the canyon will appear before you in all its glory.

text:
🏘️Cherry Tunnel Germany🇩🇪

🔶The Cherry Tunnel is an amazing few days that Japanese cherries give in the spring, in the cozy town of Bonn. 

🔶The most ordinary streets turn into a charming pink tunnel for two weeks, which gives residents and tourists wonderful landscapes during the day and even at night when the lights turn on.

🔶In the 1980s, in order to improve the quality of life and ecology of the center, it was decided to begin its complete reconstruction. Initially, they wanted to plant hawthorn here, but the regional plant nurseries could not deliver it. 

🔶Then in 1984, it was decided to plant a large number of Japanese cherry trees along the roadsides of Herstrasse and Breitstrasse streets, which run parallel to each other, in order to improve the air quality in the city center.

🔶The Cherry Tunnel is an amazing few days that Japanese cherries give in the spring, in the cozy town of Bonn. 

🔶The most ordinary streets turn into a charming pink tunnel for two weeks, which gives residents and tourists wonderful landscapes during the day and even at night when the lights turn on.

🔶In the 1980s, in order to improve the quality of life and ecology of the center, it was decided to begin its complete reconstruction. Initially, they wanted to plant hawthorn here, but the regional plant nurseries could not deliver it. 

🔶Then in 1984, it was decided to plant a large number of Japanese cherry trees along the roadsides of Herstrasse and Breitstrasse streets, which run parallel to each other, in order to improve the air quality in the city center.

text:
🏯China🇨🇳, Tibet, Potala Palace

🔶The Potala Palace is the symbol and business card of Tibet! Must see in Tibet and Lhasa. The palace was first built in the 7th century AD by the Tibetan king Sronzangambo in honor of the arrival of his bride Princess Wenchen from China. Then the Palace had 999 rooms. Of the most ancient rooms, two rooms have survived to this day: the living room of King Sronzangampo and the temple, where the main statue of the Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara is installed.

🔶The palace consists of the white part — the administrative premises, and the red part — the temple complex. The Palace has the most valuable collection of Tibetan Buddhist texts, tans, statues of Buddhas. The most valuable are memorial stupas, where the mummies of past Dalai Lamas rest. The stupas of Dalai Lama V and Dalai Lama XIII are the largest, as these leaders have made the greatest contribution to the development of Tibet.

text: Hallerbos

🇧🇪

🔶Hallerbos - aka the Blue Forest - can rightfully be called magical.

🔶During the Roman Empire, the territory of present-day Belgium was covered with dense beech forests. From those thickets now there is only one forest, but what🥰

🔶Once a year, in April or May, his land is covered with a magnificent blue-purple carpet of thousands of wild bluebells. They not only bloom, but also emit a strong fragrance.

🔶Of course, the forest is a national reserve, and it is carefully cared for, but tourists are always welcome here.

text:
Norway 🇳🇴, Atlantic Road

🔶Atlantic Road is an extraordinary road in Norway. It winds like a snake between islands and islets, connecting the island of Averoy with the mainland. There are 8 bridges between the islands. The road was opened in 1989. This is the most beautiful road in Norway, which has the status of a national tourist route. The contrast between driving on a sunny road on a calm summer day and traveling in a storm is amazing. Such memories will remain for a lifetime.

🔶The weather in this area is harsh and unpredictable. The bright sun is quickly replaced by clouds, snowfall often begins unexpectedly. Strong wind is especially unpleasant, it often exceeds 13 m/sec. Drivers need to be especially careful at such moments. The bridge can become a real trap. Waves sometimes run over the asphalt. The road is open even during storms and lightning, and this, of course, causes unforgettable impressions.

text: Greenland

🇩🇰

🔶Greenland is a land of majestic fjords and harsh northern nature, where those who are tired of idle idleness on tropical beaches come. 

🔶The island gives guests a meeting with pristine nature, clean air and unique impressions of unique man-made attractions.

🔶Greenland attracts fans of Arctic exoticism, eager to see the Northern lights (Aurora Borealis) and incredible polar mirages (Fata Morgana).

text:
Albania 🇦🇱, Reservoir (lake) Bovilla

🔶The Bovilla Reservoir is a 4.6 square kilometer reservoir in Albania, about 14 km northeast of Tirana and southeast of Kruja, in Mount Dite National Park. It provides most of the drinking water for Tirana.

🔶The water level in the lake fluctuates throughout the year by 7-10 meters, the maximum water falls during the rainy winter months. The maximum depth of the reservoir is 45 meters.

🔶The rocks around the lake are used by athletes for rock climbing. Swimming in the reservoir is prohibited.

🔶Bovilla is similar to a Norwegian fjord, but the host of a typical Mediterranean flora. This is the perfect place to escape the crowds of Tirana and spend the day surrounded by nature, admiring the stunning panoramas.

text:
🇮🇸Iceland, Skogafoss.

Skogafoss is one of the largest and most beautiful waterfalls in Iceland, a business card and a symbol of the country. It is located in the south of Iceland on the Skog River. Its classic picturesque appearance is admirable. Due to the large amount of spray and water dust generated by the waterfall, on sunny and clear days, you can observe a single, and sometimes double, beautiful rainbow.

text:
🏯Thailand 🇹🇭, Temple of Truth

🔶The Sanctuary of Truth, also called Wang Boran and Prasat Mai is a 105-meter wooden temple designed to showcase modern religious art, currently under construction in Pattaya.

 🔶The construction of the Temple was started in 1981 and continues to this day.
The temple has four groups representing images related to the Buddhist and Hindu religions and mythologies of Cambodia, China, India and Thailand, respectively.

🔶This unique creation is located in the north of Pattaya, on a secluded peninsula. The temple is completely different from traditional Buddhist buildings, and is made entirely of precious woods - teak, mahogany, golden teak. The Temple is being built without a single nail, an eclecticism of architectural styles - Thai, Khmer, Indian and Cambodian - is involved in its creation. 

🔶Approximately the completion of the construction of the Temple of Truth is scheduled for 2025.

text:
🏡The village of Houtouwan 🇨🇳

🔶About 50 years ago, life in the Chinese village of Hutuvan, located in the east of the country on one of the islands of the Shengshi archipelago, was in full swing: about 2,000 fishermen lived here with their families and there was a large port from where the caught fish were sent to the mainland. However, in the 1990s, the port fell into disrepair, and soon the island was deserted. There were only a few dozen residents who had nowhere to go.

🔶Almost 20 years have passed since the moment, and the village of Hutuvan was completely at the mercy of nature. Ivy and other plants tightly clung to all the buildings, which now look at the world with black gaps of window frames. The sinister and at the same time attractive place has become a tourist attraction in recent years, where not only guests of China, but also citizens of the country are eager to come.

text:
Russia🇷🇺, Kaliningrad, Museum of the World Ocean

🔶The Museum of the World Ocean in Kaliningrad is Russia's largest marine research center.

🔶A collection of marine mollusk shells and graphics by marine artists. There are many models of ships made by the hands of the best ship modelers in Russia. Even the skeleton of a gigantic sperm whale. The Museum of the World Ocean in Kaliningrad has collected a lot of unique exhibits.

🔶Two steps away from it is the embankment of the historical fleet. The legendary research vessel "Vityaz" has been frozen here forever, with 65 expeditions to different parts of the World Ocean behind its stern. Nearby are the operating space communication vessel "Cosmonaut Viktor Patsaev", the fishing trawler SRT—129, the floating lighthouse "Irbensky", the Soviet submarine B-413. There is a Be—12 seaplane on the shore. You can get inside most of these vessels.

text:
🏝️Indonesia 🇮🇩, Raja Ampat

🔶This incredible place is located in
the Indonesian province of West Papua and is an archipelago called Raja Ampat, combines the richest marine biodiversity on Earth. It consists of 1,500 small islands, reefs and shoals.
⠀
🔶Raja Ampat is famous for the most unforgettable diving experience in the world. According to data from the International Organization for the Protection of Nature, about 75% of the species of all living organisms live in the Raja Ampat region. A huge amount and variety of marine life, untouched coral reef systems are a dream come true for everyone who is attracted by the depths of the sea, as well as a fantastic place for snorkeling.
⠀
🔶Small tribes live throughout the archipelago. Their main occupation is fishing. With the development of tourism in the archipelago, local tribes began to produce various souvenirs from shells, coconuts, animals and plants for sale.

🇭🇺 Hungary, Budapest.

The city is located on both banks of the blue Danube, flowing through the plains of Europe. Many beautiful cities are associated with the name of the free river, but only one of them is known as the "pearl of the Danube". It is difficult to list all the sights of this city, so it's better to come and see everything with your own eyes. It's safe to say about Budapest — this point on the map is a must-visit.

🏝️Indonesia🇮🇩, Raja Ampat, Underwater World

🔶Raja Ampat, well known for its colorful corals, is a destination for divers who love dense shoals of colorful fish. Lucky divers will see an amazing number of rare species of marine life, including wobbegong sharks, manta rays, epaulette sharks, white-tailed squid, whale sharks, dwarf seahorses and thousands of colorful fish.

text:
🏝️Krabi Thailand🇹🇭

🔶Krabi is the southern province of Thailand on the coast of the Andaman Sea, which includes many picturesque tropical islands. 

🔶The main tourist "traps" of the region are delightful sandy beaches, memorable snorkeling and a less party atmosphere compared to neighboring Phuket. 

🔶Prices for holidays in Krabi are also lower than in other popular resorts, so this travel destination can be safely taken into account if the travel budget is less than we would like.

text:
🏘️Netherlands 🇳🇱, A village on the water of Losdrecht

🔶An amazing village on the water in the Dutch community of Weidemeren in the province of North Holland. Located southeast of Amsterdam.

🔶How did it happen that houses stand on small islands surrounded by water?
In the Middle Ages, this region was a large peat bog, too wet for agricultural purposes. Attempts were made to drain the swamp, but in the 17th century plans to use the swamps for agriculture were abandoned, and peat was extracted from the swamp instead.

🔶Peat extraction in Losdrecht began in the 1630s. Peat was extracted from the water and left to dry on the shore. This resulted in an area with long trenches and banks. As peat extraction continued, the land became smaller and smaller, which was destroyed by waves and wind. As a result of peat extraction, the trenches became deeper until they were flooded by groundwater, creating these narrow islands.

text:
🌋Haleakala USA🇺🇸

🔶Haleakala is a dormant volcano and the main attraction of the island of Maui

🔶A good highway leads to the volcano that formed the eastern part of Maui, indicated on the tourist map of the island in blue.

🔶Unlike the roads winding along the coast, where the vegetation riot alternates with steep slopes, and the eye does not have time to follow the changing pictures of nature, the road to the Haleakala volcano gradually lifts travelers into the clouds.

🔶The higher the serpentine rises, the more noticeably the air temperature decreases and there is a feeling that nature is "falling asleep".

text:
🏟️Switzerland 🇨🇭, Italy 🇮🇹, Lake Lugano

🔶One of the most beautiful and beloved by tourists lakes in Switzerland is Lake Lugano. Named after the city near which it is located, the lake is a popular place for summer holidays and for the construction of luxury villas. The lake is located on the territory of two countries — the southern part of it is located in the province of Como, Italy. On the shores there is an Italian exclave on Swiss territory — the commune of Campione d'Italia. 
 
🔶With picturesque villages located along the shores and surrounded by green mountains, Lake Lugano is an ideal place for recreation and active tourism. Rather elongated, 36 km long and no more than 2 km wide, Lake Lugano is the only one in Switzerland that has a bridge over it.

🔶Thanks to the clean air, practically free of dust and fog, Lake Lugano is considered the best place for rest and treatment after respiratory tract lesions and for rheumatics.

text:
Galata Tower Turkey🇹🇷

🔶Galata Tower is a historical landmark on the slope of Galata Hill in the most urbanized, European part of Istanbul — Beyoglu district. 

🔶The building towers over the historical center of the Turkish capital and belongs to the most notable and visited monuments of the city.

🔶The first wooden tower on Galata Hill appeared in the V century. And the tower, which can be seen today, was built by the Genoese in the middle of the XIV century. 

🔶In the Middle Ages, the Galata Tower served as an observatory, a lookout platform and a prison. It became the place from where the first Turkish balloonist Hezarfen made a successful flight.

Galata Tower has gained a special love in the gaming community, appearing in Assassin's Creed: Revelations

text:
🎡Russia 🇷🇺, Krasnodar, Galitsky Park

🔶Galitsky Park is a modern and relatively new park in Krasnodar, which was opened in 2017. The park was built by philanthropist Sergei Galitsky a year after the Krasnodar stadium. According to visitors, the park has created ideal conditions for recreation both with a child and in the company of friends. Galitsky Park was built according to a unique and modern project of a German architectural company.

🔶The area of the park is slightly more than 22 hectares, but this is not a very large area is fairly evenly distributed — there is enough space for a huge number of visitors.

🔶There are 2,300 trees planted in the park, already mature and quite green. Experts also note that the vegetation in the park is planted in such a way that different color combinations should be formed during different seasons, pleasing the eyes of visitors.

text: 🏝️Hundred Islands

Portugal 🇵🇹, Queluz Palace Complex

🔶The Queluz Palace is an amazing place in Portugal, the construction of which was inspired by the French Versailles. The palace and Park complex is located in the city of Sintra. It is built in an elegant and quaint Rococo style for the Portuguese kings of the Braganza dynasty. The palace was a summer residence, and with the abolition of the monarchy it became one of the most important sights of the country. 
It has been open to the public since 1940.

🔶A huge number of rooms, exhibits, a park with gazebos are the details of one magnificent complex called Queluz in Portugal: sights like this palace allow you to touch the past.

🔶The Queluz National Palace is one of the last major structures built in the Rococo style in Portugal. Its peculiarity lies in the simplified layout.

text:
🌋Iturup Russia🇷🇺

🔶Iturup is the largest island of more than fifty Kuril Islands, located at the junction of the Pacific Ocean and the Sea of Okhotsk.

🔶Volcanoes, boiling rivers, fumarole fields, the Pacific Ocean and salmon — you can endlessly list the "chips" of the largest island of the Kuril Ridge, as you can endlessly admire its sunsets in shades of cinnabar.

🔶The main thing you need to know before visiting Iturup: all your plans may be disrupted by the weather. Fogs prevent planes from landing, a storm corrects the schedule of motor ships, and rains wash out roads.

text:
🏖️Portugal🇵🇹, Azores

🔶The Azores is a picturesque archipelago in the North Atlantic Ocean, consisting of 9 green islands. The Azores belong to Portugal and lie at the latitude of the city of Lisbon. The archipelago appeared as a result of volcanic activity, there are 1766 volcanoes on it, 9 of which are active.

🔶The archipelago has an amazing beauty of nature. There are a lot of endemics preserved here: the bell–like evergreen shrub – azorina, the clover-like marsilia azorina, the day butterfly Hipparchia azorina, the Azorean evening bat and the Azorean bullfinch. Locals strive to preserve the pristine natural landscape, and therefore eco-tourism is very popular here.

🔶Many travelers come to the Azores to admire the picturesque nature and see the local natural monuments. In addition, diving, sailing, surfing, snorkeling and sea fishing can be enjoyed on the islands.

text:
Mariah Saudi Arabia🇸🇦

🔶Mariah is a unique concert hall built in the northwestern province of Saudi Arabia, in 2020 entered the Guinness Book of Records as the largest mirrored building in the world.

🔶Maraya (which means "mirrors" in Arabic) is called a "mirror miracle" because of the giant mirrors that completely cover its facades.

🔶Located in Wadi Ashaar, near the highway, the hall is equipped with the latest theater and opera sound systems. 

🔶A total of 9,740 square meters of mirrors cover the exterior walls of the cuboid structure, reflecting the picturesque surroundings of Al-Ula – a landscape that captivated artists and architects of the Nabataean civilization.

text:
🏛️Greece 🇬🇷, Acropolis of Athens

🔶The Athenian Acropolis is a 156–meter-high hill with a temple complex erected on it, protecting the townspeople from enemy raids. The upper city, which occupies an area measuring 300 by 130 m, was built over many centuries, starting with the ancient Greek archaic and ending with the era of Roman Greece. 

🔶According to legend, the founder of Athens and the Upper City was a half-man, half-snake Cecrope. It was he who preferred the goddess of wisdom as a patroness and erected the first temples in her honor. In the following centuries, more magnificent structures appeared on their ruins, until all the buildings of the Acropolis, with the exception of the fragmentary surviving temple of Hecatompedon, were destroyed by the Persians in the fifth century. During the time of Pericles and immediately after his death, the hill was decorated with the best works of ancient architecture – the Parthenon and the Erechtheion.

Borovoe Kazakhstan🇰🇿

🔶Borovoye is a resort village occupying the territory of an isthmus overgrown with pine forest, delimiting the lake of the same name Borovoye and Bolshoe Chebachye. 

🔶The second alternative name of the resort is "Kazakhstan Switzerland", assigned to it because of the similarity of the relief with Alpine landscapes and the special microclimate, which is almost the same here as in the homeland of William Tell. 

🔶People go to Borovoye to evaluate the wellness programs of village sanatoriums, to conquer the slopes of Mount Kokshetau, and just to abstract from the steppe landscapes, exchanging them for the shores of the purest lakes of meteoritic origin.

text:
🏖️Bulgaria 🇧🇬, The City Of Nessebar

🔶Nessebar is the pearl of Bulgaria, one of the oldest cities in the country and a modern European resort. It is located 37 km north of Burgas on a rocky peninsula connected to the land by a narrow isthmus about 400 m long. Tourists from all over Europe come here to get acquainted with the ancient history of this area and relax on the beautiful beaches of the Black Sea.

🔶This resort is also called the "city of forty churches" due to the fact that such a concentration of temples cannot be found in most other cities in Bulgaria. The entire territory of Old Nessebar has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1983 and is an open-air museum. 
 
🔶However, the city not only carefully preserves its history, but also actively lives in the present. For example, there are a lot of interesting events — festivals, concerts, fairs that introduce guests to the original culture, traditions, gastronomy of Nessebar.

text:
🏝️Maldives 🇲🇻, The St. Regis Maldives Vommuli Resort

🔶Surrounded by lush exotic vegetation, this luxury hotel is located on the private island of Daalu Atoll. The St. Regis Maldives Vommuli Resort is a spacious villa, impressive in sophistication and comfort. The magnificent white sandy beach is the main highlight of the fabulous lagoon, which is a natural decoration of the hotel territory. It will take no more than 45 minutes to get by seaplane to The St. Regis Maldives Vommuli Resort.

🔶The St. Regis Maldives Vommuli Resort is the perfect place to relax in the tropics. Natural beauty, exotic charm, unique private atmosphere attract romantically minded lovers here. The resort has created ideal conditions for celebrating a wedding ceremony and a honeymoon. Especially for the newlyweds, a number of exclusive services and privileges are provided here.

text: 🏯Suzhou

🇨🇳

🔶Suzhou is a stunning city that has managed to organically combine history and modernity, skyscrapers and cozy estates, high technology and provincial pace of life.

🔶The history of Suzhou dates back 2500 years. This city has always embodied the ideas of sophistication and elegance of the traditional culture of China. 

🔶The main attractions of the city are gardens, old streets, parks and canals. If you have long dreamed of seeing a traditional Chinese city, then you should definitely come here.

text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Saltinsky waterfall

🔶Saltinsky is the only underground waterfall in Dagestan. The amazing object bears the proud name of a monument of nature of republican significance. It is located on the outskirts of the village of Salta in the Gunib district.

🔶The waterfall is formed by the Stalinka River. It flows down from the mountains, passes the Kudalinsky Canyon and, almost reaching the village of Salt, "falls" into the canyon. A narrow and winding gorge leads to the waterfall — the Salta gorge, whose length is only 500 m. The route is simple, but requires care and caution.

🔶After 400 m from the start of the route, you will get to the narrowest part of the gorge. Here the walls close together, and there is 2-3 m left for passage.
The closer you get to the goal, the wider the canyon becomes. Gradually, it turns into an elongated huge cave with rounded "walls" and winding turns.

text:
Lake Natron,Tanzania 🇹🇿
Lake Natron is one of the most serene, but frightening and incredible lakes in Africa.

🔶It is not like the others: bright red, orange and sometimes green. Wide enough, but shallow. With its color, it warns us about the impending danger.

🔶The peculiarity of the lake is a strong concentration of salt and alkali, which does not allow almost anyone to live except favorites. The water temperature often reaches 50 degrees Celsius, the depth does not reach 3 m. It is 22 km wide and 57 km long. 

🔶 Small flamingos have perfectly taken root in such conditions. They build their nests on salty islands, and the pungent smell and the ability of water to kill all living things and turn them into mummies scares off large predators. 

🔶Thus, the lake saves these birds from extinction, and annually receives about 2,000,000 birds during the breeding season.

text:
Czech Republic 🇨🇿, Rock town of Adrspach

🔶This attractive, even mysterious, rocky city resembles a picture from a science fiction movie, where a dark forest and inaccessible gorges are intertwined with strange stone figures, as if they came here from a fairy tale about giants.

🔶The protected place, the Adrspakh rocks, is relatively little familiar to our tourist. It is located in the north-east of the Czech Republic, in the district is located.

🔶In ancient geological times, a shallow and warm sea sparkled on the site of the current Adrspakh, at the bottom of which organic sediments accumulated for millions of years. Then the sea left, leaving behind layers of soft sedimentary rocks that were easily eroded by water, destroyed by winds, melted like a lump of sugar. This is how these strange shapes resembling figures of people and animals were formed.

text:
Croatia 🇭🇷, Zlatni Rat Beach

🔶Zlatni Rat is the Golden Horn beach on the island of Brac, located opposite the Makarska Riviera. This beach is the most attractive among Croatian beaches, it can be seen on all tourist avenues. It is a huge spit, having almost 580 meters in length, crashed into the sea in the town of Bole. The beach is covered with small white pebbles. On the beach you can do water sports (there are 4 surf schools, dive centers, parasailing, water bikes, skiing, etc.).

🔶This is a real geological phenomenon. The pebble cape is constantly changing depending on the strength and direction of the wind and waves.

🔶At the base of the "Zlatni Rat" there is a pine grove, which allows, if necessary, to hide from the sun, because there is no vegetation on the beach itself.
There are several places to eat on the beach. There is a bar in the center of the beach, in the pines. There is a restaurant on the promenade at the entrance to the beach.

🇮🇩Pasikh Uug is a large natural pool created by a partially collapsed limestone hill hundreds of thousands of years ago. 

The beauty of this place lies precisely in the fact that the rock did not collapse completely, but in the form of an arch, the height of which is 98 meters 

Literally translated from Indonesian, this place is called "broken beach"🌊

text:
🌉Switzerland🇨🇭, Kapelbrücke Bridge

🔶The Kapelbrücke Bridge is part of the former fortification and the main attraction of Lucerne, located on the Reuss River. Having become a symbol of modern Switzerland, it is officially recognized as the oldest of all wooden bridges in Europe. Another feature of Kapelbrücke is that it is not only a historical monument to attract tourists: the bridge is operated daily by thousands of citizens who want to move from one part of Lucerne to another.

🔶You can walk along the Kapelbrücke at any convenient time and you will not have to pay for such a walk. But it is better to photograph the attraction in the spring and summer period. At this time, the design is decorated with flowerpots with flowers, which gives its appearance a certain romance and cheerfulness. The Kapelbrücke Bridge looks especially attractive in the evening: numerous light bulbs are lit under its roof, turning the wooden corridor into a fabulous gallery.

🇬🇪 Georgia, Merisi, EcoHouse Merisi.🏔️

🔶The mini-hotel is located on the mountainside in the village of Merisi in mountainous Adjara. The main distinguishing feature of the houses is a fully glass bedroom hanging over a cliff with a giant bed more than two meters wide, breathtaking and giving stunning panoramic views.
Another business card of the hotel is a Jacuzzi located on a huge outdoor veranda. Enjoy the view of the Caucasus mountains sitting in the bathroom in foam and a glass of wine in your hand – what could be more pleasant?!

text:
🏝️Thailand 🇹🇭, Mai Khao Beach 

🔶Mai Khao is a beach that is known for the fact that planes fly very low here, directly overhead, otherwise this beach is called the beach with planes in Phuket. There are only a few such beaches in the world where the landing and runway of the airport are located right by the beach. Moreover, the beach itself is usually not closed, and people calmly swim in the sea watching planes take off and land over their heads. You say — what is unusual about this? Yes, on small islands you can often see the take-off and landing of aircraft, often the landing strip is directly in the sea, but rarely in these places you can freely walk, sunbathe and swim. This is what is unusual about Mai Khao beach in Phuket. Looking from the side is one thing, but standing over low—flying planes is completely different - usually, emotions just go through the roof.

text:
⛪Italy🇮🇹, Florence, Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore

🔶This is an architectural complex that includes three buildings — the cathedral building, the Gioto bell tower and the baptistery. The Baptistery of San Giovanni is the oldest structure of the surviving buildings of Florence, built in the 5th century, the marble cladding was made later — in the 11th- 12th centuries.

🔶The Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore, undoubtedly a symbol of the city and the pride of the townspeople, is a stunningly beautiful structure with an attractive force. It is impossible to look away from its multicolored facade cladding, shimmering with delicate shades of pink, white and green and lace knitting.

🔶At the first glance at this architectural masterpiece, created by several generations of the most famous masters and architects for six centuries, there is no strength to resist an explosion of emotions — delight, surprise, joy from contemplation.

messages.text: 🇨🇭Switzerland has a mini-Jacuzzi afloat.

🏝️Tuvalu🇹🇻

🔶Tuvalu is an archipelago of five atolls and four islands. The tiny country has preserved its identity, ethnic traditions and cuisine. 

🔶Tropical plants, coral reefs, aboriginal tribes and stunning nature attract not only tourists, but also researchers.

🔶The National Research Council in the United States has predicted that by 2100 the ocean level will rise by almost 1.5 meters due to climate change. If this happens, the corals surrounding the island are in danger, and Tuvalu itself may disappear altogether. 

🔶That's why scientists and researchers from all over the globe come here. The island state is of professional interest to them.

messages.text:
Turkey 🇹🇷, Cappadocia, Balloons

Balloons in Cappadocia are known far beyond Turkey. Moreover, they are without exaggeration called one of the main attractions of this resort country. And it really is! In the summer months and in spring, you can count more than two hundred hot air balloons in the sky, painted in all the colors of the rainbow. Even if you fail to become a direct participant in this action, emotions and impressions will definitely last for a lifetime.

In Cappadocia, balloons are flown almost all year round, but the end of April – October is considered the best choice for such a walk. It is during this period that the height of the holiday season falls in Turkey, and comfortable and dry weather is set outside.

It is necessary to book balloons in advance, many people book almost six months in advance. There are many agencies through which you can book a flight. 
The easiest way to get to Cappadocia is through Istanbul.

text: Phangan

🇹🇭

Phangan is a mountainous island belonging to the Kingdom of Thailand in the Gulf of Thailand, which has become famous all over the world thanks to the monthly Full Moon Party raging here. 

Tourists are also attracted to the remote tropical island by picturesque jungles, spectacular mountain landscapes, luxurious beaches and romantic bungalows, from which you can step right into the warm aquamarine waves of the Pacific Ocean. 

Phangan appeared on the map of tourist routes in Thailand in the 80s of the last century. Not so long ago there were only a few villages here, the islanders fished, grew coconuts and fruits. 

Today, almost the entire adult population of the 11,800 inhabitants of the island of Phangan is employed in tourism.

Phangan is a mountainous island belonging to the Kingdom of Thailand in the Gulf of Thailand, which has become famous all over the world thanks to the monthly Full Moon Party raging here. 

Tourists are also attracted to the remote tropical island by picturesque jungles, spectacular mountain landscapes, luxurious beaches and romantic bungalows, from which you can step right into the warm aquamarine waves of the Pacific Ocean. 

Phangan appeared on the map of tourist routes in Thailand in the 80s of the last century. Not so long ago there were only a few villages here, the islanders fished, grew coconuts and fruits. 

Today, almost the entire adult population of the 11,800 inhabitants of the island of Phangan is employed in tourism.

messages.text:
Norway 🇳🇴, Lofoten Islands

The Lofoten Islands are an archipelago located north of the coast of Norway, north of the Arctic Circle. The Lofoten Islands rise from the green waters like a wall, the height of the mountains here reaches 1000 m, and the islands themselves are bordered by a white sandy coast. The scenery here is magnificent, everywhere flocks of seabirds dissecting the air in search of food, picturesque fishing villages hiding in bays, the northern lights. Lofotens are an unforgettable experience, but the population of the five main islands is only 25,000 people.

The islanders' main source of income is fishing, mainly cod.

Another source of income for the region is tourism. Travelers can go on an excursion and see the Maelstrom and other attractions, including the Refsvikhula Cave with rock paintings from the Stone Age. You can see colonies of seals and eagles, puffins and otters, and the mountains are ideal for hiking and rock climbing.

text: Uyuni Salt Marsh

🇧🇴

The Uyuni salt marsh is not just the main attraction of Bolivia and one of the most interesting places on the planet.

From November to March, when the rainy season comes to the plateau, the surface of the salt marsh is covered with a thin layer of water, and then Uyuni resembles a giant mirror. 

The horizon line becomes almost imperceptible, the surface of the lake merges with the sky, and the landscapes around the Uyuni salt marsh acquire unearthly beauty.

text: Etretat

🇫🇷

🔶Etretat is a picturesque corner of Upper Normandy, comfortably located among the steep cliffs of the Alabaster Coast in the department of the Seine-Maritime. 

🔶The amazingly beautiful nature of these places attracts tourists from all over the world. Today Etretat is one of the most visited places in France.

🔶The main attraction is the natural splendor of the white sheer cliffs that protrude into the sea and form vast arches. You can admire the rocks from above from the Customs Officers' Path along the coast, and from below, walking along them along the deserted beaches between the ledges of the rocks at low tide. 

🔶Be sure to look at the tide schedule, it always hangs at the descent to the beach. There is also a warning that going for a walk along the shore, the time reserve for the return trip should be at least four hours.

text: 🏝️San Blas

🇵🇦

🔶San Blas is an archipelago located along the coast of Panama and consisting of 378 islands – quite large and very tiny, inhabited and not.

🔶The islands are very popular with tourists who dream of basking on truly snow-white sand and swimming in turquoise waters. 

🔶Fishing enthusiasts also come here – you can rent a boat from the locals, or go fishing with them. The islands are also very popular with divers: firstly, the underwater world here is surprisingly bright and beautiful, and secondly, both private small boats and large ships have been shipwrecked quite often on the local shores.

🔶Almost all inhabited islands have small restaurants specializing in the preparation of dishes from the gifts of the sea. Prices are relatively low, especially in comparison with the major cities of Panama. A fairly large restaurant is located on the "capital" island of El Porvenir.

messages.text:
Switzerland 🇨🇭, Adelboden

The developed transport system in the mountains, a growing number of spa centers and family-friendly facilities, the idyllic village of Adelboden at the foot of the Wildschrtubel mountain remains one of the most suitable places to spend a vacation in the Bernese Oberland in winter and summer. It became the first tourist resort in Switzerland to receive the Alpine Wellness certificate.

A summer vacation in the mountainous countryside will make you really relax. Adelboden has 300 km of beautifully prepared hiking and themed trails, as well as several trails for cycling and mountain biking. Alpine farms with traditional huts and cheese factories are a distinctive feature of the local village life. A lot of active activities will greatly diversify your summer holidays.

In winter, Adelboden turns into a paradise for all lovers of winter sports - it is a desirable destination for athletes of all categories.

messages.text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Orekhovno Manor

The Orekhovno Estate is the first European garden in Russia with the status of private ownership, open to the public since 2016. The estate is located in the village of the same name in the Pustoshinsky district of the Pskov region on the banks of the Orekhovnitsa River. Orekhovno is included in the list of estates of the project of the educational tourism program "Russian estates", and is also included in the list of the international organization Great Gardens of the World.

Today Orekhovno is the pearl of the Pskov region, ideal for both inquisitive travelers and idle hedonists. Here you can walk through the green rooms, in which instead of walls there are hedges of linden, rosehip and thuja, and also learn a lot of interesting things not only about landscape design, but also about the history of these places. Almost every month something blooms in paradise, so people often come to Orekhovno for atmospheric photos.

messages.text:
Rothenburg an der Tauber, Germany🇩🇪

Rothenburg an der Tauber is one of those cute old towns that at first glance don't seem quite real.

🔶Tourists are delighted with literally everything they see here! 

The city is still surrounded by a defensive wall, including more than 40 towers, which remain the same as they were 400 years ago, when Rothenburg was the residence of the King of Sweden and Count Tilly. 

These walls and towers guard the idyllic city, its chic patrician mansions and half-timbered houses with turrets, wooden bay windows, red tiles and flower boxes outside the windows.

messages.text:
Ayutthaya, Thailand🇹🇭

Ayutthaya is perhaps the most impressive ruins on the Asian continent, located in the wide fertile valley of the Chauphrai River, in its bend.

🔶 The main temples can be walked around, but by renting a bike, you will see a lot more. 

The largest temple in Ayutthaya was Wat Phra Si Sanphet, it was part of the palace complex.

Some temples were built in the Khmer style, many, although they lie in ruins, are still majestic. There are many images of the Buddha here, including the image in the Wat Phra Meru temple from Sri Lanka - they say this statue is 1300 years old. 

Unfortunately, many of the figures were damaged by the Burmese invaders, besides, more recently, treasure thieves stole several heads of statues. 

Nevertheless, for Thais, this is a sacred place, here they possess Buddha figures in yellow robes, scatter flower petals and burn incense.

text:
Zanzibar  Tanzania🇹🇿

🔶Zanzibar is a coral island, perhaps once part of the African continent, a genuine pearl in the azure waters of the Indian Ocean. 

🔶The island attracts tourists with coconut palms swaying in the tropical wind, picturesque hills, sometimes covered with pristine forest, and wonderful beaches with white sand. 

🔶Another magnet for visitors is the abundance of coral reefs surrounding the island. This is a real fairy tale for divers!

text:
Kyrgyzstan🇰🇬, Jety-Oguz Gorge

🔶The Jety-Oguz Gorge sounds like "Rocks of the Seven Bulls" in Kyrgyz. It is located half an hour's drive from Karakol on the slopes of the Teskey-Ala-Too mountains.

🔶The Rocks of the Seven Bulls are one of the most remarkable natural treasures of Kyrgyzstan. The amazing canyon was formed by the efforts of the river of the same name flowing into Issyk-Kul. The gorge has become a place of pilgrimage for travelers from all over the world, some are drawn here for new experiences, others — to improve their health at the resort "Jety-Oguz" on the basis of a thermal spring.

🔶The gorge is a ridge of red sandstone mountains decorated with green forests. The rocks stretch for 37 km, and they are caressed by the Jety-Oguz River. At first glance, the striking contrast between the red sandstone and the rich greenery of the forests is striking.

text:
Adygea Russia🇷🇺

🔶Adygea is a republic located in the south—west of Russia and extending from the Kuban steppes to the Main Ridge of the Greater Caucasus. 

🔶It is located on the left bank of the Kuban River, having no access to the sea, but the lack of beach resorts in Adygea is more than compensated by natural resources that amaze even the most sophisticated travelers. 

🔶Canyons and caves, alpine meadows and dense forests, waterfalls and bubbling mountain rivers have repeatedly become a place for landscape filming, attracted many famous photographers, directors of popular movies and TV series. 

🔶The magnificent five natural monuments listed in the UNESCO World Heritage Lists are located on the small territory of the republic.

text:
🏛️Greece🇬🇷, Parga City

🔶Parga is one of the most beautiful cities on the west coast of Greece, located in the Preveza region of Epirus province. Surrounded by lush greenery and the blue waters of the Ionian Sea, this resort resembles an island, looks very much like a bright postcard and is incredibly photogenic. Parga is full of colorful houses and atmospheric streets, and the ruins of an ancient Venetian castle have been lying on top of the hill for many centuries. 

🔶Parga is located in the north-west of Greece between the coastal region of Preveza and Igoumenitsa. The city is built as an amphitheater along the picturesque bay of the Ionian Sea. It has a typical Mediterranean climate, which is characterized by very mild winters and hot summers.

🔶The main attraction of Prague is the ancient fortress, founded in the 11th century to protect the city from pirates.

🔶Parga is also a popular beach resort. There are many beaches in the vicinity of the city.

text:
🏝️Anse Lazio Seychelles🇸🇨

🔶Anse Lazio is the final major chord in a series of infinitely perfect beaches of the Seychelles.

🔶Tokamak trees giving a saving shade, palm trees leaning towards the ocean, smooth, like polished granite boulders, clear waters of the Indian Ocean and snow-white sand. 

🔶Small children can splash by the shore, and adults can enjoy snorkeling or jump on the waves. In general, even on windy days, bathing here is usually comfortable. On quiet days, the beauty of the water is amazing.

messages.text:
🏝️Mauritius 🇲🇺, Pamplemus Botanical Garden named after Sir Sivusagur Ramgoolam

🔶There is an attraction in Mauritius that is impossible not to visit. This is the Pamplemus Botanical Garden. The oldest garden in the Southern Hemisphere was founded in 1770 by the French plant breeder Pierre Poivre.

🔶The area of the park is 37 hectares. There are about 500 species of plants here — one is more wonderful than the other. At the entrance, you are greeted by a giant baobab, which is not even covered by four. The tree is about 250 years old. Since baobabs "live" to the age of 1000 years, one can imagine its size when it is "retired".

🔶The most impressive exhibit of "Pamplemus" is considered to be "Victoria Amazonskaya" — the largest water lily in the world. The diameter of the sheet can reach 2 meters! It is able to withstand a load weighing up to 30 kg. A child can easily ride on such a "boat". The underside of the leaf is covered with thorns, which gives it a menacing appearance.

messages.text:
🏘️Romania 🇷🇴, Sighisoara City

🔶Sighişoara is a medieval town with fortified walls on the Tarnava Mare River in Transylvania. Once there was a Roman city here, then artisans and merchants settled, Saxons from Transylvania, and the famous Vlad III Tepes, known as Count Dracula, was born here. His house now houses a restaurant.

🔶The medieval citadel is entered through the clock tower, one of the nine surviving towers, and once there were 14. The clock tower was built in 1360 to protect the main gate, in 1604 a clock appeared on it. 

🔶In the southern part of the citadel there is a cathedral with a wonderful interior, where traces of frescoes of the XV century are still preserved. People still live and work in the citadel, the streets and houses have been preserved in a wonderful condition. Narrow cobblestone alleys wind past the houses of artisans and wealthy merchants, painted in pink, greenish and yellowish-ochre tones. Sighisoara fully deserves the title "pearl of Transylvania".

messages.text:
🏰Russia 🇷🇺, Chateau Erken Castle

🔶Chateau Erken is one of the most popular attractions in Kabardino-Balkaria and the castle is located 25 km from Nalchik. The majestic structure is made in the Romanesque style. It is surrounded by more than 1000 hectares of vineyards.

🔶The castle is located on an island in the middle of an artificial pond, a stone bridge runs to the island. The lake is home to many exotic species of fish, and ducks and swans swim on the water, which you can feed. There is a garden and park complex with many birds around Chateau Erken. You can get to the castle only by the bridge, which is decorated with two black panthers. From the bridge, you can view the design of all the towers of the castle, on which there are viewing platforms. The towers offer an amazing view of the vineyards. 

🔶There are guided tours, during which you can visit a modern winery, which is located nearby, walk through the halls of the castle, taste local wine and visit the underground cellars.

text:
Marcessac Garden  France🇫🇷

🔶The Marquessac Garden is one of the most beautiful and romantic gardens in France and the most visited garden in the region of Perigault. 

🔶Listed as a National historic Landmark, the Marquessac Gardens, spread over 54 acres of land, offer over 6 km of shady trails among incredible, hand-trimmed forms of trees and shrubs. 

🔶The Marquessac Garden is often called the Belvedere of the Dordogne: from its height of 130 m, an exceptional panorama opens up, from where you can see many of the most beautiful villages in all of France

text:
🏰Trakai Castle Lithuania🇱🇹

🔶Trakai Castle is the only island castle in Lithuania and Eastern Europe. 

🔶The castle was built by Lithuanian Grand Dukes Kestutis and Vytautas in the late XIV — early XV centuries .

🔶Lake Trakai reliably protected the princely residence from the German Crusaders. After the victory of the Polish-Lithuanian troops over the Teutons in the Battle of Grunwald in 1410, Trakai Castle became the summer residence of the rulers of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania. It was such a golden age. 

🔶Over the following centuries, the castle became dilapidated and turned into ruins. Restoration began in the 50s of the XX century. during the Soviet rule and continues to this day.

Romania 🇷🇴, Sighisoara City

Sighişoara is a medieval town with fortified walls on the Tarnava Mare River in Transylvania. Once there was a Roman city here, then artisans and merchants settled, Saxons from Transylvania, and the famous Vlad III Tepes, known as Count Dracula, was born here. His house now houses a restaurant.

The medieval citadel is entered through the clock tower, one of the nine surviving towers, and once there were 14. The clock tower was built in 1360 to protect the main gate, in 1604 a clock appeared on it. 

In the southern part of the citadel there is a cathedral with a wonderful interior, where traces of frescoes of the XV century are still preserved. People still live and work in the citadel, the streets and houses have been preserved in a wonderful condition. Narrow cobblestone alleys wind past the houses of artisans and wealthy merchants, painted in pink, greenish and yellowish-ochre tones. Sighisoara fully deserves the title "pearl of Transylvania".

messages.text:
Australia 🇦🇺 , Lake Hillier

Hillier Lake is located on the Middle Island of the Australian Recherch Archipelago. It is believed that the British navigator Matthew Flinders first learned about its existence in 1802.

The lake has a small depth, its length is 600 meters, and its width is 250 meters. Sometimes the shade of the water changes from bright pink to maroon, it depends on the season. You can swim in Lake Hillier because it does not pose a danger to human health. Since the water in the lake is very salty, a person can simply lie down on the water and the water itself will push him to the surface. Therefore, at the beginning of the XX century, salt was even extracted from the lake, but after 6 years this case was discontinued.

The pink hue of the water is given by the presence of the algae Dunaliella saltwater.
The lake is surrounded by a dense eucalyptus forest. There are practically no paths in it, so you can only get to the lake by helicopter. So visiting Lake Hillier is a very expensive pleasure.

messages.text:
Switzerland 🇨🇭, Lake Blausee

The small Swiss Lake Blausee is one of the most romantic and picturesque places in this Alpine country. Locals call it the bluest of all the blue lakes in Switzerland. The secret of the amazingly piercing emerald-blue color is the underground springs that feed the lake with crystal water all year round.

The lake is located in the center of the natural park of the same name, which covers an area of 20 hectares in the central part of Switzerland. The area of the lake itself is 0.65 hectares .

The best time to visit is the golden autumn period, when the surrounding foliage contrasts so spectacularly with the blue water in the lake. In winter, Lake Blau does not offer much entertainment — the trails are covered with snow, there is no opportunity to go boating. But on the other hand, framed by the surrounding snow-covered forest and with illuminated houses on the shore, it looks like an illustration for a Christmas fairy tale.

messages.text:
Japan 🇯🇵, Takatiho Gorge

Takatiho Gorge is a relatively small in length, but extremely picturesque attraction of Japan. Its walls of volcanic basalt rocks rise above the blue-green waters of the Gokase River. Almost vertical rocks are decorated with moss and thickets of trees. It creates a magical atmosphere.

The Manai Waterfall adds even more beauty to this amazingly quiet and peaceful place. The height of the waterfall is only about 17 m . An interesting feature is that its stream flows directly from the rocks. 

You can enjoy the views of the Takachiho Gorge from above, walking along the pedestrian path with an observation deck, or from below, renting a small boat. Both options will provide stunning views.

A fascinating sight is experienced by people walking on boats.

The smell of wet stone, splashing fish, complete silence, which is broken only by the noise of leaves somewhere far away, as if from outside .... It seems that you are touching something fabulous, unreal.

messages.text:
Vaadhu Island, Maldives.
A unique kind of plankton that glows in the dark can only be seen on the island of Vaadhu. The waves, rushing onto the shore, take it with them, and the water begins to shimmer with hundreds, thousands of sparkling lights.

text: Lencois Maranensis

🇧🇷

🔶Lencois Maranensis is the most unusual desert on the planet, located on the northern coast of Brazil in the state of Maranhão. 

🔶This natural attraction is more like a mirage or an extraterrestrial landscape, combining extraordinary dunes of snow-white sand and blue-turquoise lagoons. 

🔶In Lensois, one of the most mysterious places on the planet, different Brazilian ecosystem groups intersect: the Amazon jungle and the tropical savanna of Cerrado merge into a single desert ecosystem found only in Brazil.

text: 🏘️Strasbourg

🇫🇷

🔶Strasbourg is a beautiful old city in the north—east of France, almost on the very border with Germany. Until the VI century, Strasbourg was called the Argentorate, which can be translated from the Celtic dialect as "fortress in the riverbed". 

🔶Strasbourg is one of the most important tourist centers of France, thanks to its rich historical past, reflected in the architecture of the city and unique museum exhibitions, as well as the modern status of the "parliamentary capital" of the European Union.

🔶In addition to the French language, it is not uncommon to hear German on the streets of the city, since many citizens or immigrants from neighboring Germany live and work here. 

🔶the staff of hotels, most restaurants, souvenir shops and other service establishments speaks excellent English.

text: 🏘️Cochem

🇩🇪

🔶Cochem is a city with old half-timbered houses, cobbled streets and medieval flavor, over which the romantic Reichsburg Castle, one of the most beautiful in the country, has been towering for many centuries.

🔶Located in the picturesque valley of the Moselle River among green hills and vineyards.

🔶Сoсhem is famous for its fairs, festivals and winemaking traditions. A popular tourist attraction is also a cruise on the Moselle River and hiking in the picturesque surroundings. 

🔶The town has changed little over the past centuries, combining beautiful nature, ancient history and rich cultural traditions.

text: 🌷Wooden Shoe

🇺🇸 

🔶Wooden Shoe is a tulip farm in the American State of Oregon.

🔶Tulips have been grown here since 1974, and the area of flower fields exceeds 16 hectares. 

🔶From the end of March to the first week of May, the annual tulip festival takes place here, at which balloons are certainly present

text:
⛰️Russia🇷🇺, Karachay-Cherkessia, Bermamyt Plateau

🔶The Bermamyt Plateau is a surprisingly little-known natural wonder in Karachay-Cherkessia. Surprisingly, because in terms of the power of the impression left, it is quite capable of being compared with the Grand Canyon in the USA. It is not so easy to get to the plateau, which creates an additional aura of inaccessibility and mystery around this place.

🔶In fact, Bermamyt is a part of a Rocky ridge near the headwaters of two rivers: the Kuma and the Malka. The main part of the plateau (the so-called Big Bermamyt) is located at an altitude of 2591 meters above sea level. A modest rocky ledge nearby is the Small Bermamyt (its height is 2643 meters).
There is a geodetic measurement point on the top of the mountain.

🔶One of the key reasons for which it is worth making the difficult way here is the incredible view of Elbrus, which, according to numerous reviews of seasoned travelers, is nowhere else.

text:
🏯China 🇨🇳, Kandin City

🔶The Chinese city of Kandin is located in Sichuan Province in a mountain gorge at the confluence of the Dar and Cei Rivers, and is the administrative center of the Gardze-Tibet Autonomous Okrug. The local city municipality organized the county of the same name. The city is inhabited by about 100 thousand people .

🔶In 2008, an airport was opened in the city, the length of the runway of which is only 4 km. This airport is located at an altitude of 4280 meters in the mountains above Kandin, is the third highest in the world.

🔶The city is inhabited mostly by Chinese and Tibetans. Historically, this city has long belonged to the Tibetan province of Kam. At any time, in every corner of Kandin, you can hear the sound of the water of the powerful rivers surrounding it.

🔶On the huge central square, residents gather every morning doing Taijiquan gymnastics and playing badminton in the afternoon.

text:
Peru 🇵🇪, Huacachina Oasis

🔶Huacachina is a small village built around a desert oasis in Peru. The oasis is surrounded by beautiful sand dunes and palm trees. It resembles the classic corners of the Sahara Desert, but is located on the other side of the world.

🔶In its center there is a lagoon measuring approximately 200 by 110 meters. And the overall dimensions of this unique place are about 480 by 340 meters.

🔶Huacachina Oasis is located 4 kilometers west of the city of Ica in the southwestern part of Peru and 45 kilometers east of the Pacific coast.

🔶In the 50s, the oasis lost its tourist significance, and for several decades it was abandoned. Local businessmen breathed a second life into Huacachina in the 1990s. They began to offer tourists the opportunity to ride on giant sand dunes in four-wheel drive buggy cars. To date, the permanent population of Huacachina is slightly more than 100 people (naturally, not counting tourists).

text:
🏝️India🇮🇳, Alappuzha (Alleppi)

🔶Alappuzha is a city located on the Laccadive Sea in the prosperous and wealthy state of Kerala. Alleppey is famous for its backwaters, beaches, rice fields and lagoons. Tourism in Alleppey is developed due to its natural attractions, which attract many tourists every year. The famous houseboat cruises in Alleppey are very popular among tourists. During August and September, tourism in Alleppey is booming due to the traditional boat races.

🔶Allepi is called the "Venice of the East" because of its famous backwaters, which are the most famous attraction of the city.

🔶Tourists from all over the world come to Alleppi to rent a houseboat. Houseboats are vessels of different sizes, different degrees of comfort. On houseboat you will feel all the beauty of the surroundings, admire the picturesque nature of the tropical forest and the vast expanses of the water surface.

text:
⛪Georgia🇬🇪, Mount Kazbek and Trinity Church

🔶Trinity Church in Gergeti (Gergetis Tsminda Sameba) is located on a hill at the foot of Mount Kazbek. It stands literally above the clouds – the height above sea level is 2170 meters. From below it seems that the monastery is floating in the air, high-high in the mountains – an amazing view!

🔶Why was the church built so high? There is a belief in Georgia that in order to get to God, a person must make an effort for this. Therefore, the temple was built so high that only true believers could overcome the difficult path up the mountain.

🔶The distance from the temple to the Russian border is only 11 km – this is the first attraction that tourists see when entering Georgia through Upper Lars. The temple is located near the village of Gergeti, and below is the picturesque village of Stepantsminda (formerly Kazbegi), which offers a stunning view from a small observation deck.

text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Monument "Motherland calls!"

🔶The monument "Motherland calls!" in Volgograd is the main monument of the ensemble "Heroes of the Battle of Stalingrad" in the most important memorial complex in Russia Mamaev Kurgan. The statue embodies the image of the Motherland, calling its sons to battle with the enemy.

🔶"Motherland calls!" is not only the most important and most famous object of the memorial complex, but also one of the tallest sculptures on Earth.

🔶The height of the statue is 87 meters. The length of the sword raised in the right hand is 33 meters.

🔶The place for the monument was chosen in such a way that it was clearly visible in any weather, even from a distance of tens of kilometers, including from the windows of passing trains.

text:
🏜️USA🇺🇸 Arizona, Grand Canyon

🔶The Grand Canyon is the most famous and one of the oldest, most popular and spectacular national parks in the USA. It is visited annually by over 6 million people, and in this indicator it is second only to the Great Smoky Mountains Nature Park, located in the densely populated eastern part of the country.

🔶On the territory of the Grand Canyon there is, perhaps, the most famous natural attraction of the country — the legendary Grand Canyon of the Colorado River, whose length reaches 446 km, average width — 16 km, and depth — up to 1600 m.

✔️The area of the Grand Canyon Park is 4926.66 sq. km
✔️The foundation of the National Park — 1919
✔️Inclusion in the UNESCO World Heritage List — 1979

🔶There are canyons longer, wider and deeper on the planet, but nowhere are there so many open historical sections of the Earth preserved in almost perfect condition.

text: ⛪Hallgrimskirkja Church

🇮🇸

🔶Hallgrimskirkja Church is a Lutheran church in Reykjavik, which was named after the 17th—century poet Hallgrimur Pietursson. 

🔶Thanks to the excellent acoustics and a huge organ, the temple has become an ideal venue for classical music concerts. Hallgrimskirkja Church can be seen from almost anywhere in the city.

🔶The building has a height of 74.5 meters. For a small fee, you can climb to the top of the church tower and enjoy an impressive view of Reykjavik, and in clear weather you can even see the Snaifedlsjokull glacier from there.

text:
Singapore🇸🇬, Gardens by the Bay

🔶Gardens by the Bay is a large tropical park in Singapore, which is known for its futuristic landscapes. In addition, there are more than 226 thousand plants of different climatic zones in the garden. The park opened to the public on June 29, 2012.

🔶Super trees are huge futuristic trees. About 200 species of plants such as ferns, orchids and other tropical flowers are planted on supertrees. At the same time, there are about 163 thousand different plants on each super tree.

🔶There are 18 supertrees in the park . They have different heights, the highest 50 m., the smallest 25 m. At the same time, the largest super trees are connected by a bridge, which is created for walking visitors to the park. From its height, you can view the entire Gardens by the Bay park and admire not only its lush vegetation, but also amazing structures. The bridge has a length of 128 m . and is raised to a height of 22 m .

text:
Spain🇪🇸, Barcelona, Casa Batlló (House of Bones)

🔶The Casa Batlló is an unusual architectural monument located in the center of Barcelona, in the Eixample district, on Paseo de Gracia Avenue. This building is a residential building built in 1877 and reconstructed in 1904-1906 by the brilliant Catalan architect Antonio Gaudi. The Casa Batlló is an example of Art Nouveau architecture of the early XX century and a well-visited landmark of the city.

🔶The researchers note that the wavy roof of the house, decorated with ceramic tiles, symbolizes the back of the dragon, and the turret, crowned with the St. George cross, represents the sword of St. George. The lower balconies, made in the form of skulls, are the remains of dragon victims. The staircases and arches of the interior resemble the spine and tail of a mythical monster, thanks to which the Casa Batlló received the nickname "House of Bones".

This building is a residential building built in 1877 and reconstructed in 1904-1906 by the brilliant Catalan architect Antonio Gaudi. The Casa Batlló is an example of Art Nouveau architecture of the early XX century and a well-visited landmark of the city.

🔶The researchers note that the wavy roof of the house, decorated with ceramic tiles, symbolizes the back of the dragon, and the turret, crowned with the St. George cross, represents the sword of St. George. The lower balconies, made in the form of skulls, are the remains of dragon victims. The staircases and arches of the interior resemble the spine and tail of a mythical monster, thanks to which the Casa Batlló received the nickname "House of Bones".

text:
Laos 🇱🇦, Kuang Si Waterfall

🔶Kuang Si is the largest and most famous waterfall in the Luang prabang area. This is a must-visit attraction in Laos.

🔶Kuang Si is a multi-level cascading waterfall of incredible beauty.
Waterfalls begin in shallow pools on a steep slope. Its total height is about 60 meters.
Due to travertine deposits, pools with turquoise water were formed at the waterfall.

🔶Most of the reservoirs are accessible for swimming and are located on the lower levels.
There are changing rooms next to several pools. The upper waterfall has a large playground with benches. The surroundings of the waterfalls are in the shade, so it is quite comfortable here.
Despite the fact that the water in the pools and waterfalls is cool, many swim here.

🔶The trip to the waterfall is no less interesting. Along the way, you will see multi-level rice fields similar to the terraces of Honghe Hani. Meet the locals in traditional clothes. Some of them sell homemade souvenirs.

text: 🏝️San Blas

🇵🇦

🔶San Blas is an archipelago located along the coast of Panama and consisting of 378 islands – quite large and very tiny, inhabited and not.

🔶The islands are very popular with tourists who dream of basking on truly snow-white sand and swimming in turquoise waters. 

🔶Fishing enthusiasts also come here – you can rent a boat from the locals, or go fishing with them. The islands are also very popular with divers: firstly, the underwater world here is surprisingly bright and beautiful, and secondly, both private small boats and large ships have often been shipwrecked on the local shores.

🔶Almost all inhabited islands have small restaurants specializing in the preparation of dishes from the gifts of the sea. Prices are relatively low, especially in comparison with the major cities of Panama. A fairly large restaurant is located on the "capital" island of El Porvenir.

text:
❄️Antarctica 🇦🇶

🔶Antarctica (or Antarctica — from the Greek ἀνταρκτικός - the area opposite to the Arctic) is a continent located in the very south of the Earth, the center of which practically coincides with the South Pole of our planet. Antarctica is washed by the waters of the Southern Ocean, has an area of 14.4 million km2, 1.6 million km2 of which are ice shelves, which are sources of icebergs of enormous size. The Antarctic ice sheet is the largest on the planet, it contains about 80% of all fresh water on Earth.

🔶The expedition of Thaddeus Bellingshausen and Mikhail Lazarev in the South Polar seas on the sloops Vostok and Mirny discovered the sixth continent of the Earth on January 16 (28), 1820 (the official date of the discovery of Antarctica) in the area of the modern Bellingshausen ice shelf.

🔶In Antarctica, any kind of activity is prohibited, except scientific.

text:
⛪Russia 🇷🇺, Solovetsky Islands

🔶The Solovetsky Islands and the surrounding water area have the status of a specially protected territory and a museum-reserve, the spiritual center of the islands – the Solovetsky Stavropol Monastery – is included in the UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Lists. It was built in the 1420s-1430s. Every year thousands of tourists and pilgrims come to these holy places to get acquainted with their dramatic history, to see the stronghold of Orthodoxy in the Far North of Russia, to enjoy untouched nature, harsh and peaceful at the same time.

🔶On Solovki, everything impresses with its solidity and inviolability: the grandiose stone walls of the Kremlin, roads and a dam on a boulder foundation, which have not been repaired for hundreds of years, but still serve people. Everything here breathes harmony, combining the beauty of nature and the fruits of human labor.

text:
🏛️Greece 🇬🇷, Melissani Cave

🔶There are places in Greece that have amazing beauty and attractiveness. Many of them are shrouded in secrets, myths and legends. One of these places is the Melissani Cave. It is located on the island of Kefalonia, about two kilometers from the city of Sami. The origin of the cave is associated with a complex geological karst process, thanks to which rocks are dissolved by water. For many millennia, underground and surface waters have made their own passages, destroyed the calcareous rock and formed a cave underground. Part of the cave space is occupied by the underground lake Melissani, whose age exceeds 20 thousand years.

🔶Today, everyone can explore the cave. In 1963, in order to provide easy access to the lake, a tunnel was laid in the rock. It leads underground to a pier with rowboats, on which tourists are taken to the far part of the cave.

text:
🌺Germany 🇩🇪, Mainau Island

🔶The island of Mainau is the third largest island in the waters of Lake Constance, administratively belonging to the land of Baden—Württemberg, also known as the "Island of Flowers". The island, owned today by the Swedish Bernadotte family, has an area of 45 hectares, and is connected by a ferry line and a pedestrian-automobile bridge to the city of Constance.

🔶The history of the settlement of the island dates back to Roman times, in the Middle Ages it belonged to the knights of the German Knightly Order. The extensive landscape park that the island is famous for today was created in 1932 by the ancestor of the current owners — Count Lennart Bernadotte. The park has an extensive collection of plants, including many varieties of orchids, palms, citrus, bulbous, roses, chrysanthemums and other garden flowers from different parts of the world.

text:
🏰Spain 🇪🇸, Bellver Castle

🔶Bellver Castle (Castel de Bellver), majestically towering on a 140-meter hill, is one of the most famous tourist attractions of Palma de Mallorca. In Spain, this is the only Gothic structure built in 1311, in an unusual round shape for this style. It is located 3 km from the city, which offers magnificent views from it. The panorama of the Bay of Palma is especially fascinating. And in clear weather, even the outlines of Cabrera Island can be seen from here.

🔶The largest tower is considered the main one. Its height is 25 m, and its diameter reaches 12 m. The main tower is oriented exactly to the north, while the other three smaller towers face east, south and west.

🔶Curiosity is aroused by the inner courtyard of the citadel, consisting of a two-story arched gallery. Here you can visit the historical museum and look at ancient sculptures. The citadel itself has a radius of 50 m.

messages.text:
🌉China 🇨🇳, Ruyi Bridge

🔶The stunning two-tiered Chinese Ruyi Glass Bridge opened at the end of 2020 and has already attracted hundreds of thousands of tourists.

🔶In 2017, the construction of the two-tier Ruyi Bridge in the Chinese province of Zhejiang began. The wondrous pedestrian crossing over the abyss was inaugurated on October 1, 2020 on China's National Day.

🔶Because of its extreme picturesqueness, the bridge is very popular with tourists, especially now that the borders are closed, the Chinese are especially actively traveling inside the country. Over the past months, about 200 thousand people have already visited this object, and many of them were attracted by its unusual shape.

The bridge is actually three separate structures combined into one structure. Their curved shape is inspired by the traditional Chinese jade rod, symbolizing luck in the local culture. A significant part of the bridge, located above a gorge 140 m deep, is made of glass, which makes its crossing especially memorable.

text:
⛰️Peru🇵🇪, Rainbow Mountains

🔶The most famous Rainbow Mountains are located in China. And few people know that there are such mountains in Peru. Vinicunca (Vinicunca) - so they are called in the language of the Quechua Indians, which literally means "rainbow-colored mountains". The beauty of the Rainbow Mountains attracts travelers from all over the world, and tourists include an excursion to Vinikunka in the program of their tour of Peru. 

🔶The colored layers of these mountains were formed millions of years ago from red sandstone, which, under the influence of climatic conditions, groundwater and mineral impurities, turned yellow, green, white and other colors.

🔶The Rainbow Mountains are located 100 kilometers from Cusco in the province of Quispicanchis at an altitude of 5200 meters above sea level among snowy peaks and turquoise lagoons. From there you can enjoy a magnificent view of the Ausangate Glacier - the sacred mountain of the Incas.

text:
🏯Japan 🇯🇵, Hirosaki Park

🔶Hirosaki Park is a park located in the city of Hirosaki , Aomori Prefecture . Other names are Takayo Park and Oyoen.

🔶It is also known as a famous place where about 50 species and 2600 cherry blossoms bloom in spring.

🔶Hirosaki Luxury Park is located on 49 hectares and includes a castle, watchtowers, canals, bridges and playgrounds for children. The park plays a central role in Hirosaki's urban tourism, being a venue for important cultural events.

🔶The castle is located almost directly in the center of the park and is surrounded by five channels: the inner, the channel of the Lotus Pond, the central, western and external.

🔶Bridges are laid across the canals. There are nine of them in total. Each of the bridges is distinguished by its elegant beauty. However, the most picturesque view opens from the Gyojo Bridge.

text:
🏝️French Polynesia 🇵🇫, Bora Bora

🔶If there is a paradise on earth, then it is probably located on the island of Bora Bora. Named in the 60s of the twentieth century the most beautiful island in the world, it remains to this day the most beautiful, better than which it is hardly possible to find something. 

🔶Bora Bora is one of the most romantic places on the planet, which is why it is chosen by lovers and newlyweds who dream of spending their honeymoon here, enjoying the stunning beauty of nature. The uniqueness of the island lies in the fact that its lagoon, even with a gray cloudy sky and rain, remains invariably bright, with an emerald tint. And the variety of flavors, the richness of colors, the quirkiness of the shapes of the colors of the island are simply amazing.

🔶Bora Bora is located 240 km northwest of Tahiti. The green island, with densely growing palm trees, outlandish flowers and rare birds, is surrounded by a scattering of small islets.

text:
🏰France 🇫🇷, Amboise, Amboise Castle

🔶Amboise Castle is a majestic example of Renaissance architecture. It is associated with the names of the rulers of France, as well as the genius inventor Leonardo da Vinci. Despite its considerable age (the first fortifications appeared here in 503) and a rich history, most of it has been preserved in excellent condition, and today it is considered an ornament of the Loire Valley. In 2000, Amboise Castle was included in the UNESCO World Heritage List.

🔶First of all, the castle of Amboise is interesting because it allows you to see how the great French monarchs lived. The interiors of various eras have been recreated with great care, as well as a unique collection of furniture. Moving from room to room, admiring the huge tapestries, beautiful sculptures, it is impossible not to feel the spirit of that time.

text:
🎡China 🇨🇳, Chongqing, Flying Kiss Attraction

🔶A new Flying Kiss extreme attraction has been built in Chongqing, China, located in the south-west of China.

🔶It consists of two statues with a height of 50 m, which lift up two rotating observation booths. The figures depict the characters of the Chinese legend about the prince and fairy in love.

🔶Visitors of the attraction can walk around the entire booth and admire the scenery opening at their feet. No seat belts are provided.

🔶The attraction is located on a mountain with a height of 1200 meters. At the moment of a symbolic kiss of two fairy-tale characters, the booths approach each other. To receive tourists and then lower them to the ground, the statues lean towards special buildings with landing pads on the roof.

🔶Critics of the project compare the statues to waiters, but, nevertheless, admire the work of Chinese engineers.

text:
Thailand 🇹🇭, Krabi, Dragon Crest

🔶Dragon Crest - this is how this ledge was named at an altitude of 600 meters above sea level.⠀⠀⠀
It is located in the mountain park Tub Kaek National Park, Krabi province. On the web, this place is known as Dragon Crest (Khuan Sai), which means the Crest of the Dragon.

🔶Trekking through the mountain park Tub Kayak National Park is an adventure that only the most energetic people can afford.

🔶Depending on your physical fitness, trekking will take from two to five hours in both directions. The route runs along the crest of a mountain, which resembles a frozen sea wave or a dragon crest with its profile. Along the way, you will come across several viewpoints and local flora and fauna, and at the end, the most stunning panorama in Krabi awaits. An incredibly picturesque valley with patches of clouds, miniature houses and a river, the edge of the sea, and scattered rocks everywhere the eye falls.
