text:
🏘️Cuba 🇨🇺, City of Havana

🔶Havana is one of the most beautiful cities on the planet, the capital of the Republic of Cuba, located in the northwestern part of the island on the coast of the Gulf of Mexico. It is the main political, economic and cultural center of the country, as well as a place extremely attractive for tourists.

🔶The city, founded by the Spanish conquistadors back in 1519, has acquired a unique and incomparable architectural appearance and flavor over several centuries of its existence. Its historical center — Old Havana — was included in the UNESCO list of Human Heritage in 1982, and the city itself is becoming more and more popular among tourists every year. Despite everything, Havana lives an active cultural life — colorful festivals are held here every year with a sea of incendiary music, dancing and excellent mood.

🔶Havana is the most populated city in Cuba. A little more than 2 million people live here.

text:
China 🇨🇳, Furong City (Waterfall City)

🔶The ancient city of Furong (or as it is also called Hibiscus Town) is located in the Chinese province of Hunan, in southeastern China. It has become a tourist attraction due to its picturesque views. The town is neatly perched above the waterfall of the Yu River . In the high water season, the waterfall from a height of 60 meters tumbles into the lake with boiling streams, and in dry periods it falls down in beautiful streams, exposing the stone walls. The history of this charming town dates back more than 2000 years. Today, about 22к people live here permanently, but the city seems more densely populated thanks to the numerous tourists. Seasoned travelers are advised to come here from April to October to fully enjoy the views and weather.  

🔶Looking at the photos and videos of this town perched above a waterfall, it's hard to believe in its existence. It seems that these are picturesque scenery for some movie.

text:
Madagascar 🇲🇬, Alley of Baobabs

🔶Baobab is a sacred tree for the inhabitants of Madagascar. He is considered the progenitor of the forest and is revered along with the gods. Baobabs are found not only on this island, but also in Africa, and even in Australia. With the development of agriculture, forests began to be cut down in Madagascar, but baobabs are not touched because of respect for majestic trees. As a result, powerful trunks of sacred trees now rise along the edges of one of the dirt roads. This road is called the Alley of Baobabs.

🔶The Alley of Baobabs is located on the road connecting the towns of Murundava and Belon i-Tziribiina, in the central part of the western coast of the island.

🔶The trees growing in the alley of baobabs belong to the species Adansonia Grandidier. This is a very rare species of endemic tree, that is, it is found only in Madagascar.

🔶The baobabs in the alley are about 30 meters high, and the age reaches 800 years.

text_entities.text:
Madagascar 🇲🇬, Alley of Baobabs

🔶Baobab is a sacred tree for the inhabitants of Madagascar. He is considered the progenitor of the forest and is revered along with the gods. Baobabs are found not only on this island, but also in Africa, and even in Australia. With the development of agriculture, forests began to be cut down in Madagascar, but baobabs are not touched because of respect for majestic trees. As a result, powerful trunks of sacred trees now rise along the edges of one of the dirt roads. This road is called the Alley of Baobabs.

🔶The Alley of Baobabs is located on the road connecting the towns of Murundava and Belon i-Tziribiina, in the central part of the western coast of the island.

🔶The trees growing in the alley of baobabs belong to the species Adansonia Grandidier. This is a very rare species of endemic tree, that is, it is found only in Madagascar.

🔶The baobabs in the alley are about 30 meters high, and the age reaches 800 years.

text:
🇷🇺Russia, Crimea, Novy Svet, Green Bay

🔶A small village of Novy Svet is hidden among the Crimean mountains and juniper forests. And indeed, tourists consider this place a real paradise, thanks to the good ecology, picturesque landscapes and amazing beaches. The entire coastal area is divided by three bays. The central beach is located in the Green Bay. Its length is about 700 m, and its width varies from 10 to 20m. The coating is sand-pebble. The entrance to the sea is flat, but not in all places flat.

🔶The village of Novy Svet and its central beach in the Green Bay are located in the southeastern part of Crimea, but despite this, the local climate differs from the rest of the peninsula and is close to subtropical. On both sides, the bay is surrounded by the Falcon and Eagle mountains, so the coast is reliably protected from the winds. Another feature of the resort village is the warm current, thanks to which the water in the sea warms up faster.

text:
Iceland 🇮🇸, Northern Lights

🔶One of the best destinations for observing the Northern lights is Iceland: an island in the Atlantic Ocean near the Arctic Circle, lying at 65° north latitude. Compared to other Nordic countries, Iceland has a relatively mild climate - in winter in Reykjavik, the temperature rarely drops below minus five degrees.

🔶The northern, or rather, the aurora borealis (because it also happens in the Southern Hemisphere), is most often observed in winter, simply because it is dark and it is remarkably visible in the black sky.
However, it can be observed at any time of the year, including in summer, if the nights are not very bright. In summer, it is difficult to notice it due to the fact that the daylight lasts for 20 hours (in the northern hemisphere) and it is almost invisible in the light of the sun. And in the southern hemisphere there are practically no populated places located close enough to the south Pole.

text:
🏘️Switzerland🇨🇭, Zermatt

🔶Zermatt is a charming town, lost between the most beautiful mountains. Next to it stands one of the symbols of Switzerland — the Matterhorn Mountain (Matterhorn). The name of the city comes from a combination of "zer", which in the local dialect means "in the direction", and "matta", which means "meadow".

🔶The city can only be reached by public transport, as cars are prohibited there. Almost all transport in Zermatt runs on batteries and is almost completely silent.

🔶Zermatt is magnificent with its views — they are so postcard-like that it is hard to believe that this can be a reality.

🔶Popular with tourists all over the world, Zermatt is one of the most expensive ski resorts in the world. The town itself is mostly a cluster of chalet—style hotels and restaurants.

🔶Zermatt is popular not only among downhill skiers, but also hikers, and the hiking trails in these places are simply fascinating.

text:
🏝️The Bahamas🇧🇸, Pig Beach🐖

🔶There is an island in the Bahamas, its official name is Big Major Cay, where the main population consists of feral piglets. It is known to tourists as Pig Beach.

🔶These pigs are different from the ones we are used to, as they have literally become waterfowl. The conditions in the Bahamas are, of course, heavenly: tropical forests, lakes, sandy beaches, many sources of fresh water. By the way, the island is uninhabited, there are no hotels for tourists.

🔶According to one version, the pigs were once left here by the sailors of one of the ships to pick them up and eat them on the way back, but that ship never returned to the island. According to another, the pigs survived the shipwreck, and the strongest of them managed to swim to the island. Some believe that the pigs were brought to the island specifically to lure tourists here.

🔶The island is a tourist attraction: many people come to it to see and feed the pigs.

text:
Montenegro🇲🇪, Durmitor National Park

🔶The Durmitor National Park, created in 1952, includes the Durmitor mountain range, the canyons of the Tara, Sushitsa and Draga rivers, as well as the upper part of the Komarnitsa plateau. It is a vast plateau with a total area of 390 km2 and located at an altitude of 1500 m above sea level. In 1980, it was included in the UNESCO World Heritage List.

🔶The national Park includes the Tara River Canyon, 80 km long and up to 1300 m deep. This is the first largest canyon in Europe and the fourth in the world, following Cotahuasi in Peru, Sulaksky in Russia, the Grand Canyon in the USA.

🔶The Durmitor mountain range is the center of mountain tourism in Montenegro. The tourist infrastructure is concentrated around the town of Zabljak.

In winter, the main sports are skiing, snowboarding. In summer, you can do mountaineering and hiking. Among the most significant attractions are 18 glacial lakes. The most famous is Crno-Jezero.

text:
Kyrgyzstan 🇰🇬, Lake Sary-Chelek

🔶The alpine lake Sary-Chelek with dignity bears the title of one of the most beautiful places on the planet. It is located at an altitude of almost 2 km above sea level in the foothill zone of the Chatkal ridge, five hundred kilometers from the capital of Kyrgyzstan and three hundred from the city of Osh. 

🔶Sary-Chelek Lake is not only the main decoration of the reserve of the same name, but also the second deepest lake in Kyrgyzstan, its average depth is 98 meters, and the maximum depth is 234 meters. Dozens of streams flow down from the gorges surrounding the lake.
The northern coast of Sary-Chelek is decorated with coniferous forests, so dense that it creates the feeling of real Siberian massifs. And the unique smell of pine needles only aggravates the impression. The power of the forests is reflected in the turquoise surface of the lake.

text:
Italy🇮🇹, Capri, Blue Grotto

🔶The Blue Grotto (Grotta Azzurra) is the main natural attraction of the popular Italian island of Capri, known since the Roman Empire. It is located in the northern part of the seaside resort, near the town of Anacapri, in the province of Naples.

🔶The grotto is a coastal cave of natural origin, partially submerged in the waters of the Tyrrhenian Sea. On sunny days, the water and the walls in the grotto appear in azure color, hence the name. It has only one entrance — from the sea, so you can only get to the grotto by boat. You can get into it through a small arch in the rock.

🔶The stone vault rises 15 m above the sea, while its length is approximately 56 m, and its width is 30 m.

🔶The amazing neon-blue color of the water inside the grotto is achieved by reflecting the sun's rays seeping through the underwater hole. Light passing through a water filter loses the red part of the spectrum, retaining only the blue.

text:
📚Armenia🇦🇲, Yerevan, Matenadaran

🔶Matenadaran translates from ancient Armenian as "book depository", is the world's largest repository of ancient manuscripts.

🔶Matenadaran was established in 1959 . as a research institute of Ancient manuscripts. For many centuries, despite the constant devastating wars and destruction, monuments of writing were collected and stored in the Etchmiadzin monastery. To this day, it has been possible to preserve manuscripts from the time of the appearance of the Armenian script, as well as collections of documents in Arabic, Syriac, Greek, Russian and other languages. This is the real pride of the Armenian people. Matenadaran is of great value for researchers of the history, philosophy and science of Transcaucasia, the Near and Middle East. In addition, lovers of applied arts will be able to find interesting examples of leather embossing, samples of ancient fabrics, artistic metal forging — all that was used in book printing.

text:
🇺🇸 USA, Hawaii, Hoomaluhia Garden

🔶Hoomaluhia Botanical Garden covers an area of only 1.61 square kilometers and is located north of Honolulu. This garden is also part of the Honolulu Botanical Garden, and admission is completely free, except on special days such as Christmas and New Year.

🔶The garden was founded in 1982 by the United States Army Corps of Engineers to prevent flooding of the area. This is a tropical garden, so there are many plants growing here that grow in tropical countries around the world. Another important purpose of this facility is the preservation of Hawaiian and Polynesian plants, which are definitely worth a look.

🔶In the center of the botanical garden there is a charming lake with an area of 120 square meters.

text:
🏯South Korea 🇰🇷, Seoul, Changdeokgung Palace

🔶Changdeokgung Palace in Seoul is one of the "Five Big Palaces" in Korea. It is the most famous and best preserved. On its territory there are a number of buildings and halls, as well as one of the most beautiful parks of the city —Huwon. It is considered one of the main attractions and is located in the central district.

🔶Changdeokkun or "palace of flourishing virtue" was founded in 1405 by the Joseon Dynasty. It remained a royal residence until the end of the XIX century. In 1412 it was expanded to 500 sq . meters, and it became a whole complex of buildings. But in the 90s of the XVI century, everything was completely destroyed during the Japanese invasions. Fortunately, the Vans (rulers) carried out restoration work. Already in 1623, everything burned down again during the uprisings of Kwanghegun. After it was rebuilt again, and became the main palace of the country. The last monarch lived here until 1926.

text:
Thailand 🇹🇭, Bangkok, Temple of the Morning Dawn

🔶The Temple of the Dawn (Wat Arun), built in the Khmer style, is the dominant architectural development of the historical part of Bangkok. In Vedic and Hindu mythology, Arun is the deity of dawn, who controls the celestial chariot of the Sun god. The silhouette of the tower, inlaid with colorful tiles, visually resembles Angkor Wat in Cambodia. 

🔶The central multi—tiered prang, surrounded by 4 chedis with a height of 16 m each, symbolizes the sacred Mount Meru - the center of the universe and the abode of Brahma in the cosmology of Hinduism. The white walls, decorated with multicolored drawings, shine in the rays of the sun, shimmering with all the colors of the rainbow. An equally fantastic sight awaits tourists at sunset, when the grandiose structure acquires a pinkish hue. At dusk, spectacular lighting turns on, and a 15-minute light show is arranged in the evenings.

text:
China 🇨🇳, Enshi, Enshi Grand Canyon

🔶The Grand Enshi Canyon is the main attraction of the city of Enshi. This is the most picturesque part of the Great Qinjiang Canyon, 108 kilometers long and with a total area of more than 300 square kilometers. The canyon is surrounded on the north by three gorges, on the south by the Zhangjiajie National Forest Park, and on the east by the city of Yichang. This tour zone impresses with a variety of landscapes. 

🔶There is a geological fracture up to 75 m deep in the Yunlong River Valley . It is filled with fantastic rocks and a riot of colors. Ancient trees grow here, streams murmur and waterfalls fall.

🔶This place is not among the top most famous places in China (but it is included among the most beautiful places in the country). Among the Chinese, the Enshi Canyon is quite popular, so on national holidays there are not enough people on the narrow paths in the canyon.

text:
🌋Indonesia🇮🇩, Java Island, Bromo Volcano

🔶Bromo Volcano is a bright peak of the Tenger Caldera in the Bromo-Tenger-Semeru National Park. It is located in the eastern part of the island of Java, in Indonesia. The height of the volcano reaches 2392 meters, and the diameter of the crater is 600 meters. The name "Bromo", translated from Javanese, means the name of the god of the Hindu trinity —Brahma.

🔶The best time to visit the volcano is from April to October. The rainy season lasts from December to March. During the day it is cool here, the temperature is no more than +20 ° C.

🔶Ascent to the volcano is possible from 7 am to 5 pm. The way to the foot through the caldera will take no more than 30 minutes. You will have to walk through volcanic ash and sand dunes past rock carvings and a Hindu temple. Some prefer to travel by horse. Before climbing, you can buy local Hungarian food and drinks at the foot. Or tourists take a snack with them from the hotel.

text:
Italy🇮🇹, Florence, Ponte Vecchio Bridge

🔶The Ponte Vecchio Bridge is among the top most famous sights of Florence. Ponte Vecchio was built in the XIV century, it connects the two banks of the Arno River at the narrowest point. The ferry has been here for centuries. The ancient Romans were the first to build a wooden bridge on stone piles at this place. The structure was destroyed by a flood in 1117. The bridge was built anew, using only stone during its construction. A new flood in 1333 destroyed it as well. The familiar view of the Ponte Vecchio was received in 1345. Architect Neri di Fioravanti designed a reliable but elegant three-arch structure.

🔶The Ponte Vecchio is the only bridge in Florence that has preserved its medieval appearance. Today there are jewelry shops open here. By the way, the prices here are very high. The Ponte Vecchio Bridge must be admired from the shore. The best view is from the embankment or from Michelangelo Square.

text:
France 🇫🇷, Pont du Gard Aqueduct 

🔶The Pont du Gard near the French city of Nimes is the largest and best preserved ancient aqueduct. This is one of the most impressive evidences of Roman rule in France, dating back about 2000 years.

🔶The Pont du Gard crosses the gorge of the Gordon River in the vicinity of the Roman city of Nemaus, which is now called Nimes by the French. The Romans built the Pont du Gard in the 1st century AD to supply the city with water. The aqueduct bridge is just part of a 50-kilometer water supply system that delivered water from the source to the city of Nimes without a single pump.

🔶The upper tier, through which the water supply passed, has a length of 275 m, a height of 7 m and a width of 3 m. The water channel laid out in stone was supported by 35 relatively small arches. This channel is 1.2 m wide and 1.8 m deep and is still in good condition.

text:
Thailand 🇹🇭, Nong Nooch Tropical Park

🔶Nong Nooch Tropical Park is 2.4 sq. km of botanical gardens located on the 163rd km. Sukhumvit Road in Chonburi Province, Thailand, (near Pattaya), combining the advantages of an arboretum, an open-air museum and grounds for resort entertainment.
Expositions of local and foreign flora are surrounded by sculptures, topiary figures, fountains and reservoirs.

🔶For comfortable walks equipped with "air bridges" — SkyWalk. Panoramic views of picturesque landscapes open from multi-level paths equipped with canopies. Thematic zoning allows you to move through sections, choosing the direction depending on your preferences. Today there are about 2,700 species of palm trees in the world, and 1,100 species grow in the park.
Flower beds fill the air with fragrance and delight with a riot of colors.

text:
🌋Russia🇷🇺, Kamchatka, Valley of Geysers

🔶One of the world's largest geyser fields is located on the territory of the Kronotsky State Biosphere Reserve in Kamchatka. At the same time, this is the only valley of geysers in the entire area of Eurasia (not counting Iceland, which is remote from the mainland). It was first discovered in the middle of spring 1941.

🔶Along the Geyser River there is a canyon, the total area of which is up to 6 km2. Within these limits, arranged by nature, there is a valley of geysers, containing many geyser outlets, mud pits, waterfalls, thermal pads, natural reservoirs, hot springs.

🔶According to the results of the voting held in 2008, the Valley of Geysers was included in the Seven Wonders of Russia.

🔶You can get to the valley only by buying a helicopter tour from a travel agency, as it is protected by a protected regime.

text:
🌉China 🇨🇳, Shanghai, Nanpu Bridge

🔶Nanpu Bridge - it is spoken of as one of the most beautiful bridges in the world. And yet, this bridge at one time became the first cable-stayed bridge in China.

🔶The Nanpu Bridge is a rope suspension bridge, ranked fourth in the world in terms of the largest suspension bridges with two supports. It was put into operation in early December 1991. The total length of the bridge is 8346 meters. The length of its main span is 846 meters, the width is 31 meters and the height is 46 meters, allowing ships of quite impressive size (displacement up to 55,000 tons) to pass under it.

🔶On average, about 120,000 cars pass through this bridge every day. The central supports in the form of the letter H rise 150 meters. The length of the central span (the distance between the two main pillars) of the Nanpu Bridge reaches 423 m. Nad npu was the leader among suspension bridges in China until it was bypassed by the new Yangpu Bridge.

text:
Croatia 🇭🇷 , Krka Park

🔶Krka Park is one of the largest natural treasures of Croatia. It is located in the central part of the Adriatic coast between the Croatian cities of Knin and Sibenik (Middle Dalmatia region).

🔶The National Park has quite impressive dimensions — the total area of the protected area is 109 square kilometers, the length is about 72 kilometers.

🔶Krka is unique with a cascade of natural waterfalls, lakes and beautiful islands in the center of the river. The special attraction of this place is given by the opportunity to swim in waterfalls, which is usually prohibited in Balkan national parks.

🔶The natural combination of water, forests, the proximity of the sea and mountains have created a special climate here, favorable for flora and fauna. The territory of the reserve is inhabited by 860 species of various animals, more than 220 species of birds and 18 species of fish, most of which are found only in this region.

text:
Ukraine🇺🇦, Odessa.

🔶Odessa  is a port city on the north-west coast of the Black Sea. This is the third largest city in Ukraine after Kiev and Kharkov, the main industrial, cultural, transport, scientific and resort center of the Northern Black Sea Coast.

🔶Odessa was founded by Catherine II in 1794, when the Russian Empress decided that the country needed a port on the Black Sea to expand ties with Europe. Once in place of today’s Odessa was an ancient Greek settlement, then the Crimean Tatars lived there. They were replaced by the Ottoman Turks, who founded the fortress Hadzhibey, which was captured by Russian troops in 1789.

🔶Successfully located geographically, Odessa quickly evolved from a small settlement into a commercial, industrial and scientific center of European importance. During the Second World War it was partially destroyed. Today the city continues to develop, now as a major industrial and resort center of Ukraine.

text:
Irish🇮🇪, Powerscourt Gardens 

🔶Powerscourt is a manor house owned by Viscounts Powerscourt for more than 2 centuries. The main decoration of the estate is landscaped gardens. The house on the top of the hill occupies the main place of the composition, and its windows overlook the mountains, valley and gardens.

🔶Today, the area of the gardens occupies almost 19 hectares. The central part of the estate in front of the house is decorated with a Triton fountain and a small pond. A terrace made of light stone and a staircase with sculptures leads from the house to the gardens. 

🔶The complex includes various themed gardens. 
In the English Garden there is a pond with reeds and a fountain. 
In the Japanese Garden there are gazebos stylized as pagodas. 
The Irish garden can be safely called botanical because of the variety of plants and herbs. The Greek Garden is decorated with roses and sculptures.

text:
🗼China 🇨🇳, Shanghai, The Pearl of the East TV Tower

🔶The Pearl of the East or Oriental Pearl TV Tower is the third tallest tower in Asia, and occupies the fifth position in the world. It can be seen from almost all points of Shanghai. Attracts attention not only for its size, but also for its architectural solution. Inside there are a number of entertainment services for tourists: a viewing platform with a transparent floor, a museum exhibition, a rotating restaurant and other places.

🔶The skyscraper is not just a landmark, but a real symbol of the city, because its second name is "Pearl of the East". He has appeared several times in Hollywood films like "Godzilla" and "Transformers". His visit should be included in the mandatory tourist program.

🔶The total height of the structure is 468 m, but it is impossible to get to the top. The highest viewing area is located at 351 m in the capsule.

text:
🏝️Maldives🇲🇻 , Halaveli Island

🔶Halaveli — the island is named after the durable tree "Ala" and is surrounded by wonderful beaches and sandy spits extending into the lagoon. The Italian public mostly stays here, but the atmosphere in Alaveli is surprisingly calm. The island is very much appreciated by divers, because from here you can see wonderful places near the reef and stunning marine reserves are available. 

🔶Constance Halaveli Resort is located on the island. 86 luxury villas, made in traditional Maldivian style, are located on the beach and on stilts above the water.

🔶Spacious terraces feature private pools with ocean views. Constance Halaveli Maldives offers its guests a combination of outdoor activities with beach relaxation. The spa center, located above the water, has a team of professional massage therapists and cosmetologists.

text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Kabardino-Balkaria, Karakaya-Su Waterfall

🔶The noisy and majestic Karakaya-Su waterfall is located in the area of Jila-Su warm springs. The waterfall got its name because of the characteristic black stripes on the reddish-yellow rocks. In the Turkic languages, "kara kaya" means "black rock", and "su" means "water". Karakaya-Su flows down from the highest peak of the Rocky Ridge – Mount Karakaya (3646 m), which is also located on the territory of Kabardino-Balkaria.

🔶The beautiful and powerful waterfall is magnificent at any time of the year. On frosty days, the main stream is "overgrown" with a mass of bluish-colored ice growths, and the surrounding rocks and rocks are covered with bizarre icicles.
In summer, water flows fall from a height of about 30 m and form a dense layer of large and small splashes. The view of this waterfall is impressive! For the sake of such a spectacle, it is not a pity to spend neither strength nor time!

text:
🏝️Qatar🇶🇦, Banana Island Resort Doha by Anantara

🔶Banana Island Resort Doha by Anantara is one of the best hotels in Qatar, recreating the atmosphere of a holiday in the Maldives.

🔶The resort is managed by the Thai hotel chain Anantara Hotels Resorts & Spa and combines Asian hospitality with Oriental luxury.

🔶Guests will enjoy the large green area of the resort, as well as cozy bungalows in the Arabian style. For those who prefer complete privacy, water villas are suitable.

🔶The only Middle Eastern resort known as the "Eastern Maldives". The resort has an anti-alcohol policy. 
The main advantages of Banana Island Resort Doha are a sandy beach with a length of 850 meters, a 100–meter swimming pool with a view of the lagoon, a private marina for 30 yachts, a 9-hole golf course.

text:
⛪Portugal 🇵🇹, Hieronymite Monastery

🔶Hieronymite Monastery on the outskirts of Lisbon Belen, Geronimos (port. Mosteiro dos Jerónimos) is a grandiose monument of the late Gothic Manueline style of Portuguese architecture. It is protected by UNESCO as a monument of the World Heritage of Mankind. The monastery buildings are located in the Lisbon suburb of Santa Maria de Belen (Bethlehem).

🔶Founded by Henry the Navigator in 1450, the monastery is inextricably linked with the history of Great Geographical Discoveries. It was here that Vasco da Gama and his companions spent the night in prayer before sailing to India. The construction was carried out with the money earned from the resale of Indian spices from 1502 to 1520 and from 1550 to 1580, and then it was resumed in the XIX century.

🔶About 1 million people visit the monastery every year. Thus, the Jeronimos Monastery is the most popular attraction in Portugal.

text:
🏞️Austria🇦🇹, Gesäuse Nature Reserve

🔶This mountainous park is located on the territory of Styria, it stretches along the valley of the Ens River. Picturesque local landscapes attract a large number of tourists and wildlife lovers to the park: rare animals and plants live on the territory of the reserve. The Gesäuse National Park is spread over an area of 110 km2.

🔶Basically, the territory of the park is a mountainous area, the highest is the Hochtor Mountain, whose height is 2,369 meters. The mountains are covered with forests and green pastures, and at their foot flows the stormy river Ens. Even the Gesäuse logo shows three stripes — gray, green and blue, symbolizing, respectively, mountains, forests and water.

🔶Forests in the national park are located on different types of terrain and at different heights. Therefore, a huge variety of natural communities has arisen here.

text:
Indonesia🇮🇩, Bali, Sekumpul Waterfall

🔶Sekumpul Waterfall is one of the most picturesque natural attractions of Bali. It is formed by six or seven (depending on the season) narrow cascades falling into a small mountain crevice in the central part of the green bamboo valley of the Buleleng River in the north of Bali.

🔶The height of the Sekumpul waterfall is about 70-80 meters.

🔶Sekumpul is fed by two springs and remains spectacular all year round. Nevertheless, the best time to visit this attraction is the rainy season, which lasts from November to April. At this time, the cascades are the most full-flowing and picturesque. A strong right stream falling from the maximum height for this waterfall is distinguished by crystal clear water.

🔶There are usually few tourists on the observation deck and at the foot of Sekumpul: the waterfall is considered difficult to access, and there are no mass bus excursions to it.

text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Moscow, Kremlin in Izmailovo

🔶Izmailovsky Kremlin is a cultural and entertainment complex in the Old Russian folklore style. It has become one of the most striking sights of Moscow. It has absorbed the best Russian traditions of architecture and architecture. On its territory it accommodates museums, galleries, workshops, ethnic buildings, cafes, banquet halls and even a registry office. For Muscovites and guests of the city, the Kremlin in Izmailovo has become a place of rest for the whole family.

🔶The history of the Kremlin in Izmailovo began relatively recently. The place for construction was not chosen by chance. A lot of historical events are connected with it. Under Tsar Alexei Romanov, there was an exemplary farm with a weaving manufactory, glass-blowing and brick factories.

🔶The Kremlin in Izmailovo is rich in sights. Every visitor will find something fascinating for themselves.

text:
🏝️Maldives 🇲🇻, Aturuga Island

🔶Athuruga is a private island in the North Ari Atoll in the Maldives. There is good snorkeling on the home reef, and a little further in the lagoon there is excellent diving. By itself, the island has a pleasant beach - with palm trees, white sand and a good entry into the water. Shore and bottom: sand, rocks.

🔶Diamonds Athuruga Beach & Water Villas is a 5-star hotel with a room rate from $ 800 per night on an all-inclusive system with a bias towards Italian cuisine.

text:
Peru 🇵🇪 , Lima, Miraflores District

🔶Miraflores district is located in the southern part of Lima (the capital of Peru) and borders with other tourist areas – San Isidro, Barranco and others. And from the west it is washed by the Pacific Ocean. It is thanks to the beautiful and well-groomed embankment (Malecon in Spanish) that Miraflores became famous in Peru. Since Miraflores is a tourist mecca, this area is completely clean, cultured and safe. Among other things, it is considered one of the best places to live in Lima.

🔶Of course, the embankment (Malecon) is the heart of Miraflores. It is here that all tourists flock and walk, ride bicycles or even paraglide over the high cliffs almost 80 meters high, on which Lima is located. The length of the embankment (or malecon) in Miraflores is almost 10 km.

text:
USA 🇺🇸, New York, Central Park

🔶Central Park is the most beautiful, famous and popular park in New York. It covers an area of 3.4 square kilometers. Its construction began already in 1853, when it was decided to create an inviolable green area for residents to relax in the rapidly growing city.

🔶Central Park is not exactly a park in our understanding of the word. This is a well-maintained forest with a summer theater and an amazing atmosphere created by bizarre gnarled trees.

🔶In every Hollywood movie that takes place in Manhattan, there are entire episodes filmed here. The park area is located between 59th and 110th Streets, in the heart of business districts built up with skyscrapers, banks and government buildings.

🔶According to the most conservative estimates of tour operators, 25 million people come here every year, and these are only foreigners, which makes the attraction one of the most visited places on the globe.

text:
🏰Austria🇦🇹, Ambras Castle

🔶Ambras Castle was built in the 16th century by order of Archduke Ferdinand II of Austria.

🔶Ambras Castle is a beautiful palace with carved ceilings, unique frescoes and mosaic doors. This is one of the most important castles in Austria, built in the Renaissance style.

🔶The Art Hall has a rare collection of caskets, bronzes, statuettes, wood carvings. Also in Ambras there is an exceptional collection of small children's armor and medieval Rustkammer equipment, in the center of which is armor belonging to the giant Bartolomeo Bon (his approximate height is 260 cm).

🔶The most unique collection is a collection of outlandish rarities, among which various exhibits unusual for those times are presented: exotic fish, corals, a portrait of a man with a hairy face, a two-headed animal, a rare image of Count Dracula, a trap chair for drunken visitors, a sinister and at the same time unique figurine of Death made of bone.

text:
China 🇨🇳, Chinese Venice

🔶Not far from Shanghai there is a very ancient small town of Zhouzhuang. In 1086, the local rich man Zhou Digong donated 13 hectares of land to the Taoist monastery, which still exists today, has been repeatedly rebuilt and expanded.

🔶The town began to grow rapidly. Intellectuals, artists, various dignitaries settled here, who spared no money for the construction of their houses and bridges. Zhouzhuang is surrounded on all sides by rivers and lakes connected by canals, which are the streets of the town. Almost every house has its own pier. There are also paved sidewalks on which you can walk.

🔶Most of the houses are architectural monuments. A two-storey mansion built in 1742 is very interesting. It occupies 2000 square meters, has 100 rooms, 7 courtyards, 5 arches. The luxurious residence, built in 1436-1449, during the Ming Dynasty, belonged to the Zhang family. It occupies 1800 square meters, has 70 rooms and 6 courtyards.

text_entities.text:
China 🇨🇳, Chinese Venice

🔶Not far from Shanghai there is a very ancient small town of Zhouzhuang. In 1086, the local rich man Zhou Digong donated 13 hectares of land to the Taoist monastery, which still exists today, has been repeatedly rebuilt and expanded.

🔶The town began to grow rapidly. Intellectuals, artists, various dignitaries settled here, who spared no money for the construction of their houses and bridges. Zhouzhuang is surrounded on all sides by rivers and lakes connected by canals, which are the streets of the town. Almost every house has its own pier. There are also paved sidewalks on which you can walk.

🔶Most of the houses are architectural monuments. A two-storey mansion built in 1742 is very interesting. It occupies 2000 square meters, has 100 rooms, 7 courtyards, 5 arches. The luxurious residence, built in 1436-1449, during the Ming Dynasty, belonged to the Zhang family. It occupies 1800 square meters, has 70 rooms and 6 courtyards.

text:
🏝️Bahamas🇧🇸, Kokokei Island

🔶The small Bahamian island of Kokokei (1 kilometer long and 183 meters wide) has been under long-term lease from the cruise holding Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. since 1990. The island is on the routes of only the liners of the companies that are part of the holding.

🔶The official geographical name of the island is Little Stirrup Cay.

🔶In May 2019, a huge entertainment zone Perfect Day began operating on the island, the construction of which cost the company $ 250 million. Liners are now moored at the pier, and do not stand on the tender parking lot.

🔶The island's water park is home to the Daredevil's Peak, the highest water slide in North America, with a height of 41 meters. In total, the water park has 13 water attractions, as well as the largest artificial wave pool in the Caribbean.

text:
🏝️Abkhazia, Gagra City

🔶Gagra is a resort town on the Black Sea coast of Abkhazia. Colorful and bright, it will give you a warm sea, beautiful natural parks, lots of sunny days, great beaches and delicious gastronomy traditions. Mountains, the sound of waves, amazing panoramas, delicious restaurants and an extensive selection of hotels and accommodation in the private sector. Perhaps the most developed infrastructure in the republic is Gagra. A city that has been consistently considered synonymous with a vacation by the sea for the last hundred years.

🔶This was the case in tsarist Russia, when aristocrats and intellectuals went here on vacation, during the Soviet era, who glorified Gagra as an elite place by the sea, the dream of every Soviet person, and today it has a lot of fans and admirers. The most popular resort of the republic attracts travelers.

text:
Jordan🇯🇴, Petra

🔶Ancient Petra is a unique rock city, which until the beginning of the XIX century was known only to local Bedouins. They kept the secret for centuries, not letting outsiders in, because they believed that the royal treasures were hidden somewhere here. Today, an unusual attraction is open to millions of tourists.

🔶Petra is called a "pink" city because of the characteristic shade of the rocks, which increases during the hours of sunrise and sunset. The layered structure of sandstone creates an incredible palette of colors, changing depending on the illumination, and delights with unimaginable drawings and divorces created by nature itself.

🔶Petra is hiding from civilization in southwest Jordan, near the border with Israel.

🔶The city rises 900m above sea level, more than 650m above the surrounding plateau. The entrance portal, which opens a fabulous path in the era of ancient times, is carried out from the side of the town of Wadi Musa.

text:
Italy 🇮🇹, Rialto Bridge

🔶The Rialto Bridge is one of the most famous symbols of Venice. Among the many other Venetian bridges, the Rialto stands out because there are almost always a huge number of tourists on it, it is one of the busiest places in the city. Despite the fact that there are only four famous bridges in Venice, the Rialto is statistically the most visited of them. This bridge is famous for being the very first bridge in Venice, spanning the famous Grand Canal, and, accordingly, the oldest.

🔶The Rialto Bridge does not impress tourists with its size, its length is only 48 m., width is 22 m., and the highest point is at 7.5 m. But it is impressive that the support of the Rialto Bridge in Venice consists of 12,000 piles that are driven into the bottom of the Grand Canal. The appearance of the crossing resembles a large arch, on two sides of which there are shopping malls.

text:
Montenegro 🇲🇪, Rijeka Crnojevic

🔶Rijeka Crnojevica is one of the most beautiful and inspiring places of power, where you can be inspired by the natural beauty and energy of the mountains in Montenegro.

🔶The length of this river is small – about 13 kilometers. The Crnoevicha River flows into the Skadar Lake and, in fact, feeds it with its waters. This is a fairly calm river stream, and the area through which the river flows is characterized by picturesque beauty.

🔶The interest in the river is caused largely by the fact that in the XV century there was an estate of the Crnojevic dynasty in its vicinity. Ivan Crnoevich, the founder of the city of Cetinje and one of the Montenegrin princes, was forced to hide somewhere on the river. It was this surname that gave the name to the river and the city itself.

text:
🏯Japan 🇯🇵, Kenroku-en Garden

🔶The symbol of the Japanese city of Kanazawa is the ancient Kenroku-en garden. The garden was named "Kenroku-en" (Garden of six Virtues) due to the fact that it has 6 virtues that create a beautiful garden: vastness, privacy, artificiality of creation, traditional forms, water sources and majestic view.
Kenroku-en was founded in 1676.

🔶On the territory of the 25-acre park there are more than 8000 trees, over 200 varieties of flowers and herbs, there are picturesque ponds, restless waterfalls, talkative streams with carved bridges and much more. Among the attractions of the park are the ancient fountain, the water in which circulates under natural pressure, the Yugao—tei tea house, built in 1774, the Ganko-basi Bridge, made of 11 huge red stones and the Kotoji lantern - a symbol of the garden and the city of Kanazawa.

text:
🏰Germany 🇩🇪, Neuschwanstein Castle

🔶Neuschwanstein Castle is a romantic castle of King Ludwig II, in the town of Hohenschwangau, near the town of Fussen, in Bavaria, in southern Germany. Today it is one of the most popular attractions in Germany.

🔶About 1.5 million people visit annually the "Fortress of the Fairy King", as Neuschwanstein is often called, towering with its numerous towers on an impregnable rock.

🔶Neuschwanstein Castle is located in a wonderful location with panoramic views of the Alps, the valley and two lakes — Alpine (Alpensee) and Swan Lake (Schwansee).

🔶The amazing beauty of the nature of these places inevitably sets up a romantic mood. Perhaps that is why the events of Richard Wagner's opera "Lohengrin" and the famous ballet "Swan Lake" by Tchaikovsky unfolded here.

text:
Italy 🇮🇹, Padua, Piazza Prato della Valle

🔶Piazza Prato della Valle is the largest square in Italy and one of the first largest in Europe. It is located in the city of Padova to the south of the historical center and occupies an area of 88,620 m2.

🔶Its romantic name, which means "meadow in the valley", already suggests that this is not an ordinary square. Piazza Prato della Valle has its own interesting history and incredibly picturesque architectural ensemble.

🔶During the Roman Empire, the area of Prato della Valle was known as Campo Marzio or the Field of Mars, because it was a place for military meetings.

🔶The main mission of reorganizing the old square fell to the lot of Andrea Memmo, a politician and writer who served as administrator of Padua in 1775-1776. His passion for art and architecture allowed him to carry out a huge job of turning a large earthen glade into a monumental square.

text:
Russia🇷🇺, Sochi, Navalishchenskoye Gorge

🔶Navalishchenskoye Gorge is a natural attraction and recreational facility in the Sochi National Park. The gorge is part of the Akhunsky ridge, located on the bed of the Khosta River near the Sochi microdistrict of the same name. The Khosta River, which has been flowing here for millions of years, has cut through a picturesque canyon, which is simply a must-visit for those who love picturesque places.

🔶The rocks here are covered with a large number of relict trees and plants, which makes these places especially attractive. And the gorge itself is divided into 2 parts – the Upper and Lower canyons. The boundary between the two zones is a 4-meter waterfall.

🔶The total length of the Navalishchensky Gorge in Sochi is about 1.5 km. The maximum height of the gorge walls is 250 meters relative to sea level, the depth is up to 140 meters.
⠀

text:
Northern Ireland 🇬🇧, Giant's Causeway

🔶This road or path of giants was formed many millions of years ago during a volcanic eruption. Huge lava flows came to the surface and quickly solidified, leaving behind giant basalt vertical columns. Researchers have counted more than 40 thousand such columns, most of which have a regular hexagonal shape, some are seven- or octagonal. The highest of them is 12 m high and forms a kind of springboard. Gradually, this road becomes lower and goes under water. In 1986, the Giant's Causeway was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and a year later its territory became a national nature reserve of Northern Ireland.

🔶There are quite a lot of tourists here, but only during the period from late spring to early autumn. At other times, visitors are not allowed on this trail, because it can be dangerous for their lives.

text:
Switzerland 🇨🇭, Eschinensee

🔶Eschinensee is a mountain lake in the Bernese Oberland in Switzerland, part of the nature protection zone of the Swiss Alps, included in the UNESCO list in 2007.

🔶Lake Eshinensee is located at an altitude of over 1.5 thousand meters above sea level, its dimensions are up to 1.6 km long and no more than 1 km wide, the maximum recorded depth is 56 meters. The main thing in this reservoir is not its size, but the picturesque landscapes and clean air of the surroundings, which tirelessly attract travelers.

🔶The surface of the lake freezes every year, the ice usually lasts from December to May. However, even in winter, Eshinen does not cease to be a tourist destination. Almost all year round you can order fishing on the lake.

text:
Turkey, The resort town of Oludeniz

🔶Oludeniz is a popular beach resort on the Aegean coast in Turkey. It is located in Mugla province, 60 km from the city of Dalaman, where the nearest airport is located.

🔶The resort picture here is truly idyllic. Azure, clear seas, snow-white edge of beaches, giant mountains protecting the coast from bad weather and winds. All this creates a special, unique microclimate, which is appreciated by fans of Oludeniz.

🔶The beaches in Oludeniz are ideal: the Central beach of Belgekiz, the reserved Blue Lagoon, the secluded Kidrak beach and such a popular, snow-white-azure Kaputash.

🔶Active recreation is popular in Oludeniz: sailing, diving, snorkeling, cycling. As well as hiking trails, the local surroundings are very picturesque. You can walk along the Lycian Trail, the most popular hiking route in Turkey with coniferous forests and magnificent views of the coast.

text:
Belgium 🇧🇪, Leuven Town Hall

🔶The Town Hall of Leuven is located on the central square of the Grote Markt and is a significant landmark of the Belgian city.

🔶The Leuven Town Hall looks amazing: ornate patterns, many sculptures, magnificent decoration in the late Gothic style makes it a masterpiece of architecture.

🔶The origin of the town hall dates back to the 15th century: it was erected in the period from 1439 to 1469 in front of the Gothic church of St. Peter. Later, in the 19th century, the building was restored, adding 236 statues to the facade.

🔶The statues on the town hall are located on several floors of the facade: The first level is occupied by famous citizens (philosophers, artists, etc.), the second accommodates figures of patron saints, and the third contains sculptures of Brabant rulers. Made of stone, they are located in consoles and niches.

text:
Peru 🇵🇪 , Lake Humantay  

🔶Lake or lagoon Humantay  for thousands of years was a place of pilgrimage of the ancient Incas and intrepid explorers. The greenish-blue pond fascinates with its beauty. It is located at an altitude of 4200 meters above sea level in the lowlands of the majestic Nevado Humantay mountain, covered with snow caps.

🔶The water in the lake is absolutely transparent, in the middle it has a blue or turquoise color, near the shores it becomes greener. The unusual color of the water is given by the minerals that are part of it. The depth of the lake is about 4 m . Colorful algae of different types are visible under the water. 

🔶Lake Humantay  is a popular tourist attraction in Peru. Organized groups of tourists from the city of Cusco regularly come here.

text:
Russia🇷🇺, Tver and Novgorod region, Lake Seliger

🔶Seliger is a magical lake country and a popular Central Russian resort located between Moscow and St. Petersburg.

🔶The complex-shaped water system is called the "blue necklace" of Central Russia. The total length of the coastline is about 500 km.
Depth — up to 24 m.

🔶Seliger, with its boundless water surface, forests sheltering the steep shores of islands, beaches under the crowns of pine trees, a mild healing climate, is in no way inferior to the most picturesque and famous lakes in Europe. Rest here is great at any time of the year. In the warm season, tourists go in for water sports, swim and sunbathe on sandy beaches near quiet water, fish, go on boats and overland on sightseeing tours to the historical and natural attractions of the lake district.

🔶On Lake Seliger, tourists are offered to stay in cozy houses surrounded by lush vegetation

text:
🏝️Thailand 🇹🇭, Phangan Island

🔶Phangan is a mountainous island belonging to the Kingdom of Thailand in the Gulf of Thailand, which has become famous all over the world thanks to the monthly Full Moon Party raging here. Tourists are also attracted to the remote tropical island by picturesque jungles, spectacular mountain landscapes, luxurious beaches and romantic bungalows, from which you can step right into the warm aquamarine waves of the Pacific Ocean.

🔶Mountainous terrain does not allow you to build your own airport on Phangan. Planes from Bangkok are received by the neighboring island of Koh Samui, from where high-speed catamarans run daily to the shores of Phangan.

🔶All 125 km2 of the territory of Phangan is covered with moist tropical forests climbing mountain ranges up to half a kilometer high. In places, the jungle gives way to slopes of coconut plantations. Small rivers flow from the mountains, forming several picturesque waterfalls.

text:
🌉USA 🇺🇸, Royal Gorge Bridge

🔶The Royal Gorge Bridge in Colorado is the tallest suspension bridge in the United States. Its length is 384 meters and its width is 5 meters. Impressive in its appearance is not only the bridge itself, but also its towers located on the edges of the cliff. Their height is 46 meters. 

🔶The two main support cables weigh 20 tons each and are a plexus of 2,100 individual cables. It took 1,292 wooden beams to build the spans. At the bottom, at a distance of 300 meters, there is an intermountain river. When walking, the bridge sways noticeably, because it does not have any supports in its middle.

🔶Until 2011, Royal Gorge was considered the highest bridge in the world. It was built in 1929 for only $350,000. The bridge stretches for as much as 384 meters across the majestic Royal Gorge Canyon of Colorado. At the bottom, 291 meters under the bridge, the Arkansas River flows, periodically carrying away brave rafting lovers downstream.

At the bottom, 291 meters under the bridge, the Arkansas River flows, periodically carrying away brave rafting lovers downstream.

text:
Spain🇪🇸, Barcelona, Park Guell

🔶Park Guell is a popular tourist attraction in Barcelona. Both tourists and locals like to come here on vacation. Gaudi Park is located in Barcelona on the Carmel Hill, its area is 17.2 hectares. The landmark was built in the first half of the last century, its author is Antonio Gaudi, and the customer is Eusebi Guell. The park complex is a huge territory with residential buildings, comfortable recreation areas, picturesque gardens, shady alleys, quaint terraces, bright flower beds, grottoes and gazebos. Today, the attraction is included in the list of the most beautiful places on the planet and is included in the list of UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

🔶Fabulous gingerbread houses, an amazing hall with columns, quaint alleys, winding benches and a magical mosaic – it's all gathered here, in one of the districts of Barcelona.

text:
Bulgaria 🇧🇬, Seven Rila Lakes

🔶The natural pearl of Bulgaria, the high-altitude Rila lakes are located at an altitude of 2100-2500 meters above sea level. The landscape around is unearthly: there is not too much greenery, mostly mountains — and, of course, the purest water, in which the sky is reflected. The lakes are glacial, so the water is very cold: you won't be able to hold your hand for a minute. In general, there is no question of bathing.

🔶The main system of the Rila lakes includes seven — Fish, Long, Shamrock, Gemini, Kidney, Eye and Tear. The tear is the highest and cleanest, the water is so transparent that it allows you to see far into the depths. The Lake of Eyes is perfectly oval in shape. The Kidney lake resembles this organ in shape. Gemini is the largest lake in the park. The shamrock also bears this name because of its shape. The shallowest lake is the Fish Lake, and the Bottom One is located below all of them.

text:
🌃USA 🇺🇸, Las Vegas

🔶"Sin City", "The World capital of Entertainment", "City of Lights", the fastest growing city in the USA, the largest American city founded in the XX century – Las Vegas has many unofficial nicknames and quite official titles.

🔶Numerous casinos, hotels, daily concerts and shows attract tourists from all over the world. In total, more than eighty casinos, several thousand gaming pavilions, and many fashionable hotels are concentrated on the territory of Las Vegas.

🔶The main attractions of Las Vegas are casinos, hotels and the whole atmosphere that makes up the soul of the city and forms its reputation.

🔶The dancing fountains in front of the Bellagio Hotel attract thousands of tourists every day. Water jets soar into the air at 73m . To really enjoy the spectacle, it is better to come in the evening, when the lights are turned on. Another popular entertainment is the "High Roller", a 168m high Ferris wheel, from which the whole city is visible!

text:
⛰️Peru 🇵🇪, Huascaran

🔶Huascaran National Park is a natural park of the Peruvian Andes zone, the most famous natural attraction of the Ancash region, Peru.

🔶The park is located on the territory of two very contrasting mountain ranges, which can be seen even by their name — Cordillera Blanca, which means White Cordillera, so named because of the abundance of tall peaks covered with eternal snow and Cordillera Negra, that is, the Black Cordillera.

🔶In 1985, UNESCO included this park in the List of Natural Heritage of Mankind. There are several walking routes of different difficulty categories on its territory, both for professional climbers and for ordinary mortals — lovers of trekking, hiking and horseback riding.

🔶In total, 663 glaciers, 296 lakes and 41 rivers are concentrated in the park on an area of 3,400 km2. The most spectacular and picturesque of its many lakes are Llanganuco and Paron.

text:
Russia🇷🇺 , Dagestan, Sarykum Dune

🔶The Sarykum dune in Dagestan is an amazing natural phenomenon. This dune is recognized as the largest in Europe, it is equal in height to a 90-storey skyscraper. It has its own microclimate, a unique ecosystem has developed. A ladder with metal and wooden surfaces equipped with handrails is laid along the slope of the sandy hill. Stairs are arranged on steep sections. From the top there are picturesque panoramas of the rocky foothills of the Caucasus, a view of the vast steppe valley and the coast of the Caspian Sea.

🔶The area of the dune is about 4 km2, length and width — 3 and 2 km, respectively, height above sea level — 262 m.

text:
Turkey🇹🇷, Gainyuk Canyon

🔶The Goynuk Canyon is one of the most attractive sights of Turkey, along with Pamukkale, created by nature. Traveling to it can be compared to visiting another planet with an unknown and mysterious world, unusual shapes and shades. The gorge is very popular with tourists who come to rest in Antalya and the nearest cities.

🔶The Goynuk Canyon in Turkey is a narrow gorge no more than 6 meters wide and up to 350 meters high. It has a length of 14 kilometers, ending in the spurs of Beidaglara. At the bottom of the canyon flows the river of the same name, which carved such an amazing gorge in the rock. In some places, its depth can reach up to 6 meters.

🔶Gorges of this size are quite rare for Asia Minor and Europe. 

The nearest settlement:
Kemer – 7 kilometers.

text:
🏝️Seychelles🇸🇨, Praslin Island

🔶Praslin is the second largest island of the Seychelles, located in the Indian Ocean, 44 km northeast of Mahe. Magnificent clean beaches, a unique rain forest and the small number of cities where 7.5 thousand people live make the island an ideal place for a secluded luxury holiday.

🔶There are tropical forests on the island, where rare birds live, such as the local Seychelles bulbul and black parrot. The Valle de Me Reserve, founded in 1979, is known for its unique coconut and vanilla orchids. One of the most famous British generals of the XIX century, Charles George Gordon, believed that the Valle de Mae was the Garden of Eden from the Bible.

🔶It is comfortable to rest on Praslin all year round, as the air warms up to +25...+27 ° C, and the water temperature does not fall below +23 ° C. Usually Praslin is less rainy than the neighboring Mahe, which is why it is more popular with tourists in winter.

text:
🏘️France🇫🇷, Antibes 

🔶Antibes is a resort on the French Riviera, cut into the Mediterranean surface by Cape Garoup on the stretch between Cannes and Nice. Against the background of its glamorous neighbors, Antibes is no longer so glossy and expressive, but this is nothing more than a first impression, which is little true. In fact, the commune is caressed by the attention of the cinematic beau monde no less than Cannes, and in terms of the number of billionaire yachts moored in the city marina, it has no equal at all.

🔶Vine–covered sandstone houses, winding streets with coffee shops and brasseries crowding on both sides, flea markets with mountains of old-school trifles - it is behind the glossy postcard atmosphere of old Provence that tourist caravans continue to drag in Antibes.

text:
🕌Morocco 🇲🇦, The City Of Marrakech

🔶Marrakech is the former capital of Morocco, a city known for its bazaars and festivals, hippies and criminals, devout worshippers and outcasts of the homeless, intellectuals and scientists. This is one of the most interesting cities in the world, a legendary place that, despite the influx of tourists, is still surrounded by an aura of mystery.

🔶Remote from Europe by a distance of only a short flight, Marrakech did not approach it in terms of lifestyle, remaining the same as it was during the Middle Ages. It's a city of commerce and... magic. The city is home to fire-eaters, reptile charmers, acrobats, predictors of the future. The motifs of the fairy tale "One Thousand and One Nights" seemed to be intertwined into one big picture in Marrakech.

text:
⛪Russia 🇷🇺, Kazan Cathedral

🔶Kazan Cathedral is one of the largest churches in St. Petersburg. It was built on Nevsky Prospekt in 1801-1811. After the Patriotic War of 1812, it acquired the significance of a monument of Russian military glory. In 1813, the commander Kutuzov was buried here and the keys to the captured cities and other military trophies were placed. 
 
🔶In 1932, during the Soviet era, it was turned into a Museum of the History of Religion and Atheism. Since 2000 — the cathedral of the St. Petersburg Diocese of the Russian Orthodox Church.  
 
🔶The cathedral gave the name to Kazan Square, Kazan Street, Kazan Island in the Neva Delta and Kazan Bridge.

text:
Great Britain 🇬🇧, Beachy Head Cape

🔶Beachy Head Cape is the highest seaside chalk cliff in the UK (162 meters), a famous natural landmark in the vicinity of Eastbourne

🔶For a long time, the high cape was a landmark for English sailors, even mentioned in British folklore — the folk song Spanish Ladies.

🔶The Belle Tout lighthouse on the sea at the cape was built in 1831. The chosen location, rather unusual for a lighthouse, is actually explained simply: so that the fog and low clouds over the cape do not hide the light of the lighthouse.

🔶The chalk cape Beachy Head managed to light up in a whole galaxy of British films: in "Bond" and the fourth Harry Potter film, "Brighton Rock" in 2010 and other famous films.

🔶Currently, the cape remains a popular tourist destination, which also includes a visit to the Seven Sisters Cliffs.

text:
⛰️China 🇨🇳, Fanjing Shan Mountain

🔶Fanjing shan Mountain is located in the Chinese province of Guizhou and it is at the same time a sacred place for Chinese Buddhists, one of the most visited local attractions.

🔶Fanjing shan rises above other peaks, having an altitude of 2572 m above sea level. Therefore, this place is a rare case when you can look at the mountains from high.

🔶The forked peak rises almost 100 m above the mountain itself, and at the very top there are two small Buddhist temples. The Buddha Temple and the Maitreya Temple were built about 5 centuries ago, but, of course, have already been completely redone.

🔶The authorities have introduced a limit on visiting the attraction - 23.8 thousand tourists per day. During the day, people literally steam train up the ancient steep stairs. Sometimes it's difficult to even stop to rest here - the stairs are narrow, and people are propping up from below, so you have to go without stopping.

text:
🌃USA 🇺🇸, Chrysler Building

🔶The Chrysler Building is one of the most famous buildings in New York, which rises in the eastern part of Manhattan. This powerful and majestic structure rightfully ranks second in the ranking of the highest buildings in the city. 

🔶The construction of the 77-storey building was successfully completed on May 27, 1930. From that moment until the 50s, the headquarters of the Chrysler corporation was located in the skyscraper, on the very last floors there were extensive apartments of the owner of the corporation - Walter Chrysler.

🔶The walls of the 31st floor of the building are lined with white and gray bricks. The next ledge appears on the 61st floor, on it towering eagle heads of incredible size and facing all four directions of the world. They are designed to protect Chrysler from its competitors. The upper floors are in a steel crown, which smoothly turns into a spire.

text:
Peru 🇵🇪, Colca Canyon

🔶The fame of Colca Canyon is booming both in South America and around the world, suffice it to say that it was even nominated for the contest of the New Seven Wonders of Nature, but did not reach the final. The depth of the Stake surpasses even the American Grand Canyon, and almost twice, its depth ranges from 1000 to 3400 meters.

🔶Colca Canyon appeared as a result of seismic activity of nearby volcanoes — Sabankaya and Ualka-Ualka. Interestingly, the walls of Colca Canyon are not positioned as vertically downwards as those of the Grand Canyon.

🔶The most spectacular part of the canyon is, of course, the Mirador Cruz del Condor observation deck, where you can admire the flights of condors.

 🔶From the observation deck of the Cruz del Condor, an unforgettable view of the canyon opens, at the bottom of which, at a depth of 1200 meters, the Colca River flows, and on the opposite side, Misty Mountain rises above the cliff.

text:
Croatia 🇭🇷, "The Eye of the Earth"

🔶Lake Glavaševo is a small reservoir of karst origin 7 kilometers from the town of Vrlik. It is located near the village of Cetina, in the Sibenik-Knin district in southern Croatia. The lake has an unusual appearance, which is why it is often called the "Eye or Eye of the Earth". Like other karst reservoirs, Glavaševo is filled with very clear water, through which a deep cave is clearly visible. There is no sand on the bottom, only soft calcareous deposits that give the water an azure hue.

🔶Since 1971, the "Eye of the Earth" has been included in the list of national natural monuments of Croatia and is under state protection.

🔶Many sources indicate that the depth of Lake Glavaševo asevo is about 150 meters, but this is not entirely true. The speleologists of the Croatian Institute of Nature were unable to determine the exact depth, but they managed to explore the bottom up to 155 meters.

text:
Spain 🇪🇸, Montjuic Mountain

🔶Montjuic Mountain is part of the Collserola mountain range, a spur of the Catalan coastal Range in southeastern Spain. The height of Montjuic is 177.7 m . This famous hill dominates the port of Barcelona. Around the mountain is one of the 10 administrative districts of the city – Sants-Montjuic. Landscape parks have been planned here, ornamental gardens have been planted, numerous historical and architectural monuments, museums, art galleries, theaters, and outstanding sports facilities are located. Today Montjuic Mountain is the center of Barcelona's attractions.

🔶The architectural dominant of Montjuic hill is the castle bearing the name of the mountain. This mighty fortress was built in 1640 and significantly expanded in 1751.

🔶There are many view terraces on the slopes of Montjuic Mountain, the most popular viewport is Mirador del Alcalde.

text:
Italy 🇮🇹, Valdaora, Alpin Panorama Hubertus Hotel

🔶The Alpin Panorama Hubertus Hotel in the Italian resort of Valdaora is designed as one large chalet, and in its end part there is an elongated swimming pool standing on wooden "legs". The height is small — the 4th floor, but the landscape views of the valleys and mountains - you will swing, and there is a transparent insert in the bottom.

🔶The Alpin Panorama Hubertus Hotel is located in a 5,000 sq.m park. 

🔶The largest roof terrace in Valdaora is located in the Alpin Panorama Hubertus Hotel. From here you can enjoy breathtaking views of the Dolomites and the Vedrette di Ries mountain range.

🔶The town of Valdaora is part of the Kronplatz resort, and this is another attractive resort in the Dolomites in the Pustertal Valley near the Austrian border, also part of the largest ski region Dolomiti Superski.

text:
Irish🇮🇪, Dingle Peninsula

🔶The Dingle Peninsula in the southwestern part of Ireland is the northernmost of the five peninsulas that jut into the waters of the Atlantic like the fingers of a hand, and Cape Dunmore Head is known as the westernmost point of the mainland of Ireland. On each of the peninsulas there are mountain ranges, and on the Dingle Peninsula there are Sliv Mish Mountains. The highest peak is Brandon with a height of 953m, the second highest peak in Ireland.

🔶The peninsula is known for its magnificent landscapes and stunning monuments of the early Christian era, Iron Age fortifications and picturesque gorges. Dingle is a wonderfully located village at the foot of Ballysitterach Mountain. Fishing boats are still going to the harbor, which is almost closed by us, so we can consider the village an ideal base for exploring the antiquities on the peninsula. The main attraction is the dolphin Fangi, who has been living in the bay since 1984.

text_entities.text:
Irish🇮🇪, Dingle Peninsula

🔶The Dingle Peninsula in the southwestern part of Ireland is the northernmost of the five peninsulas that jut into the waters of the Atlantic like the fingers of a hand, and Cape Dunmore Head is known as the westernmost point of the mainland of Ireland. On each of the peninsulas there are mountain ranges, and on the Dingle Peninsula there are Sliv Mish Mountains. The highest peak is Brandon with a height of 953m, the second highest peak in Ireland.

🔶The peninsula is known for its magnificent landscapes and stunning monuments of the early Christian era, Iron Age fortifications and picturesque gorges. Dingle is a wonderfully located village at the foot of Ballysitterach Mountain. Fishing boats are still going to the harbor, which is almost closed by us, so we can consider the village an ideal base for exploring the antiquities on the peninsula. The main attraction is the dolphin Fangi, who has been living in the bay since 1984.

text:
China 🇨🇳, Tongtian Road (Heavenly Highway)

🔶There are really scary roads in this world. If there was an official list of such roads, then the Street to Heaven would occupy the first place in it. It rises from a height of 200 m to 1300 m above sea level.

🔶It is not surprising that the construction of the road, which began to be built in 1998, took eight years. Its steep turns are definitely not for the faint of heart. The road goes up the Tianmen Mountain.

🔶In China, this road is better known as the 99 Turns road, a mountain serpentine leading to the Heavenly Gates. The name of the road was given to 99 steep bends-turns of the highway on the way to this famous natural phenomenon.

🔶The road was built to help tourists get from the foot of the mountain to its top and the Tianmen Cave.

text:
💐Netherlands🇳🇱, Keukenhof Flower Park

🔶The Royal Keukenhof Flower Park, also called the Garden of Europe, is the national pride of the Netherlands and one of the main attractions of the country, included in all tourist guides and reference books as a must—visit place. However, this can be done only in the spring and for only two months.

After the Second World War, Dutch flower exports brought the main income to the treasury and private farms.

The park received its first guests in 1949 on the initiative of the Mayor of Lisse, who invited exporters to show their products in one place under the open sky. In 2018, the Dutch flower show was visited by 1.4 million people from 100 countries.

Gardeners form bright flower beds, annually plant more than 7 million tulips, crocuses, daffodils, freesias, hyacinths, lilies, irises, carnations and orchids. The blossoming buds fill the air with delicate aromas, and the variety of shapes and colors is amazing.

text:
Bahamas🇧🇸, Dean's Blue Hole

🔶The Bahamas is known not only for its islands, beautiful scenic nature and comfortable rest, but also for a Blue Hole called Dina. It owes its name to the owner of nearby lands.

🔶Dean's Blue Hole is located in the waters of Long Island (near Clarence Town).

🔶Blue holes are commonly called vertical karst caves, which are located well below sea level.

🔶The length of the Blue Hole is 202 meters. Its diameter at the surface is 25-35 meters. From about 20 meters deep, it begins to expand to a hundred meters.

🔶This unusual place is especially attractive for divers and freedivers (divers who dive into the water without scuba gear, while holding their breath).

text:
Montenegro, The City of Budva

🔶Budva is a resort town in Montenegro, located in the central part of the Adriatic coast of the country. Founded 2500 years ago, the city of Budva is one of the most ancient settlements on the shores of the Adriatic.

🔶Budva is divided into an Old and a New city. The Old Town is a picturesque historical part of Budva, with a fortress and old streets, located at the northern tip of the bay. Most of the hotels, cafes and restaurants are located in the New City, and the famous Slavic Beach is located right there. The main resort street — a promenade with a large number of cafes, restaurants, clubs and discos — stretches parallel to the embankment. 

🔶In the coastal waters of Budva is the island of St. Nikola, to which boats regularly ply, transporting beach lovers.

🔶Today Budva is one of the most popular resort and entertainment centers in Montenegro, the main city of the Budva Riviera, an important tourist center of the country.

messages.text:
Jamaica 🇯🇲, Seven Mile Beach
Once in Jamaica, you will definitely want to visit the famous "Seven Mile Beach". Year after year, this beach in Negril is awarded a rating of one of the ten best in the world.
Seven Miles Beach in Negril is a classic of the Caribbean, and undoubtedly the best beach in the west of Jamaica. Hippies began to settle in it in the 1960s, but since then Negril has quickly gained popularity in the tourist environment, not least thanks to the coral reefs, which are just a stone's throw from the beach. 
Recently, the development of resorts here has been limited in order to preserve the natural beauty of Negril.

messages.text:
Spain 🇪🇸, Ronda City
Ronda is a city in the south of Spain in the province of Malaga. It is located on a cliff around the deep El Tahoe Gorge, through which an impressive bridge has been built. Ronda is one of the most beautiful cities in Andalusia, a colorful ancient tapestry woven from threads of winding streets, ancient white houses and picturesque landscapes. The landscape, atmosphere, history and legends make this cradle of bullfighters and artists so unique.
The city stands in a mountainous area at an altitude of about 750 m above sea level. The Guadalevin River divides it in half and forms the steep El Tahoe Canyon, over which the town is built.
Puente Nuevo  is an impressive stone bridge, one of the symbols of the Ronda. It was built at the end of the 18th century and connected the Mercadillo district and the old town. The bridge offers a beautiful view of the El Tahoe Gorge.
Rhonda encourages a leisurely stroll through its ancient streets, exploring every detail of this ancient Moorish city.

text:
🏰Belgium 🇧🇪, Walzin Castle

🔶Walzin Castle is located in the village of the same name about 40 km south of Namur and 7 km south of Dinant, it is built on a rock above the river Les.

🔶This is one of the largest castles in Belgium, it was erected in the 11th century by the Bishop of Liege Ditvin (Theodwin) of Bavaria as an observation and defensive point. Since the owners of the castle occupied important posts and constantly participated in military conflicts, the fortress was often besieged, captured and destroyed.

🔶The castle was restored twice: the first time in 1881 (architect Emile Jean le) and in 1930-1932 (Olivier Flano). After the restoration work, the fortress acquired the romantic look that is now widely known.

🔶Because of the inspiring-romantic look that is displayed in works of art and literature, Walzin is sometimes called the Belgian Neuschwanstein. The castle can only be admired from afar, since access to it is closed.

text:
⛰️New Zealand🇳🇿, Mount Cook National Park

🔶This park, also known as Aoraki, no less than Arthur's Pass, conveys the spirit of a real Alpine area - there is no escape from high snow—capped peaks, glaciers and snowfields. The park is named after the highest mountain in New Zealand — Mount Cook with a height of 3754 meters, on which Sir Edmund Hillary trained before conquering Jomolungma. 

🔶In total, there are 23 peaks in this National Park, exceeding 3 kilometers in height. One of the attractions is the Tasman Glacier, reaching 27 kilometers in length.

🔶The starting point for tourists is the village of Aoraki, through which Highway 80 passes. Near the village there is a picturesque lake Pukaki. In total, 17 huts are equipped here for the needs of park guests, designed mainly for climbers.

text:
🏝️Fiji🇫🇯, Taveuni Island

🔶Taveuni Island is considered one of the most picturesque islands of Fiji, many travelers know it by its unofficial name – "The world capital of soft corals". 

🔶It is located in the Pacific Ocean in the Vanua Levu island group. The nearest mainland, Australia, is about 3000 km away. The history of the island is full of legends about adventurers of the 19th century who came here in search of exotics, sandalwood and sexual fantasies. These are stories of shipwrecks, romantic love and tragic deaths.

🔶The main feature of the island remains its unique nature, it attracts ecotourism fans from all over the world. Fans of water sports also like to relax here. Walking through picturesque places, observing representatives of the local fauna, fun beach activities and exciting excursions are just a few of the leisure activities available to guests of the island.

text:
Denmark🇩🇰, Faroe Islands, Mulafossur Waterfall

🔶Take a look at the most iconic attraction of the Faroe Islands – the majestic Mulafossur waterfall, falling from a bright green cliff into the boiling ocean from a 30-meter height. Thanks to the towering cliffs and the charming village of Gasadalur with grass roofs, it is impossible to imagine a more fantastic sight.

🔶Gasadalur is located on the western side of Vagar Island. The unspoilt valley where you will find this village is a must-visit place in the Faroe Islands.

🔶Until 2004, the residents of this village had to walk a 400-meter mountain to get home, and the local postman made this journey three times a week. The Faroese government, as part of its policy to support and preserve remote settlements, laid a tunnel to this village, which became a great gift for all 16 residents of the village and especially for the postman.

text:
USA 🇺🇸, Lake Powell

🔶Lake Powell is not a natural lake. It was formed above a dam with a power plant blocking the Colorado River. The Colorado flows through soft limestone rocks, forming canyons in many places. The largest and most famous of them is the Grand Canyon. But there are others, for example, located next to Page Glen Canyon. It follows the Colorado riverbed, and numerous tributary canyons flow into it. The water in Lake Powell is bright blue, the sky above the lake is bright blue. Incredible landscapes, numerous fjords flowing into the main canyon, small sandy beaches hidden behind rocks, caves, arches, silence and tranquility make this place ideal for relaxing on a boat or yacht. The relative remoteness from densely populated areas does not contribute to a too rapid influx of tourists, which also adds charm to this place. 
 
🔶Here you can rent a motor boat, yacht or scooter and spend the day on the water.

text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Altai, Kucherlinsky lake

🔶One of the largest Altai reservoirs has glacial origin and is famous for its amazing turquoise hue. It is located at an altitude of 1.7 km above sea level at the foot of Belukha. It stretches for 4.8 km in length, 0.75 km in width. It is surrounded by picturesque rocks of the Katun ridge, slopes densely overgrown with greenery descend to the shores.

🔶In clear weather, mountain peaks and majestic forests are reflected in the mirror surface. Sparkling streams run down from the ledges into the water. In the vicinity there are roe deer, snow leopards, mountain goats. Below Kucherlinsky stretches a small lake Kichinek, above – Orokol. These places are characterized by a sharp change in the weather, even in summer snow can fall. You need to take warm clothes and comfortable shoes with you.

messages.text:
Canada 🇨🇦, Lake Moraine

🔶Moraine Lake is considered one of the most recognizable places in Canada, it is located on the territory of Banff National Park, in the Valley of Ten Peaks and belongs to the province of Albert. Tourists are attracted here by stunning nature and picturesque landscapes.

🔶Lake Moraine has a glacial origin, is considered the most beautiful in Canada and is one of its "business cards". It is located at an altitude of 1885 m above sea level, thanks to which there is mountain clean air. This reservoir has a relatively small size – its surface covers an area of 0.5 sq. km, and the maximum depth reaches 14 m.

🔶Lake Moraine is fed by a glacier, so it is fully filled only by mid-June. At this time, the water acquires a rich blue color, while a variety of shades are visible in it, which are formed due to the refraction of sunlight on the stone bottom of the reservoir.
