messages.text:
Yemen🇾🇪, Socotra Island

🔶Socotra Island is the largest land area of the archipelago of the same name, located in the northwestern part of the Indian Ocean on the territory of Yemen. The main city on the island is the settlement of Hadeibo (Hadibo). The name "Socotra" comes from Sanskrit and means "Island of Happiness".

🔶Socotra Island is 130 km long and 40 km wide. The central and eastern parts of it are dominated by pointed mountains. The highest of them is Hajar (1570 meters). There are mountain tourist routes that can be shown to travelers by one of the local guides. The hills alternate with real green oases of the plains, which stretch along the coast and at the foot of the peaks. 
 
🔶In general, the landscapes of Socotra are very diverse: limestone plateaus, steep cliffs, lush palm groves and deserted tropical beaches washed by salty waves. This is a great place for hiking, camping, water sports.

messages.text:
🏝️India🇮🇳, Kerala, Varkala Beach

🔶Varkala Beach is located near the resort settlement of the same name, which is part of the Indian state of Kerala. This place is not as famous as Goa. And in vain — Varkala beach today does not differ much from fashionable resorts: it has all the necessary infrastructure and entertainment.

🔶This place has several features that are associated with the Indian mentality. For example, it is difficult to find night establishments in Varkala: even restaurants and bars are closed mostly until midnight. But all this covers the opportunity to practice yoga, swim in healing springs and visit a salon where they do a real Ayurvedic massage.

🔶Since the sea in the area of Varkala beach is restless, this place is not suitable for children's recreation in the best way. Safety is monitored from morning to evening by rescuers who point tourists to places with dangerous currents. By the way, the cleanliness of the beach is monitored here, which is not typical for India.

messages.text:
🏰France🇫🇷, Carcassonne Fortress

🔶Carcassonne Fortress is a medieval citadel located in the French city of the same name. It stands in the old part of the city, on the right bank of the Od River. This is one of the most interesting fortresses in Europe. Around it there is a double row of fortress walls, about 3 km long, over which 52 towers rise. At one time, Carcassonne fortress was considered the most impregnable in Europe. On its territory are the Count's castle of Komtal and the Basilica of St. Nazarius and Celsius. Since 1997, the fortress has been included in the UNESCO World Heritage List.

🔶Carcassonne Fortress looks especially impressive from a distance, when the view can completely cover the entire scale and grandeur of the architectural structure.

messages.text:
Morocco🇲🇦, The City of Shefshauen

Chefchaouen is a city in Morocco, located near Tangier. It is known for its architecture and the fact that the vast majority of the walls of buildings in it are painted in various shades of blue and light blue. It was founded at the end of the XV century as a mountain refuge for Moors and Jews who were expelled from Spain by the decision of the Catholic kings. The striking Old Town is one of the most beautiful in Morocco: there are unique houses painted in a light blue shade, and artisans on the narrow streets, as before, sell traditional goods, including embroidered clothes, carpets, leather goods, ceramics and copper dishes.
The surrounding countryside is very picturesque, natural springs abound here, clouds float very low above the ground, and sheep graze on meadows strewn with wild flowers.

messages.text:
Spain 🇪🇸, Mila House

The Mila House is one of the most striking creations of Antonio Gaudi in Barcelona. The attraction, located at the intersection of Passech de Gracia Boulevard with Carrer de Provensa Street, attracts attention with smooth curves, imitation of the sea element, a delicate balance between lightness and bulkiness.

The object owes its name to its customers: magnate Pere Mila-i-Caps and his wife turned to Gaudi with a request to build a house for them that will amaze and surprise.

Implemented in 1906-1910, the project was innovative in all respects. First of all, it concerned his forms. Gaudi remained true to his unique style. The facade of the Casa Mila is devoid of straight lines, corners - it seems to flow and shimmer. This effect was achieved thanks to the smooth bending, turning into one another, round and elliptical shapes, as well as decorative grids in the form of seaweed.

The roof is supported by arched arches made of brick – there are 270 of them in total.

messages.text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Baikalsk, Pomegranate beach

There is an unusual beach on the outskirts of the city of Baikalsk in the Irkutsk region. Garnet he was nicknamed because of the unusual red-maroon shade of sand - this is the color of sand due to the fact that it contains the natural mineral garnet almandine.

Pomegranate Beach stretches for several kilometers, but its width is only 5 m. Baikal is splashing on one side of the beach, and there is a swamp on the other. It is good to walk here and enjoy the views, as well as take pictures.

However, according to local residents, over time there is less and less red sand and it gradually mixes with yellow, thereby losing its hue. It is best to come here at sunset — in the rays of the setting sun, the sand acquires a rich red color.

messages.text:
Italy 🇮🇹, Atrani
Atrani is a fishing village with a population of less than a thousand people. He lurked on the border of steep cliffs and the coast of the Tyrrhenian Sea near the cities of Pompeii and Naples. Its colorful houses rise in rows above a beautiful stretch of pristine beach and turquoise sea. It is one of the most idyllic and picturesque cities in Italy.
 
It seems that Atrani does not change with time. You can climb the steps from the beach and wander through the narrow winding streets. There you will find churches of the thirteenth century and squares with fountains. Listen to the bell ringing from the sixteenth century tower as it rings and interrupts the silence of the siesta. Think about life at a cafe table in Piazza Umberto, the main square of the city. If you have a strange feeling of deja vu, don't be surprised yet. The picturesque streets of the city and the stunning coast have appeared in many films.

messages.text:
Brazil 🇧🇷, Lencois-Maranensis Park

A unique park of Brazil, located on the Atlantic coast of the northern part of the country, in the state of Maranhão, southeast of San Jose Bay, between the bay and the mouth of the Fomi River. 
 
This is one of the most mysterious places on the planet. The vast flat territory of the park is covered with huge sand dunes reaching up to 40 m in height. During the rainy season (300 times more precipitation will fall here than in the famous Sahara), water accumulates between the dunes, forming many lagoons that create a landscape of unique beauty – turquoise, green and blue mirrors of lakes among snow-white velvety sands. 
 
This fantastic landscape stretches over an area of more than 1.5 thousand km2, it extends almost 270 km inland, and the length of the dunes along the coastline is about 44 km.

messages.text:
China 🇨🇳, Zhongshuge Bookstore

The Dujiangyan Zhongshuge bookstore in Dujiangyan, China, with an area of about 975 square meters, was designed by Li Xiang, founder of the Shanghai architectural studio X + Living, and opened in the fall of 2020. The designers used elements such as spiral staircases, curved arches and numerous mirrors to create a stunning illusion of infinity. Just look at the interior photos to feel the otherworldly world of this place.

Large, arched walnut bookshelves dominate the space, but this is an endless illusion created by the mirrored ceiling and shiny black tiles. It is done so flawlessly that even knowing the secret of the illusion, it is still impossible to see where the real sticks begin and where they end.

messages.text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Sakhalin, Iturup Island, Yankito Lava Plateau

The Yankito lava plateau was formed after the eruption of the Bogdan Khmelnitsky volcano and is located right at its foot. These are the bizarre rocks formed, thanks to the volcano. By the way, Bogdan Khmelnitsky is active, but he is not active now.

The stones are rough to the touch, with an interesting texture and with sharp ends, have a brownish-red color, and some even grow flowers. The shape of the rocks is also amazing, something resembles a throne, something flowers - just look and the imagination will come up with a lot of interesting things.

Lava rocks go into the sea, and when you come to their cliff, you will see a fascinating sight. In good windless weather, you can go down, swim and even jump from the lava itself.

In a strong storm and wind, you will not be able to go down, but you can watch how huge waves break on the rocks, reaching the very top.

messages.text:
Romania 🇷🇴, Bigar Waterfall

One of the most mysterious, picturesque, unusual and unique natural corners of Romania can be called the Bigar waterfall.

The Bigar Waterfall is part of the Romanian Beushnitsa National Park, which is visited by a large number of tourists. And of course, Bigar is the most popular place among most visitors, who are sure to take pictures near it and admire the beautiful sight.

The area where the waterfall is hidden is called Karas-Severin, in western Romania.

The Minis River flowing here suddenly meets an obstacle on its way – a rock made of calcareous tuff completely covered with moss, its waters envelop this rock and smoothly flow down in silvery streams from an 8-meter height back into the river. The flowing water becomes like an elegant curtain. Thus, a clear border of the waterfall is created, and such a cozy grotto is formed inside it. This is the cascading waterfall Bigar. And it all looks fantastically beautiful!

messages.text:
Venezuela 🇻🇪, Margarita Island, Pampatar Salt Marsh

The Pampatar Salt Marsh is one of the most impressive landscapes on Margarita Island in Venezuela thanks to the various shades of flowers that appear here during sunrise and sunset.

The name Pampatar comes from the salt plain, which was discovered by the Indians and which in the Guaikeri language is pronounced as Pampatar and means Salt Village.

Today, this place is not commercial, salt is not mined here. Because for Venezuelans, this is just a gift from the sorceress of nature, a place to enjoy beautiful landscapes. The mineralization process takes place here all the time and it affects the color of the water. Here you can observe transitions from crystal clear water to a rich blue color, and then transitions from bright red to crystal white. This color appears when the salt hardens and is ready for use.

messages.text:
French Polynesia 🇵🇫, Moorea Island

Moorea Island is one of the windward islands of the "Society Islands" archipelago in French Polynesia in the Pacific Ocean, located 17 km northwest of Tahiti.

 Translated from Polynesian, its name means "yellow lizard". If you look from a bird's-eye view, the shape of the Moorea resembles a triangle, but for people with even more imagination, it seems that it looks like a heart. Therefore, it has become a popular venue for weddings and honeymoons. This is really a paradise for lovers.

There are cozy and quiet coves, gentle lagoons, soft beaches and turquoise waters of the Pacific Ocean. You can go scuba diving near the coast, explore the coral reefs that nature has decorated the coastal waters of Moorea or feed the sharks.

The highest point of the Moray Eel is the peak of the Town Hall Mountain, which rises 900 meters above sea level. The island occupies 133.50 km2 and is home to about 14 thousand people.

messages.text:
France🇫🇷, The Marqueissac gardens

The Marquessac Garden is located in the Dordogne Valley in the middle of the small communes of La Roque-Gajac and Benac-et-Kaznac in France.

More than 20 hectares of the garden amaze guests and tourists for almost three hundred years.

6 kilometers of shady paths, many hundred-year-old box trees trimmed by gardeners, belvedere, fountains and ponds, emerald glades, a Gothic chapel, gazebos and century-old oaks.

The XVIII century castle has a terrace. On it, guests will see hundreds of well-groomed box trees and cypresses. The curves of boxwood trees repeat the rounded hills surrounding the garden.

After passing by the terrace, visitors will get to the belvedere. From here you can see a panorama of the river, whose waters run 130 meters below. The observation deck, designed by Julien de Serval, offers a view of the entire Dordogne Valley.

Julien de Serval inherited the estate in 1861 and turned it into a real work of art.

messages.text:
Turkey 🇹🇷, Pamukkale

Pamukkale (Turkey) is a unique natural site located in the southwestern part of the country, 16 km from the city of Denizli. The exclusivity of the area lies in its geothermal sources formed among travertine deposits. Translated from Turkish, Pamukkale means "Cotton Castle", and this name perfectly reflects the appearance of the attraction. The object, which has no analogues in the whole world, is under the protection of UNESCO and annually attracts hundreds of thousands of tourists vacationing in the resorts of Turkey.

Pamukkale photos in Turkey have managed to fascinate millions of travelers and every year continue to attract more and more curious travelers to the sights. An intricate natural complex combined with antique buildings becomes a real tourist treasure.

messages.text:
Puerto Rico 
🇵🇷, Culebra Island, Flamenco beach

Flamenco Beach is a beach on the Caribbean island of Culebra. It is known for its shallow turquoise waters, white sand, swimming spots and diving spots. It stretches for a mile around a sheltered bay in the shape of a horseshoe. Playa Flamenco is a popular place for beach holidays both on the island of Culebra and in Puerto Rico. 

In March 2014, Flamenco Beach took 3rd place among the best beaches in the world according to TripAdvisor Travelers' Choice Award.

Off the coast of Flamenco, about a quarter of a mile away, there is a reef where the surf breaks. Flamenco is characterized by white sand and shallow water with clear water.

Culebra Island in Puerto Rico has always been famous for its stunning white beaches and wildlife, but shortly before World War II, the US Navy used the picturesque island to test the skills of soldiers, leaving behind several tanks that are still rusting on a tropical Flamenco beach.

messages.text:
USA 🇺🇸, Golden Gate Bridge

The Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco is one of the most recognizable and beautiful bridges in the world. It is known for its bright coloring and light, as if floating in the air, construction. The bridge connects the city of San Francisco, located in the north of the peninsula of the same name, and Marin County, near Sausalito. The Golden Gate serves as the main thoroughfare of Northern California, and is also known as a bright landmark of the USA. For a long time, or rather from 1937 to 1964, the Golden Gate Bridge was the longest suspension bridge in the world. Let this status has long been lost, but, nevertheless, the length of more than 2.7 km is quite impressive. Its mass is 894,500 tons. The width of the bridge is 27 meters, of which 19 m is given over to the roadway, and the sidewalks occupy 3 m. 
 
The height of the supports is 227 m above the water. The height of the roadway above the water surface at high tide is 67 meters.

messages.text:
Russia🇷🇺, Khakassia, Sayano-Shushenskaya HPP

The Sayano-Shushenskaya HPP is the largest operating hydroelectric power plant in the entire territory of the Russian Federation, built on the Yenisei River. It is also one of the ten most powerful power plants in the world. The whole complex consists of the SSHPP itself, the coastal spillway and the Main hydroelectric complex located downstream.

The name of the hydroelectric power station came from the Sayan Mountains and the village of Shushenskoye. The construction of this structure took 37 years. Downstream of the Yenisei River is the Sayano-Shushenskoye reservoir and the state Nature Reserve of the same name.

messages.text:
Italy 🇮🇹, Burano Island (Venice)

Burano is an island in the northern part of the Venetian Lagoon, located 11 km from Murano and Venice. This is one of the most picturesque places in Italy, famous for charming colorful houses, traditional lace and great cuisine. In fact, Burano is a fishing village with a population of about 2,000 people, thriving thanks to tourists from Venice who come here to buy lace, as well as photograph colorful houses and picturesque canals.

It is said that the tradition of painting houses on Burano in this way is connected with the heritage of the island as a fishing village - bright colors made it easier for returning fishermen to find their homes in the thick fog of the lagoon. There is also an opinion that Burano residents prefer bright paint as a separation, where one property ends and another begins.

messages.text:
UAE 🇦🇪, Dubai, Atlantis The Palm Hotel and Aquaventure Water Park

The Atlantis The Palm Hotel stands at the edge of its own beach, 1.4km long, on the very "top" of the artificial Palm Jumeirah Island. Aquaventure Water Park is located just 300m from here.

The hotel is the largest beach hotel in the UAE and is perfect for families and newlyweds, as well as for businessmen who have come to Dubai on a business visit.

The hotel has a lot of entertainment for every taste, which will appeal to both adults and children. The most vivid impressions await guests on the slides of the Aquaventure water park, in its own dolphinarium and in the Lost World aquarium, where over 65 thousand representatives of marine fauna live.

Aquaventure Water Park is one of the largest water parks in the world and the largest in the UAE.
The area of the Aquaventure water park, including all attractions and the beach area, is 17 hectares.
On the territory of the water park there are several dozen attractions, many of which are unique.

messages.text:
Australia 🇦🇺, Pools in the shape of an eight

In Australia, south of Sydney, namely in the Royal National Park, there are wonderful pools Figure 8 Pools. They formed naturally and have a shape resembling the number eight. 

This place is especially loved by tourists, but it is worth knowing that swimming here is not always safe. So, you should visit the pools only at low tide, otherwise you will be covered by a wave and you can suffer. 

For example, in January 2016, more than a hundred people were injured because they violated safety rules and came here at high tide.

In 2021, tourists spotted a shark in one of the pools. She probably got stuck in the pool when the tide came in, and couldn't swim back out into the ocean before low tide.

Port Jackson sharks are considered harmless to humans, although their teeth can cause a painful bite if you come into contact with them.

messages.text:
Saudi Arabia🇸🇦, Madain-Salih

Madain Salih is a pre-Islamic excavation site located in the Al-Madina region of Saudi Arabia.

The complex consists of 130 massive rock tombs and associated structures. During the heyday of the Nabataean Kingdom in the first century AD, these places were incorporated into the Roman Empire. This is one of the most outstanding examples of the construction of hydraulic structures of that time, as well as the most valuable historical heritage that has survived to our times.

During its heyday, the Nabataean kingdom extended from its capital, the city of Petra, to the present territory of Jordan deep into the Arabian Peninsula. Here lay the largest trade routes, along which spices, frankincense and other aromatic plants were transported. Madain Salih has reached its peak as the main transshipment point between the trade routes of the north and the south.

messages.text:
Switzerland🇨🇭, Bernese Highlands

To the south of the Swiss capital Bern, about an hour away by train, lies a vast mountainous area called the Bernese Highlands (Berner Oberland). The gateway to this beautiful country is the resort town of Interlaken (567 m above sea level) — a town located between two picturesque lakes — Thun and Brienz, and at the very foot of the Alpine peaks of the Oberland.

The beautiful nature of the region, mountains and lakes, summer and winter holidays, casinos and mineral waters and many other attractions - that's what attracts many tourists there.

In the Bernese Oberland there are majestic mountain peaks, along which the best routes for skiers are laid. They are adjacent to beautiful valleys that will appeal to all lovers of quiet walks.

messages.text:
China 🇨🇳, Li River

Lijiang, encircling Guilin, or simply "Li", is one of the cleanest rivers in China, the pearl of the Guilin landscape. And also one of the most beautiful water bodies on the planet. The source of the river is located 70 km north of Guilin in Xing'an County, near Cat Mountain (yes, there is one in China). The length of the river is more than 420 km .

It is possible to carry out an absolutely fantastic cruise with a length of about 50-80 km. What he saw leaves no one indifferent: the river, like a silk belt, meanders among thousands of unique hills and mountains, which, like a mirage, suddenly loom out of the fog and disappear again, as in a fairy tale. The mesmerizing beauty of these places attracted the attention of not only travelers, but also Hollywood cinematographers who shot the film "The Painted Veil" based on Somerset Maugham's novel "Patterned Veil" here.

It is also interesting what is around her. For many centuries, nature has formed bizarre mountains along the river.

messages.text:
Russia🇷🇺, Kabardino-Balkaria, Maiden Braids waterfall

The Chiranbashi-Suu waterfall (which means "maiden braids" in the Karachay-Balkar language) is one of the most beautiful waterfalls in the Elbrus region.

Water falling from a huge height (about 30 meters), beautifully "crumbles" in flight in long streams, resembling the hair of some local Circassian beauty. Such an unusual effect is due to the fact that the water flows here through particularly strong rocks — basalt rocks, where it fails to break even a small trough for itself. In fact, it falls vertically from smoothed rocks (they are called "sheep's foreheads" here), thus creating a magnificent cascade.

The width of the Chyranbashi-Suu water stream is almost 15 meters. The waterfall is "fueled" by Gara Bashi, a melting glacier, one of the 23 glaciers of Elbrus. Below, the water that has fallen from the slope flows into the Kara-suu River.

messages.text:
Indonesia🇮🇩, Kelimutu volcano

Kelimutu is a volcano in Indonesia with three colorful lakes, located on the island of Flores. The people of Indonesia consider this area a national treasure, and each of the three lakes has its own characteristics and its own color. Kelimutu is a popular tourist attraction. The last known eruption took place in 1968.

In many guidebooks to Indonesia, it is written that the bright colors of the Kelimutu lakes are explained by the deposits of certain minerals. On the one hand, this is true, but the color of water in lakes depends not least on the oxygen content. When there is not enough oxygen in the lake water, it appears green, on the contrary, when there is an excess of oxygen, the lakes turn a shade of dark red, almost black. Kelimutu Lakes are a stunning natural phenomenon that you simply cannot miss!

messages.text:
Singapore 🇸🇬, Marina Bay Sands

Marina Bay Sands is an integrated resort overlooking Marina Bay in the central area of Singapore. At the time of its opening in 2010, it was declared the most expensive stand-alone casino in the world worth $ 8 billion

The resort includes a hotel with 2561 rooms. Shops in the Marina Bay Sands mall, a museum, a large theater, restaurants, two crystal pavilions, art exhibitions and the world's largest casino with 500 tables and 1600 slot machines.

The Marina Bay Sands complex consists of three 58-storey towers. They, in turn, are connected by a single "deck" of the 57th floor, on which, in addition to the observation deck, there is also the world's largest Infinity Pool. In addition to the pool and observation deck, there are also several bars and lounge areas.

The Marina Bay observation deck is visited by about 3 thousand people daily.

The height of the observation deck is 200 m above the ground. Its area is about 12.4 thousand m2

messages.text:
Kazakhstan🇰🇿, Zailiyskiy Alatau

The Trans—Ili Alatau is a mountain range in the north-west of the Tien Shan (on the border of Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan). In the northern foothills is located the millionth city of Alma-Ata — the former capital of Kazakhstan. The famous Medeo sports complex and the high-altitude ski base of Cimbulak are also located here. 

The modern name "Trans-Ili Alatau" was adopted in 1865, when the famous traveler and geographer P. P. Semenov stopped at the crossing of the Ili River and saw a grandiose ridge that stretched beyond the river.

The Trans-Ili Alatau lies within four high-altitude zones. Up to 1600 m, forest-steppes and deciduous forests dominate here, where wild apple trees, apricots, aspen and mountain ash grow. Above – up to 2800 m – coniferous forests extend, consisting mainly of pyramidal Tianshan spruce. Above them lies a zone of alpine meadows, and from a height of 3500 meters, bare rocks and glaciers begin.

messages.text:
USA 🇺🇸, California, Yosemite National Park

Yosemite National Park in California is one of the most attractive natural places in the USA. One has only to look at the pictures taken by travelers, as soon as you want to see it all with your own eyes. 

Mesmerizing waterfalls, sheer cliffs, majestic mountain peaks, giant sequoias, vast meadows, picturesque lakes and rivers — you can't even list all the stunning sights, there are so many of them in the park. Its area is 3081 km2, it stretches on the western slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountain system, it is distinguished by a variety of flora and fauna.

In the national park you can find something to do at any time of the year — from active pastime to a relaxing holiday aimed at contemplating the local beauties.

The name of the park translates from Indian as a Big Grizzly bear, indeed, in addition to cute animals like squirrels and deer, bears can be found here.

messages.text:
Netherlands🇳🇱, Rijksmuseum

The Rijksmuseum is the main state museum of Amsterdam, one of the most famous art museums in the world, is among the top 20 most visited museums in the world. The museum is located on the Museumplein, next to the Van Gogh Museum and the Stedelijk Museum of Modern Art.

The building of the Rijksmuseum was opened to the public in 1885. About 2 million people visit the Rijksmuseum every year.

The Rijksmuseum collection illustrates the history of Holland from the Middle Ages to the present. In total, the museum's collection contains about 1 million pieces of art from 1200 to 2000. There are about 8000 exhibits on the 4 floors of the museum, in 80 halls.

The works in the Rijksmuseum are numerous works by Dutch masters of the XV—XIX centuries, the main of which are Rembrandt, Vermeer and Hals.

In addition to the art collection of paintings, the museum presents sculptures, archaeological finds, ancient artifacts, decorative and applied art, drawings, engravings and photographs.

messages.text:
Italy 🇮🇹, Saturnia thermal baths

In the Italian province of Grosseto in the south of Tuscany, there is one of the most beautiful and unique places in the world — the baths of Saturnia.

The Cascate del Mulino baths are open all year round. This is a great place for relaxation and wellness. The water temperature is kept within +37 ° C, which ensures comfortable bathing at any time of the year. Every year, tens of thousands of tourists rest at the Mill Waterfalls. During the day it is crowded there, so those who like privacy, it is better to visit the baths in the morning or in the evening.

Mill waterfalls are a multi-stage pool, looking at which it is difficult to believe that nature created it. The cascades of sulphurous waters originating in limestone rocks are truly beautiful. For centuries, water has flowed out of many reservoirs in the travertine rock. As a result, natural healing pools with clean water enriched with a high concentration of mineral salts and gases were gradually formed.

messages.text:
China🇨🇳, Danxia Landscape (Danxia Landform)

China has the Zhangye Danxia National Geopark, which is definitely among the top most unusual parks in the world. All thanks to the mountains, known for their bright colors.

The uniqueness of these mountains also lies in the fact that man did not affect their design in any way. All colors were formed by nature, and the process of their formation took millions of years.

Zhangye Danxia National Geopark is located in the north of China in Gansu Province. It covers an area of 510 km. In 2009, it was included in the UNESCO World Heritage List.

The colors we see today did not appear immediately. The process of their formation took about 24 million years. The main color is dark red. It was formed due to the fact that once there were many rivers in these mountains, and mudstones settled at their bottom.

Later, under the influence of other sedimentary rocks, new colors appeared, including yellow, green and gray. It took thousands of years to create each layer.

messages.text:
Russia 🇷🇺, The Heart of Chechnya Mosque

The Heart of Chechnya Mosque is one of the largest Muslim temples in Russia and around the world. The entire area of the temple premises is 5 thousand square meters. m. The mosque can accommodate up to 10 thousand people at the same time. The Muslim temple is named after Akhmat Kadyrov, the first president of the Chechen Republic. The mosque was opened in autumn 2008.

The main temple of the city is located in the center of Grozny, at the intersection of Hussein Isaev and V. V. Putin Avenues. The Sunzha River flows nearby. The mosque was built on the territory of a picturesque park with an area of 14 hectares.

In the interior of the temple there is a decor of white marble. The interior is decorated with paintings and traditional Chechen ornaments. Patterns and texts from the Koran were made with the help of gold dusting of the highest standard. Inside the temple there are 36 chandeliers made of bronze and gold of the highest standard.

messages.text:
Canada🇨🇦, Vancouver Island, Butchart Gardens

Fabulous Butchart Gardens spread out on Vancouver Island are visited by a huge number of tourists every year. Where the garden is now, there used to be a quarry from which limestone was extracted. The cultivation of flowers and the arrangement of the garden were taken up by Pim and Jenny Butcharts, Canadian industrialists. To begin with, the hollow was filled with fertile soil, thus leveling the surface for the future garden. The landscape was designed by master Isaburo Kishida. He created a harmonious landscape composition in the best Japanese traditions, adding in addition to herbs and plants, stones and water. On the same territory there is a Rose Garden, an Italian and a Mediterranean garden. Fountains and statues against the background of ancient trees and shrubs connected to each other by a network of paths and bridges. The floral rainbow of colors varies depending on the season, and the aromas of flowers are simply irresistible.

messages.text:
Tunis 🇹🇳, El Jem Amphitheater

The amphitheater of El Jem is a grandiose structure that has survived for almost two millennia. To show how rich the Roman city of Fisdre was, which lived by trading olive oil from the vicinity of the future El-Jam, in the II century A.D. proud mayors built this amphitheater, the second largest in the Roman world.

The amphitheater of El Jem was designed for 30k spectators.

In 238, an uprising broke out in Fesdra: large landowners rebelled against the new taxes of Rome. The imperial authorities reacted harshly, a significant part of the city was destroyed. But the amphitheater was damaged only in the XVII century, when Sultan Mohammed Bey ordered his troops to breach the walls with cannonballs to destroy the rebels who had settled there.

Inside, you can walk through the underground passages where slaves and gladiators were waiting for their "exit", or climb the theater rows and imagine how people and wild animals fought for their lives here for the amusement of the audience.

messages.text:
Brazil 🇧🇷, Copacabana Beach

Copacabana Beach is a strip of snow–white sand stretching for 4 km along the Atlantic Ocean at the entrance to Guanabara Bay, in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. This place in the 50s and 60s was popular with representatives of European bohemians, and later became an elite area populated by businessmen, politicians and simply wealthy people. It was at the peak of Copacabana's popularity that cafes, shops, casinos, upscale hotels and penthouses were built up. 

Being 5 km from the center of Rio, the Avenida Atlantica embankment is still of interest among visitors today. In high season, it is difficult to get to the water, but it is possible. To do this, you need to cross several volleyball courts, a football field and, stepping over the tanned bodies of cute Brazilian girls, finally reach the cool waters of the ocean.

messages.text:
Norway🇳🇴, Veringsfossen waterfall

Veringsfossen Waterfall is one of the most visited natural attractions in Norway. Its total height is 182 meters, while the height of the free fall of water is 145 meters. This creates an amazing impression: a huge stream and a picturesque rocky canyon covered with forests.

Geographically, the waterfall belongs to the city of Eidfjord in the county of Hordaland. The name Veringsfossen (in Norwegian Vøringsfossen) comes from the words "vyrða" ("respect") and "fossen" ("waterfall"). It is not difficult to guess that the locals respected the power of nature and the power of the water flow.

The waterfall is part of Norway's largest national park. The law protects both the area and its inhabitants. For example, the largest herd of wild reindeer that live in natural conditions is registered here. The National Park attracts thousands of tourists both in winter and summer.

messages.text:
Albania 🇦🇱, Tet Park

The Tet National Park (alb. Parku Kombëtar i Thethit) is undoubtedly one of the most beautiful natural attractions in Albania. 

The territory of the park is located in the North Albanian Alps at an altitude of 1200 - 2567 m above sea level.

Tet Park is a quiet and secluded place high in the mountains among the incredible natural silence because it is not easy to get to these beautiful places. This can be done only in favorable weather.  The road is quite heavy. Despite the fact that the distance from the city of Shkoder to the village of Tet is about 75 km, you will have to drive at least 4 hours. Firstly, the quality and tortuosity of the road will not allow you to get there faster, and secondly, you will often stop for short photo shoots, since the surrounding landscapes will not be able to leave you indifferent.

messages.text:
USA 🇺🇸, Antelope Canyon

Antelope Canyon is a complex of several independent canyons located in the northern part of Arizona near the border with Utah. "Antelopes" are the so—called "slit canyons" - narrow channels of bizarre geometry that have arisen as a result of erosion caused by seasonal floods and underground processes. Changes in lighting cause ever-changing variations in shapes and colors inside the canyon; it is one of the most frequently photographed places in the world. 
The depth of the "Lower Antelope" reaches 37 meters (approximately twelve floors), the length is 407 m. The variety of shades of stone — red, orange, purple — is explained by impurities of various iron oxides. 
The age of the Navajo sandstone rocks is 174-191 million years, but the canyons themselves were formed much later, only a few hundred years ago. Undoubtedly, the process of "canyon formation" continues now.

"Antelopes" are the so—called "slit canyons" - narrow channels of bizarre geometry that have arisen as a result of erosion caused by seasonal floods and underground processes. Changes in lighting cause ever-changing variations in shapes and colors inside the canyon; it is one of the most frequently photographed places in the world. 
The depth of the "Lower Antelope" reaches 37 meters (approximately twelve floors), the length is 407 m. The variety of shades of stone — red, orange, purple — is explained by impurities of various iron oxides. 
The age of the Navajo sandstone rocks is 174-191 million years, but the canyons themselves were formed much later, only a few hundred years ago. Undoubtedly, the process of "canyon formation" continues now.

messages.text:
Greece🇬🇷, Rhodes Island, Lindos

The town of Lindos is located on the southeastern side of the island of Rhodes, on Cape Crane. Lindos covers an area of almost 16.5 km2, and its population is only a little over 800 people. From the capital of the island, the city of Rhodes, the village will be separated by 40 km of road.

Lindos is recognized by UNESCO as a historical monument of global significance, and local authorities have restricted the construction of modern buildings to preserve its originality.

Getting to know this ancient Greek city is best to start with a walk through the narrow winding streets, many of which are deaf. In the tourist center, you can get a free map of the city, and although not all streets are signed on it, the probability of getting lost with it decreases. All the houses of Lindos are small, no higher than 2 floors, and traditionally painted white. On the ground floors of many of them there are shops and cozy cafes.

messages.text:
USA 🇺🇸, Montana, St. Mary's Lake

In the state of Montana, on the territory of Glacier National Park, there is a beautiful lake of St. Mary. The picturesque lake is located in the eastern part of the boundaries of the reserve and is one of the largest.

This is probably the most picturesque place. Panoramas of the lake, neatly placed between the mountains, seem fabulous. The gently sloping shore, where century-old trees scatter, sometimes gives way to sharp cliffs. The water in the lake is almost turquoise. The reservoir itself is the purest vessel of life-giving moisture. The temperature in it is low all year round, since St. Mary does not warm up.

The park and lakes are located in the very north of the United States on the border with Canada. Previously, there were about 150 glaciers on the territory of Glacier, but in the XX century many of them disappeared as a result of climate mitigation, forming magnificent lakes in the park.

messages.text:
Philippines 🇵🇭 , Isla de Gigantes Islands

Isla de Gigantes is an island chain in the Great Western Visayas Archipelago in the Philippines.

Small islands do not allow to accommodate a large number of tourists, and their certain distance from each other makes them unique and relatively deserted in their own way.

That is why the beaches of Isla de Gigantes can be considered untouched.

Here you can find several protected species of mammals, birds and reptiles, such as the Frigate bird and the soft-shell turtle

A popular attraction of the archipelago is Kabugao, a small island that is located half a kilometer south of Gigantes Sur and is part of the Islas de Gigantes group of islands. There are two white sandy beaches that form a sand spit connecting two islets and an observation deck.

messages.text:
Russia🇷🇺, Gelendzhik, Old Park

An amazing park is spread out in the resort city of Gelendzhik, which contains architectural wonders from all over the world. It is located on a plot of more than a hectare, which has become a home for thematic architectural creations from different cultural eras.

The essence of his concept is simple — to recreate in a relatively small area something that would contradict in historical and cultural terms. For example, ancient Egypt and Classical Europe, Western civilization and Eastern civilization.

The park contains more than 20 buildings and the same number of territories, due to the type and theme.

messages.text:
Switzerland🇨🇭, Helmer funicular

The Gelmerbahn is a funicular railway in the Hasli Valley in the Swiss canton of Bern.

Connects the village of Handegg (altitude 1400 m above sea level) with Lake Helmer (1850 m above sea level).

Until the end of 2017, the Helmer funicular with a slope of 106 percent was considered the steepest in Europe.

And if you sit down successfully, you can experience feelings akin to "cheerful horror" when riding on the roller coaster, which in Russia are called American, and in the USA — Russian.

The Gelmer funicular itself was not originally conceived as a tourist attraction. It was built in the 1920s in order to deliver construction materials and workers needed for the construction of a dam on Lake Helmer.

In 2001, the lift was converted into a passenger funicular — the views from it were very picturesque, it was a pity not to use such potential.

An open lift car lifts 24 people in 10 minutes to Lake Helmer, located at an altitude of 1,860 m above sea level.

messages.text:
Iceland 🇮🇸, Skaugafoss Waterfall

The south of Iceland is a place of unique natural beauty, and one of these attractions is the stunning Skaugafoss Waterfall, created by the Skaugau River.

The width of the waterfall is about 25 meters, and the height of the falling water flows can be compared with a 20-storey building (60 meters)! On cloudless, clear days, as a result of a huge amount of splashes formed by a falling stream of shining water, you can admire a rainbow, and sometimes more than one.

The waterfall can be reached by a specially conducted hiking trail that leads up to the Fimmvurduhauls pass, located between the Eyjafjallajekull and Myrdalsjekull glaciers. Then the trail of tourists descends to the colorful Torsmerk Valley.

messages.text:
Spain 🇪🇸, Sierra y Cañones de Guara Natural Park

The Sierra y Cañones de Guara Natural Park is the largest protected natural area in Aragon.

On 80 thousand hectares there are picturesque gorges and prehistoric caves, mysterious grottoes and waterfalls, deep canyons stunning in their beauty and uniqueness, along which numerous hiking trails are laid.

The park is significant mainly for its relief, mainly karst, with many caves, galleries and wells and gorges with canyons, where rock paintings still remain in the caves. Primitive people once lived and hunted here. They left behind dolmens and rock carvings (the heritage of humanity under UNESCO protection).

There are many abandoned medieval and early medieval villages on the territory of the Sierra. Sierra used to protect, but now it deprives the inhabitants of the benefits of civilization by its inaccessibility.

messages.text:
China 🇨🇳, Bailong Elevator

The Bailong Elevator — translated from Chinese as "The Elevator of a hundred dragons" — is located in Zhangjiajie National Park in southern China. It is the tallest elevator in the world, located outdoors. Three two-storey cabins lift tourists to a height of 330 meters in just 88 seconds.

Three two-storey high-speed cabins with glass walls move between the landing pad and the top of the cliff, so that during the flight to the top, tourists can also enjoy the surrounding beauty.

Thanks to the high speed of the mountain elevator, it was possible to get rid of queues on the rise. The ticket price for Bailun is quite affordable — $19.

Before the pandemic, about 14,000 tourists used the Balloon daily, now their number has decreased to 8000 due to the absence of foreign tourists in the country. Each of the three elevators accommodates 50 people — 25 in each of the two cabins.

messages.text:
Angola 🇦🇴, Namibia 🇳🇦, South Africa 🇿🇦, Namib Desert

The Namib Desert is the oldest desert on Earth, located in the Namib Naukluft Park, the fourth largest nature reserve in the world, covering an area of 49,768 square kilometers. The name "Namib" in the language of the Nama people means "a place where there is nothing." 
 
Namib stretches for 1,900 km along the Atlantic Ocean coast through the whole of Namibia to the mouth of the Oliphants River in South Africa. From the ocean, the desert goes deep into the continent at a distance of 50 to 160 km to the foot of the intracontinental plateau; in the south it connects with the southwestern part of the Kalahari.

Near the ocean coast, the air temperature rarely drops below 10 or rises above 16 degrees. In the interior of the desert, the summer temperature reaches 31 degrees. In those places where the cool sea breeze does not reach — from the windless sides of the dunes or in deep canyons — the temperature can rise above 38 degrees.

messages.text:
Russia🇷🇺, Saint Petersburg, Scarlet Sails 2022

The 30th anniversary celebration of graduates "Scarlet Sails" took place in St. Petersburg. The Palace Square and the Neva water area turned into grandiose stages, where thousands of artists from all over the country performed.

The holiday was broadcast not only in Russia. The event is known far beyond its borders. A pyrotechnic show, a concert with idols of youth, unexpected surprises, fireworks and the passage of the brig "Russia" under scarlet sails were watched by people from all over the world — the events were broadcast online and on television. Only the main audience - school graduates, had a unique opportunity to see a stunningly beautiful show live.

messages.text:
USA🇺🇸 Oregon, Multnomah Falls

Multnomah is the highest natural waterfall in the state: the upper level of the water drop is about 165 m, the lower level (second cascade) is 21 m. Fed by groundwater and precipitation, it does not dry up in summer and does not freeze with the onset of cold weather.

A long pedestrian bridge was erected over the Lower Cascade in 1914, named after Simon Benson, who owned this territory at the beginning of the XX century. In 1915, Benson transferred the rights to the land to the Portland authorities.

It is one of the five highest waterfalls in the USA.

This is one of the most visited natural attractions in Oregon. More than 2 million people a year come to see it.

It is located in a unique canyon, where there are about 90 waterfalls besides it.

messages.text:
Thailand 🇹🇭, Kamala Resort

The five-star Keemala opened in Phuket on December 1, 2015. The hotel consists of 38 villas, including unusual treehouses and even clay huts — as expected, with all amenities.

The extraordinary design of Keemala combines local culture and natural features. Guests can choose a villa from one of four categories — each is decorated in a unique authentic style of ancient Thai tribes and has its own terrace and swimming pool.

Su Tha Restaurant serves Thai cuisine and international dishes. And in Mala Holistic Spa they do traditional relaxing treatments and massage using the reiki technique, which helps restore energy. Everyone can also combine relaxation with yoga classes — under the supervision of an experienced instructor.

A night at this hotel will cost from $ 400 depending on the season.

messages.text:
Spain 🇪🇸, Granada, Alhambra

The Alhambra is a unique architectural and park ensemble - a monument of Islamic culture, located in the eastern part of the Spanish city of Granada. 

The complex is spread out on the wide terraces of the high hill of La Sabica. Its observation decks offer stunning panoramic views. Lush vegetation surrounds the impregnable fortress walls, hiding the best masterpieces of Moorish architectural and decorative art in Western Europe, dating back to the period of its highest perfection.

Meshuar is of the greatest interest to tourists. This most ancient part of the complex served for holding court sessions and receiving notable guests.

The Meshuar includes the main hall with a patterned ceiling, columns with complex consoles and walls decorated with tiles and plaster ornaments. Nearby there is a chapel, outside there are courtyards with porticos, swimming pools and gardens. 

The palace was founded in 1527, and finally completed – only in 1957.

messages.text:
France 🇫🇷, Etretat

Etretat is a picturesque corner of Upper Normandy, comfortably located among the steep cliffs of the Alabaster Coast in the department of the Seine-Maritime. The amazingly beautiful nature of these places attracts tourists from all over the world. Today Etretat is one of the most visited places in France.

The main attraction of Etreta is the natural splendor of the white sheer cliffs that protrude into the sea and form vast arches. You can admire the rocks from above from the Customs Officers' Path along the coast, and from below, walking along them along the deserted beaches between the ledges of the rocks at low tide. 

Be sure to look at the tide schedule, it always hangs at the descent to the beach. There is also a warning that going for a walk along the shore, the time reserve for the return trip should be at least four hours. Otherwise, you will have to stay for a long time on a deserted beach between rocks, or swim back in the cold waters of the English Channel.

messages.text:
Qatar🇶🇦, Doha

Doha is the capital of Qatar, a small country covering an area of 11,571 km2. Large-scale oil production is carried out in it, and each resident receives his share of profits. All Qataris, without exception, are rich because their social expenses are fully covered by the state. It is curious that only 20% of the people living in Qatar have citizenship. The remaining 80% are emigrants and employees from other countries

Tourists come to Doha to see an amazing city in which skyscrapers coexist with ancient Arab traditions. Here you can visit luxury shopping malls and amusement parks, as well as see how the Bedouins live.

In the summer months, the thermometer often rises above +45 ° C, and from December to February the average air temperature is +18...+20°C. There is very little precipitation in Doha – only 76 mm per year. There were years when not a single rain fell over the Qatari capital.

messages.text:
Iceland 🇮🇸, Hvitserkur Rock

Hvitserkur Rock is one of the many natural attractions of Iceland. This is not an ordinary rock. The fact is that it is almost flat like a Sail rock in Gelendzhik, but looks like a prehistoric stone monster lurking in the water waiting for prey.

The rock is located 60 meters from the coast of the Vatnness peninsula in the northwestern part of Iceland in the waters of Huna Bay.

In summer, birds nest on the rock, giving the stone monster shades of life.

It is noteworthy that during low tide you can come close to the rock. In summer, it is worth considering aggressive Arctic terns. There are a lot of them in Iceland at this time, and usually these birds attack anything that violates their territory.

Scientists believe that the rock was once a plug in the mouth of a volcano. Over time, the softer rocks collapsed, leaving only a dense layer of frozen volcanic lava in memory.

messages.text:
Tanzania 🇹🇿, Zanzibar Island, Hotel Zuri Zanzibar

The Zuri Zanzibar Hotel on the snow-white coast of the Indian Ocean will welcome you with the cordiality and versatility of the island of Zanzibar. The hotel consists of bungalows, villas and suites, each of which is separated from each other and is more of a resort complex than a hotel. All houses are equipped with large picturesque terraces. 

Zanzibar, as a new tourist destination, has already managed to win the hearts of many beach lovers. It is here, as in the Bounty advertisement, that the sea is turquoise in color, and the beaches are so white, just like a paradise. Beach holidays on the island of Zanzibar are considered one of the best in the whole world.

The coast of Kendwa beach, like other beaches of the island, is a fairly wide strip with fine white and very clean sand, walking on which is a pleasure.

messages.text:
Italy🇮🇹, Dolomites, Lake Molveno

This azure lake is more than three thousand years old. Its waters are very similar in color to the Plitvice Lakes in Croatia.

Molveno is the largest lake in the Italian Alps, its area is more than three square kilometers. It is spread out in a valley surrounded by mountain peaks, the highest of which is almost 2000 meters.

In addition to its beauty, Lake Molveno is famous among the inhabitants of the region for the fact that there are a lot of fish in its waters. Even Arctic lake trout can be found here (which can only live in exceptionally clean water). Also (sometimes) in the waters of the lake you can notice a special kind of Baikal omul.

It is best to visit the lake from the second half of June to September. This place is not very popular with tourists, so you will not meet a large influx of people.

It is best to visit the lake from the second half of June to September. This place is not very popular with tourists, so you will not meet a large influx of people.

messages.text:
Russia🇷🇺, Crimea, Vorontsov Palace

Vorontsov Palace in Alupka is rightfully considered one of the pearls of the peninsula. The elegant and, at the same time, majestic building is located at the foot of Ai-Petri Mountain. It is surrounded by a unique park complex, and an amazing view of the Black Sea opens from the front staircase.

The palace complex organically fits into the surrounding landscape due to the fact that its location corresponds to the mountainous terrain. That is why the palace has such an original image. The Vorontsov Palace in Crimea and the park adjacent to it often became a film set. At least 17 films have been recognized by the general public.

In the appearance of the building, elements of various eras and a successful combination of architectural styles are visible — strict English, with a direction towards Neo-Gothic, and lush oriental, neo-Moorish.

During the Yalta Conference (February 1945), the palace temporarily turned into the residence of W. Churchill and his entourage.

messages.text:
USA 🇺🇸, Colorado, Rocky Mountain

Rocky Mountain National Park is one of the best areas of rock climbing and mountaineering in the United States. Its area is relatively small – the park is organized on a small section of a huge chain of Rocky Mountains. Rocky Mountain is located in Colorado, the nearest town is Estes Park. The park with an area of 1078 km2 was founded in 1915.

Rocky Mountain Park has 720 km of rivers and streams, 150 lakes. In addition, there are 60 peaks, the height of which exceeds 3,700 meters. The highest of them is Longs Peak.

There are grizzly bears here. In addition, beavers, cougars, coyotes, wolves, deer and moose live in the protected area. Also in the national park you can see a thick-horn, wapiti, squirrel and hummingbird.

Rocky Mountain National Park has more than 370 hiking trails, differing in their complexity. Many of them can be ridden by horses. Hiking trails pass through rocky mountains, tundra, alpine lakes, aspen groves, meadows and forests.

messages.text:
Norway 🇳🇴 , Troll Language (Trolltunga)

Troll Language in Norway is one of the most dangerous and picturesque places in the world. The famous fragment of the Skjeggedal rock can collapse at any moment from a 350-meter height, but somehow inexplicably retains its horizontal position.

The high risk and difficult route do not stop extreme lovers: every year the number of climbers on Trolltunga increases exponentially. Tourists overcome 11 kilometers with a climb of 1200 meters to admire the fabulous views of the mountains and Lake Ringedalsvatn, take dizzying photos, and if you have the courage and recklessness — sit on the very tip of the stone tongue.

A 10-meter stone fragment protruding from the cliff hangs over the Ringedalsvatn Lake, which is framed on all sides by steep mountain slopes. The Troll's Tongue offers stunning views at any time of the day, but the most beautiful landscapes can be photographed at sunset and dawn.

messages.text:
Switzerland 🇨🇭, Trift Bridge

In the central part of Switzerland there is one of the longest and highest suspension bridges in Europe. The Trift Bridge got its name from a glacier located on Mount Titlis. As a result of the melting of its lower part in 2002, a small emerald-colored lake Triftze was formed at an altitude of more than 3000 meters. Although it decorated an already charming region, it seriously hampered the electrical work that was carried out in the vicinity of the glacier.

In 2004, a suspension bridge appeared above the lake, at a height of about one hundred meters, the length of which was 170 meters, and the width was 1 meter. The structure swayed violently in the wind, and not everyone dared to walk on that bridge. In the summer of 2009, the bridge was modernized. As a result, the structure turned out to be very reliable and stable - the Trift bridge can withstand up to 500 tons of snow and wind gusts up to 200 kilometers per hour.

The bridge claims to be the scariest in the world.

messages.text:
Australia 🇦🇺, Wallaman Falls

Wallaman is known not only in Australia, but all over the world as one of the highest water flows in the world. The height of the fall is 302 m, and if you take into account several straight platforms – 340 m. The highest waterfall in Australia is located in North Queensland, on the Stony Creek River. 

The formation of the Wallaman began more than 40 million years ago, when due to a change in the position of one of the earth's plates, the Herbert River changed its course from west to east. The rocks were gradually eroded by water, which eventually led to the formation of a deep gorge with an equally impressive cascade of water.

This is the territory of the humid tropics, which is a UNESCO site, as part of the World Heritage. Camping near the waterfall is available, so staying here will be quite comfortable. If desired, you can admire not only from above, but also go down to the bottom.

messages.text:
Indonesia 🇮🇩, Pulo Clnta Eco Resort Hotel

The unique Pulo Clnta Resort or "Love Island" is a magnificent romantic boutique hotel built in the shape of a heart on one of the 23 charming tiny islands of North Sulawesi. Despite its modest size, Pulo Cinta Eco Resort offers excellent conditions for recreation. Love Island has its own private beach, a restaurant with excellent cuisine. 

Guests of the resort are accommodated in villas on stilts and can fully enjoy the solitude, peace and proximity of the sea: relax, swim, sunbathe. 

The region where Pulo Cinta is located boasts the highest marine biodiversity on the planet. Therefore, it is very interesting to do snorkeling here – masks and tubes are provided to all hotel guests for free. For an additional fee, you can arrange scuba diving or take advantage of the unique opportunity to swim with whale sharks! 

There are no active excursions on the "Love Island"! Only the sea, the sky and you!

messages.text:
Italy 🇮🇹, Vipiteno

Vipiteno is a small town in the Italian Alps, in South Tyrol, located at an altitude of 950 meters above sea level. Vipiteno is considered one of the most beautiful cities in Italy, its name constantly flashes in the constantly compiled various ratings.

The city has its roots in 14 BC, when Nero Claudius Drusus founded a military camp called "Vipitenum" along the road between Italy and Germany.

75% of the city's residents speak their native German. All the signs in Vipiteno are presented in German and Italian.

Multi-colored painted houses with bay windows and stepped gables are the main feature of Vipiteno. The houses look completely toy-like.

There is only one Vipiteno in the old town (but what!) central pedestrian street via citta nuova (via città nuova). Walking through it is like getting into an old fairy tale from childhood. You're just waiting for a gnome to look out of the doorway of a toy house.

messages.text:
Lithuania 🇱🇹, Trakai Castle

The largest preserved ancient fortress in Lithuania is the Trakai Castle, also known as Trotsky or Troksky. It is an island castle located in the center of Lake Galve. Geographically, it is located in the city of Trakai — the ancient residence of the Lithuanian princes. Today it is a very beautiful city, which is visited by thousands of tourists who want to visit the Trakai National Park, and, of course, to see the Trakai Castle.

Since the attraction is located on the island, you can only get to it by the bridge connecting the fortress with the city. In 1962, a museum dedicated to the history of Trakai was founded on the territory of the castle, and souvenir shops were opened. The best time to visit it is in the morning on weekdays. On weekends, the castle grounds are crowded, because at this time locals like to walk there.

messages.text:
Russia 🇷🇺, Anapa, Utrish Nature Reserve

The state Reserve "Utrish" is located on the Abrau peninsula of Anapa, Krasnodar Krai. This natural attraction, which occupies a huge territory, is unique not only in its external beauty, but also in its plant and animal diversity.

The Utrish Nature Reserve is one of the leaders in the number of diverse species of plants and animals in Russia.

The diversity of the flora of the reserve is represented by the Mediterranean subtropics, in which many endemic and relict plants of the tertiary period grow, including: juniper-pistachio forests, high juniper, smelly juniper, pistachio, Pitsunda pine, oak, ash, linden, maple and much more.

Trees over 1000 years old grow on the territory of the reserve. About 50% of the reserve's plants are officially considered endemic (including pre-glacial plants).

messages.text:
France 🇫🇷, Strasbourg

Strasbourg is a city located in the north-east of France, on the right bank of the Rhine. It is the main city of the Alsace region and the Bahrain Department. The city has been the seat of the Council of Europe since 1949 and the European Parliament since 1992. Strasbourg has the title of the European capital and the capital of Europe.

The city borders with Germany, so it combines the culture of the two countries. Its rich and turbulent history can also be traced in its remarkable cultural heritage. The city center, located on a Large Island, was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1988, on its territory there is the famous Notre-Dame de Strasbourg Cathedral and the Petit France quarter. Strasbourg has also become a symbol of the Franco-German truce, however, as well as the whole of Europe.

messages.text:
USA, Hawaii, Vailua Falls

Wailua Falls is located on one of the most ancient islands of Hawaii – Kauai, formed more than six million years ago. The waterfall got its name in honor of the river on which it is located. The water slide is represented by two main jets of 24-meter height.

According to some ancient legends, ancient warriors representing the Hawaiian tribe Ali'i, as proof of their courage and willingness to stand up for their fellow tribesmen, made jumps from the platform between two streams of the Vailua waterfall.

Vailua is one of the most beautiful waterfalls in Hawaii. Vailua radically changes its appearance depending on the amount of precipitation. The best time to visit this spectacular waterfall is early in the morning.

There is a descent to the place where the waterfall falls, which, however, is slippery, dirty and life-threatening. Some tourists pull ropes along the way, but local officials cut them off every time.

messages.text:
Turkey🇹🇷, Eskisehir

Eskisehir, or in Turkish "old town" is not at all old, but the "youngest", brightest and most European city in all of Anatolia. "Young" because it houses several large universities, and in this regard there are very, very many young people. Bright, because houses, bridges and lanterns are painted with bright colors. European, because it resembles Venice, Amsterdam and Berlin at the same time.

Eskisehir is a city of almost half a million located approximately between Istanbul and Ankara. Thanks to the abundance of students, and there are about half of the population, there is a cheerful atmosphere in the city, several pedestrian streets in the center are occupied by bars, restaurants and other entertainment establishments.

messages.text:
Qatar🇶🇦, Doha, the Pearl of Qatar

 - an artificial island that is not inferior in scale and prestige to the famous Dubai Palm Jumeirah.

One of these is the construction of the artificial Pearl Island of Qatar, a luxury residential complex that includes luxury villas, dozens of skyscrapers, luxury hotels, trendy boutiques and cozy restaurants.

The island is shaped like a string of pearls.

The island got its name for a reason: pearl mining is one of the main sources of income for the Qatari economy. This country has been the main trader of jewelry in the Asian market for many years.

The island is the only place in Qatar where a foreigner can own land in private ownership.

The whole island is divided into 12 districts, each of which is made in one particular style, for example, in Italian, Moroccan or Spanish. There is an area made in the style of Venice, and there is in the form of a Colosseum, separate areas are allocated for entertainment and trade.

messages.text:
Italy 🇮🇹, Sirmione

Sirmione is a city in the province of Brescia in Italy on the picturesque Lake Garda. Sirmione can rightfully be called the pearl of Lombardy and one of the most popular tourist centers of Northern Italy. The historical center of the city is located on a peninsula that seems to cut into the lake.

The territory of Sirmione and the coast of Garda was inhabited already in the Bronze Age. And the Romans turned the city into a place of rest.

The iconic landmark of Sirmione is the Scaligerian Water Castle. Built in the 13th century in the lake harbor, this is a real outpost with powerful walls and towers connected by stairs and passages. The tallest tower is 47 meters. There is an observation deck on it. Previously, the entrance to the castle was protected by a suspension bridge. Currently, the bridge is permanent. It connects the historical center and the new districts.

messages.text:
USA, Oregon, tulip farm

Not far from the town of Woodburn in the western US state of Oregon there is an amazing place. This is a tulip farm. It is called "Wooden Shoe" (Wooden Shoe Tulip Farah).

Tulips have been grown here since 1974, that is, for almost 50 years. Fields with flowers occupy, just think about it!- more than 16 hectares!

The farm hosts an annual tulip festival from the end of March to the first week of May. The Tulip Festival is one of the most visited places in the U.S. state of Oregon.

During the festival, you can ride over the fields in a balloon. It costs such a pleasure $ 15 per adult.

Also at the festival you can buy bouquets of cut tulips or already growing in pots, as well as a lot of all sorts of charming trinkets for home and garden.

messages.text:
Abkhazia, Khashupsin canyon

Khashupsin Canyon is a fantastically beautiful natural location stretching for several kilometers in the valley of the Khashupse River. Sheer limestone cliffs, numerous gorges and natural bowls with crystal clear, cool river water, which tirelessly makes its way to the sea.

Thousands of tourists flock to the picturesque sights of Abkhazia every year. Someone is planning long walking routes, someone just needs to visit the most colorful places with an excursion group, and some arrange rafting on sapboards during the high-water season.

Hiking routes (if you move from the village of Tsandrypsh) require endurance and physical fitness from travelers. After all, you will have to overcome about 10 km under the scorching rays of the sun.

messages.text:
Turkey 🇹🇷, Karadeniz

Karadeniz is a Black Sea region in the northeastern part of the country.
There will be no huge hotels, crowds of tourists and "all inclusive".

Tea plantations, Turkish Alps, waterfalls no worse than in Bali, trekking through fern groves, fjords and breakfast above the clouds are waiting for you.

It is better to choose the time to travel to high-altitude areas in summer.
The weather is too changeable in autumn and spring. One day the sun warms, and tomorrow the snow falls softly.

Karadeniz is the birthplace of many famous Turkish dishes and the national horon dance accompanied by musical instruments kemenche and tulum.

It is more convenient to travel around the region by car, visit more interesting places at a comfortable pace.

Go to Karadeniz if you want to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city and enjoy all the shades of green in the wooded mountains, wake up above the clouds and wander along the tea plantations...

messages.text:
UAE, Abu Dhabi, Sheikh Zayed Mosque

The Sheikh Zayed Mosque in Abu Dhabi is the largest mosque in the United Arab Emirates and one of the 6 largest and most beautiful mosques in the world. The mosque in Abu Dhabi is named after Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan, the founder and first president of the UAE, who is next to it. Among the guests and residents of the capital of the Emirates, this is one of the most visited places.

The Sheikh Zayed Mosque, opened in 2007, covers an area of 12 hectares. Its size allows to accommodate about 41,000 believers. The main prayer hall can accommodate up to 7,000 people. 

A visit to the mosque is available to everyone, regardless of faith. Tourists have been allowed to enter the territory of the Muslim shrine since March 2008. When visiting, it should be noted that the dress code is observed on the territory, according to which entry is not possible in clothes with open shoulders, knees, with uncovered head (for women).

UAE, Abu Dhabi, Sheikh Zayed Mosque

The Sheikh Zayed Mosque in Abu Dhabi is the largest mosque in the United Arab Emirates and one of the 6 largest and most beautiful mosques in the world. The mosque in Abu Dhabi is named after Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan, the founder and first president of the UAE, who is next to it. Among the guests and residents of the capital of the Emirates, this is one of the most visited places.

The Sheikh Zayed Mosque, opened in 2007, covers an area of 12 hectares. Its size allows to accommodate about 41,000 believers. The main prayer hall can accommodate up to 7,000 people. 

A visit to the mosque is available to everyone, regardless of faith. Tourists have been allowed to enter the territory of the Muslim shrine since March 2008. When visiting, it should be noted that the dress code is observed on the territory, according to which entry is not possible in clothes with open shoulders, knees, with uncovered head (for women).

messages.text:
Russia, Karachay-Cherkessia, Dukkin Lakes

Dukka Lakes are one of the most visited in the vicinity of Arkhyz. Located at an altitude of 2,450 m.n.m., they are opened from the ice earlier than others, for example, Sofia, Zagedan, or lakes near the passes of the Abishira—Akhuba ridge, and later covered with snow, so you can walk here from the beginning of June to mid-October.

There is no "better" time to visit the lakes: in early summer, ice floes still float on the black surface of the lakes (and this is a passion, how beautiful), then meadows and rhododendrons begin to bloom along the shores, and at the end of September, the gorges acquire a bright, saturated yellow-orange color.

All lakes are filled with clear water with a pleasant, blue tint. Sometimes the color of the water surface becomes saturated blue, or even completely black. Standing by the shore, you can see the bottom down to each small pebble.

messages.text:
Portugal 🇵🇹, Nazare

In the town of Nazare on the west coast of Portugal, on the shores of the Atlantic Ocean, you can see both a relaxed beach holiday and the biggest waves in the world.

In summer, the small resort town of Nazare is a classic tourist attraction of the country. Tourists bask in the gentle sun, swim in the Atlantic Ocean. In general, the usual serene rest.

In winter, everything changes dramatically. Beach tourists are replaced by extreme and lovers of unusual natural phenomena. During this period, you can observe the formation of giant waves that hit the coast almost at arm's length. This phenomenon, incredible in its power and amazing in its beauty, attracts both travelers and the most desperate surfers.

The creator of the giant waves was the atypical relief of the ocean floor near the city of Nazare, in particular the underwater Northern Canyon of Nazare. This depression in the bottom surface reaches almost to the shore, forming a kind of springboard for ocean waves.

messages.text:
Turkey 🇹🇷, Amasra

The small Turkish town of Amasra is a wonderful place where you can not only bask in the southern sun and splash in the waves of the Black Sea, but also significantly diversify your knowledge of ancient history by admiring unique monuments.

This resort, not so popular among our compatriots, is in great demand among residents of Turkey and tourists from European countries. The charm of the town lies in the absence of a large number of vacationers, the presence of beautiful natural landscapes and unique attractions.

A small, extremely beautiful and ancient city is located on the northern rocky coast of Turkey. If you look at the map, you can see Amasra opposite the coast of Crimea. Part of the city is located on the mainland, and the other half is on the island of Boztepe. They are connected by a stone arch bridge built by the ancient Romans. From the shore you can see another island called Rabbit Island.

messages.text:
Germany 🇩🇪, Rakotzbruck Bridge

The extraordinary fascinating beauty of the bridge can be seen in one of the ancient palace arboretums in Germany. For more than a century, this ideal semicircular structure, created from basalt columns, amazes people with its geometry, giving rise to incredible legends shrouded in mysticism and superstition, and not only ancient ones. 

 It is the main attraction of the small Saxon town of Gablenz, in Germany. Back in 1844, Friedman Herman Retschke decided to set up an amazing English-style park on the shore of Lake Rakoff with beautiful bridges, alleys, mysterious grottoes, pyramids and artificial rocks. To implement such unusual plans, basalt slabs had to be imported from Switzerland and Bohemia, because there was no such rock in these places. And when there was a need to build a ferry across the lake located in the Kromlau Park, it was this stone that became the main building material.

messages.text:
Belarus 🇧🇾, Nesvizh Castle

Nesvizh Castle is a fortification complex located in the Minsk region, in the city of Nesvizh, on a hill surrounded by picturesque lakes. Romantics and lovers of stories about knights do not have to go to Western Europe for fresh impressions: a bright representative of this fabulous era lurks very close – in Belarus. Nesvizh Castle is a unique architectural monument, which from time immemorial belonged to the greatest family of rulers of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania – the Radziwills

The interior interiors of the castle, even after restoration, very accurately convey the boundless luxury and splendor of the daily life of the Radziwills. In the lobby, tourists are greeted by a grand staircase decorated with frescoes telling about the military glory of members of the famous family. Most of the halls of the Nesvizh Castle have capacious names that reflect the purpose of a particular room at the time when its founders lived here.

messages.text:
Croatia 🇭🇷, The City Of Dubrovnik

Dubrovnik is a city located in the south-east of Croatia, in Dalmatia, on the shores of the Adriatic Sea. Tourists remember Dubrovnik with its red terracotta roofs, marble squares, secluded monasteries and majestic walls - 25 meters high. According to UNESCO, it is one of the most beautiful European cities: Dubrovnik is second only to Venice and Amsterdam. It is called the "pearl of the Adriatic"

The coast of the city looks fabulous: bays, golden beaches, rocks and lush greenery. The surroundings are filled with the aroma of pine trees, cypresses, fragrant lemons and tangerines. Palm trees and cacti are found on the hillsides. Exotic plants are displayed in local squares and parks. Once they were brought to Dubrovnik by captains from different parts of the world. Part of this treasure is collected in the arboretum, located 12 km from Dubrovnik.

messages.text:
Germany🇩🇪, The City of Dresden

Dresden is a city in East Germany, the capital of the federal state of Saxony. It is one of the most important cultural centers of the country and one of its largest cities, which is often called "Florence on the Elbe". Dresden is a city of amazing beauty, a pearl of the Baroque, an art center of European scale, almost destroyed during the Second World War and carefully restored again.

The city of Dresden is located on both banks of the Elbe River at the foot of the Ore Mountains. The highest peak of the neighborhood has a height of 384 meters. Nature is a hilly plain covered with forests and agricultural land. Interestingly, Dresden itself is a very green city. Parks and other green spaces occupy 60% of its area. The climate is temperate with some marine influence. Summer is warm, winter is cool, but mild with an average temperature of about zero. More than 600 mm of precipitation falls per year.

messages.text:
USA 🇺🇸, Monument Valley

Monument Valley is the territory of the Navajo National Park, located at the junction of the states of Utah and Arizona, is part of the Colorado Plateau

The status of a cult attraction in the USA and the picturesque Monument Valley gained worldwide fame thanks to the classic westerns of John Ford, who began shooting his films against the background of red rocks and sands since the 1930s. 
 
The height of the valley floor ranges from 1500 to 1800 meters, the area of the territory is about 600 square kilometers. In the process of weathering and soil erosion, the soft upper layer of sedimentary rocks was destroyed, as a result, only sandstone remnants of rocks remained on the surface. The red color of geological formations is explained by iron oxide in the mineral composition of sandstone. 
 
Monument Valley is characterized by a desert climate — cold winters and hot summers. During the winter months, snow may fly by, but no stable cover is formed.

messages.text:
France 🇫🇷, Palace of Versailles

The Palace of Versailles is one of the French royal residences, which was built in the suburbs of Paris, the city of Versailles, in the XVII century. Today it is one of the most popular attractions not only in France, but also in the world. 
 
The complex of the Palace of Versailles, which includes several more "small palaces" and a park, is the largest in Europe. Despite the splendor and size, the overall appearance of the Palace of Versailles is integral, it does not create a feeling of piling up elements and excess, which allowed it to become a model for other royal residences of the Renaissance. But Versailles itself became a symbol of excessive and irrational spending of public money during the peak of the absolute monarchy. This is why the palace is interesting, since it is unlikely that residences capable of eclipsing Versailles will appear anywhere in the near historical period.
